SNT.47972.1585	Those with advanced breast cancer will continue to be eligible for special assistance from Medicare Australia independently from the PBS.
SNT.47972.1586	According to the Commonwealth Department of Health and Ageing, around 2,000 of the 14,000 cases of breast cancer diagnosed annually are of the HER2 positive type.
SNT.47972.1587	Herceptin has shown to prevent the recurrence of cancer in 30% of these patients.
SNT.47972.1588	In order to constrain costs, the government has accepted a recommendation from the Pharmaceutical Benefits Advisory Committee (PABC) to provide Herceptin under the PBS only to patients who have the HER2 positive type of cancer, who have undergone surgery and who are undergoing chemotherapy.
SNT.47972.1589	In addition, those who are predisposed to heart damage (which can be a side effect of the drug) will not be provided with the subsidised medication.
SNT.47972.1590	The government will provide subsidised Herceptin for 52 weeks (as found to be most effective in clinical trials) at a cost of around AUD$50,000 per patient.
SNT.47972.1591	Herceptin will become available on the PBS from 1 October.

SNT.123299.1596	The agency has submitted a proposal to the Obama administration which aims to list carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gasses as pollutants under the Clean Air Act.
SNT.123299.1597	The policy had previously been proposed to and rejected by the Bush administration, which said it was the wrong tool to be using.
SNT.123299.1598	The proposal lists the negative effects of global warming, including longer and hotter heat waves, increased flooding, and the increased spread of diseases due to warmer weather.
SNT.123299.1599	EPA administrator Lisa Jackson has previously suggested declaring global warming a health threat, and that the agency could use the 1970 Clean Air Act to use to combat it.
SNT.123299.1600	Environmental groups applauded the finding, with the director of Clean Air Watch, Frank O'Donnell, calling it "a green-letter day for the environment."

SNT.123299.1602	It is unclear whether the Obama administration will go along with the proposal.

SNT.123299.1604	No specific timeline has been given for when a decision would be made.

SNT.255058.1607	The company indicated it would like to share specifications and design documents to help startups and to support innovation.
SNT.255058.1608	Facebook hopes that they will be able to benefit from the innovations of others.
SNT.255058.1609	Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook's CEO, announced the company's "Open Compute Project" at an event held for reporters at the company's headquarters in Palo Alto, California.
SNT.255058.1610	Facebook will not directly make any money from the new project.
SNT.255058.1611	However, by making the designs of its servers open source, the company hopes others will find ways to improve them.
SNT.255058.1612	They can then incorporate those advances into their own servers.
SNT.255058.1613	Anything that can make Facebook's servers run more efficiently provides a major benefit for the company.
SNT.255058.1614	More efficient servers will also drive down utility costs for the social media giant, which relies on massive data centers around the United States to keep its operations going.
SNT.255058.1615	Facebook says it is already working with manufacturers, including Dell, that are manufacturing servers based on its designs.

SNT.456424.1637	In order to win the Triple Crown, a horse has to race and win the Kentucky Derby, the Preakness Stakes, and the Belmont Stakes.
SNT.456424.1638	The first Triple Crown winner was Sir Barton in 1919 and the last was Affirmed in 1978.
SNT.456424.1639	The dry spell will continue at least another year — the 34th year without a Triple Crown victory.
SNT.108616.1640	In a 5-4 vote, the United States Supreme Court overturned the death penalty for Patrick Kennedy, convicted of raping a child, saying it is not proportional to the crime and that it violates the Constitutional ban on cruel and unusual punishment, and thereby setting a precedent.
SNT.108616.1641	In the case Kennedy v. Louisiana, Patrick Kennedy of New Orleans, Louisiana was convicted of raping his eight-year old stepdaughter, and was sentenced to death for the crime.
SNT.108616.1642	A Louisiana law adopted in 1995 allowed the death penalty for those who had raped a child under 12 years old (later amended to 13).
SNT.108616.1643	Five other states have similar laws, while the remaining states ban the death penalty for rape.
SNT.108616.1644	The last execution for rape in America occurred in 1964.
SNT.108616.1645	The Louisiana Supreme Court defended Kennedy's sentence, saying that "short of first-degree murder, we can think of no other non-homicide crime more deserving" of the death penalty.
SNT.108616.1646	Kennedy, who was one of two criminals on death row in America who did not commit murder, challenged the court's decision, and the case was brought to the U.S. Supreme Court.
SNT.108616.1647	Writing for the majority, Justice Anthony Kennedy said the Constitution did not allow the death penalty where the crime did not result, and was not intended to result, in a person's death.
SNT.108616.1648	He noted exceptions in cases of crimes against the state, such as treason and espionage.
SNT.108616.1649	Despite "the years of long anguish that must be endured by the victim of child rape," Justice Kennedy wrote, "the death penalty should not be expanded to instances where the victim's life was not taken."
SNT.108616.1650	He added, "When the law punishes by death, it risks its own sudden descent into brutality, transgressing the constitutional commitment to decency and restraint."
SNT.108616.1651	The four liberal-leaning justices (Stevens, Souter, Ginsburg and Breyer) joined Kennedy, a moderate who often casts the deciding vote in close cases.
SNT.108616.1652	The four conservative-leaning justices (Roberts, Scalia, Thomas and Alito) dissented.
SNT.108616.1653	Samuel Alito wrote in his dissent, "The harm that is caused to the victims and to society at large by the worst child rapists is grave..."
SNT.108616.1654	"It is the judgment of the Louisiana lawmakers and those in an increasing number of other states that these harms justify the death penalty."
SNT.108616.1655	Alito said the decision would bar the death penalty "no matter how young the child, no matter how many times the child is raped, no matter how many children the perpetrator rapes, no matter how sadistic the crime, no matter how much physical or psychological trauma is inflicted, and no matter how heinous the perpetrator's prior criminal record may be."
SNT.108616.1656	"One thing is clear: The five members of the court who issued the opinion do not share the same 'standards of decency' as the people of Louisiana," Jindal said.
SNT.12989.1657	The U.S. Supreme Court today ruled that Internet file sharing networks can be sued for copyright infringement.
SNT.12989.1658	The court ruled that businesses created with the purpose of letting users commit copyright violations should be held liable for the infringement.
SNT.12989.1659	Writing for the court, Justice David Souter wrote: "One who distributes a device with the object of promoting its use to infringe copyright, as shown by clear expression or other affirmative steps taken to foster infringement, going beyond mere distribution with knowledge of third-party action, is liable for the resulting acts of infringement by third parties using the device, regardless of the device's lawful uses."
SNT.12989.1660	The strength of the decision was unexpected — this is the first major Internet copyright case to reach the Supreme Court in many years, and the Justices' unanimity sends a strong message about their lack of tolerance for companies designed to violate the law.
SNT.12989.1661	The decision affects such companies as Grokster and StreamCast, both of which were defendants in this suit.
SNT.12989.1662	The court's ruling does not have an immediate effect, however, as the Justices referred the decisions to a lower court to be reconsidered.
SNT.12989.1663	Fred von Lohmann, senior staff attorney for the EFF, panned the court for not providing a clear test for what constitutes inducement, saying it would discourage innovators unsure of their project's legality.
SNT.12989.1664	He did however remain optimistic about Grokster and StreamCast's chances in the lower courts.
SNT.103393.1665	An internet forum, run by the non-profit Epilepsy Foundation, was attacked last week by a group of vandals.
SNT.103393.1666	The attack, first reported by Wired News, exploited a function of the forums to post JavaScript code.
SNT.103393.1667	The code injected by the vandals flashed two images repeatedly and tried to lead users off to external websites showing flashing lights and shapes intended to trigger off epileptic fits.
SNT.103393.1668	The Epilepsy Foundation had to shut down the forum, and took some measures to prevent future attacks.
SNT.103393.1669	In a press release, the Foundation stated that several users of the forum, sufferers of epilepsy, experienced harsh migraines and seizures as a result of the attack.
SNT.103393.1670	One woman, RyAnne Fultz, was paralyzed by the flashing images in what she calls her worst attack in over a year, until her 11-year old son managed to get her to stop looking at the screen and close the flashing images.
SNT.103393.1671	They also posted a message regarding new measures saying "In our upping of security on the forums, we have established the following new rules: No animated images are allowed to be used anywhere from now on."
SNT.103393.1672	"No rich text is allowed in the body of messages at all, either."
SNT.103393.1673	Wired News additionally reports that there is "circumstantial evidence" linking the perpetrators of the attack to the internet group "Anonymous", who are most well known for their recent protests and attacks against the Church of Scientology, and their members created a reputation as "griefers" in the virtual worlds Second Life, and Habbo Hotel.
SNT.103393.1674	The Austrian paper Krone reports that the "usual goal of their attacks is to raise a fuss or disturb others".
SNT.103393.1675	Following critical reports about the attack, members of the group blamed the attack on the Church of Scientology.
SNT.103393.1676	Wired News states that the attack on the forum may have been the first computer attack in history to inflict physical harm on its victims.
SNT.103393.1677	Between three and five per cent of all epilepsy sufferers are vulnerable to seizures triggered by flashing lights, shapes or colours, like ones used in the attack.
SNT.103393.1678	Photosensitive epilepsy has been in the news increasingly over the last few years as various media have triggered seizures in people.
SNT.103393.1679	Recently a logo animation for the 2012 London Olympics caused thousands of people to experience seizures.
SNT.103393.1680	In another incident, the episode "Dennō Senshi Porygon" of the animated TV series Pokémon caused thousands of children to experience seizures in Japan.
SNT.103393.1681	In March, MTV refused to air a new video by Gnarls Barkley out of fear it would trigger seizures.
SNT.10736.1682	Irish low fares airline, Ryanair, this week celebrated its 20th birthday.
SNT.10736.1683	Having reached the milestone, the airline promptly used the opportunity, as always, to sell seats; launching a massive 200,000 seat sale at 99p/99c a seat.
SNT.10736.1684	The airline was founded in 1985 by the Irish businessman, Dr Tony Ryan.
SNT.10736.1685	It began its existence flying a small 15 seat aircraft between Waterford and London Gatwick with the small aim of breaking the duopoly on London-Ireland flights, held at that time by British Airways and Aer Lingus.
SNT.10736.1686	Today however, the airline now flies to over 200 European destinations with its fleet of 84 Boeing 737's and is awaiting the arrival of a future 225 aircraft from Boeing.
SNT.10736.1687	The company today carries as much as 3m passengers a month (depending on the season) and has revealed it made a profit of €245m (USD$307,916,000) in the past year.
SNT.10736.1688	Ryanair CEO Michael O'Leary has stated that the airline will carry over 70m passengers annually within five years.
SNT.10736.1689	The notoriously eccentric Mullingar man went on to tell the press "The very fact that a Mickey Mouse Irish airline can start in a field in Waterford 20 years ago and in 20 years overtake the world's self-styled, self proclaimed favourite airline is testament to the almost unstoppable demand for low airfare travel around Europe."
SNT.10736.1690	To demonstrate the huge drop in airfares over the last year, the company claimed while the price of a Ryanair seat had dropped from ￡99.99 in 1985 to 99p today, the price of a pint of beer had trebled and the average house price in England had increased by 500%.

SNT.223800.1692	The airline stated that all of the aircraft have undergone extensive safety inspections and they are satisfied they are safe.
SNT.223800.1693	Alan Joyce, CEO of Qantas, said: "It's great that we can reintroduce the aircraft."

SNT.15006.1702	The U.S. space agency NASA called off the launch of Space shuttle Discovery today after a problem with a fuel sensor in the external tank used to detect fuel exhaustion.
SNT.15006.1703	According to the agency-run NASA TV, the low-fuel sensor was either malfunctioning or damaged.
SNT.15006.1704	The launch was already facing the threat of a scrub due to thunderstorms in the area.
SNT.15006.1705	The sensor is one of four used to trigger the engine cutout after launch.
SNT.15006.1706	Although only two are required for normal operation, and the Shuttle can be flown with one, NASA elected to maintain full redundancy.
SNT.15006.1707	Should more of the sensors fail, the engine might burn out due to lack of fuel, a situation that has not been tested.
SNT.15006.1708	The problem was detected during a simulation of an empty tank.
SNT.15006.1709	When placed in a mode simulating an empty tank, three of the sensors correctly registered that the tank was empty, while the faulty sensor stayed in the "full" state.
SNT.15006.1710	NASA is currently unsure whether the problem relates to the sensor, the instrumentation circuits reporting the sensor's state, or the simulation circuits.
SNT.15006.1711	The problem comes after a separate incident yesterday when a cockpit window cover fell from the Orbiter, damaging thermal protection tiles.
SNT.15006.1712	A similar problem caused the replacement of the fuel tank in June.
SNT.15006.1713	The launch, which was scheduled for 3:51 ET (20:51 UTC), would have been the first launch of a shuttle since Columbia's February 2003 crash which killed all crew members aboard.
SNT.15006.1714	It is still unknown to NASA officials what caused the sensor to become defective.
SNT.15006.1715	It is also unknown at the moment whether the issue will be fixed on the launch pad, or in the Vehicle Assembly Building - in which it takes close to a full day's time to transport a shuttle between the two areas.
SNT.15006.1716	In the interim, the crew of the shuttle will stay at KSC unless there are further delays, in which case the crew might be transported back to JSC in Houston for refresher training.
SNT.147700.1717	The president of Uganda, Yoweri Museveni, has distanced himself from a controversial bill in the Parliament that would make certain acts of homosexuality punishable by death.
SNT.147700.1718	Until President Museveni publicly spoke out, this proposal was widely supported by the ruling majority party, the National Resistance Movement (NRM), and, as a result, was expected to easily pass with a significant number of votes in its favor.
SNT.147700.1719	In a nation where homosexuality is already a criminal offense punishable by up to fourteen years in jail, this bill would raise that penalty to life in prison.
SNT.147700.1720	It would also dole out the death penalty for any offense categorized as "aggravated homosexuality"—meaning a case in which one of the participants is either a minor, HIV-positive, or a "serial offender."
SNT.147700.1721	Museveni stressed in this statement on Wednesday, that the Member of Parliament who drafted the legislation in question, although he is a member of the NRM, was not following government policy and did so solely as an individual.
SNT.147700.1722	Museveni, who admitted being at the center of widespread international criticism, said in the same statement that this matter was now a "foreign policy issue," and therefore his government, Parliament included, "must take into account [Uganda's] foreign policy interests."
SNT.147700.1723	Case in point, Sweden has since threatened to cut financial support to the small African nation if this bill does in fact go through.
SNT.147700.1724	In addition, numerous other world powers over the past weeks have contacted Museveni directly to elaborate upon their objections.
SNT.147700.1725	Following which, a frustrated Museveni told the BBC, "The Prime Minister of Canada came to see me and what was he talking about? Gays."
SNT.147700.1726	"Prime Minister Gordon Brown came to see me and what was he talking about? Gays."
SNT.147700.1727	In light of all that has occurred, Museveni told his party that the issue as of today was no longer a parliamentary one, and that it is to be discussed and handled accordingly by him and his cabinet alone.

SNT.55948.1748	The Trident defence system was developed as Britain’s response to the Cold War which ended with the collapse of the USSR in December 1991.
SNT.55948.1749	The first Trident submarine went on patrol in December 1994.
SNT.55948.1750	The present system consists of Trident ballistic missiles with nuclear warheads carried by four Vanguard class nuclear powered submarines.
SNT.55948.1751	The main issue is about the replacement of the submarine fleet.
SNT.55948.1752	Supporters who include the majority of the main opposition party, argue that because of the proliferation of nuclear weapons and threats from countries such as Iran and North Korea, Britain must have a nuclear defence capability.
SNT.55948.1753	Opponents including at least one Cabinet Minister and several Labour backbenchers, say that the system is an inappropriate response to the present threats to national security, terrorism, energy shortage and climate change and that there are better ways of spending the money.
SNT.55948.1754	Fifteen Anglican bishops have denounced the possession of such a weapon as ‘evil’.

SNT.55948.1756	He promised that if the UK government went ahead with the Trident project, the SNP would propose to use those powers to stop it proceeding in Scotland.
SNT.55948.1757	There are two establishments in Scotland, at Faslane and Rosyth, providing services to the nuclear submarine fleet.

SNT.18687.1799	Oregon State University (OSU) animal researchers in conjunction with the U.S. Department of Agriculture's (USDA) Dubois, Idaho-based Sheep Experiment Station released a report on an OSU-USDA study which was initiated in 1995 after breeders asked the government to determine why some rams bought as breeding studs showed no interest in females.
SNT.18687.1800	The researchers are working under a $2.8 million grant from the National Institutes of Health in hopes of developing a test which can determine the likelihood of a ram being female-oriented before it is sold as a stud.
SNT.18687.1801	By studying difference in the animal's brains after slaughter, the study also showed what could be a biological determiner for what makes a ram male-oriented instead of female-oriented sexually.
SNT.18687.1802	The scientists' results showed that the anterior preoptic area of the rams' hypothalamus was 50 percent smaller in male-oriented rams as opposed to female oriented rams.
SNT.18687.1803	A 1991 study of human brains of AIDS victims showed a similar hypothalamus size difference between gay and heterosexual men.
SNT.18687.1804	The sheep researchers postulate that low levels of aromatase hormones in the brain of a developing male sheep fetus may have kept the brain from fully masculinizing, leading to sexually male-oriented rams.
SNT.18687.1805	"This lends further support to the idea that homosexuality has biological underpinnings," Charles Roselli, a professor of physiology and pharmacology, said in an interview with the Corvallis Gazette-Times.
SNT.18687.1806	Professor Stormshak believes that "understanding sexual drives and the continuum of sexual behavior could possibly help explain the scientific basis of sexual assault [and] put an end to assertions that homosexuality is a lifestyle choice."

SNT.112376.1814	Multiple news agencies, including the New York Times and CNET yesterday suggested that a campaign operative for Sarah Palin, the Republican vice presidential candidate, worked on the Wikipedia article on her in the 24 hours before the vice presidential candidate was announced.
SNT.112376.1815	Wikinews has investigated the claim further, after seeing these allegations.
SNT.112376.1816	The user who added the content on Wikipedia was known as Young Trigg, and Wikinews has learned that the account was created at exactly 08:02 UTC on August 28.
SNT.112376.1817	Just eight minutes later the user made their first edit to Wikipedia.
SNT.112376.1818	In this first edit the user said that Palin "briefly worked as a sports reporter for local Anchorage television stations, while also working as a commercial fisherman with her husband, Todd, her high school sweetheart".
SNT.112376.1819	In the second edit Palin and her family were described as "avid outdoors enthusiasts."
SNT.112376.1820	This edit also said that "Sarah and her father would sometimes wake at three am to hunt moose before school, and the family would regularly run 5k and 10k races".
SNT.112376.1821	Some of the other edits say that Sarah was "brought to statewide attention because of whistleblowing on ethical violations by state Republican Party leaders," she played in a "championship game despite a stress fracture in her ankle, hitting a critical free throw in the last seconds," and she won a "scholarship to help pay her way through college."
SNT.112376.1822	Young Trigg also noted that "Palin holds a lifetime membership with the National Rifle Association".
SNT.112376.1823	The editor also said that her election of mayor came "despite the lack of support from party leaders and being outspent by her Democratic opponent."
SNT.112376.1824	Other positive claims added included the statement that "Palin successfully killed the Bridge to Nowhere project that had become a nationwide symbol of wasteful earmark spending".
SNT.112376.1825	Young Trigg also removed the sentence that said that "critics [of Palin] included the state Republican party's chairman, Randy Ruedrich, one of her fellow Oil & Gas commissioners".
SNT.112376.1826	This unusual editing pattern aroused some suspicion among other editors of Wikipedia.
SNT.112376.1827	One of these editors is Justen Deal, who told Young Trigg that "some of yours edits may have affected the article in such a way so as to reflect more favorably on the subject of the article."
SNT.112376.1828	Deal described his reason for suspecting a conflict of interest to a reporter for Wikinews.
SNT.112376.1829	He said that "It was clear to me that an editor very familiar with Wikipedia and the governor had made a single-purpose account that had made a significant number of edits that were universally favorable to the subject of the article."
SNT.112376.1830	"Given the fortuitous timing, it made sense to remind the editor of our conflict of interest guidelines".
SNT.112376.1831	After this message was sent by Deal, Young Trigg said that "I will acknowledge that I volunteer for the McCain campaign."
SNT.112376.1832	The user did however state that "I did not know Palin was the nominee when I made my edits," and "no one instructed me to make these edits."
SNT.112376.1833	"I did this on my own 'becuz' I like improving Wikipedia articles".
SNT.112376.1834	Young Trigg made a total of 43 contributions (many on talk pages) and announced they would retire from Wikipedia at 07:58 UTC on August 31.
SNT.112376.1835	In addition to editing the article on Sarah Palin, the user also asked an anonymous contributor to Wikipedia about that person's edit that stated that Palin was the VP nominee, before the official announcement:
SNT.112376.1836	Wikinews contacted the McCain campaign with a request for a statement regarding this issue; and, at the time of publication, had not received a response.
SNT.113200.1837	Following misleading reports that Rev Professor Michael Reiss had advocated that creation should be taught in science class, he left his post as director of education at the Royal Society, the UK's national academy of science.
SNT.113200.1838	Last week at the British Association's science festival Rev Professor Michael Reiss said that creation should not be ignored if it come up in class.
SNT.113200.1839	Professor Reiss, who was director of education at the Royal Society, said that since a substantial number of pupils have concerns about the issue, they are likely to "detach from" science if their concerns and world view are not addressed.
SNT.113200.1840	Creation should not be taught, he said, but if it comes up, teachers should be encouraged to explain the science of evolution.
SNT.113200.1841	He also said that students should be taught the nature of a scientific theory - that it does not simply mean a hypothesis about the way things might work, but a rigorously supported system of ideas that fit with the available evidence.
SNT.113200.1842	The Times of London reported him as saying that Creationism should be taught in science classes as a legitimate point of view.
SNT.113200.1843	This provoked a storm of protest from a group that included two Nobel Laureates and other scientists who strongly oppose the teaching, or even the discussion of creation in science class.
SNT.113200.1844	Yesterday the Royal Society said in a statement that some of Professor Reiss' comments had been "open to misinterpretation", and that this had damaged the Society's reputation.
SNT.113200.1845	"As a result, Professor Reiss and the Royal Society have agreed that, in the best interests of the society, he will step down immediately as director of education."
SNT.113200.1846	The Royal Society went on to say: "However, if a young person raises creationism in a science class, teachers should be in a position to explain why evolution is a sound scientific theory and why creationism is not, in any way, scientific."
SNT.113200.1847	The chief executive of the British Association for the Advancement of Science, Roland Jackson, said that the Royal Society should have supported Professor Reiss and used this opportunity to further a reasoned debate.
SNT.113200.1848	"I was at the actual discussion, and what I heard him say, however it has been reported, was essentially the position advocated by the Royal Society," Jackson said.
SNT.59150.1849	French Presidential candidate Nicolas Sarkozy has promised to address what he calls the French "moral crisis... of work".
SNT.59150.1850	With unemployment for younger people running at alarming levels (15.5% in 2002 for those aged between 20 and 24 according to the OECD) and the memory of the 2005 riots still recent, Sarkozy promised to reign in government spending and implement tax policies that reward longer working hours.
SNT.59150.1851	Once a matter of pride, the 35 hour maximum working week is seen by Mr. Sarkozy as contributing to the sluggish growth of the French economy.
SNT.59150.1852	In previous years France's aversion to "anglo-saxon" economic and labour policies contributed to the rejection of the EU constitution in a referendum last year.
SNT.59150.1853	However, such views are now being challenged by the French right's main Presidential candidate as he proposes to abolish tax on hours worked above the 35 hours limit as well as proposing to introduce new measures to increase share options for employees outside of the managerial elite.
SNT.59150.1854	As well as challenging France's work ethic he is planning to roll back the boundaries of the State by adopting policies that will reduce the size of State organisations to allow for tax reductions in the hope of kick-starting the economy.
SNT.59150.1855	The effect of his tax and spend reduction plans on state social provision has not yet been explained.
SNT.59150.1856	Reaction from Socialist candidate Ségolène Royal was immediate in describing his proposal as "scandalous" and that tax reductions on the richest on society would aggravate the already existing social divisions in the country.
SNT.59150.1857	She argues that State spending on public services were essential at a time when such divisions existed in the country.
SNT.59150.1858	Mr. Sarkozy is currently pulling ahead in the polls one week after announcing his candidacy for the May poll.

SNT.260719.1862	The Swedish Navy have released a picture regarding a foreign submarine discovered in the Saltsjöbaden river of Lake Mälaren in Stockholm, the capital city of Sweden, situated on the western coast of the Baltic Sea.
SNT.260719.1863	The submarine was seen by Hanna Harge, a 40-year-old entrepreneur who lives locally, when walking with her dog on the morning of 13 April this year.
SNT.260719.1864	She woke up her family, brought them to the location and took pictures of the submarine, before it disappeared.
SNT.260719.1865	She and her family immediately called the Swedish Navy, believing it to be an exercise, and told them to hide the vessel better.
SNT.260719.1866	The Navy, however, had no knowledge of such an exercise, and no reports from other nations regarding the submarine.
SNT.260719.1867	Soon afterwards, the Navy's intelligence agency visited Harge, taking the pictures to technical staff.
SNT.260719.1868	The Harge family compares them to the submarines of the former Soviet Union and the early Russian Federation which allegedly violated Sweden's border in the same vicinity.
SNT.260719.1869	In addition to the Armed Forces of Sweden, other government agencies are also involved in the investigation such as SMHI and Environmental Protection Agency.
SNT.260719.1870	According to Andersson Larsson of the technical staff, the proceedings of the investigation are classified and it is expected to be finished and sent to the Government of Sweden within two months.
SNT.42707.1871	In a small-scale trial on humans, American scientists say they may have developed a new drug that could stop the spread of HIV and "rapidly clears" the blood of the virus.
SNT.42707.1872	"There is a lot of interest in this product," said editor Keith Alcorn of the National Aids Manual.
SNT.42707.1873	The drug called PA-457, which is derived from betulinic acid and comes from by-products from paper manufacturers, is being manufactured and developed by Maryland drug manufacturer Panacos Pharmaceuticals.
SNT.42707.1874	The drug is known as a maturation inhibitor, which is a new group of drugs.
SNT.42707.1875	Its purpose is to break down the protective protein coating of HIV.
SNT.42707.1876	The drug exposes the inner genetic material by making holes in the coating of the virus essentially causing it to break down and disabling its ability to be passed from one human to the next.
SNT.42707.1877	The drug also shows that it works on strains of HIV that are resistant to other medications.
SNT.42707.1878	"It's a truly novel new class of drugs, and I really support their development."
SNT.42707.1879	"If PA-457 turns out to be non-toxic, easy to use and not to select for resistance, it will find good use," said Charles Boucher who researches HIV at Utrecht university medical center in the Netherlands.
SNT.42707.1880	"It stops the virus by interfering in one of the final stages in its assembly and stops it from 'budding out' from the wall of a cell," said Alcorn.
SNT.42707.1881	Scientists are expected to begin a larger scale test on 48 people in one month, whose drugs are no longer working; however, the drug itself is not likely to be available for wide-scale use for at least 3 years.
SNT.42707.1882	Test subjects will be administered either a placebo or PA-457 that will be taken in combination with the medication they already take.
SNT.42707.1883	"This provides the basis for future studies that will be designed to provide a detailed understanding of the interaction between PA-457 and its target as well as insights into the design of new generations of maturation inhibitors," said CEO of Panacos Pharmaceuticals, Graham Allaway.
SNT.42707.1884	At least 80% of those suffering from the disease have shown resistance to other medications.
SNT.677055.1885	In the United Kingdom, television presenter Derek Batey has died at the age of 84.
SNT.677055.1886	Yesterday, ITV Border, the company for whom he used to work, said Batey died Sunday night in a hospice near his Lytham St Annes residence in Lancashire, England after experiencing a brief illness.
SNT.677055.1887	Batey, who was born in Brampton, Carlisle in 1928, was at one time a ventriloquist.
SNT.677055.1888	According to BBC News Online, Batey first worked in broadcasting for the BBC.
SNT.677055.1889	He went on to work for Carlisle-based Border Television, which is now called ITV Border, from its inception in 1961.
SNT.677055.1890	He continued to work at the station for about 25 years, gaining the nickname 'Mr Border' as a result.
SNT.677055.1891	Batey was notable for presenting the game show Mr. and Mrs., a format which he developed for Border Television after seeing a similar game show on Canadian television.
SNT.677055.1892	Batey presented 500 episodes of the TV programme, which tested married persons on their knowledge of their partners to see which which couple had the best knowledge of each other.
SNT.677055.1893	At its peak in the 1970s, the programme achieved nine million viewers.
SNT.677055.1894	Batey adapted the game show into a successful stage show which he presented 5000 times.
SNT.677055.1895	Batey also presented a talk show called Look Who's Talking.
SNT.677055.1896	Recalling the basis for the launch of the series, Batey said: "[T]here wasn't a lot of theatre in the Border area and we thought if we could bring the national names to Carlisle and invite the audiences in, it is a chance to see names where they couldn't see elsewhere, so we did that."
SNT.677055.1897	Both Mr. and Mrs. and Look Who's Talking were originally regional programmes and were later broadcast across the ITV Network, Batey reported.
SNT.677055.1898	Harry King, a former colleague and friend of Derek Batey, described him as "a proud Cumbrian [...] a people person and was never happier than when he was talking to people."
SNT.677055.1899	"He could be talking to the Queen or the person next door".
SNT.677055.1900	King described Mr. and Mrs. as "iconic" and said Batey "would always let the people he was talking to take the limelight".
SNT.677055.1901	ITV News Border reporter Matthew Taylor said Batey "will leave a lasting legacy in this region".

SNT.118494.1917	The United Kingdom Parliament is planning to expand the powers of bailiffs in pursuit of unpaid debts.
SNT.118494.1918	While the new measures are not yet officially active, bailiffs are expected to soon be able to use force in entering debtors' homes and restraining them.
SNT.118494.1919	The preemptive crackdown was introduced with predictions of hundreds of thousands of British citizens losing their homes to credit companies as the international financial crisis grows worse.
SNT.118494.1920	Previous to the proposed laws, bailiffs were not allowed to break into or enter homes unless the debtor was already there, or as a last resort.
SNT.118494.1921	Justice Lord Bach stated the Act would not be made active until after Parliament had finished extensive consulting, and that the new powers of bailiffs would be carefully monitored.
SNT.118494.1922	Civil rights activists like Paul Nicolson of the Zacchaeus 2000 Trust, however, have heavily criticized the new laws, accusing them of destroying fundamental civil rights and stripping away "tried and tested protections that make a person's home his castle and which have stood for centuries".
SNT.118494.1923	A government spokesman said the Parliament was considering its options for implementing the new laws and would make an announcement soon.

SNT.421036.1942	According to a new diagnosis by a surgical pathologist, Frida Kahlo most likely suffered uterine damage during a streetcar accident as a teenager and this led to a rare condition known as Asherman's syndrome, and that would explain the Mexican artist's infertility.
SNT.421036.1943	Dr. Fernando Antelo, from the Harbor–UCLA Medical Center, said, "Her survival defied the grim prognostication by her physicians; however, complications from this physical trauma would emerge in her adulthood."
SNT.421036.1944	He presented his diagnosis yesterday at the annual meeting of the American Association of Anatomists in San Diego.
SNT.421036.1945	Asherman's syndrome is normally caused by a trauma to the uterus that results in internal scar tissue.
SNT.421036.1946	For example, it can occur after multiple procedures to clear the uterus after a miscarriage or abortion, which is known as a "D & C" procedure.
SNT.421036.1947	Antelo said Kahlo tried to have children many times and her miscarriages, as well as three therapeutic abortions, could have further aggravated the scarring.
SNT.421036.1948	At present the condition could be diagnosed and treated after advancements in medical imaging and hysteroscopy, but in Kahlo's time, Dr. Antelo said, the technology had not advanced far enough to diagnose and treat her.
SNT.421036.1949	Asherman's syndrome has been known since 1894 when it was first reported.
SNT.421036.1950	"She kept attempting to have children with a uterus that wasn't in any condition to do that," Antelo said.
SNT.421036.1951	Antelo, who has been working on connections between art and medicine, says that Kahlo brought her infertility to the canvas and this can be seen in her many paintings of reproductive organs or in her depiction of her own bleeding body in the 1932 painting Henry Ford Hospital.
SNT.421036.1952	In that image, Kahlo is shown lying on a hospital bed with multiple umbilical cords extending from her body and each one holds an object or body part, except one holding a baby.

SNT.108953.1961	"Thousands of Georgians in Abkhazia cross the border to get pensions, do their shopping and work".

SNT.108953.1963	The border will be shut from tomorrow as security in the region is tightened.

SNT.385377.1981	The strikes have caused a significant number of Kenyan hospitals to cease operations.
SNT.385377.1982	According to Kenya Health Professionals Society spokesperson Alex Orina, the average monthly wage plus allowances for health workers in Kenya is KSh25,000 (£193, US$302 or €230) approximately.

SNT.20974.1992	Over the summer a customized distribution of the Linux (or GNU/Linux) operating system was installed on 2,460 desktops in the Italian South Tyrol province of Bolzano.
SNT.20974.1993	This deployment included all 70 of the province's private and public schools and affects more than 16,000 students.
SNT.20974.1994	The distribution installed, FUSS Soledad GNU/Linux, is a customized version of the popular Debian GNU/Linux distribution.
SNT.20974.1995	FUSS Soledad GNU/Linux has multi-language support and uses the GNOME desktop environment.
SNT.20974.1996	In addition to the desktops in the schools, more than 20,000 LiveCDs are scheduled to be created and given free of charge to the students and their families.
SNT.20974.1997	These LiveCDs allow students to use the same software on their home computers that they are going to use at school.
SNT.20974.1998	Project co-director Antonio Russo said, "With the participation of all the public and private schools, this will give to all the students, families, teachers, and operators from the educational world the opportunity to use a entirely free operating system, both at school and at home."
SNT.20974.1999	The switch was funded by the province of Bolzano, the European Social Fund, and the Center for Professional Formation in Italian Language.
SNT.1022735.2000	Earlier this week, Wikinews interviewed Sarah Walsh, a former Australian women's national soccer team (Matilidas) player, about women's football in the country.
SNT.1022735.2001	The Australian women's team is currently ranked ninth by FIFA, down one spot from the previous quarter when they were tied at eighth with the North Korea women's national football team.
SNT.1022735.2002	Meanwhile, Australia's men (Socceroos) are currently ranked 59th in the world, between the Burkina Faso and Slovakia national football team.
SNT.1022735.2003	Walsh retired from the national team in September of last year, after scoring 32 goals in 71 appearances.
SNT.1022735.2004	She was on Matildas side that qualified for the World Cup for the first time while playing in the Asian Football Confederation instead of the Oceania Football Confederation.
SNT.1022735.2005	She also played in two World Cup quarter-finals for the team.
SNT.1022735.2006	Playing in Australia's top level domestic league, the W-League, she won the league championship in 2009.
SNT.1022735.2007	Walsh played professionally in the United States for Sky Blue FC and Saint Louis Athletica.
SNT.1022735.2008	The Matildas are ranked 8th by FIFA in the latest rankings.
SNT.1022735.2009-1	Should media coverage correlate to team performance and internationally rankings?
SNT.1022735.2009-2	Is there an element of tall poppy syndrome in the coverage of the Socceroos?
SNT.1022735.2009-3	What other factors can be used to explain the relative differences in media attention other than performance?
SNT.1022735.2010	::Sarah Walsh: Traditionally in Australia, male sports have dominated media coverage.
SNT.1022735.2011	Slowly we are seeing women's sports feature more frequently in mainstream media publications.
SNT.1022735.2012	There is a growing interest in women's sports, especially women's national teams in general here in Australia.
SNT.1022735.2013	With time, the public will be exposed to more female sports on a daily basis and perhaps will build the same affections for these female sports.
SNT.1022735.2014	As a teenager, I was exposed to NRL living in Sydney, so naturally I have a strong interest in this game along with football (soccer).
SNT.1022735.2015	Young female teenagers today, have the option to turn the TV on and watch the W-league and follow their heroes.
SNT.1022735.2016	I believe in 5–10 years' time we will see a cultural change with regards to media coverage and gender bias.
SNT.1022735.2017	: What's the difference in style of play between the men and women's national teams?
SNT.1022735.2018	::Sarah Walsh: Men :: They appear to play a possession-based game working at effective possession combined with a developing system of pressing using our natural athleticism and high work rate as well as our cultural mental strength.
SNT.1022735.2019	::Sarah Walsh: Women ::The women seem to employ a more defensive and well organized "block" making it hard for teams to play through particularly in the middle and our back thirds utilizing transitional moments (BPO – BP) to good effect with quick attacks through the natural speed of certain players.
SNT.1022735.2020	: Why are the Matildas more successful in international competitions and ranking wise than the Socceroos?
SNT.1022735.2021	::Sarah Walsh: There could be a number of contributing factors.
SNT.1022735.2022	Given there is more financial support for men's national teams globally in general, I believe the competition across the board is more extensive.
SNT.1022735.2023	Due to this, there are more teams that compete at a higher level, so effectively this would make it difficult for the Socceroos to reach the same ranking as Matildas.
SNT.1022735.2024	: Why do you think men don't watch the Matildas in the same numbers as they watch the Socceroos?
SNT.1022735.2025	: Does the media feed into traditional Australian gender stereotypes by not covering elite women's sports?
SNT.1022735.2026-1	: What is your role in sports?
SNT.1022735.2026-2	Journalist?
SNT.1022735.2026-3	Academic?
SNT.1022735.2026-4	Sport administrator?
SNT.1022735.2026-5	Player?
SNT.1022735.2026-6	Please provide one to two sentence biography to contextualize your answers.

SNT.1022735.2028	I made my debut for the Matildas at 21 (2004–2012) I have spent the past two years working in community football at FFA delivering a Drug and Alcohol program.
SNT.1022735.2029	I am currently the Women's Football Coordinator and Female Elite Player mentor at FFA.

SNT.187876.2046	The Canadian Government is watching the "slowing growth" of the BP oil spill.
SNT.187876.2047	Canada is running their dash-8 on a twice a day mission to the gulf, monitoring for signs that the BP Oil slick may expand up the Eastern seaboard into Canadian waters, and to provide assistance to US efforts to contain the spill.
SNT.187876.2048	This started in May, and is expected to continue until the spill has been fully contained, or no longer needed.
SNT.187876.2049	Canada has also provided technical experts, research and development teams, and general staffing to assist in spill containment and cleanup.
SNT.187876.2050	While the risk is slim that the oil slick will move up the seaboard enough to get into Canadian waters, it is possible.
SNT.187876.2051	Currently the spill is being held within the Gulf of Mexico, however, as the spill grows each day it is at bigger risk of being picked up by the Loop Current.
SNT.187876.2052	If oil is swept up into the Loop Current—which moves at about 3.3 to 6.5 feet (one to two meters) a second—there's essentially no way to stop it, Tony Sturges, professor emeritus of oceanography at Florida State University, told National Geographic.
SNT.187876.2053	After being picked up by the Loop Current, the oil spill could then quickly be carried further by the Gulf Stream, which can travel up to 2.5 metres per second (5.6 mph).
SNT.187876.2054	This current leads right through some of Canada's best fishing waters, and could potentially even be washed up directly onto the shores of Canada, if not properly contained.
SNT.187876.2055	This spill could devastate the fishing industry of Canada, and harm any potential tourism on the beautiful coastal waters of Eastern Canada.
SNT.187876.2056	So while Canada is offering its hand to the United States as a gesture of assistance, it serves dually as a self assurance that Canada will not be affected by the spill, and to stop it before it reaches the border if it does get picked up by the currents.
SNT.108970.2057	United States President George W. Bush today signed a bill providing $162 billion for the war efforts in Iraq and Afghanistan, which intends to fund the wars for the rest of Bush's term and well into the first year of the new President's term.
SNT.108970.2058	In addition to war funds, the bill includes educational benefits for young troops and veterans, a 13-week extension of unemployment benefits, $2.7 billion in emergency relief for victims of the Midwest floods, and billions of dollars for items such as international food aid, anti-drug enforcement, and repairs of Louisiana levees.
SNT.108970.2059	At a ceremony in the White House's Oval Office, Bush praised the legislation as a necessary product of bipartisanship.
SNT.108970.2060	I appreciate that Republicans and Democrats in Congress agreed to provide these vital funds without tying the hands of our commanders, and without an artificial timetable of withdrawal from Iraq.
SNT.108970.2061	This bill shows the American people that even in an election year, Republicans and Democrats can come together to stand behind our troops and their families.
SNT.108970.2062	Although not mentioned by Bush in his statement, the bill also waives an older law that restricted America's capacity to finance the removal of nuclear weapons in North Korea.
SNT.108970.2063	The absence of the waiver could have led to an embarrassing situation where progress on dismantling North Korea's nuclear program would have been delayed because of a technicality, said Leonor Tomero of the Center for Arms Control and Non-Proliferation.
SNT.108970.2064	North Korea was recently removed from a U.S. list of countries that sponsor terrorism, as a reward for turning over all documents relating to the country's nuclear program.
SNT.108970.2065	For months, the Democrats and Republicans in Congress had argued over the bill, forcing several compromises to be made in the form of amendments.
SNT.108970.2066	One of these amendments, the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2008, can be described as a modern version of the World War II-era G.I.
SNT.108970.2067	It provides lower college tuition costs for war veterans, which was originally opposed by Bush and Senate Republicans, including Presidential candidate John McCain.
SNT.108970.2068	The Republicans conceded after Democrats agreed to add "transferability" to the bill, which allows veterans to transfer the benefits to family members.
SNT.108970.2069	Senate Democratic majority leader Harry Reid commented on the bill, saying, "At a time when 2 million men and women have fought in Iraq and Afghanistan and when our troops have had to endure multiple deployments ... and an unclear strategy, giving them the opportunity to fuel our future economy is the least we can do."
SNT.108970.2070	With the passing of this bill, Congress has provided $650 billion for the Iraq War effort, and nearly $200 billion for war operations in Afghanistan.

SNT.41134.2072	The committee, made up of 10 independent experts has urged the Bush administration to put a stop to the use of torture or cruel treatment during the interrogation of terror suspects.
SNT.41134.2073	In an 11-page report, the committee said that the US should not detain anyone in a secret facility under its control.
SNT.41134.2074	The committee also said that the US should disclose and investigate any such facilities.
SNT.41134.2075	It is alleged that the US has a number of secret prisons where suspects are transported to and questioned using techniques that violate international human rights conventions.

SNT.41134.2079	The committee said that some of the US' techniques had resulted in the deaths of prisoners during the interrogation process.
SNT.41134.2080	The committee further claimed that "vague" guidelines had led to abuse of detainees.
SNT.41134.2081	According to the Associated Press, John B. Bellinger III, a State Department legal advisor and participant during the hearings at Geneva, said of the recommendation to close the base that, "one, seems to be beyond their mandate; two, legally wrong to say that the existence of Guantanamo is a per se violation of the convention; and, three, a not very practical recommendation given that they say that it ought to be closed but that individuals can't be sent back to a large number of countries."

SNT.188098.2085	The resolution directs United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-Moon to organize a conference of all the Middle East states.
SNT.188098.2086	The resolution singles out Israel, calling on "all states in the Middle East that have not yet done so to accede to the treaty as non-nuclear weapon states so as to achieve its universality at an early date."
SNT.188098.2087	In an official statement from the Prime Minister's Office, Israel said the resolution, "is deeply flawed and hypocritical."
SNT.188098.2088	"It ignores the realities of the Middle East and the real threats facing the region and the entire world."
SNT.188098.2089	The statement went on to state, "[the resolution] singles out Israel, the Middle East's only true democracy and the only country threatened with annihilation."
SNT.188098.2090	"Yet the terrorist regime in Iran, which is racing to develop nuclear weapons and which openly threatens to wipe Israel off the map, is not even mentioned in the resolution."
SNT.188098.2091	An Arab-backed proposal for a WMD-Free zone in the Middle East, supported in 1995 by the NPT Conference, was never acted upon.
SNT.188098.2092	As a non-signatory state, Israel is not bound by any resolutions of the NPT.

SNT.111056.2127	Musharraf has little support in the National Assembly, as most of his political allies were defeated in the February elections.
SNT.111056.2128	If the coalition is successful, Musharraf will be the first president in Pakistan's sixty-one year history to have been impeached.
SNT.111056.2129	Musharraf has canceled his trip to the Beijing Olympics so that he can focus on planning a response to the coalition.
SNT.111056.2130	Successfully defeating the impeachment will depend largely on the support of the military, for which he acted as chief until international pressure forced him to step down a year ago.
SNT.111056.2131	Other options Musharraf may explore include declaring a state of emergency, which could aid him in getting the support of the military, or dissolving parliament, though this would likely lead to political chaos.

SNT.47846.2188	A report by the International Water Management Institute (IWMI) says rising demand for irrigation to produce food and biofuels will aggravate scarcities of water.
SNT.47846.2189	One in three people is enduring one form or another of water scarcity, states the report compiled by 700 experts.
SNT.47846.2190	IWMI warns there has to be a radical transformation in the management of water resources - citing as examples Australia, south-central China, and last year’s devastating drought in India.
SNT.47846.2191	Report authors claim that the price of water could double or triple over the next two decades.
SNT.47846.2192	The report, backed by the United Nations and farm research groups, shows that globally, water usage had increased by six times in the past 100 years and would double again by 2050 - driven mainly by irrigation and demands by agriculture.
SNT.47846.2193	Record oil prices and concerns about rapid onset climate change are driving more countries to produce biofuels - from sugarcane, corn or wood - as an alternative to fossil fuel.
SNT.47846.2194	If people are growing biofuels and food it will put another new stress, says David Molden, who led the study at the Sri Lanka-based IWMI.
SNT.47846.2195	The big solution is to find ways to grow more food with less water. 
SNT.47846.2196	" The number one recommendation... is to look to improve rain-fed systems in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia."
SNT.47846.2197	The report says conquering hunger and coping with an estimated 3 billion more humans by 2050 will result in an 80 percent increase in water use for agriculture.
SNT.47846.2198	Irrigation absorbs around 74 percent and is likely to surge by 2050.
SNT.47846.2199	We will have to change business as usual in order to deal with growing scarcity, said Frank Rijsberman, director general of the IWMI, of the report released at the 2006 "World Water Week" conference in Stockholm.
SNT.47846.2200	Solutions included helping poor countries to grow more food with available fresh water via simple, low-cost measures, a shift from past policies that favoured expensive dams or canals, the report said.
SNT.47846.2201	According to Rijsberman, there are two types of shortages: those observed in regions where water is over-exploited, causing a lowering of groundwater levels and rivers to dry up; and those in countries lacking the technical and financial resources to capture water - despite its abundance.
SNT.47846.2202	Billions of people in Asia and Africa already faced water shortages because of poor water management, he said.
SNT.47846.2203	We will not run out of bottled water any time soon, but some countries have already run out of water to produce their own food, he said.
SNT.47846.2204	The report said that a calorie of food took roughly 1 litre of water to produce, with a kilo of grain needing only 500-4,000 litres compared to a kilo of industrially produced meat taking 10,000 litres.
SNT.47846.2205	Without improvements in water productivity the consequences of this will be even more widespread water scarcity and rapidly increasing water prices.
SNT.47846.2206	Rijsberman said water scarcity in Africa was caused by a lack of infrastructure to get the water to the people who needed it.
SNT.47846.2207	The water is there, the rainfall is there, but the infrastructure isn't there, Rijsberman told reporters.
SNT.47846.2208	Other recommendations for certain regions include the extension and the improvement of agriculture using rainwater, the introduction of cereal varieties that need less water as well as the development of irrigation systems.
SNT.47846.2209	But the priority, Rijsberman stresses, is to change mentalities and often outdated government policies.
SNT.47846.2210	Government policies and their approach to water are probably the most urgent that need changing in the short term, he said.
SNT.47846.2211	There is, he says, enough land, water and human capacity to produce enough food for a growing population over the next 50 years, but one of the challenges is to provide enough water for agriculture without damaging the environment.
SNT.47846.2212	Agriculture is driving water scarcity and water scarcity is driving environmental degradation and destruction, he said.
SNT.47846.2213	In Australia last week, Rijsberman said he would "not be surprised to see the price of water double or triple over the next two decades."

SNT.318388.2223	The book includes 101 questions for students to use to challenge their climate science teachers.
SNT.318388.2224	Professor Plimer said the previous book received feedback from parents concerned about education.
SNT.318388.2225	This prompted him to address the next book to children.

SNT.318388.2230	Margaret Watts, president of the Science Teachers' Association of New South Wales, said the educational bias claim is mistaken.
SNT.318388.2231	What science teachers do, she said, "is put all of the facts, pro and con, against any topic, whatever it is, and show the children how to work through the evidence".

SNT.7864.2235	At the recently held 22nd ICANN International Conference in Mar del Plata, Argentina, the ICANN (Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers), officially designated three new top level domain names: .jobs and .travel and .eu.
SNT.7864.2236	Tralliance will operate the new .travel domain and Employ Media will operate the .jobs. domain.
SNT.7864.2237	.jobs was created for the use of personnel businesses, .travel for the travel industry, and .eu will be used by organizations based in the European Union.
SNT.7864.2238	ICANN has also entered into negotiations with registries for .cat, .post and .mobi domains.
SNT.7864.2239	The ICANN, established by the U.S. Department of Commerce in 1998, is a non-profit corporation responsible for the technical coordination of the Internet through the assignment of domain names and IP addresses.
SNT.89267.2240	The People's Republic of China has banned free plastic shopping bags in a move to take effect from June 1, 2008.
SNT.89267.2241	The decision made by the Chinese Cabinet, the State Council, is intended to reduce the amount of plastic bags used in China, currently being estimated at three billion per day.
SNT.89267.2242	The State Council also announced that at the same time as the ban, the manufacturing, sale and even use of very thin plastic bags, which are defined as being under 0.025mm thick, will be banned.
SNT.89267.2243	Any company that does not follow this ban can be fined.
SNT.89267.2244	The ban of free plastic bags and complete ban on very thin bags will, the government hopes, help reduce the amount of crude oil used for plastic packaging, which is currently at five million tonnes per year according to Times Online.
SNT.89267.2245	The notice issued by the Chinese government said: "We should encourage people to return to carrying cloth bags, using baskets for their vegetables."
SNT.89267.2246	The People's Republic of China is not the first country to ban or restrict plastic shopping bags and the notice names Uganda and South Africa according to CNN.
SNT.89267.2247	Many supermarkets in the European Union have voluntarily adopted methods to reduce usage of plastic bags, which often also consist of charging for bags (e.g. Germany) or rewarding customer loyalty points for returning used carrier bags.
SNT.89267.2248	Still, many of the world's leading polluting countries, including the United States of America, have not yet introduced any legislation intended to reduce the usage of plastic bags.
SNT.89267.2249	The United States Environmental Protection Agency claimed that in 2000 only 1% of plastic bags in the United States were recycled.
SNT.89267.2250	The People's Republic of China has attracted a lot of attention in the past for having possibly the highest greenhouse emissions in the world, disproportionate to the size of its economy, according to The Telegraph.
SNT.89267.2251	Times Online quoted a Chinese activist as saying that plastic bags are not the main problem and the government needed to make people care more about the environment.

SNT.761179.2271	Australian Capital Territory — Thousands of Canberrans took a look at the new Cotter Dam on the Cotter River on open day on Sunday.
SNT.761179.2272	The public was given limited access to the still-active construction site.
SNT.761179.2273	Buses took viewers from the car park below to top of the dam wall.
SNT.761179.2274	They ran every 15 minutes from 8:30 am to 4:00 pm.
SNT.761179.2275	The dam is to supply fresh water to the city of Canberra.
SNT.761179.2276	This is to provide water security for the city as droughts become more frequent due to global warming.
SNT.761179.2277	It is a gravity dam, which holds back the waters through sheer mass.
SNT.761179.2278	In addition to the main dam, there are two saddle dams filling depressions in the landscape so flood waters flow over the spillway and not out the sides of the lake.
SNT.761179.2279	The dam on the Cotter River has been under construction for four years.
SNT.761179.2280	These are to be replanted to replace the native flora.
SNT.761179.2281	The dam replaces an old dam, first built in 1911 but subsequently expanded several times.
SNT.761179.2282	Now heritage listed, it has been submerged by the waters of the new dam.
SNT.761179.2283	Some materials were salvaged from the old dam to build the new, and some have been put on display.
SNT.761179.2284	The river is named after Garrett Cotter, an Irish-born convict who was transported to Australia and lived in the area in the 1830s and 1840s.

SNT.88221.2296	It has emerged that last night a bridge was swept away by the swollen river it stretched across, leaving around 40 to 50 people missing in Madiun, East Java.
SNT.88221.2297	Meanwhile, the total toll of those known or feared to be dead has reached 130.
SNT.88221.2298	According to local police chief Supardi in a telephone conversation with Xinhua the flood waters weakened a foundation, resulting in the collapse.
SNT.88221.2299	At least twenty motorcyclists, car drivers and passengers are thought to be dead, but as of midnight, no bodies had been recovered.
SNT.88221.2300	Continuing heavy rain forced the search to be abandoned temporarily.
SNT.88221.2301	Java as a whole is the worst affected island; in addition to the bridge collapse most of the landslides occurred in two Central Java districts.
SNT.88221.2302	Health ministry official Rustam Pakaya told reporters that at least 28,000 people have been forced to abandon their homes in central Java, although exact figures are not yet available.
SNT.88221.2303	The Red Cross commented that 45,000 East Javanese people have been similarly displaced.
SNT.88221.2304	Thousands are seeking shelter in mosques and other public buildings.
SNT.88221.2305	Landslides buried houses and made roads impassable, while hundreds police officers, military personnel, local officials and volunteers have been digging with farm tools and even their hands to search for survivors.
SNT.88221.2306	Heavy machinery is available but the road conditions have prevented it arriving at the areas where it is required.
SNT.88221.2307	Jakarta has dispatched aid in the form of five tonnes of biscuits and instant meals, ten tonnes of baby food and multiple boats.
SNT.88221.2308	This brings the total confirmed death toll in the area to 48.
SNT.88221.2309	He said that most bodies were recovered from three metre deep mud and required heavy digging machinery to retrieve.
SNT.88221.2310	Local resident Siswo told AFP "Suddenly I felt my house shaking, and I thought it was an earthquake."
SNT.88221.2311	"When I got outside, I saw that the houses next to mine were already covered by earth," and that it struck twelve neighbouring houses.
SNT.88221.2312	In the next district, Wonogiri, disaster management centre head Sri Mubadi told reporters they had retrieved two more bodies, reaching a total of six, with eleven more missing.
SNT.88221.2313	He also confirmed that they currently have no access to heavy equipment.
SNT.88221.2314	In Tawangmangu about 1,000 rescuers were also searching for bodies and survivors without the aid of heavy machinery.
SNT.88221.2315	Islamic cleric Abu Bakar Bashir toured a Karanganyar village, at which time he commented that he felt the disaster had been caused as a form of divine revenge, saying "This was likely caused by immoral acts going on here," and "This could be a lesson to be learned."
SNT.88221.2316	The 69-year-old served two years after being linked to the 2002 Bali bombings, before having his conviction overturned last year.
SNT.88221.2317	For five consecutive years landslides and floods have occurred in Java, claiming many lives. 
SNT.88221.2318	 The main trigger is ecological destruction caused by deforestation, forest conversions and chaotic spatial planning, Chalid told Reuters.
SNT.88221.2319	There have been no adequate efforts by the government to protect the people from disasters. 
SNT.88221.2320	 When the landslides happened officials were on holiday and there was no access of heavy equipment to the affected areas.

SNT.108527.2379	An Australian air safety group claims that Yogyakarta International Airport was opearating illegally with no license when Garuda Indonesia Flight 200, a Boeing 737, crashed at the airport, killing 16 Indonesians and five Australians.
SNT.108527.2380	Flight Safety Pty Ltd had been asked to carry out an independent investigation by an anonymous client after the March 2007 disaster, which occurred when the aircraft landed at excessive speed and shot off the end of the runway.
SNT.108527.2381	Flight Safety has now announced that they have found Yogyakarta International had been granted a five year license but this would be withdrawn after twelve months if several conditions were not met.
SNT.108527.2382	Since these conditions remained unchanged, the license effectively voided six months before the disaster, claim Flight Safety.
SNT.108527.2383	One of the conditions was extension of the runway and provision of an adequate Runway End Safety Area (RESA).
SNT.108527.2384	The group adds that it also conducted checks on Solo International Airport and Semarang International Airport, and that these airports also had invalid Airport Operating Certificates.
SNT.108527.2385	The final report was not released at the time as the client in question felt it 'too sensitive', and Flight Safety says that it was rapidly covered up three months later when it leaked in Indonesia.
SNT.108527.2386	The group says it notified the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO), and that they in turn said the Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) - who assisted in the crash investigation - was in control of the situation.
SNT.108527.2387	However, Flight Safety claim that when approached, the ATSB denied knowing about it.
SNT.108527.2388	Allegedly, the ATSB had missed the licensing discrepancy because they only checked the front page of the airport's license and did not conduct a detailed analysis of the small print.
SNT.108527.2389	Flight Safety claim that the Indonesian Director of Aviation Safety told them that the situation had been rectified.
SNT.108527.2390	However, the group have now conducted a re-audit and say Solo and Yogyakarta airports both remain illegal.
SNT.108527.2391	They go on to accuse the ICAO, ATSB and Indonesian Director of Aviation Safety of "keeping quiet" and described them as 'compromised'.
SNT.108527.2392	Flight Safety go on to claim that the survivors of the crash and relatives of the deceased have not been informed either, and say that this will have a serious effect on the compensation process and on any insurance claims.
SNT.108527.2393	Crikey, an Australian news service, also suggested that AU$12 million of aid promised by Australia to help Indonesia improve air safety is also being misused.
SNT.108527.2394	All Indonesia's air carriers are currently on the list of air carriers banned in the EU.
SNT.108527.2395	An official statement by Flight Safety head Chris Weir concluded "It [the group's findings] should now be exposed as the safety issues remain unresolved."
SNT.108527.2396	Mardjono Siswo Suwarno of the National Transport Safety Committee, the body responsible for investigating the disaster, denied that Yogyakarta Airport was illegal, saying "At that time [the license] was still valid, but the RESA was not long enough…"
SNT.108527.2397	"But still in the [Garuda] case, even if the RESA length was adequate, the plane would have still overrun because the speed was 1.8 times normal speed."
SNT.108527.2398	The final report found that the pilot-in-command, who has been arrested and charged over the crash, attempted to land after fifteen Ground Proximity Warning System activations to tell him he was landing too fast, and says that although a longer runway and full-sized RESA wouldn't have stopped an airliner traveling at such excessive speed it could have reduced the toll of deaths and injuries.
SNT.108527.2399	The directors of Yogyakarta and Solo airports claim that since the re-audit they have taken steps to improve safety and rectify any problems, but have not actually admitted their airports were illegal.
SNT.108527.2400	Indonesian director general of air transportation Budi Mulyawan Suyitno said that although local budget limitations have prevented some airports from being improved there are no problems currently at Yogyakarta, with improvements including declaration of a RESA for 140 metres of the 2,250 metre runway and stationing Aircraft Rescue and Firefighting trucks at the airport.

SNT.223324.2403	Officials confirmed the news after Dutch scientists completed tests on the bone.
SNT.223324.2404	The jawbone, which also had a wisdom tooth with it, was found by an American tourist close to the Phoenix Hotel.
SNT.223324.2405	A second bone had also been found by another tourist earlier this month.
SNT.223324.2406	The bone was sent to the Netherlands Forensic Institute where scientists completed tests.
SNT.223324.2407	They compared the bone to dental records given to them by Natalee's father, from which they confirmed the the bone was not that of Natalee, although it was human.
SNT.223324.2408	It was said to be unlikely that the bone was Holloway's as there is no physical evidence that she was murdered.

SNT.630979.2425	According to this report the drills — which began on Friday — are to be conducted over roughly half a million square miles (a million square kilometers) of waters stretching from the Strait of Hormuz to the northern part of the Indian Ocean which includes the Gulf of Oman.

SNT.630979.2427	According to the U.S. Energy Information Administration, 17 million barrels of oil passes through this part of the Persian Gulf per day.
SNT.630979.2428	That is nearly 20% of the worldwide oil trade and about 35% of oil transported by sea.

SNT.630979.2432	Iran has said it might close the strait if its nuclear program were attacked.

SNT.62405.2487	Just two weeks after China sent global markets into a tumble, growing worries about sub-prime mortgage lenders in the United States are sending jitters through stock exchanges around the globe.
SNT.62405.2488	The three major US stock market indices each fell two percent from Monday's closing price, marking the second-biggest loss of 2007.
SNT.62405.2489	London's FTSE 100, Paris' CAC 40 and Frankfurt's DAX 30 indices each closed down more than 1 percent.
SNT.62405.2490	As the Mortgage Bankers Association reported that late payments on mortgages and home foreclosures in the US homes rose in the fourth quarter to their highest level in years, investors are concerned that not only US banks but also multi-national banks around the globe could have exposure.
SNT.62405.2491	More than two dozen sub-prime lenders have closed or sold operations as defaults on those mortgages have risen.
SNT.62405.2492	The delinquencies and defaults have started to soar, said Nicolas Retsinas, director of Housing Studies at Harvard University.
SNT.62405.2493	A lot of these lenders started to make loans and lost track of some of the fundamentals.
SNT.62405.2494	New Century Financial Corporation, the second largest sub-prime lender in the US, has recently revealed that its creditors were no longer providing funds and, further, it has become subject of an SEC investigation.
SNT.62405.2495	The New York Stock Exchange has said it will delist New Century.
SNT.62405.2496	Accredited Home Loan Lending, another major sub-prime mortgage specialist, said it was seeking fresh capital and waivers on its lending covenants.
SNT.62405.2497	Sub-prime lenders provide mortgages to people who do not qualify for loans from mainstream lenders, typically due to their credit histories.
SNT.62405.2498	The lenders then bundle these mortgages as collateral for loans that they obtain from other financing firms, such as GMAC.
SNT.62405.2499	Such firms can then repackage these loans and sell them as mortgage-backed securities.
SNT.62405.2500	These securities may end up in the hands of major multi-national banks such as Citibank, HSBC, and Commerzbank.
SNT.62405.2501	Each level of lending assumes a level of financial risk, but trouble can arise when the risk tolerances are exceeded.
SNT.62405.2502	If too many homeowners default on their mortgages, the sub-prime lender can end up defaulting.
SNT.62405.2503	If too many of these lenders default, as it is feared may be happening now, the defaults can cascade upward.
SNT.62405.2504	While no one is predicting major bank failures at this point, it is feared that their profits could be hurt.

SNT.7710.2559	April 9, 2005 A rise in flesh-eating staph infections has worried doctors about the possible spread of drug resistant bacteria.
SNT.7710.2560	Staphylococcus aureus, commonly known as staph, is a bacteria that commonly causes skin infections in otherwise healthy people.
SNT.7710.2561	However, as a persistent threat in hospitals, it tends to infect patients who are already sick and whose systems are vulnerable due to IV lines that pierce the skin.
SNT.7710.2562	Doctors have already battled for years against drug-resistant strains of the bacteria, but the struggle has generally been confined to hospitals.
SNT.7710.2563	Now, however, Methicillin Resistant Staph Aureus (MRSA) has been spreading in communities outside hospitals.
SNT.7710.2564	Cases have multiplied by 25 times since 1998 at the University of Chicago.
SNT.7710.2565	A Los Angeles hospital documented 14 cases of the flesh-eating infection, where patients required substantial time in intensive care and surgery.
SNT.7710.2566	The infections are particularly problematic because nearly a quarter of people who get a staph infection require hospitalization.
SNT.7710.2567	Staph infections are spread much like other diseases, with crowded conditions, poor hygiene, and skin-to-skin contact most frequently to blame.
SNT.7710.2568	At higher risk are prison inmates, homeless people, military personnel, and families with kids in day care.
SNT.7710.2569	Athletes also have a higher risk, because sweating makes it easier for bacteria to infect the skin.

SNT.169599.2571	A Tesoro Corp. refinery caught fire at about 0030 local time (0830 GMT) while maintenance work was being performed in preparation for returning a part of the plant to operation in a dangerous procedure involving increasing heat and pressure in the unit involved.
SNT.169599.2572	Some people reportedly felt the explosion, which sent flames as high as the tower in the refinery, from as far as five miles away.
SNT.169599.2573	The fire, whose cause is not yet known, burned for around an hour and a half before being extinguished.
SNT.169599.2574	Initially, Tesoro announced that three people had died in the fire.
SNT.169599.2575	According to a spokesperson from Harborview Medical Center in Seattle, a fourth person, a 29-year-old woman, later died from her injuries at the hospital, while three other people, a woman and two men, all remain in critical condition with major burns.
SNT.169599.2576	Three of the dead were named as Matthew Bowen, Darren Hoines and Daniel Aldridge, while the person who died in the hospital has not been identified.
SNT.169599.2577	According to CNN, three workers are still missing, and a search has begun for them.
SNT.169599.2578	The incident was the first fire at an oil refinery in Anacortes since 2007, when a fire at the Shell Puget Sound Refinery damaged a storage, resulting in three minor injuries.
SNT.169599.2579	A Tesoro-owned refinery was involved in another fire in 2002, also with no reported injuries.

SNT.117294.2594	It ended when commandos finally caught up with a lone gunman, who had played a cat-and-mouse game in the Taj Mahal Palace & Tower, nearly 56 hours after the attacks began.
