SNT.15800.3831	A multi-center US study of 748 patients, who were to undergo treatment for coronary artery disease, has found that prayer by Christian, Muslim, Jewish, and Buddhist groups had no measurable effects on the medical health of the study subjects.
SNT.15800.3832	The prayers were conducted by established congregations and were held away from the hospitals.
SNT.15800.3833	The study, published in the 16 July 2005 issue of The Lancet, found that the likelihood of an adverse cardiovascular event in hospital, re-admission or death within six months was unaffected by prayer.
SNT.15800.3834	None of the patients were told that they were prayed for, and none of the prayer groups knew who they prayed for.
SNT.15800.3835	The study also examined the effects of "music, imagery, and touch (MIT) therapy" before heart surgery.
SNT.15800.3836	Practitioners qualified to Level 1 Healing Touch taught the patient relaxation techniques and played soothing music before applying 21 Healing Touch hand positions, over a 40 minute session.
SNT.15800.3837	There was no significant change in the combined chance of an adverse cardiovascular event in hospital, re-admission or death within six months.
SNT.15800.3838	However, while the set of patients was evenly split, only 7 patients who received MIT therapy died, and 20 patients who did not receive it died.
SNT.15800.3839	The result is not highly significant due to the low overall number of people who died.
SNT.15800.3840	A number of studies has recently examined the possible effects of prayer, with mixed results.
SNT.15800.3841	While some religious groups have hailed studies which found positive results , skeptics have challenged the very notion of scientifically examining prayer , and have described past studies as flawed or even fraudulent.
SNT.15800.3842	The mechanisms through which distant intercessory prayer might convey healing benefit are unknown, the authors of the study explain.
SNT.15800.3843	One hypothesis they propose for such effects are "non-local features of consciousness based theoretically around observations in quantum physics."

SNT.47309.3845	UNSC Resolution 1701, which calls for a "full cessation of hostilities" in the Israeli-Lebanon war, was passed by the UN Security Council last Friday and was approved by Lebanon and Israel over the weekend.
SNT.47309.3846	Lebanon's defence minister, Elias Murr, says that the 15,000 troops Lebanon has committed to the peacekeeping operation will be on the north side of the Litani River by the end of the week.
SNT.47309.3847	As part of the truce agreement, they must cross the river and exercise control over what has been Hezbollah controlled territory in southern Lebanon.

SNT.105849.3855	People studying the situation in Myanmar are claiming that an inadequate response of the government of Myanmar (formerly Burma) to scientists' warnings about the cyclone, coupled with large-scale destruction of protective mangroves along its coasts, aggravated the devastation wreaked by tropical Cyclone Nargis.
SNT.105849.3856	The cyclone has killed an estimated 22,980 people so far, with millions rendered homeless by the disaster, which struck the Irrawaddy Delta region of Myanmar last week (3 May).
SNT.105849.3857	Scientists at the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) in New Delhi, theWorld Meteorological Organisation's specialist centre for Asia, say they issued the first of the cyclone bulletins to Myanmar as early as 26 April.
SNT.105849.3858	Mrityunjay Mohapatra, director of IMD's cyclone-warning centre, told SciDev.Net that Myanmar was warned of the impending cyclone at least 48 hours in advance.
SNT.105849.3859	But there was no acknowledgement from Myanmar's meteorological office, or any indication of a response.
SNT.105849.3860	Mohapatra says IMD's first warning bulletin, issued on 1 May, indicated the land area likely to be hit by the cyclone.
SNT.105849.3861	It warned that a cyclone with wind speeds of 180 kilometres per hour would cross the southwest coast of Myanmar sometime between 8pm and midnight on the night of the 2 May.
SNT.105849.3862	IMD's bulletins contain information on the actual and predicted centre, intensity and movement of the cyclone, as well as sea conditions and maximum wind speeds around the cyclone centre.
SNT.105849.3863	Uma Charan Mohanty, from the Asian Disaster Preparedness Centre in Thailand, said that, according to the World Meteorological Organisation's data, Asian cyclones are fewer and less intense than hurricanes in the Atlantic Ocean or typhoons in the Pacific Ocean region, but they cause more death and destruction.
SNT.105849.3864	In 2005, 25 hurricanes in the Atlantic caused 10 deaths, but cyclone Sidr, which hit Bangladesh in 2007, left 3,500 dead.
SNT.105849.3865	Mohanty says that the Atlantic coast has a good early-warning system and people have the means to drive to safer areas.
SNT.105849.3866	In contrast, Asian coasts are densely populated, with many poor fishing and farming communities who cannot evacuate on their own, even if they have been warned.
SNT.105849.3867	News agencies quote Maung Swe, Myanmar's minister for relief and resettlement, who told a press conference (6 May) that most deaths were caused by a 3.5-metre-high storm surge — a wall of water that develops when cyclonic winds churn up sea water.
SNT.105849.3868	Mohanty says that 85 per cent of cyclone deaths are due to storm surges and that predictions of the size and location of such surges are critical in disaster forecasting.
SNT.105849.3869	Asian coasts are also becoming increasingly vulnerable because of the loss of protective mangrove forests that serve as windbreaks and limit damage by storm and tidal surges.
SNT.105849.3870	In a 2006 report, the International Union for Conservation of Nature said that areas in Sri Lanka with mangrove forests suffered less damage in the 2004 Asian tsunami, compared with regions where forests had been destroyed.
SNT.105849.3871	And in January 2008, the UN Food and Agriculture Organization warned that Asia is fast losing its coastal mangroves, with more than 1.9 million hectares being destroyed each year.
SNT.105849.3872	The organisation's report reviewed the world's mangroves between 1980 and 2005.
SNT.105849.3873	It found that the mangrove forests around Myanmar's Irrawady Delta had degraded because of "overexploitation" and the conversion of land for rice fields — promoted by the government as a way to ensure self-sufficiency in food production.
SNT.105849.3874	Government officials in Myanmar have said that 22,464 people have been confirmed dead from Cyclone Nargis.
SNT.105849.3875	Only once rescue workers reached the hardest hit areas of the storm did they begin to realize the extent of damage that had occurred.
SNT.105849.3876	At least 10,000 people died in one town alone, Bogalay in the Pyapon District of the country.
SNT.105849.3877	The United Nations has reported that one million people are homeless, or in need of help in some other way.
SNT.99990.3878	Dutch financial institution ING Group reported today in its quarterly results an impairment charge of €194 million euros (approximately US$285.6 million).
SNT.99990.3879	However, as a result of selling an equity stake in rival ABN AMRO, the net profit of €2.48 billion, was 18% higher than last year.
SNT.99990.3880	The impairment charge is a result of risky investments, including RBMS (mortgage) investments backed by subprime loans and Alt-A loans, which are made to borrowers with a slightly better credit profile than those in the subprime category, as well as from collateral debt obligations (CDOs).
SNT.270995.3881	Modern polar bears are genetically related to an extinct species of Irish brown bear, according to a study published Thursday in Current Biology.
SNT.270995.3882	The two share a distinct genetic marker not present in other brown bears, strongly suggesting that all modern polar bears are descended from the same extinct species.
SNT.270995.3883	The study found evidence of polar bear hybridization with a now-extinct population of brown bears that lived in Ireland and Britain during the last ice age.
SNT.270995.3884	Brown bears are no longer found on the British Isles, and it had been thought that polar bears interbred more recently with brown bears living around Alaska.
SNT.270995.3885	However, the samples used in the analysis came from the past 120,000 years and show that interbreeding of the two species occurred a great deal earlier.
SNT.270995.3886	Climate change is thought to have presented opportunities for the two species to mate now and then in the past 100,000 years.
SNT.270995.3887	The evidence comes from a DNA analysis of fossil bones collected from the teeth and bones of seventeen bears from eight Irish caves.
SNT.270995.3888	Ten Irish brown bears from between 10,000 and 38,000 years ago carried a distinct sequence of mitochondrial DNA, originating from a specific female brown bear, and this DNA sequence has been passed down the female polar bear line and is found in all polar bears today.
SNT.270995.3889	Fossils from the last species of ancient brown bears in Ireland, living from 3,000 to 5,000 years ago, have a different genetic fingerprint, matching neither that of polar bears nor of modern brown bears.
SNT.270995.3890	A member of the international team conducting the study, Dr Ceiridwen Edwards from Oxford University, said: "Hybridisation between ancient Irish brown bears and polar bears has led to the complete replacement of the original polar bear mitochondria.
SNT.270995.3891	This maternal lineage is now present in all modern polar bears."
SNT.270995.3892	The authors of the paper conclude that their evidence shows that matrilineal history of brown and polar bears suggest that "a likely genetic exchange with extinct Irish brown bears forms the origin of the modern polar bear matriline."
SNT.270995.3893	They suggest that hybridization may be more common than previously recognized and may be a way species deal with loss of their habitats when the environment is changing.

SNT.78857.3899	Freelance journalist, Gabriel Pollard, spoke to Joe Stewart and David Farrar about the new anti-spam legislation in New Zealand that comes into effect today.
SNT.78857.3900	Joe Stewart is the Unit Manager of the Department of Internal Affairs new Anti-Spam Compliance Unit, and David Farrar is Chair of InternetNZ’s Public Policy Committee, who also had significant input into the final bill.
SNT.78857.3901	Keith Norris, CEO of the New Zealand Marketing Association, didn't respond to multiple requests for an interview.
SNT.78857.3902	The anti-spam legislation, or the Unsolicited Electronic Messages Act 2007, promotes spam education and awareness and will enable international agencies to work together to share information and will enable cross-border pursuit of serious law breakers.
SNT.78857.3903	And it doesn't just cover e-mail spam, but all electronic messaging such as SMS/text messaging, etc.
SNT.78857.3904-1	However, New Zealand isn't the most up-to-date country with implementing similar legislation, Farrar says, “We are in fact almost the last country in the OECD to have such legislation.” 
SNT.78857.3904-2	He urges Eastern Europe and China to take part in the fight against spam.
SNT.78857.3905	Stewart said that the new law would only help combat a small amount of spam, as 99%-99.9% of all spam received originates from overseas.
SNT.78857.3906	He says the legislation alone will not solve the problem.
SNT.78857.3907	As well as it helping to fight New Zealand-sourced spam and preventing New Zealand from “becoming a haven for spammers”, it will promote good practices within the e-marketing community, Stewart said.
SNT.78857.3908	The new Act will affect legitimate marketers in New Zealand by making sure they have expressed or inferred consent to continue sending marketing messages to people on their database.
SNT.78857.3909	Inferred consent is where the marketers have the e-mail address and send messages to those on their database, but didn't get expressed consent to send messages.
SNT.78857.3910	Stewart does issue a warning against using inferred consent saying, “They may have been sending these people messages for years, but this does not establish consent.”
SNT.78857.3911	A surge in emails has also been felt with companies/marketers making sure they have consent to continue the e-mails and asking those to confirm they wish to continue their subscription.
SNT.78857.3912	“However, many marketers are already fulfilling these requirements because they are standard good e-marketing practice,” Stewart said.
SNT.78857.3913	Due to legislative requirements, as well as having consent, businesses will have to provide details about the company sending the item, and provide a free way to unsubscribe from future mailings.
SNT.78857.3914	Those found breaking these requirements deliberately could find themselves facing a personal fine of up to NZ$200,000.
SNT.78857.3915	Farrar said, “Experience from Australia shows most cases are dealt with by way of education.”
SNT.78857.3916	Farrar also gives a final piece of advice to those annoyed with spam levels, “Never ever respond to a spam e-mail, and only give your real address out to people you trust.”

SNT.106006.3959	The discussion, which is titled 'The World that Wikipedia Made,' was to be based on the online encyclopedia Wikipedia and ethics involved in the editing of the website.
SNT.106006.3960	It is the ninth such meeting in a series on technology, ethics, and law and is taking place today.
SNT.106006.3961	In an e-mail to Wikinews, Miriam Schulman the communications director for the Markkula Center for Applied Ethics at Santa Clara University which is to host the discussion, states that Mike Godwin, legal counsel for the Foundation, will not be speaking during the discussion as was originally planned.
SNT.106006.3962	According to Schulman, Godwin canceled his scheduled appearance just one week ago and has decided not to have anyone from the foundation replace him.
SNT.106006.3963	Valleywag, a gossip website about technology, recently reported that Godwin was not attending due to a "groundswell of criticism of Wikipedia".
SNT.106006.3964	I don't want to speak for Mr. Godwin or Wikimedia, but someone else made an incorrect assumption about this, so let me clarify that in our understanding, the problem was never with the composition of the panel.
SNT.106006.3965	Mike Godwin, General Counsel of Wikimedia, was scheduled to participate in the panel, 'The World that Wikipedia Made,' on May 15.
SNT.106006.3966	 Last week, Mr. Godwin informed us that he would not participate, and subsequent discussions with Wikimedia Foundation indicated that they would not designate a replacement speaker, stated Schulman to Wikinews.
SNT.106006.3967	This is our ninth such panel (in addition to the hundreds of events on other topics our centers run each year), and we feel confident in our ability to set a respectful tone for discourse on controversial topics, added Schulman.
SNT.106006.3968	Schulman would not comment on the reason for the Foundation's decision.
SNT.106006.3969	Wikinews also attempted to contact Godwin, but was directed to Jay Walsh who is the head of communications for the Foundation, but Wikinews has not received a response.
SNT.106006.3970	The panel was to include Carl Hewitt an electrical and computer science engineer at Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Godwin discussing Wikipedia with Pedro Hernández-Ramos, associate director for the Center for Science, Technology, and Society moderating the discussion.
SNT.106006.3971	The plan was to discuss Wikipedia, and what does and doesn't work for the encyclopedia.
SNT.106006.3972	This panel will explore what works and what doesn't in the Wikipedia editing model from the angles of ethics, expertise, education, and the law, said a statement on the Center's website.
SNT.106006.3973	Schulman states that the discussion, which is open to the public, is "still planned" for Thursday May 15 at 6:00 p.m. (pacific time) at the De Saisset Museum on the university's campus, but it is not yet known if anyone outside the Foundation will be replacing Godwin.
SNT.106006.3974	The High Tech Law Institute along with the Ethics Center are sponsoring the discussion.
SNT.106006.3975	These events are always open to the public, which means everyone is welcome.
SNT.106006.3976	In this kind of setting, we invite anyone with an interest in the topic, stated Schulman to Wikinews.
SNT.106006.3977	The Foundation is the parent organization of Wikipedia and other projects such as Wikinews and Wikimedia Commons, a Wiki dedicated to hosting images that can be used throughout the projects of the Foundation.

SNT.198553.3981	The first came on Thursday, when the jury requested a transcript of one of the prosecution's closing arguements.
SNT.198553.3982	The second note came on Friday, when the foreman wrote "Is it permissible to obtain the transcript of the testimony? It would be helpful."
SNT.198553.3983	Zagel interpreted the request as saying that the jury wanted transcripts of the testimony of every single witness in the trial.
SNT.198553.3984	Zagel again declined the request because it was not practical to do so; about 30 witnesses testified in this case, and the transcripts have not yet been prepared.
SNT.198553.3985	Zagel instead offered to consider requests for transcripts of testimony from "specific identified witnesses", but said that he would warn the jury that such requests could take some time to fulfill.

SNT.198553.3987	Zagel said in reply that he would still consider each of the jury's requests individually.

SNT.8709.4070	New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) announced last Wednesday that it has agreed definitively to merge with Chicago-based Archipelago Exchange (ArcaEx) and form a new publicly traded, for-profit company known as NYSE Group.
SNT.8709.4071	This announcement was followed two days later by NASDAQ®, which independently announced a definitive agreement to purchase Instinet Group.
SNT.8709.4072	Archipelago and Instinet are innovative e-trading (electronic trading) companies, and formerly were the two largest American rivals to NYSE and NASDAQ, in recent years taking increasingly large portions of their market share.
SNT.8709.4073	The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and other regulatory agencies still have to review and approve the transactions, particularly with respect to US securities law and antitrust law, in order to ensure that the marketplace remains lawful and competitive.
SNT.8709.4074	Other pending issues for NASDAQ include obtaining the approval of Instinet shareholders, as well as customary closing conditions.
SNT.8709.4075	NYSE must obtain the approval of its members and Archipelago shareholders.
SNT.8709.4076	These changes, a reaction to increased e-trading competition and a changed regulatory environment, will result in NASDAQ and NYSE trading each other's shares and attempting to grab market share, which many hope will drive down transaction costs and ultimately benefit consumers.
SNT.8709.4077	However, at least one commentator, Dan Ackman writing in Forbes, has noted that the trading commission at the NYSE currently averages less than a nickel (US$0.05) per share, and was less enthusiastic about potential efficiency gains from electronic trading at the exchange.
SNT.8709.4078	The transactions are also intended to make the two leading American stock exchanges more globally competitive with such exchanges as the London Stock Exchange, the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, the Toronto Stock Exchange, and the Australian Stock Exchange located in Sydney.

SNT.423635.4117	The state's governor Dannel Malloy signed the repeal into law on Wednesday and is to take effect immediately.
SNT.423635.4118	"This afternoon I signed legislation that will, effective today, replace the death penalty with life in prison without the possibility of release as the highest form of legal punishment in Connecticut."
SNT.423635.4119	In future convictions, the death penalty will be replaced with life imprisonment with no possibility of parole.
SNT.423635.4120	However, despite the state's decision, prisoners currently serving a death row sentence are still set to be executed as planned.
SNT.423635.4121	Currently in Connecticut, eleven prisoners are serving a death row sentence, all of them men.

SNT.423635.4123	The senate had passed the measure just seven days before.
SNT.423635.4124	Jodi Rell, then Connecticut's governor, blocked a prior attempt at repeal by state lawmakers in 2009.
SNT.423635.4125	Only one person in Connecticut has been executed since 1976, when the U.S. government reinstated the death penalty after the U.S. Supreme Court upheld capital punishment.
SNT.423635.4126	That execution of serial killer Michael Bruce Ross occurred in 2005 by lethal injection.
SNT.423635.4127	"As our state moves beyond this divisive debate, I hope we can all redouble our efforts and common work to improve the fairness and integrity of our criminal justice system, and to minimize its fallibility," added Malloy.

SNT.12045.4162	Charges include grand larceny, securities fraud, conspiracy, and falsifying business records.
SNT.12045.4163	The first trial ended in a mistrial after one juror received a threatening letter.
SNT.12045.4164	Nancy Salomon says of the second trial that the "Defense was counting on the jury not reaching a verdict; they had used their challenges during the jury selection process to kick almost every potential juror who had a college degree, or had any business experience or Wall Street experience off the jury ... they were hoping that this case was just going to be too confusing for the jury."
SNT.12045.4165	To combat the aggressive jury selection strategy undertaken by the defense, the prosecution "basically gave the jury several credit hours worth of an MBA", teaching them about following paper trails and detecting falsification of business records.
SNT.12045.4166	It paid off during deliberation as the jury requested over 100 documents to review.
SNT.12045.4167	The two former executives face a minimum of eight years in prison, up to a maximum of 25 years.
SNT.12045.4168	In addition, Kozlowski is accused of evading $1 million in sales taxes on six paintings that he bought in 2001 in a separate New York State case, and Swartz faces tax evasion charges in New Hampshire.
SNT.12045.4169	If convicted in these cases as well, they would face up to 30 years in prison.

SNT.190678.4174	What is believed to be the world's oldest leather shoe, over 5,500 year old, has been found in a cave in Armenia by a team of archaeologists.
SNT.190678.4175	The Armenian shoe is in a perfectly preserved condition and is a few hundred years older than the one found on Ötzi the Iceman, making it the oldest piece of leather footwear in the world, and the oldest footwear yet found in Europe.
SNT.190678.4176	The leather shoe was found in a cave dubbed Areni-1, near the village of Areni in the Vayots Dzor province of Armenia, on the Iranian and Turkish borders.
SNT.190678.4177	"I was amazed to find that even the shoe-laces were preserved," recalled Diana Zardaryan, the Armenian PhD student who made the discovery.
SNT.190678.4178	According to researchers, the shoe, made of cow-hide, consists of only one leather piece and was probably customised to the wearer's foot.
SNT.190678.4179	It was relatively small, measuring the corresponding to European size 37 or US size 7 women, however, it could have been worn by a man.
SNT.190678.4180	It was kept in excellent condition by a thick layer of sheep excrement, which acted as a seal, helping it survive the millennia.
SNT.190678.4181	The shoe contained grass, although the archaeologists were uncertain as to whether this was to used to maintain the shape of the shoe and/or prepare it for storage.
SNT.190678.4182	"We thought initially that the shoe and other objects were about 600-700 years old because they were in such good condition," said co-author Dr. Ron Pinhasi from the University College Cork in Ireland.
SNT.190678.4183	The shoe and the cave will continue to be researched.
SNT.190678.4184	"We do not know yet what the shoe or other objects were doing in the cave or what the purpose of the cave was," said Pinhasi, "We know that there are children's graves at the back of the cave but so little is known about this period that we cannot say with any certainty why all these different objects were found together".
SNT.190678.4185	Currently, the oldest known footwear are sandals made from sagebrush bark, found in Fort Rock Cave, Oregon in the United States.
SNT.190678.4186	These shoes were discovered in 1938, and have been dated to about 10,000 years before present.
SNT.190678.4187	Discoveries within the cave move early bronze-age cultural activity in Armenia back by about 800 years.
SNT.190678.4188	Additional discoveries yielded an extensive array of Copper Age artifacts dating to between 6,200 and 5,900 years ago.
SNT.236246.4189	In a Tuesday media event, Verizon Wireless announced it had reached an agreement with Apple Inc. and would begin selling a CDMA version of the iPhone 4 beginning early February.
SNT.236246.4190	The move means the end of rival company AT&T's status as the only official US carrier of the iPhone, a status it held since the first iPhone debuted in 2007.
SNT.236246.4191	The press conference, held in New York City, was hosted by Verizon's president, Lowell McAdam, Apple's chief operating officer, Tim Cook, and Verizon Wireless' chief executive officer, Dan Mead.
SNT.236246.4192	Neither Verizon Communications CEO Ivan Seidenberg nor Apple CEO Steve Jobs attended the conference.
SNT.236246.4193	During the event, McAdam said, "If the press writes something long enough and hard enough, it eventually comes true."
SNT.236246.4194	"We're bringing the fruit of our labor with a giant partner, and that's Apple."
SNT.236246.4195	Such a partnership had been rumored for years, and the amount of speculation grew over the past few months.
SNT.236246.4196	iPhone 4 pre-orders for current Verizon users begin February 3, and a public release is scheduled for February 10.
SNT.236246.4197	The "Verizon iPhone," as it has been dubbed for months, has been altered from the original iPhone 4 so it can utilize Verizon's 3G CDMA (code division multiple access) network.
SNT.236246.4198	This means, however, that Verizon iPhone users will not be able to use the company's 4G LTE (long term evolution) network, and will thus be unable to make calls and access the Internet at the same time.
SNT.236246.4199	Cook told the audience that the LTE hardware was not ready yet, saying, "The first generation LTE chip sets force some design compromises, some of which we would not make."
SNT.236246.4200	"Secondly—and most importantly—Verizon Wireless customers have told us they want the iPhone now."
SNT.236246.4201	However, Verizon's iPhone 4 allows the user to create a personal Wi-Fi hotspot, which means up to five other wireless devices can connect to the Internet through the phone.
SNT.236246.4202	Pricing was announced as US$199 for a 16 GB version and US$299 for a 32 GB version, both requiring two-year contracts—the same cost for an AT&T iPhone 4.
SNT.236246.4203	However, Verizon said it would not mention the cost of data plans at this time, with Mead saying, "We talked about the device pricing, but we're not going to talk about the pricing for the network for that connectivity."

SNT.40624.4215	Despite entering the match with the burden of having to score 32 points and receiving a bonus point (by scoring four tries), the Bulls managed to overcome fellow South African team, the Stormers, at Newlands Stadium in Cape Town on Saturday May 13, winning the match 43 points to 10 in the final round of the regular season.
SNT.40624.4217	Entering the final round of the regular season, the Bulls and fellow South African Durban-based Sharks, as well as the Australian Canberra-based Brumbies were the only sides in contention for the fourth and last finals position.
SNT.40624.4218	After the Brumbies, who unlike the Sharks were actually ahead on the number of points, were soundly defeated by the Canterbury-based Crusaders, 33 points to 3, the result meant that either the Sharks or Bulls could mathematically take fourth position on the ladder.
SNT.40624.4219	The Sharks stormed to victory over Perth-based Western Force, winning 41 points to 25, meaning that the Bulls would have to score at least four tries to be ensured of a bonus point, to move ahead of the Sharks, who were now sitting in front of them on points difference.

SNT.40624.4221	A try to the Stormers happened in the opening minute of the second half, though the Bulls held on to the victory.
SNT.40624.4222	Bryan Habana scored the last try, which was subsequently converted and pushed the Bulls into fourth place on the table on points difference.
SNT.40624.4223	The Bulls will now faced the Crusaders in New Zealand next week for a spot in the final, the other spot is to be contested also in New Zealand, between the Wellington-based Hurricanes and the New South Wales Waratahs.

SNT.57053.4227	"Moreover, the new warranty policy is retroactive, so consumers that may have already paid for out-of-warranty Xbox 360 repair within one year of the console's purchase will be eligible for reimbursement of their console repair charges."
SNT.57053.4228	This extension should help ease customers' minds who have been concerned with the Xbox 360's reputation for hardware failures.

SNT.57053.4231	Previously in September, 2006, Microsoft had waived the cost for repairs on all Xbox 360 consoles made before January 1, 2006, and refunded any fees already paid.

SNT.109708.4246	On January 8, 2008 in Stephenville, Texas, one of the larger UFO sightings in the United States occurred.
SNT.109708.4247	A few days ago the UFO investigative organization Mutual UFO Network (MUFON) released a 77-page report on the sighting.
SNT.109708.4248	MUFON is a UFO investigative organization in the United States.
SNT.109708.4249	Founded in 1969, it now has 3,000 members and is headquartered in Fort Collins, Colorado.
SNT.109708.4250	The MUFON report, entitled "Special Research Report Stephenville, Texas" was written by Glen Schulze and Ropert Powell.
SNT.109708.4251	Shulze has radar experience from working at the White Sands Missile Range.
SNT.109708.4252	Powell has a chemistry degree and has extensive experience with semiconductors from working for Advanced Micro Devices.
SNT.109708.4253	The report is an analysis of radar records from the Federal Aviation Administration and the National Weather Service, obtained through several Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests, and comparing them to witness accounts.
SNT.109708.4254	Shulze/Powell concluded that the radar data confirms the witness observations of an object, as well as the Air Force's statement that said ten aircraft were operating in the area.
SNT.109708.4255	They say that it is too difficult to say what the witnesses saw, but that there was something there.
SNT.109708.4256	Twice, they say, radar picked up an object travelling at nearly 2,000 mph, and at other times it showed a slow moving object.
SNT.109708.4257	Much media attention has been focused on the report's observation that radar records show one of two objects moving directly toward the Prairie Chapel Ranch in Crawford.
SNT.109708.4258	This is the home of United States President George W. Bush, which has been nicknamed the Western White House.
SNT.109708.4259	They did not draw any conclusion as to why such movement was observed.
SNT.109708.4260	The authors also concluded that military air activity was heavy at the time, but that the radar records show no overt action toward the unknown object.
SNT.109708.4261	They express concern about the possibilty that this could have been a terrorist aircraft with no transponder.
SNT.109708.4262	Shulze/Powell stated that they felt that they had been stonewalled in some of their FOIA requests by some government agencies.
SNT.109708.4263	They encouraged the government to more readily provide more information about the incident.
SNT.109708.4264	The Stephenville incident on January 8, saw dozens of witnesses reporting a large object in the evening sky that hovered above the community before it took off at high speed.
SNT.109708.4265	Steve Allen, a pilot, observed the object from the ground and described it as being a half-mile with flashing strobe lights.
SNT.109708.4266	He also said that it was pursued by two fighter jets, when it disappeared at a speed he estimated to be 3,000 mph.
SNT.109708.4267	"I don't know if it was a biblical experience or somebody from a different universe or whatever but it was definitely not from around these parts," Allen said.
SNT.109708.4268	Another witness was local law enforcement officer Leroy Gateman who reported it as a red glowing object suspended 3,000 feet in the air.
SNT.109708.4269	"It was so fast I couldn't track it with my binoculars," said Gateman.
SNT.109708.4270	Rick Sorrells says he saw the object while deer hunting in the woods.
SNT.109708.4271	"You look at the trees, and it was right here," he told ABC News.
SNT.109708.4272	He estimated it to be the length of "three or four football fields," though he could not be entirely sure due to his vantage point.
SNT.109708.4273	Sorrells has later claimed that military helicopters have since overflown his property at low altitude and that he has been getting strange phone calls.
SNT.109708.4274	He also claims that an unknown man came to his door, even once told him that,"Son we have the same caliber weapons you have, but we have more of them", after Sorrells grabbed his rifle, and, "You need to shut your mouth about what you saw."
SNT.109708.4275	"I'm trying to decide whether or not to open the door," Sorrells said to the Empire-Tribune.
SNT.109708.4276	"We're just standing there face to face looking at each other."
SNT.109708.4277	"I'm thinking he's dressed for the elements and the dogs are raising such a ruckus he must know he's in danger of being caught."
SNT.109708.4278	"That's when I realized he wanted me to see him."
SNT.109708.4279	The man then turned away and walked into the woods.
SNT.109708.4280	The United States Air Force initially said witnesses must have seen reflections coming from commercial airliners.
SNT.109708.4281	However, they later clarified that ten F-16 Fighting Falcons had been on a night-time training mission in the area on January 8.
SNT.109708.4282	"In the interest of public awareness, Air Force Reserve Command Public Affairs realized an error was made regarding the reported training activity of military aircraft," said the statement.
SNT.109708.4283	According to Air Force spokesperson Karl Lewis, the aircraft were from the 457th Fighter Squadron and the error in the initial report was due to an internal communications problem between offices at the base.
SNT.256881.4284	Following on from January's strike, the UK's Public and Commercial Services Union (PCS) yesterday took 24 hours strike action in a dispute over working conditions within call centres providing Jobcentre services for the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP).
SNT.256881.4285	A press release sent Sunday night by Katrine Williams, the Chair of PCS Wales, states 70% of members who voted were in favour of the industrial action.
SNT.256881.4286	PCS members "suffer oppressive working conditions that simply result in high levels of stress and sickness" according to the union, and points to the 2,779 staff who left Jobcentre Plus call centres since April last year – approximately 20% of the workforce in the 37 Jobcentre Plus offices handling calls from the public – as evidence of the challenging work environment.
SNT.256881.4287	The union says management is "obsessed with hitting call centre targets at the expense of providing good quality services to the public".
SNT.256881.4288	The DWP characterises the action differently, stating 75% of staff voted against the strike.
SNT.256881.4289	According to the DWP staff work under reasonable terms, but "we have to ensure that our service is available when our customers, who include some of the most vulnerable people in the country, need us."
SNT.256881.4290	To that end the DWP readily admits it uses performance measures to ensure high productivity and performance, their goal is to "deliver value for money for the taxpayer", and they do not have any plans to change the way they do business.
SNT.256881.4291	A report in the Liverpool Daily Post cites more than 500 Merseyside staff on strike, and quotes PCS regional secretary Peter Middleman describing the culture in-place in Jobcentre Plus contact centres as "battery-farmed working practices".
SNT.256881.4292	Similarly, the Lancashire Telegraph cites 120 staff on strike at the Cardwell Place call centre and the expectation that 2,500 across the North West of England were expected to take action; Middleman is quoted describing the call centres as "the modern day equivalents of dark, satanic mills where our members are over worked, overly monitored and forced to endure an obsession with arbitrary targets".
SNT.256881.4293	The DWP reported the union informed them approximately 40% of the 9,000 staff in JSP contact centres would be taking action, which tallied with their own estimates.
SNT.256881.4294	Face-to-face Jobcentre services were unaffected by yesterday's strike action; the union have announced that this will be followed with an indefinite ban on members working overtime.

SNT.25404.4314	The Dover, Pennsylvania school board became the first to mandate inclusion of Intelligent Design in a public school biology curriculum.
SNT.25404.4315	For this year's November 8 election, Republicans fielded a pro-Intelligent Design slate of candidates including some returning candidates who had previously voted to include a statement about Intelligent Design in the biology curriculum.
SNT.25404.4316	A mixed slate of Democrat and Republican candidates came forward as an alternative group of school board candidates, the Dover CARES coalition.
SNT.25404.4317	They proposed to remove Intelligent Design from the biology curriculum but allow discussion of Intelligent Design in courses dealing with philosophy and comparative religion.
SNT.25404.4318	All eight open school board seats were won by Dover CARES coalition candidates.
SNT.25404.4319	Two candidates who had previously voted as school board members to include intelligent design in the public school science curriculum received the fewest votes in Tuesday's election.
SNT.25404.4320	One of the newly elected board members is Bryan Rehm, a parent of a Dover school student.
SNT.25404.4321	Rehm, along with ten other parents, initiated a law suit against the school board for its decision to insert Intelligent Design into the science curriculum.
SNT.25404.4322	In October 2004, the Dover school board decided that Intelligent Design is a scientific theory that should be mentioned in biology classes that include discussion of biological evolution as part of the course content.
SNT.25404.4323	The board mandated that a statement should be read in those classes stating "Intelligent Design is an explanation of the origin of life," and "The school leaves the discussion of the Origins of Life to individual students and their families."
SNT.25404.4324	The school board's statement on Intelligent Design directs students to the book Of Pandas and People as a source of information "for students who might be interested in gaining an understanding of what Intelligent Design actually involves."
SNT.25404.4325	This book is published by the Foundation for Thought and Ethics, a non-profit organization founded for the purpose of "promoting and publishing textbooks presenting a Christian perspective."
SNT.25404.4326	Parents of some Dover public school students filed a lawsuit against the school board, charging that including the school board's statement on Intelligent Design was an attempt to introduce religion into the science curriculum.
SNT.25404.4327	The book Of Pandas and People says, "Intelligent design means that various forms of life began abruptly through an intelligent agency."
SNT.25404.4328	The original complaint in the law suit against the school board claimed that "Intelligent design is a non-scientific argument or assertion."
SNT.25404.4329	The US District Court Judge John Jones, who heard the non-jury case, hopes to make his ruling by the end of the year.
SNT.25404.4330	The evidence phase of the trial ended on November 4, 2005.
SNT.25404.4331	A local Dover newspaper, the York Daily Record, editorialized that Dover voters should take trial testimony into account during the general election when they could cast votes for school board members along with other elective offices.
SNT.25404.4332	Biology teachers in the Dover schools have refused to read the school board's statement on Intelligent Design to students because the Pennsylvania state code for education states that "The professional educator may not knowingly and intentionally misrepresent subject matter."
SNT.25404.4333	In a letter to their administrator, the teachers stated their view that "Intelligent design is not science."
SNT.25404.4334	School administrators have been reading the school board's Intelligent Design statement to students in Dover public schools.

SNT.10408.4340	NASA has completed a major test of a 20-meter square solar sail, marking a "crucial milestone" in space propulsion technology.
SNT.10408.4341	It is not the first to test solar sails, as the Japanese have deployed two solar sails in space.
SNT.10408.4342	The Planetary Society is planning on launching a solar sail possibly by June 21.
SNT.10408.4343	Shot into orbit by a converted intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), the Cosmos 1 would be launched from a submerged Russian submarine from within the Barents Sea.
SNT.10408.4344	The spacecraft, powered by the sail, will have no destination.
SNT.10408.4345	The purpose is simply to test the propulsion system that uses the pressure from solar light particles to move the ship outward from a starting orbit around the earth at 500 miles.
SNT.10408.4346	The propulsion technology is currently believed to be the most efficient available for interstellar space travel.
SNT.10408.4347	Theoretically a craft propelled by the pressure of a constant light source, such as a purpose-built laser, could achieve speeds approaching the speed of light.
SNT.10408.4348	This is due to the efficiencies of the spacecraft not having to carry its own fuel.
SNT.10408.4349	Approaching the speed of light would, however, require a long period of constant acceleration.
SNT.10408.4350	Such high speed will be impossible for the current test vehicles and any launched in the foreseeable future, as they rely on the light from the Sun, which rapidly becomes weaker with increasing distance.
SNT.10408.4351	According to the National Geographic News, "NASA, the European Space Agency, Japan, and Russia all have developed solar sails, but none has yet tried to prove that the sails can propel a spacecraft under controlled flight."
SNT.107402.4352	The Supreme Court of Japan ruled on Wednesday that a condition imposed by an Act for acquiring Japanese nationality is unconstitutional, and confirmed the nationality of the plaintiffs.
SNT.107402.4353	Each of the ten plaintiffs is a child who was born to a Filipino mother and later acknowledged by a Japanese father.
SNT.107402.4354	They filed claims for Japanese nationality between 2003 and 2005, but the government turned down because the parents were not legally married in each case.
SNT.107402.4355	According to Japan's Act on nationality, a non-Japanese child (under 20) who was after its birth legitimated by marriage and acknowledgment can acquire Japanese nationality by filing notification, with some requirements which the plaintiffs had already fulfilled.
SNT.107402.4356	The Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday that the condition 'legitimated by marriage' results in unreasonable distinctions to violate Article 14 of the Constitution of Japan, which guarantees equality under the law.
SNT.107402.4357	The Supreme Court left effective the rest of this provision and accepted the plaintiffs' claims for Japanese nationality.
SNT.107402.4358	The judgment pointed out recent changes in people's notions in Japan as to family life or parent-child relationship, and also referred to two conventions which Japan has ratified.
SNT.107402.4359	There are estimated to be tens of thousands of children in similar situations in Japan and a considerable number overseas.
SNT.107402.4360	Chief Cabinet Secretary Nobutaka Machimura on Wednesday made a comment about the judgment at a press conference.
SNT.107402.4361	Machimura said, "This judgment, saying violation of Constitution, weighs so much."
SNT.107402.4362	"As a government, we should take it gravely, and we want to examine its content in detail and consider how to react."
SNT.107402.4363	He added, "I have an impression, just hearing of it, that it's a reasonable judgment."
SNT.107402.4364	"Equality under the law is an important point of view."
SNT.107402.4365	:(a) while it's within the scope of the Legislation of the Diet how conditions are set for acquiring / losing Japanese nationality (Article 10), a distinction without rational reasons brought by such a condition may be unconstitutional (Article 14: Paragraph 1).
SNT.107402.4366	:(b) being legitimated by the parents' marriage or not is a thing the child can not change by its will or endeavor.
SNT.107402.4367	:(c) the purpose of legislation of this provision is rational, because that is considered to demand the child's tight connection with Japan's society.
SNT.107402.4368	:(d) after this provision was added in 1984, both notions and actual situations of people in Japan have been becoming of variety, as to family life or parent-child relationship.
SNT.107402.4369	:(e) the child's tight connection with Japan's society can not be measured instantly by whether the parents have got legally married.
SNT.107402.4370	:(g) this provision results in distinctions not only as to legitimacy but also as to two other factors: any non-Japanese child without legitimacy acknowledged before its birth by a Japanese father, and any child without legitimacy born to a Japanese mother, can acquire Japanese nationality provided by this Act.
SNT.107402.4371	These distinctions have no rational relation with the purpose of legislation.
SNT.107402.4372	:(h) another provision in this Act states a child in this situation may be naturalized with fewer conditions, but it doesn't justify the relation between the purpose and the distinctions, because naturalization is within discretion of the Minister of Justice.
SNT.107402.4373	One judge in the majority, who supported the conclusion, shared a view with the five dissenting: the distinction as to legitimacy is caused by non-existence of due legislation.
SNT.107402.4374	This judge concluded that the Judiciary can remedy the lack, because it doesn't betray the will of the Legislation of the Diet as to this Act.
SNT.107402.4375	Two dissenting judges of the five concluded that these distinctions are unconstitutional, but correction of it depends, in principle, on legislative measures by the Diet.
SNT.107402.4376	The other opinion of three dissenting judges is contrary to the major opinion.
SNT.107402.4377	They argued, for example, :the distinction as to legitimacy is not unconstitutional and is within the range of choice of legislative measures.
SNT.107402.4378	:even if it's unconstitutional, the plaintiffs' appeals are to be dismissed, following the viewpoint in the other dissenting opinion.
SNT.107402.4379	:it's dubious whether or how people in Japan have been making changes as in (d).
SNT.107402.4380	:it's rational to offer Japanese nationality in two other situations as in (g).
SNT.107402.4381	:easy naturalization as in (h) to offer Japanese nationality is rational both as a measure and in practice.
SNT.107402.4382	:foreign countries' movement as in (f) is not to be instantly reflected in judgment on constitutionality; they are different from Japan, with a large number of international marriages and expansion of regional unification like EU.

SNT.272325.4384	Clinton is on a two-day visit to Turkey and made some of her comments during a news conference on the Turkish CNN channel during an event where she answered questions from Turkish citizens.
SNT.272325.4385	Answering a question regarding the issue, she said that "I do not think it’s necessary or in Turkey's interests to be cracking down on journalists and bloggers and the Internet [...] it seems to me inconsistent with all the other advances that Turkey has made."
SNT.272325.4386	In a press conference jointly held with Ahmet Davutoglu, Turkey's foreign minister, Clinton suggested that Turkey could serve as an example for Arab countries currently undergoing governmental changes.
SNT.272325.4387	She said that "people in the Middle East and North Africa are seeking to draw lessons from Turkey's experience" and that "democratic development also depends on responsible leadership."
SNT.272325.4388	According to Turkish media groups, upwards of 60 journalists are being held based on dubious evidence, though government officials say that only 26 are imprisoned, all on charges separate from their activities in the media.
SNT.272325.4389	In some recent arrests, authorities have cited anti-terror laws as justification.
SNT.272325.4390	Separately, the government plans next month to place filters on Internet traffic in the country, which could allow for monitoring of individual users.
SNT.272325.4391	Such human rights concerns have long served as a stumbling block for Turkey's attempts to join the European Union.

SNT.108082.4393	The flooding that has devastated cities in eastern Iowa has travelled downstream and is now threatening Iowa City and Coralville, both of which have issued evacuations for low-lying areas.
SNT.108082.4394	Flooding on the Cedar River earlier filled Waterloo, Cedar Falls, and Cedar Rapids, Iowa, with record-breaking water levels.
SNT.108082.4395	Interstate 80 is closed between mile markers 266 and 267, with a 281-mile long detour to get around it: Eastbound through traffic must leave I-80 at Des Moines and travel north along Interstate 35 then east to Dubuque via U.S. Route 20, where it can move south along U.S. Route 61 to return to Interstate 80 at the Quad Cities, with westbound through traffic following the opposite route.
SNT.108082.4396	Local traffic is being allowed, since this shuts off a 150-mile stretch of highway.
SNT.108082.4397	Interstate 380 has also been closed, between mile markers 4 and 10, due to flooding from the Iowa River and Lake Coralville.
SNT.108082.4398	This, combined with the flooding of the bridges across the Cedar River at Cedar Rapids, effectively cuts Cedar Rapids off from Iowa City; the only way between the two cities, normally 30 miles apart, is a 281-mile long detour that takes drivers through Des Moines.
SNT.108082.4399	The Cedar River at Cedar Rapids crested today at a record-breaking 31.1 feet, nearly 20 feet above flood stage.
SNT.108082.4400	The Iowa River is expected to crest at Iowa City at 33 feet, 11 feet over flood stage and 4.5 feet over the record, on the morning of June 17.

SNT.120451.4413	The following day, a freight train with 40 wagons derailed east of Kalgoorlie, injuring three people.
SNT.120451.4414	The second derailment has closed the line used by the long distance Sydney to Perth Indian Pacific passenger train.
SNT.120451.4415	Operators Great Southern Railway expect to lose A$500,000 revenues as the line remains closed until at least Thursday.
SNT.120451.4416	Police say heavy rain has affected the area, and the federal Australian Rail Track Corporation say that a new access road needs to be built in order to clear the wreckage and repair the track.
SNT.120451.4417	Rio Tinto have sufficient stocks of iron ore already in place to keep working.
SNT.120451.4418	However, the freight train was carrying consumer products, which may run short in the south of Western Australia in the next few days.
SNT.120451.4419	The Kalgoorie crash is to be investigated by the Australian Transport Safety Bureau, while maintenance company Transfield Services will also be examining the incident.
SNT.61058.4420	Researchers with the University of Calgary in Canada have found that prolactin, a hormone produced during pregnancy, may reverse the progression of multiple sclerosis (MS), according to a paper published this week in The Journal of Neuroscience.
SNT.61058.4421	The study, led by Drs. Samuel Weiss and V. Wee Yong of the Hotchkiss Brain Institute, compared virgin and pregnant mice with MS-like lesions introduced by lysolecithin, a chemical which destroys the myelin sheaths around neurons.
SNT.61058.4422	They found the pregnant mice developed smaller lesions and fewer damaged neurons, and showed signs of repaired neurons.
SNT.61058.4423	They also found the pregnant mice had higher levels of cells called oligodendrocytes, which create myelin and are able to repair some damaged neurons through remyelination.
SNT.61058.4424	Because prolactin regulates the levels of precursors of oligodendrocytes, the scientists hypothesized that prolactin levels were responsible for the differences in damage.
SNT.61058.4425	They also tested virgin mice given additional prolactin, and found results similar to pregnant mice.
SNT.61058.4426	Previous studies have shown that other hormones could reduce myelin damage, but this is the first study to show a mechanism to reverse myelin damage, and establish an empirical connection between that mechanism and pregnancy.
SNT.61058.4427	Dr. Weiss says, "It is thought that during pregnancy, women’s immune systems no longer destroyed the myelin."
SNT.61058.4428	"However, no previous study has tested whether pregnancy actually results in the production of new myelin, which may lead to improvement of symptoms."
SNT.61058.4429	"We're excited about this result because it suggests to us that prolactin has the potential to be used to enhance the production of new myelin."
SNT.61058.4430	Dr. William McIlroy, national medical advisor for the Multiple Sclerosis Society of Canada, explains the significance of this study: "The results of this study should be well received by people living with MS today."
SNT.61058.4431	"It represents a new insight of how we might be able to reverse some of the effects of the disease and improve the quality of life for those who live under its influence."
SNT.61058.4432	Dr. Luanne Metz, director of the Calgary MS Clinic in the Department of Clinical Neurosciences, University of Calgary and Calgary Health Region, adds, "This discovery has the potential to take MS therapy a step further than current treatments that stabilize the disease in its early stages."
SNT.61058.4433	"By promoting repair, which is the goal of prolactin therapy, we have hope of actually improving symptoms in people with MS."
SNT.61058.4434	Further animal studies need to be done to examine the possibility of side effects, such as lactation in men and non-pregnant women, as well as increased inflammation which could worsen the MS.
SNT.61058.4435	Researchers believe human trials may begin within a few years.
SNT.61058.4436	Funding and support were provided by the Canadian Institutes of Health Research and the Multiple Sclerosis Society of Canada, the Alberta Heritage Foundation for Medical Research and the Stem Cell Network.
SNT.61058.4437	MS is an autoimmune disease of the central nervous system where the body attacks the fatty myelin which helps nerves carry electrical signals, causing muscle weakness and spasming which may lead to disability.
SNT.61058.4438	MS affects approximately one of every 1000 people in North America, northern Europe and Australasia.
SNT.351723.4439	The microblogging service Twitter has changed its software support for censoring posts.
SNT.351723.4440	With the new updates, Twitter can now withdraw individual posts and accounts in specific countries, as opposed to a global deletion.
SNT.351723.4441	Twitter announced these changes in a blog post on Thursday, and released a clarification update on Friday.
SNT.351723.4442	Twitter says it needed to make the changes to expand on an international level.
SNT.351723.4443	It said in a blog post entitled Tweets still must flow, "we will enter countries that have different ideas about the contours of freedom of expression."
SNT.351723.4444	"Some differ so much from our ideas that we will not be able to exist there."
SNT.351723.4445	"Others are similar but, for historical or cultural reasons, restrict certain types of content, such as France or Germany, which ban pro-Nazi content."
SNT.351723.4446	Twitter says it will use the new feature only "when required to do so in response to what we believe to be a valid and applicable legal request."
SNT.351723.4447	The new tools will give Twitter the ability to withdraw posts and entire accounts in selected countries.
SNT.351723.4448	Once the posts have been withdrawn, they are replaced with a message saying: "This Tweet/account has been withheld in: Country."
SNT.351723.4449	The social network has been used in the past as an outlet for political expression.
SNT.351723.4450	During the Arab Spring, protesters in various countries used Twitter to mobilize support and report information to the outside world.
SNT.351723.4451	The organization Reporters without Borders sent an open letter to Twitter's chairman, Jack Dorsey, saying "We urge you to reverse this decision, which restricts freedom of expression and runs counter to the movements opposed to censorship that have been linked to the Arab Spring, in which Twitter served as a sounding board..."
SNT.351723.4452	"Twitter is depriving cyberdissidents in repressive countries of a crucial tool for information and organization."

SNT.9321.4614	"The only aim of the current government is the implementation of the disengagement plan, and therefore it is wrong, even immoral, for me to remain a part of this government."
SNT.9321.4615	Sharansky said that although he was always against what he calls the "so-called disengagement plan," he decided to leave the government once the battle against the withdrawal was no longer able to be waged from within the government.
SNT.9321.4616	"Our main battle now is public opinion, because the struggle in the government is finished," he said.
SNT.9321.4617	Although he hopes to take the struggle to the people, the former minister hopes his move will pave the way for other politicians to follow their consciences.
SNT.9321.4618	"I don’t know how effective my quitting will be," Sharansky said, "but I hope it will encourage other politicians and ministers to at least vote according to what they believe and what they think."
SNT.9321.4619	The former prisoner of Zion (who served time in a Soviet prison for wanting to emigrate to Israel) says his main objection to the plan to withdraw from Gaza and northern Samaria is the fact that the withdrawal is not contingent on the creation of democracy within the Palestinian Authority.
SNT.9321.4620	"I have promoted the spread of democracy as the only answer for thirty years."
SNT.9321.4621	"And now, at the time when an American president declares these principles and promotes them, an Israeli PM comes along and does the exact opposite."
SNT.9321.4622	Although he has in the past supported withdrawal from parts of the land of Israel, Sharansky says the current plan goes too far.
SNT.9321.4623	"We cannot control another people and we will need serious compromise, but that compromise does not include giving another people the ability to destroy us…as if we run from Gaza, Gaza will not run after us."
SNT.9321.4624	"I had many opportunities to present my point of view to the Prime Minister, both publicly and privately," Sharansky said.
SNT.9321.4625	"I told him we will not have ten years – we will not even have ten days free from pressure, because we are legitimizing one-sided withdrawals from Jewish areas – each withdrawal will only invite more pressure."
SNT.9321.4626	"We are speaking about three generations of Jews that were sent on the important mission by the Israeli government and made an empty desert into a blossoming garden."
SNT.9321.4627	"Now we will just destroy all these beautiful communities, with their unique agriculture and incredible Judaism - for what?" Sharansky asks.
SNT.60319.4628	Violent clashes have broken out between Palestinians and Israeli police near the al-Aqsa Mosque and Temple Mount in Jerusalem, from controversy over Israeli construction near the site, which is holy to both Muslims and Jews.
SNT.60319.4629	The construction work reportedly is to repair a pedestrian bridge that leads to the Mugrabi Gate, the entrance to the mosque used by Palestinians, and runs over the Jewish Western Wall area of the complex.
SNT.60319.4630	The earthen ramp bridge leads to a hilltop compound known as the Temple Mount to Jews and as the Noble Sanctuary to Muslims.
SNT.60319.4631	The bridge collapsed in 2004 and was temporarily replaced with a wooden bridge which Israelis say is weakening and unsafe.
SNT.60319.4632	Israel has controlled the contentious compound since the 1967 Mideast War,
SNT.60319.4633	The construction involves excavation work and digging at the site, which Palestinian leaders contend is part of an attempt to dig under the mosque to find evidence of the Jewish Second Temple and/or to deliberately weaken the foundation of the mosque.
SNT.60319.4634	Muslims dispute that the Temple was located at the site.
SNT.60319.4635	Israeli forces locked down Palestinian neighborhoods of Jerusalem in anticipation of backlashes from the construction.
SNT.60319.4636	The Old Jerusalem city limits were blockaded, allowing only Palestinians over 45 years old from entering and only on foot.
SNT.60319.4637	Opponents have declared the blockades and the construction work a deliberate act to prevent Muslims from accessing the holy site.
SNT.60319.4638	The mass of protesters at the site have in turn blocked Jewish access to the Western Wall.
SNT.60319.4639	Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas declared the construction and blockade as "hostile measures" against Muslims.
SNT.60319.4640	Palestinian chief justice Tayssir al-Tamimi declared a "day of anger" and called on Palestinians to defend the mosque.
SNT.60319.4641	Arab and Muslim countries including Jordan, Malaysia and Indonesia criticized Israel for the controversial work and urged it to halt construction.
SNT.60319.4642	Israeli defense minister Amir Peretz also warned against starting construction.
SNT.60319.4643	The leader of the Pakistan Muslim League urged Muslim countries to freeze diplomatic ties with Israel in protest of the work.
SNT.60319.4644	Around 150 Muslims were inside the mosque for morning prayers when the construction and blockade began.
SNT.60319.4645	An Israeli Muslim journalist reported that the worshippers were unable to leave and received loud messages from Israeli loudspeakers.
SNT.60319.4646	Conventional Judaism believes it is also the historic site of the First and Second Temples, the holiest temple in Judaism, which is prophesised to be rebuilt ahead of the coming of the Messiah.
SNT.60319.4647	No deaths have been reported in the clashes, which simmered by evening.
SNT.60319.4648	Demonstrations also took place at mosques throughout the Muslim world, including Egypt and Jordan.
SNT.60319.4649	The incident comes only a few days after rival Palestinian political factions, Hamas and Fatah, came to an agreement for a unity government aimed at restoring international support of Palestine and a return to Israeli negotiations.
SNT.59522.4650	Barbaro, winner of the 2006 Kentucky Derby, was euthanized on the morning of January 29, according to co-owner Roy Jackson.
SNT.59522.4651	Barbaro suffered a major injury to his right hind leg shortly after the start of the 2006 Preakness Stakes.
SNT.59522.4652	According to Jackson, "We just reached a point where it was going to be difficult for him to go on without pain."
SNT.59522.4653	"It was the right decision, it was the right thing to do."
SNT.59522.4654	"We said all along if there was a situation where it would become more difficult for him then it would be time."
SNT.59522.4655	Barbaro's right hind leg was shattered in the opening lengths of the Preakness race.
SNT.59522.4656	Three bones in the leg were broken - the cannon bone, the sesamoid bone, and the pastern bone.
SNT.59522.4657	Laminitis took hold in the left hind leg as a result of the extra weight borne on the leg by the horse.
SNT.59522.4658	It appeared for a while that Barbaro would recover; however, earlier this month, the horse suffered two significant setbacks that greatly reduced his ultimate chances for survival.
SNT.59522.4659	The three-year-old colt underwent emergency surgery on May 20 to fuse two joints in the damaged right leg.
SNT.59522.4660	Further surgery was required on January 27 to insert two steel pins into one of the healed bones.
SNT.59522.4661	The latest procedure was especially risky because it transferred more weight on to the leg, with the foot resting on the ground not bearing any weight.
SNT.59522.4662	The right rear hoof was already deteriorating, having developed a painful abscess earlier in the week.

SNT.21086.4670	The migration was originally due to start this year, three years after the decision to migrate to Linux was made.
SNT.21086.4671	Peter Hofmann, the project leader of the migration said the delay was because the "pilot was more important than we first thought and should last longer."
SNT.21086.4672	Once the pilot is completed all the departments will eventually be migrated to Linux and OpenOffice.org.
SNT.21086.4673	On May 28, 2003 Germany's third-largest city, voted to move to open source software.
SNT.21086.4674	Munich made the decision to switch after Microsoft discontinued support for their current OS, Windows NT 4.
SNT.21086.4675	While Suse was very involved in the early phases, Debian was ultimately selected to replace Windows on 14,000 desktops.
SNT.21086.4676	The migration is estimated to cost between 30 and 34 million euros, once complete would affect approximately 16,000 users.
SNT.21086.4677	The first department to migrate to Linux and OpenOffice.org will be the office of the Lord Mayor planed for the middle of 2006, though not all of the department's computers will be immediately migrated.
SNT.21086.4678	Peter Hofmann said "Some departments will start with OpenOffice on Windows, others will start with OpenOffice on Linux".

SNT.38339.4699	Yesterday, Australia's Deputy Prime Minister, Mark Vaile, appeared before the Cole Inquiry into kickbacks paid to Saddam Hussein's Iraqi regime.
SNT.38339.4700	It is the first time in over a decade that a senior government official has been called to give evidence before a royal commission in Australia.
SNT.38339.4701	The inquiry heard that Mr Vaile could not recall being told any specific details of the allegations made against the wheat exporter AWB before 2003, and despite his department receiving information about the allegations, it came as no surprise that he was not informed as he held no responsibility for the UN Oil-for-Food program.
SNT.38339.4702	Mr Vaile has been Australia's trade minister since 2000 and the deputy prime minister since 2005.
SNT.38339.4703	Mr Vaile told the commission that despite the cables received by his department in 2000 alleging that the AWB agreed to pay a kickback to Hussein's regime in Iraq, inflating wheat prices and paying money into another non-Iraqi account, he does not recollect being told specific details of the allegations.
SNT.38339.4704	When asked by counsel assisting the commission John Agius about how such cables are dealt with, Mr Vaile told the commission that they are looked at by department officers who decide whether or not they need the minister's attention.
SNT.38339.4705	Mr Vaile said that if a particular cable needed his attention it was generally put into a ministerial submission.
SNT.38339.4706	He said that such submissions may require ministerial action, while others just contain information which he may need to make a note of.
SNT.38339.4707	Once the submission has been read, the minister signs it and it goes into the system.
SNT.38339.4708	Mr Vaile told the commission that on occasion he receives information from cables via briefings from his advisors and departmental officers.
SNT.38339.4709	When questioned about a cable sent to the department of trade containing concerns raised by the UN about AWB's dealings in Iraq dated January 13, 2000, Mr Vaile said that he was briefed in a general sense on the issues raised.
SNT.38339.4710	Despite the UN's concerns being stated in the cable, Mr Vaile said that he "can't recall being aware of the substance".
SNT.38339.4711	Mr Vaile said he was under the belief that the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) and Australia's UN mission were taking care of the UN's concerns.
SNT.38339.4712	He said that he did not have responsibility over the issues being raised．
SNT.38339.4712-2	 "That's my recollection, and my recollection is that there were concerns that had been raised about an AWB contract, and that DFAT and the Mission in New York were dealing with it, bearing in mind that I was not - I didn't have direct ministerial responsibility for either the UN Mission in New York or the Oil-for-Food Program" he said.
SNT.38339.4713	When asked if he would have expected to be briefed in detail on the issues in the cable, Mr Vaile said "Given the circumstances at the time, in terms of my direct ministerial responsibility and being new in the portfolio, probably not."
SNT.38339.4714	Mr Vaile told the inquiry that he was surprised that he had not been briefed about a cable dated March 11, 2000 from Austrade to the department of trade.
SNT.38339.4715	The summary of the document said "It may be necessary to advise the minister of the situation."
SNT.38339.4716	The inquiry heard that in April, 2000 Mr Vaile was told by an advisor that the issue raised in January, 2000 had been resolved with the UN.
SNT.38339.4717	When questioned by Mr Agius about why he did not follow up on the allegations made against AWB in 2000, Mr Vaile said he was too snowed under with work.
SNT.38339.4718	"My best recollections are that I was pretty well snowed under in taking on the responsibilities of a new portfolio and the breadth of issues, having come from a much narrower base in the previous portfolio, and I recall early in 2000 being very, very focused on what to do next in the WTO process after the Seattle ministerial failed in the December of 1999," he told the inquiry.
SNT.38339.4719	Mr Agius then questioned Mr Vaile about allegations made by US Wheat Associates in 2003 that AWB had been inflating wheat prices to Iraq.
SNT.38339.4720	At the same time there were also allegations that money was being paid to Hussein's regime, that AWB was not being transparent in their dealings.
SNT.38339.4721	At the time Mr Vaile defended AWB based upon information provided to him by his department.
SNT.38339.4722	He claims that it was some time later that he learned the information he was given was provided to the department by AWB.
SNT.38339.4723	Mr Vaile said that his department did not conduct an investigation into the allegations despite them being raised in 2000 and again in 2003 by separate parties.
SNT.38339.4724	Mr Vaile also admits that at the time, he dismissed the allegations made by US Wheat Associates as he believed that they were putting pressure on the US administration with regards to WTO negotiations between Australia and the US.
SNT.38339.4725	Mr Vaile told the inquiry that the first he became aware of possible corruption with connected with AWB was in April, 2004.
SNT.38339.4726	The inquiry heard that Mr Vaile and Alexander Downer (Australia's foreign minister) had received a submission claiming that AWB had acted properly, but the company they paid to transport wheat in Iraq had been paying kickbacks to Hussein's regime.
SNT.38339.4727	Mr Vaile said that at the time he saw no need to review procedures within his department for the distribution of information regarding AWB.
SNT.38339.4728	According to Mr Vaile, the only time the department of trade investigated its files to locate information it had received on AWB's dealings in Iraq was around March 2004 to assist the UN's inquiry into the Oil-for-Food programme.
SNT.4672.4729	Google Inc. may offer hosting services to Wikipedia, a free community-built encyclopedia, and other projects hosted by the Wikimedia Foundation.
SNT.4672.4730	Google's competitors, such as Clusty.com, MSN Search, and Yahoo, already offer searching of encyclopedias as a dedicated search category.
SNT.4672.4731	Clusty.com offers the English Wikipedia, MSN Search links to Encarta, and Yahoo has access to the Columbia Encyclopedia.
SNT.4672.4732	Wikipedia is often one of the top results of many searches.
SNT.4672.4733	Anyone can distribute and even modify Wikipedia content in compliance with its license, called the GNU Free Documentation License.
SNT.4672.4734	Besides attribution, the license requires that modifications are made available under the same conditions, a principle known as "copyleft" and most frequently applied to computer software such as the free operating system Linux.
SNT.4672.4735	How would a tight Wikipedia integration into Google look?
SNT.4672.4735-2	1. A Wikipedia-specific search category like Google's Newsgroups Index Google Groups that even is editable.
SNT.4672.4736	You can subscribe to Google Groups and post a response to a message thread.
SNT.4672.4737	2. A Wikipedia-specific search category that is non-editable and links to the original project like Google that uses the Open Content the Open Directory Project.

SNT.60723.4750	Their retail game releases still contain no copy protection, but online activation is required to download updates.

SNT.252355.4815	Yesterday the Health Ministry claimed that China issued a national ban on smoking in all indoor public spaces.
SNT.252355.4816	The ban is included in the government's 12th Five-Year Plan.
SNT.252355.4817	Also banned is smoking in outdoor public areas where pedestrians pass.
SNT.252355.4818	China, with a third of the world's smoking population at 300 million smokers, is the largest cigarette market in the world.
SNT.252355.4819	Each week approximately 70 percent of non-smoking adults are exposed to second-hand smoke.
SNT.252355.4820	According the the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, tobacco-related illnesses kill over one million people annually.
SNT.252355.4821	The World Health Organisation says Chinese smoking-related deaths account for one fifth of deaths from smoking world-wide.
SNT.252355.4822	The number of deaths are predicted to rise to 3.5 million deaths a year by 2030 if no steps are taken, states a report co-authored by Zhao Ping, deputy director general of the Chinese Cancer Foundation.
SNT.252355.4823	Further, there is a spike of new smokers in China as increasingly women, young people and the poor become smokers.
SNT.252355.4824	The posting of logos is being required to alert people not to smoke.
SNT.252355.4825	Vending machines selling cigarettes in public places will be banned as will cigarette advertisements and sponsorships.
SNT.252355.4826	The new regulations include educational measures to inform people about the dangers of tobacco.

SNT.3036.4927	Free software is software which, once obtained, can be used, copied, studied, modified and redistributed.
SNT.3036.4928	It is often made available online without charge or offline for the cost of distribution; free software is not limited to being given away, but can be "free as in free speech" and sold for profit.
SNT.3036.4929	Some of the most well-known examples of free software are the Linux operating system, the Mozilla web browser and the OpenOffice office suite.

SNT.28727.4996	A group of Melbourne scientists has released a study of the energy problems confronting Australia in the future.
SNT.28727.4997	The study endorses the use of nuclear energy and attacks some of the data used by anti-nuclear campaigners.
SNT.28727.4998	The scientists from the University of Melbourne say their research shows that the benefits of nuclear energy have been underestimated and concerns about nuclear waste overplayed.
SNT.28727.4999	The six month study compared the environmental impact, health risks, economic effects and social implications of the use of fossil fuels, renewable energy sources such as wind and solar energy, and nuclear power.
SNT.28727.5000	According to the Melbourne University, the investigation will significantly impact the nuclear debate in Australia, with findings showing that hundreds of times more uranium could be available than was predicted in a widely quoted European study.
SNT.28727.5001	Associate Professor Martin Sevior, of Melbourne University's school of physics, claims the recent study bolsters the case for Australia to invest more in nuclear energy.
SNT.28727.5002	Sevior says his research into nuclear waste disposal should help dispel many environmentalists' fears.
SNT.28727.5003	"One thing that's perhaps not always realised is that the amount of waste that comes out of a typical plant is around 30 tonnes a year," he said.
SNT.28727.5004	"The amount of waste that comes out of a coal-fired power plant is around 1,000 tonnes a day."
SNT.28727.5005	Prof Sevior says his study has exposed flaws in the European study into the limits of the uranium industry.
SNT.28727.5006	"This previous research overestimated the energy costs and carbon emissions generated by the construction of nuclear power plants and for mining uranium," Prof Sevior said.
SNT.28727.5007	The Australian Conservation Foundation's (ACF) nuclear campaigner, Dave Sweeney, says the study appears flawed and does not provide a sound argument for the use of nuclear energy.
SNT.28727.5008	"It glances over some really key concerns of proliferation, key areas of reactor safety are not delved into too deeply and they have direct links to industry websites for further information," said Mr Sweeney.
SNT.28727.5009	"I'm not sure it's altogether appropriate or altogether balanced to be referring people to the nuclear industry's own websites for further information on such matters as radioactive waste, nuclear weapons and nuclear reactor safety."
SNT.28727.5010	The six-month study found Australia has more uranium than was previously thought.
SNT.28727.5011	"We have enough uranium in Australia to power the country for thousands of years," said Prof Sevior.
SNT.28727.5012	Friends of the Earth nuclear campaigner Dr Jim Green said nuclear power should never be considered as an energy source.
SNT.28727.5013	He said greenhouse emissions saved by switching to nuclear power were only about 5 per cent of total emissions and could only be achieved if thousands of reactors were installed globally.
SNT.28727.5014	Dr Green said an energy debate in Australia was necessary, but it had to go beyond just the nuclear alternative.
