SNT.4994.5024	Yesterday, one euro could be bought for just 35,844 lei, down from 36,133 lei two days ago.
SNT.4994.5025	These rates are also significantly stronger from the period in mid-2004 when the euro was worth more than 40,000 lei.
SNT.4994.5026	Last week, the leu reached such a high rate against the euro that the National Bank of Romania had to intervene and restore the exchange rate back to around 37,000 lei per euro.
SNT.4994.5027	The leu's growth also had an impact on global exchange rates, weakening the US dollar worldwide by 1%.
SNT.4994.5028	The National Bank, however, is hesitant to intervene in the marketplace once again due to the positive effects of the leu's appreciation on importers, who can now get products for lower prices, and for consumers, who now have higher purchasing power for imported goods.
SNT.4994.5029	Romanians are also pleased that their currency, which has faced long periods of fairly sharp depreciation in the 1990s due to high inflation, is finally picking up again and strengthening against other currencies.
SNT.4994.5030	The leu's appreciation, however, isn't all positive, because it is putting a great deal of pressure on exporters.
SNT.4994.5031	Other countries are finding Romanian exports more expensive, and therefore less competitive, due to the leu's appreciation, and this could widen the already large account deficit in the country.
SNT.4994.5032	Analysts predict, however, that the leu's surge cannot be stopped and it will continue strengthening against the euro, reaching a rate of 34,000 lei for one euro in the next week.
SNT.4994.5033	The current leu will be replaced in July 2005 with the New Leu (RON), with 10,000 old lei = 1 New Leu.
SNT.4994.5034	The revaluation is expected to prepare Romania for adoption of the euro in 2012.
SNT.4994.5035	Starting from next month, all Romanian prices must be shown in both the old currency and the new currency.
SNT.4994.5036	The National Bank of Romania has said that it expects the exchange rate between the New Leu and the euro to hover at around 3.5 RON = 1 euro when the RON is introduced.
SNT.73275.5037	A young woman was killed Friday night after an accident occurred on a gyrating ride at the Playland amusement park in Rye, New York in the United States.
SNT.73275.5038	The woman, Gabriela Garin, was a worker at the amusement park, and had worked there for the past seven years.
SNT.73275.5039	The accident occurred near the end of Garin's shift; as she was loading riders onto the ride.
SNT.73275.5040	The ride's new operator, unaware of Garin's presence, started the ride while Garin was still on it.
SNT.73275.5041	The new operator then noticed Garin, and shut the ride down in 20 seconds, but Garin had already been ejected from the ride and killed, according to a park spokesperson.
SNT.73275.5042	The ride is an attraction that spins people around in two-seat cars, inside a darkened tent to flashing lights and music.
SNT.73275.5043	This incident is not the first in the ride's history.
SNT.73275.5044	In 2004, a seven-year-old from Connecticut managed to free herself from the ride's restraining bars, and climb onto the front edge of her seat.
SNT.73275.5045	A safety precaution was put in place after this incident, however, the spokesperson acknowledged that it was not followed when Garin was killed.
SNT.73275.5046	The company which owns the ride shut it down, along with two other rides it owns at the park.
SNT.73275.5047	The park features more than 50 rides, a pool, and a beach.

SNT.46746.5061	Oil prices rose dramatically on Monday after a major Alaskan oil field shut down operations, halving the total output of oil from Alaska.
SNT.46746.5062	Coming on top of the ongoing violence in the Middle East, the price of Light, sweet crude for September delivery rose by $1.23 to US$75.99 a barrel in early afternoon Asian trading at the New York Mercantile Exchange.
SNT.46746.5063	The shutdown of the Prudhoe Bay oil field "caught traders by surprise", says Victor Shum, an energy analyst in Singapore.
SNT.46746.5064	"The Middle East violence is a threat to the oil supply, but Alaska is a real disruption."
SNT.46746.5065	The oil field began shutdown procedures on Sunday due to severe corrosion and a minor leakage from an oil transit line.
SNT.46746.5066	The total shutdown process is expected to take a few more days.
SNT.46746.5067	BP Exploration Alaska, Inc, the company running the field, has said that oil production will be reduced by 400,000 barrels per day, or nearly 8% of the total U.S. oil production.

SNT.4109.5069	A collaboratively-developed operating system kernel known as GNU Hurd has been made bootable using the L4 microkernel, which provides room for significant speed improvements over an existing implementation using the Mach microkernel.
SNT.4109.5070	The newer architecture also has a more lively developer community.
SNT.4109.5071	Developer Marcus Brinkmann made the historic step and finished the process initialization code, which enabled him to execute the first software on Hurd-L4.
SNT.4109.5072	In a message to the L4 port of GNU Hurd mailing list, Brinkmann wrote, "We can now easily explore and develop the system in any way we want."
SNT.4109.5073	"With my glibc port, I can already build simple applications, but most won't run because they need a filesystem or other gimmicks (like, uhm, fork and exec), and I only have stubs (dummy functions which always return an error) for that now," he added in a later posting.
SNT.4109.5074	Compared with Linux and BSD Unix's monolithic kernel architecture, a microkernel based operating system provides developers greater modularity and isolation from hardware, a big win with L4 already being available for a large number of hardware varieties.
SNT.4109.5075	There is a cost in speed for such abstraction, and this cost was higher on Mach, at around 15%, compared with only around 5% on L4 and it's predecessor L3, both developed by Dr. Jochen Liedtke.
SNT.4109.5076	The greater modularity and abstraction of a microkernel approach means that the microkernel itself does not need constant modification as is seen in the Linux kernel today, since it provides only the very minimum of services, and does so very carefully.
SNT.4109.5077	However, the Mach kernel first developed ten years earlier at Carnegie Mellon University is seen as a flawed first implementation, with the lessons learned being implemented in microkernels like L4, known as second-generation microkernels.
SNT.4109.5078	The GNU Hurd forms the base of the GNU operating system, much of which has been widely adopted by users of other Unix-like operating systems, including Linux.
SNT.4109.5079	The GNU Project has been developing the Hurd since 1983.
SNT.4109.5080	In 1990, the GNU Project decided to use the Mach kernel, rather than writing their own.
SNT.4109.5081	The Hurd is released as free software under the GNU General Public License (GPL).
SNT.4109.5082	The Hurd kernel is an experiment which aims to surpass existing Unix kernels in functionality, security, and stability, while remaining largely compatible with them.
SNT.4109.5083	According to the GNU Hurd project, "The Hurd should, and probably will, be ported to other hardware architectures or other microkernels in the future" .
SNT.4109.5084	A limited port of Linux already runs on L4, known as L4Linux.
SNT.16621.5085	On Sunday, a group of 80 people from Beijing and Shanghai landed at Heathrow to become the first Chinese to arrive in the United Kingdom on tourist visas.
SNT.16621.5086	After protracted negotiations last year, the UK was granted "Approved Destination Status" (ADS) by the People's Republic of China in January 2005.
SNT.16621.5087	The agreement will also allow travel companies to establish offices in China to promote tourism to the UK.
SNT.16621.5088	Before the signing of the agreement, China allowed only students and people on business trips to visit the country.
SNT.16621.5089	It is estimated that 135,000 people visited the UK last year — just 0.6% of China's external tourism market.
SNT.16621.5090	The 80 tourists are expected to visit London, Oxfordshire, Stratford-upon-Avon and Scotland, where they will meet the First Minister, Jack McConnell, in Edinburgh Castle.
SNT.16621.5091	The Duke of York is expected to greet the tourists at the Tower of London later today.
SNT.16621.5092	Other destinations will include Liverpool (twinned with Shanghai) and Manchester's Old Trafford stadium, where the football team Manchester United play.
SNT.16621.5093	They have a large following in China and are currently on a Far East tour.
SNT.16621.5094	They are to play Beijing Hyundai in a friendly match tomorrow.

SNT.16621.5096	The UK tourist industry hopes that by 2020, Chinese tourism to the UK will bring £500 million pounds (about $878 million US dollars) annually to the UK economy.
SNT.36511.5097	After every earthquake, flood, or other disaster, the call goes out for pledges to fund emergency relief.
SNT.36511.5098	Then a second round of begging tries to convert those pledges into actual payments.
SNT.36511.5099	In the meantime, some relief is delayed, and people die.
SNT.36511.5100	Money that does eventually come may not be in proportion to the need.
SNT.36511.5101	For example, relief funding for the 26 December 2004 tsunami generally came rapidly and exceeded the amount requested, but famine relief for 3.5 million Kenyans suffering drought is now 75% underfunded.
SNT.36511.5102	The Fund is about half way to the goal of half a billion dollars in deposits, which could be spent for either natural or man-made disasters.
SNT.36511.5103	"We meet to launch a fund that is proactive rather than reactive." 
SNT.36511.5104	"The CERF will provide a ready pool of resources that better empower the United Nations in funding immediate relief efforts in the aftermath of disasters", said UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan on March 9.
SNT.36511.5105	Jan Egeland, the UN Emergency Relief Coordinator, will manage the Fund.
SNT.36511.5106	"We are working on the two first allocations from the CERF...One is to the Horn of Africa and Kenya drought, the other one is to Cote d'Ivoire where humanitarian work and the civilian population is suffering so much, "he said.
SNT.36511.5107	"Too often, aid resembles a lottery in which a few win but most lose based on considerations other than need." 
SNT.36511.5108	"We must move from lottery to predictability so all those who suffer receive aid."
SNT.36511.5109	The biggest donations paid so far are $41 million from Sweden and $30 million from Norway.
SNT.36511.5110	The largest pledges are $70 million from the United Kingdom and $24 million from the Netherlands.

SNT.106081.5231	According to Xinhua News Agency, Beijing Health Bureau spokeswoman Deng Xiaohong said that the 13-month-old boy died Sunday while en route to the hospital.
SNT.106081.5232	Health authorities state that 24,934 children in mainland China are afflicted with the disease, and 42 children have died from it.
SNT.106081.5233	The cause of the disease has been identified as Enterovirus 71 (EV-71).
SNT.106081.5234	Another child infected with the virus died Monday, but as he died in Hebei province his death was counted there.
SNT.106081.5235	Xinhua News Agency also reported that a 21-month-old boy died Monday of the virus in Hubei province.
SNT.106081.5236	After an order was given last week by the Ministry of Health of the People's Republic of China that all cases must be reported, the count of those infected has increased markedly.
SNT.106081.5237	Eastern China saw a large number of cases in early March, but this information was not made public until late April.
SNT.106081.5238	In March, Children under age six in eastern Anhui province began being admitted to hospitals with symptoms of the virus, and the outbreak spread quickly after that.
SNT.106081.5239	The city of Fuyang in Anhui province was especially hard-hit by the outbreak.
SNT.106081.5240	The majority of patients who were in critical condition have recovered, said a Health Ministry official in a statement on Monday.
SNT.106081.5241	"What I know is the death rate has gone down drastically since early May." 
SNT.106081.5242	 "There are very, very few cases with complications — 99 percent of these are mild cases", said World Health Organization (WHO) China representative Hans Troedsson in a statement on Wednesday.
SNT.106081.5243	Incidents of the disease are expected to peak in June and July.
SNT.106081.5244	Children with mild cases of the disease generally recover rapidly after manifesting a rash and a fever.
SNT.106081.5245	Other symptoms include diarrhea, cold-like symptoms, and sores on the extremities and mouth.
SNT.106081.5246	In severe cases, fluid may accumulate in the brain, and result in meningitis, encephalitis, pulmonary edema, paralysis and death.
SNT.106081.5247	The EV-71 virus is spread through contact with fluid secreted from blisters, nose and throat mucus, feces and saliva.
SNT.106081.5248	There is no specific treatment or vaccine for the virus.
SNT.106081.5249	The disease is unrelated to foot-and-mouth disease, which affects livestock.
SNT.106081.5250	United States Department of Health and Human Services Secretary Mike Leavitt was visiting in the country, and said in a statement Monday in Shanghai that the U.S. is assisting China fight the outbreak.
SNT.106081.5251	According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), a division of the Department of Health and Human Services, symptomatic treatment can be given to address possible fever and aches and pains.
SNT.106081.5252	The CDC advises children and adults to practice proper hand washing technique, and to wash and disinfect contaminated items and surfaces using diluted solution of chlorine-containing bleach.
SNT.106081.5253	China is also dealing with a magnitude-7.9 earthquake which hit the country Monday and has killed almost 15,000.
SNT.106081.5254	The outbreak is a concern to the government, as the country prepares for the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing this August.
SNT.106081.5255	"We are confident the potential outbreak will not affect the Beijing Olympic Games," China's Health Ministry spokesman Mao Qunan stated.
SNT.106081.5256	And at a joint press conference held by China's Ministry of Health and the WHO, he further noted that, "China is confident that it can control the spread of the disease with effective prevention methods."

SNT.73731.5258	For the first time, an American and Frenchwoman were matched up to compete for the British women's singles title.
SNT.73731.5259	A Wimbledon champion in 2000, 2001 and 2005, Williams was not the favorite to win the title again this year.
SNT.73731.5260	Currently ranked 23rd in the world, she entered the tournament in the shadow of her sister, Serena Williams.
SNT.73731.5261	At the beginning of the tennis season, Serena stated her own determination to reclaim the No. 1 ranking.
SNT.73731.5262	Serena showed better than Venus at the French Open by reaching the quarter finals, and won the Australian Open in January (Venus dropped out due to an injury).
SNT.73731.5263	In spite of her initial strength, Serena's hopes to dominate the tournament were cut short when she lost to No. 1 seeded Justine Henin in the quarterfinals.
SNT.73731.5264	Bartoli, the eighteenth seed for this year's championships, had never progressed past the fourth round of any Grand Slam event.
SNT.73731.5265	However, she progressed to the final by defeating third seed Jelena Janković in the fourth round and Justine Henin in the semifinals in one of the major upsets of Wimbledon history.
SNT.73731.5266	As Henin lost to Bartoli in the semifinals, Venus Williams was poised to become the lowest seeded player in recorded history to win the Wimbledon singles title.
SNT.73731.5267	With powerhouse serves and an aggressive ground strokes battle, she did just that.
SNT.73731.5268	Williams comfortably knocked out Bartoli in two straight sets, with match point accidentally striking Bartoli in the wrist.
SNT.73731.5269	Venus was reunited with the Venus Rosewater Dish on Centre Court during the trophy ceremony.
SNT.73731.5270	Another first, the All England Club is paying men's and women's singles champions equal prize money.
SNT.73731.5271	Venus was paid $1.407 million, to which she replied "Thank you, All England Club - we're playing under equal terms."
SNT.73731.5272	The men's final takes place later today with first seed and defending champion Roger Federer taking on second seed Rafael Nadal in a repeat of last year's final.
SNT.46605.5273	A "highly pathogenic strain" of the H5N1 Avian Flu virus has been detected in a dead Australian black swan, floating in a pond located at the Dresden Zoo in Dresden, Germany.
SNT.46605.5274	Conflicting reports say that the swan was found on Monday, Tuesday or Wednesday.
SNT.46605.5275	The Friedrich Loeffler Institute which specializes in animal diseases confirmed the test results.
SNT.46605.5276	"We can confirm that this is the highly pathogenic strain," said a spokesperson for the institute.
SNT.46605.5277	Officials have blocked off an area of Dresden approximately 1.9 miles (3km) from the site where the swan was found and have posted observation areas at approximately 6.2 miles (10km) outside the area as a precaution.
SNT.46605.5278	For the moment, all birds in the zoo have been confined to their cages and viewing of birds by the public is no longer permitted.
SNT.46605.5279	The zoo still remains open for business and cleaning efforts have been intensified.
SNT.46605.5280	Officials have also restricted cats and dogs from roaming areas nearby.
SNT.46605.5281	There are at least 112 different species of birds, totaling 720, located at the zoo.
SNT.46605.5282	In April, H5N1 was first discovered in Germany in a domestic fowl and in wild birds.
SNT.46605.5283	The last case of H5N1 to turn up in Germany was on May 12, 2006.

SNT.78430.5285	All the suspects are male Finns residing in southern Finland.
SNT.78430.5286	The new developments are the result of an investigation into four to six alleged dog fights.
SNT.78430.5287	Dog fighting is a breach of animal cruelty laws in Finland, and the case will be considered for prosecution in October.
SNT.78430.5288	They are being investigated under suspicion of breaching the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act.
SNT.78430.5289	At least thus far there has been no evidence of illegal gambling on the outcome of fights.
SNT.78430.5290	There also does not seem to be any large-scale organisation behind the incidents or connections with organised crime groupings.
SNT.78430.5291	"It would appear to be the pastime of a group of individuals."
SNT.78430.5292	Despite this, the group is known to have links throughout Scandinavia, as well as possible links to Russia.
SNT.78430.5293	He added that about a dozen pit bulls from America were involved in the incidents.
SNT.78430.5294	Key evidence includes video footage and testimony from veterinary surgeons, who were present when police raided several locations suspected to be involved.
SNT.78430.5295	"Statements by veterinary surgeons are a significant part of the investigation." 
SNT.78430.5296	"They play the same role here as forensic pathologists would in a normal violent crime investigation," Inspector Töyräs said.
SNT.78430.5297	The investigation was begun as a result of an investigation into dog fighting in the United Kingdom by the state-run British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC).
SNT.78430.5298	A BBC journalist teamed up with a man with military experience to infiltrate a notorious dog fighting ring from Ulster, Ireland, known as The Farmer Boys.
SNT.78430.5299	This uncovered links to a group involved in comparable activity in Finland.
SNT.78430.5300	The documentary, which is part of the Panorama series, was broadcast in Finland yesterday by YLE.
SNT.78430.5301	The BBC had contacted Finland regarding it's discoveries in April.
SNT.78430.5302	The BBC itself had begun it's investigation after Gerard Cavlan, a football player from Northern Ireland, was convicted on charges related to dog fighting.
SNT.78430.5303	Privacy laws in Finland required the faces of those believed to be involved to be pixelated during the Finnish version of the broadcast, although this was not mirrored in the UK screening - which, in an unprecedented move, coincided exactly with the showing in Finland.
SNT.78430.5304	The show was widely discussed on the internet, with large volumes of material requiring deleted by site administrators as breaching Finnish privacy legislation.
SNT.78430.5305	The investigation is the only one ever conducted into dog fighting in Finland.
SNT.78430.5306	Töyräs explained the problem to journalists: "We have only had vague unconnected hints of this sort of activity in the past, and on the basis of these it was not possible to mount an earlier investigation."
SNT.240117.5307	The sole United States manufacturer of a key component of lethal injections announced Friday that it will cease production of the drug, contributing to shortages and delaying executions.
SNT.240117.5308	Sodium thiopental, the first of a three drug cocktail used in 34 states to render the prisoner to be executed unconscious, was manufactured in Italy until Italian authorities stated that they would only license the manufacture if it was used for medical purposes and not, crucially, for executions.
SNT.240117.5309	In a statement, the company, Hospira, said that they have never condoned the use of their drug, marketed as 'Pentothal', in executions, and that they could not "prevent the drug from being diverted to departments of corrections for use in capital punishment procedures".
SNT.240117.5310	The move means that the United States is without a viable supplier for sodium thiopental.
SNT.240117.5311	Although many European countries manufacture the drug, which is primarily used in Europe as an anæsthetic, no manufacturer has been found that is willing to supply it for use in conjunction with the death penalty, the abolition of which has been lobbied by the EU since 2008.
SNT.240117.5312	The shortage means that executions in California and Oklahoma have been delayed, with Texas' last remaining stocks of the drug due to expire in March, weeks before two scheduled executions.
SNT.240117.5313	These delays are likely to be prolonged as the legal process of drawing up new drugs to be used for injections is lengthy.
SNT.240117.5314	Pentobarbital, an alternative which is used at the Dignitas clinic in Switzerland, is used for lethal injections in Oregon, and has started to be used by Oklahoma.
SNT.240117.5315	Hospira's decision caused mixed reactions throughout the medical community, with the American Society of Anesthesiologists stating Monday that sodium thiopental is an "important and medically necessary anesthetic agent" that is a "first-line anesthetic in many cases", citing geriatric and cardiovascular conditions, among others.
SNT.240117.5316	It said that, although they disagree with the death penalty, "we also do not condone using the issue as the basis to place undue burdens on the distribution of this critical drug to the United States."
SNT.240117.5317	"It is an unfortunate irony that many more lives will be lost or put in jeopardy as a result of not having the drug available for its legitimate medical use."

SNT.144319.5335	He said that 65 elephants and 30 rhinoceroses have been killed this year by poachers.

SNT.144319.5337	"In the same period we have lost 24 black and six white rhinos. "
SNT.144319.5338	"It is true that we have witnessed an escalation of poaching nationwide, particularly on private farms."
SNT.144319.5339	"We do have a group of international gangsters, who are funding poachers around this part of the world and taking away many horns and it is a major problem," the director continued; "we have arrested 2,500 poachers in the same period, ten poachers have been shot dead since the beginning of this year."
SNT.144319.5340	Zimbabwe is one of four countries in Africa that are home to large numbers of rhinos, the others being Kenya, Namibia, and South Africa.
SNT.144319.5341	About 100,000 elephants live in Zimbabwe, and Chandenga said that the numbers have been growing in past years.
SNT.102178.5342	The Congressional Hispanic Caucus has blocked voting on legislation that would allow employers to rehire foreign seasonal workers.
SNT.102178.5343	This year, the U.S. government will only issue 33,000 visas for winter workers and 33,000 for summer workers.
SNT.102178.5344	This comes as a stark comparison to 2007, when 120,000 foreign workers entered the U.S. with H-2B visas.
SNT.102178.5345	Currently, the reduction in visas is having profounds effects on both Mexico and U.S.
SNT.102178.5346	In Tlapacoyan, a Mexican town which in the last 30 years has exported a large seasonal workforce, using H-2B visas, to work in U.S. circuses and carnivals, the effects are already a stark reality.
SNT.102178.5347	The local economy has been paralyzed, and unemployment has reached dramatic highs.
SNT.102178.5348	The lack of money being pumped into the local economy has caused many businesses to close, and the construction of the town's new church has come to a screeching halt.
SNT.102178.5349	Additionally, residents like Pablo Juarez Mendoza, who last year made $450 working in Texan livestock shows, are having difficulties finding local work.
SNT.102178.5350	Those that do, are only making an average of $50 per week.
SNT.102178.5351	U.S. businesses are getting ready to face their own set of economical obstacles caused by the lack of cheap labor.
SNT.102178.5352	Many employers are finding creative ways to cut costs, including scaling back operations.
SNT.102178.5353	In Cape Cod, for example, the local chamber of commerce reports that town employers will only receive 15 of the 5,000 visas requested.
SNT.102178.5354	In response, local Cape Cod business owner, Williman Zammer, has called the situation "a major crisis," and states that what the Hispanic Caucus is doing is "ruthless."
SNT.102178.5355	Opponents of the change state that recent legislation blocking is part of the Caucus' efforts to push for comprehensive immigration reform, not seen in the U.S. since the early 1980s.
SNT.102178.5356	Hispanic Caucus Chairman, Rep. Joe Baca, D-California, hopes that policymakers will place attention not only on helping small businesses, but also on what to do with 12 million illegal immigrants currently residing in the U.S., and improving border security.
SNT.102178.5357	The issue of immigration has become a polarizing subject in the U.S., and one that has been an intrinsic part of the fabric that makes up the American society.
SNT.102178.5358	Since 2006, the U.S. accepts more legal immigrants as permanent residents than any other country in the world.
SNT.102178.5359	That same year, a NBC/Wall Street Journal poll revealed that the U.S. public was equally divided on the whether immigration helps or hurts the country.
SNT.102178.5360	Forty-four percent said it helped, forty-five percent said it hurt.
SNT.102178.5361	However, a recent Pew Research Center study suggests that the issue will remain at the forefront of the American political agenda for many years to come.
SNT.102178.5362	The study revealed that by 2050, one in five Americans will be foreign-born, and the overall U.S. population will double to 438 million.
SNT.102178.5363	The U.S Latino population will account for 30% of the population, while Asians will account for 9%.
SNT.102178.5364	Thus, what we see unfolding is a U.S. where minorities will become the majority, and drastic cultural and societal changes seem almost certain.
SNT.102178.5365	The study seems to also hint that this growth is in many ways connected to legislation passed by Congress in 1965, that abolished a quota system that had nearly ended immigration from non-European countries since the 1920s, and consequently caused an immigration surge.

SNT.143610.5398	The United Nations World Health Organization (WHO) stated that the H1N1 virus, more commonly known as swine flu, has become the dominant flu strain in the world.
SNT.143610.5399	In a briefing with reporters Thursday, WHO Special Pandemic Influenza Advisor Keiji Fukuda said the virus has been particularly active in the Northern Hemisphere in recent months.
SNT.143610.5400	He added that he expects the trend to continue through the winter months, with more severe cases and even deaths.
SNT.143610.5401	Fukuda said the vaccine currently in use in some 20 countries around the world remains effective and safe, and that no rare or dangerous side effects have been reported.
SNT.143610.5402	"East Asia is one of the parts of the world where seasonal influenza viruses have remained in reasonably high circulation." 
SNT.143610.5403	 "But even in that part of the world, the pandemic virus is becoming dominant," Fukuda commented.
SNT.143610.5404	He noted that it was difficult to predict the activity of the virus.
SNT.143610.5405	The H1N1 virus differs from the normal seasonal flu in that it has persisted during the summer months and affected relatively healthy people under the age of 65.
SNT.143610.5406	The WHO says most people recover without hospitalization, although Fuduka pointed out that people with severe health complications and pregnant women were most at risk.
SNT.143610.5407	The World Health Organization has declared the swine flu outbreak a pandemic.
SNT.143610.5408	As of October 25, 2009, the WHO says there have been more than 440,000 laboratory confirmed cases of H1N1 influenza and more than 5,700 deaths reported to the UN agency.

SNT.120763.5434	Rescuers were able to get him out of the water, but he died while being flown to a nearby hospital for treatment.
SNT.120763.5435	The Coast Guard also said that the fishermen were warned that the ice could break, but many didn't believe there was any danger.

SNT.22119.5444	The body’s immune system is less effective at quashing disease than it could be - but if it were better the immune system might do more harm than good, according to new research by Michael Deem and colleagues of Rice University in Houston.
SNT.22119.5445	The immune system has apparently evolved to be mildly inefficient so that it achieves a balance between quick response to disease and decreased probability of autoimmune disease, a condition in which the immune system attacks healthy tissue.
SNT.22119.5446	The authors drew their conclusions from a model of the dynamics of antibody evolution.
SNT.22119.5447	Their simulations show that while there are mechanisms that would allow the immune system to develop antibodies that respond faster and more strongly against invading pathogens, those mechanisms would also create antibodies that are likely to attack the body’s own healthy cells.
SNT.22119.5448	The model also bolsters controversial suggestions that chronic infections could lead the immune system awry, ultimately resulting in rheumatoid arthritis or other autoimmune ailments.
SNT.22119.5449	The study will be detailed in a forthcoming issue of the journal Physical Review Letters.

SNT.79134.5479	Australian Prime Minister John Howard has announced that leaders of APEC nations have agreed on "aspirational goals" on climate change.
SNT.79134.5480	The agreement, which Prime Minister Howard calls the Sydney declaration focuses on reducing energy intensity (the amount of energy used to produce a dollar of gross domestic product), reforestation and technology sharing.
SNT.79134.5481	Despite Australia, the United States and China being non-signatories to the United Nations' Kyoto protocol on greenhouse gas reductions which is set to expire in 2012, the APEC accord calls for "We call for a post-2012 international climate change arrangement ... that strengthens, broadens and deepens the current arrangement and leads to reduced global emissions of greenhouse gases," according to the draft declaration.
SNT.79134.5482	The declaration as agreed upon will be released on Sunday.
SNT.79134.5483	The draft agreement recognised that action was required to "slow, stop and reverse" greenhouse gas emissions; that nations should vow to reduce energy intensity by 25 percent by 2030; that forest cover in the region should be increased by 50 million acres by 2020; and that APEC nations will work with other nations to find a solution to climate change.
SNT.79134.5484	The declaration is non-binding and is simply a statement of goals to which the nations will try to achieve.
SNT.79134.5485	Host nation Australia has been criticised by China, Indonesia, Japan and Malaysia for putting climate change on the agenda at the APEC summit, saying they would prefer dialogue on climate change to occur under a United Nationa framework.
SNT.79134.5486	Indonesia's Foreign Minister Hassan Wirayuda said "the APEC meeting does not replace the appropriate forum to deal with climate change."
SNT.79134.5487	Mr Wiraydua said that despite Indonesia not being entirely satisfied with the declaration they would "live with it".
SNT.79134.5488	Environmental group Greenpeace has rejected the APEC statement because it doesn't set firm targets and includes the use of nuclear energy as a replacement for fossil fuels.

SNT.5462.5570	Insulin production has been discovered in the brain and linked to Alzheimer's disease, potentially changing how the illness is viewed and treated.
SNT.5462.5571	While insulin resistance, a characteristic of diabetes, is linked with neurodegeneration, the new finding provides a strong connection between diabetes and Alzheimer's disease.
SNT.5462.5572	"What we found is that insulin is not just produced in the pancreas, but also in the brain," says study senior author Suzanne de la Monte of Rhode Island Hospital and Brown University Medical School.
SNT.5462.5573	"And we discovered that insulin and its growth factors, which are necessary for the survival of brain cells, contribute to the progression of Alzheimer's."
SNT.5462.5574	The finding was made by studying a genetic abnormality in rats that blocks insulin signaling in the brain.
SNT.5462.5575	Additionally, they determined that a drop in insulin production in the brain contributes to brain cell degeneration, a symptom of Alzheimer's.
SNT.5462.5576	These abnormalities do not correspond to type 1 or type 2 diabetes, but reflect a different and more complex disease process that originates in the CNS (central nervous system), the researchers report.
SNT.5462.5577	Analysis of postmortem brain tissue also revealed that the proteins aren't produced at normal levels in human Alzheimer's sufferers.
SNT.5462.5578	Insulin and IGF I were significantly reduced in the frontal cortex, hippocampus and hypothalamus—all areas affected by Alzheimer's—while not in the cerebellum, which is generally not affected by Alzheimer's.
SNT.5462.5579	The study "opens the way for targeted treatment to the brain and changes the way we view Alzheimer's disease," says de la Monte.
SNT.5462.5580	The research is reported in the Journal of Alzheimer's Disease.

SNT.276029.5654	38 people were killed on Saturday when a US Chinook helicopter crashed west of Kabul, Afghanistan, with the Taliban claiming responsibility for the crash.
SNT.276029.5655	Thirty Americans were killed in the crash, including at least seventeen members of SEAL Team 6, Air Force members, the helicopter's crew, a dog handler and a civilian interpreter, while eight members of the Afghan Army were also on board and died.
SNT.276029.5656	According to witnesses, members of the Taliban and officials from the US and Afghanistan, the Chinook was deliberately targeted, apparently by a rocket propelled grenade (RPG).
SNT.276029.5657	While no American officials have spoken on the record about the cause of the crash, anonymous sources have said that the helicopter was shot down, an assertion that corresponds with reports from local officials and witness, who said that the helicopter crashed after a rocket struck it.
SNT.276029.5658	The Taliban said that they had brought the aircraft down while it was involved in an operation targeting a house where insurgents were meeting.
SNT.276029.5659	While Taliban forces do not have a history of shooting down aircraft, they claim to have modified their RPGs for improved accuracy, but there is no proof of this.
SNT.276029.5660	The chairman of the US Joint Chiefs of Staff, Admiral Mike Mullen, warned against leaping to conclusions, however, saying that "[i]nformation is still coming in about this incident."
SNT.276029.5661	" I think it's important that we allow investigators to do their work before jumping to too many conclusions."
SNT.276029.5662	President Barack Obama issued a statement after the incident, saying that "[t]heir deaths are a reminder of the extraordinary sacrifices made by the men and women of our military and their families, including all who have served in Afghanistan."
SNT.52541.5663	Irish Taoiseach Bertie Ahern and British Prime Minister Tony Blair have unveiled a new roadmap for the Northern Ireland devolution process.
SNT.52541.5664	The roadmap sets a target date for a new Northern Ireland Executive to be set up.
SNT.52541.5665	The roadmap, known as the Saint Andrews Agreement, came after three days of intense talks in St. Andrews, Scotland.
SNT.52541.5666	The agreement gives dates for the steps to devolution culminating on March 26, 2007 when the Executive is to be fully up and running.
SNT.52541.5667	The first deadline is on November 10, 2006 during which time both parties must accept the agreement and for the first time in the history of the party, the Democratic Unionist Party will cast a vote for their rivals, Sinn Fein.
SNT.52541.5668	The second deadline is on November 27, 2006 in which the Northern Ireland Assembly, would gather to elect the first minister and deputy first minister of the Executive.
SNT.52541.5669	The first minister is speculated by many to be Ian Paisley, the leader of the Democratic Unionist Party.
SNT.52541.5670	The deputy first minister is speculated to be Martin McGuinness, the deputy leader of Sinn Fein.
SNT.52541.5671	One of the key issues is Sinn Fein's recognition of the Police Service of Northern Island, which replaced the controverisal Royal Ulster Constabulary.
SNT.52541.5672	In a reassurance to unionists, the governments said they will not transfer duties over to the executive till 2008.
SNT.52541.5673	Sinn Fein demanded an immediate transfer of power, possibly to a Sinn Fein minister.
SNT.52541.5674	"You can't have a democratic society unless the police are given full support," Blair said.
SNT.52541.5675	After the election of ministers, three steps will take place.
SNT.52541.5676	The Democratic Unionists will be given time to observe Sinn Fein and see if they are accepting policing.
SNT.52541.5677	Also, in January, the Independent Monitoring Commission will give another report on the status of the Provisional Irish Republican Army revocation of violence.
SNT.52541.5678	Finally in March, an electoral endorsement of the Saint Andrews Agreement will take place be it either through election or referendum.
SNT.52541.5679	Most of the participants at the summit favored a referendum, except for Ian Paisley, according to an anoynoums source who wished not be identified as he no authorization to release details publicly.
SNT.52541.5680	The last two final steps take place in March 2007.
SNT.52541.5681	On March 14, the nomination of the Executive will take place.
SNT.52541.5682	Finally, if all goes well, the Northern Ireland Executive power-sharing government and full devolved Northern Ireland Assembly would be revived and take power on March 26, 2007.
SNT.52541.5683	However, if the parties fail to set up the Executive or fail to agree "at any stage", the Assembly will be dissolved and direct rule from London will continue with input from the Republic of Ireland.
SNT.52541.5684	Tony Blair said the essential parts of the agreement are that all parties accept policing and the courts and have a clear agreement on power-sharing.
SNT.52541.5685	"So those are the two essential parts of it," Mr Blair said.
SNT.52541.5686	Ian Paisley, the notorious hardliner evangelist who has made his political career out of saying no to comprehensive reforms, eschewed his trademark fire-brand rhetoric offered a welcome and said that the province is "at a crossroads."
SNT.52541.5687	Paisley said of Ulster, "a place where there is a road to democracy and where there is a road to anarchy."
SNT.52541.5688	Further adding, "I trust that we will see in the coming days the vast majority of people taking the road to democracy."
SNT.52541.5689	Blair also added, "We've been through different parts of this process many times over the past few years but I think this is a sound basis to proceed."
SNT.52541.5690	He also said on the possible election of Paisley and McGuinness to their minister positions, "I do not think anybody will find it easy to sit in an executive with people who they are deeply opposed to, or indeed hostile to."
SNT.52541.5691	Referring to Sinn Fein, Paisley stated "We will meet the requirements. "
SNT.52541.5692	"But the IRA-Sinn Fein has got to meet those requirements." 
SNT.52541.5693	"And when they do, we will really be on the way to peace in Northern Ireland."
SNT.52541.5694	Paisley left St. Andrews quickly after attending the press conference in order to be with his family for his fiftieth wedding anniversary.
SNT.52541.5695	Sinn Fein leader, Gerry Adams offered a guarded welcome of the plans and stated "requires thoughtful consideration and consultation."
SNT.52541.5696	However, he stated the restoration of power-sharing was an "an enormous prize. "
SNT.52541.5697	"Common sense, political realism and the interests of all sections of our people demand that we achieve this."

SNT.52541.5699	He added "Sinn Fein will sign up to the PSNI being the only force of law and order and Ian Paisley, or a colleague, will share the joint office of first and deputy first minister with Martin McGuinness in a mandatory coalition."

SNT.52541.5702	He added, "Despite all that remains to be done, there is now at least a sense of hope for a shared future."
SNT.52541.5703	Direct rule from London has been in place since the Assembly and Executive dissolved in 2002 over allegations of IRA spying ring.

SNT.207717.5731	Leclerc had the distinct honour of being the first person to score nul points at the 1962 contest.
SNT.207717.5732	The singer performed at the first contest in 1956 and appeared again two years later and achieved his best result with his performance of Ma petite chatte.
SNT.207717.5733	After appearing for the third time at the 1960 contest he made his final appearance at the 1962 contest.
SNT.207717.5734	At the 1962 contest Leclerc became the first person in Eurovision history to fail to score any points, also known as Nul Points.

SNT.207717.5736	After his final Eurovision appearance he left the music industry and became a building contractor.
SNT.207717.5737	In 2005 he made an appearance on a special programme to commemorate Eurovision.

SNT.5451.5747	The CIA has been secretly authorized by a classified directive, signed by US President Bush, to send suspects overseas as part of a "rendition" process.
SNT.5451.5748	The program has been used to manage the large case load which has accumulated since the September 11, 2001 attacks, leaving US officials free to concentrate on the "high value" suspects who are kept under US control at secret locations throughout the world.
SNT.5451.5749	Today, US officials were reluctant to defend this policy for any specific cases, but White House spokesman Dan Bartlett presented a generic defense of US anti-terrorism policies on Sunday talk shows in the United States.
SNT.5451.5750	A former government official claimed that the program was "fully authorized" and that the CIA was "not doing anything illegal" in an interview with The New York Times, and said that the leadership of the House and Senate intelligence committees was able to find out about the program, or had been informed of its existence.
SNT.5451.5751	Allowing the CIA to have so much power in deciding who can stay in the country and who is shipped off to other countries is controversial, because in the past, the White House, State Department, or Justice Department would have been involved in approving individual cases of sending prisoners to other countries.
SNT.5451.5752	While refusing to admit that the rendition policy even exists, the Bush administration claimed that they do not hand over people to be tortured in other countries, to get around US laws which prohibit such practices.
SNT.5451.5753	However, the New York Times interviewed a number of current and former officials who believed that the policy was designed to allow the government to plausibly deny that torture was being tolerated.
SNT.5451.5754	The case of Australian Mamdouh Habib attracted widespread attention in that country, after he was released in January after 40 months, without any charges being pressed.
SNT.5451.5755	Australian officials were aware that he had been transferred by the United States to Egypt for six months.
SNT.5451.5756	During this time, Habib claims he was subjected to various methods of torture, including electric shock and being held under water.
SNT.5451.5757	The United States denies that Habib was tortured with their knowledge, although US officials were not present during his overseas captivity and could not guarantee that he had not been tortured.
SNT.5451.5758	Egypt has not confirmed that Habib was ever in the country.
SNT.5451.5759	A similar case involving Syrian born Canadian Maher Arar, deported to Syria in October, 2002, subsequently held and allegedly tortured for 374 days, led to Canada issuing a travel advisory strongly cautioning Canadians born in Iraq, Iran, Syria, Libya and Sudan against travel to the United States for any reason.
SNT.5451.5760	A subsequent internal RCMP investigation found several instances of impropriety in the Arar case, including the provision of sensitive information on Arar to US officials, and that a liaison officer may have known of the deportation plan but did not contact his supervisors.
SNT.5451.5761	Mr. Arar's attempt to sue American Attorney-General John Ashcroft over the incident in January 2004 was dismissed when the US government invoked the rarely used "state secrets privilege", claiming that to go forward in open court would jeopardize intelligence, foreign policy, and national security interests.
SNT.5451.5762	Legal analysts point out that information obtained through the use of torture is useless in court proceedings, but US officials insist that the information obtained from such interrogations is still useful for their purposes, and that "it has resulted in the capture of terrorists."

SNT.392416.5777	Shenouda spent 40 years as pope to the Coptics, who make up the majority of the nation's estimated ten million Christians.
SNT.392416.5778	Much of this time was spent pacifying his followers in the wake of violence and perceived discrimination, whilst working with the majority Muslims.
SNT.392416.5779	He spent three years exiled in the cathedral after claims of sectarian troublemaking from then-President in 1981.

SNT.392416.5785	His body was taken to a military airfield and was to be taken to desert monastery St Bishoy for burial.

SNT.115154.5828	The UK Government has stated that children in Britain will no longer be required to take compulsory, externally marked tests at the age of fourteen.
SNT.115154.5829	The change takes effect immediately, meaning that children who were due to take the test this year no longer have to do so.
SNT.115154.5830	Secretary of State for Children, Schools and Families Ed Balls yesterday announced his plans to radically change the UK testing system yesterday, in parliament.
SNT.115154.5831	Currently, almost ten million tests are sat each year by British pupils.
SNT.115154.5832	This change is expected to cut the number of tests taken in half, according to The Guardian.
SNT.115154.5833	The tests for seven and eleven year olds are not being abolished.
SNT.115154.5834	A review group is being set up, however, to research the effect of these tests on eleven-year-olds.
SNT.115154.5835	Instead of league tables showing test results, the government will produce report cards for secondary schools.
SNT.115154.5836	According to Ed Balls, the results from GCSEs will be adequate to judge the performance of schools by their test results.
SNT.115154.5837	The decision to abolish the tests for fourteen year olds came as a result of a situation earlier this year, when there were long delays with the delivery of test results to students of this age.
SNT.115154.5838	According to Christine Blower, acting general secretary of the National Union of Teachers, the government is admitting that the previous test system failed by making this move.
SNT.115154.5839	"For too long English, mathematics and science teachers in secondary schools have found themselves skewing everything to enable their pupils to jump through a series of unnecessary hoops," she claimed, while Chris Keates, general secretary of the National Association of Schoolmasters Union of Women Teachers, said that "the sound of a deep collective sigh of relief will emanate from secondary schools across the country."
SNT.115154.5840	Conservative Shadow Secretary of State for Children Michael Gove stated that his party have "argued for fewer national tests and more rigor and we want to work constructively to improve the assessment and qualifications regime."
SNT.115154.5841	David Laws, Shadow Secretary of State for Children for the Liberal Democrats, said that "the Sats tests taken by 14-year-olds are not only a waste of time but have been highly unreliable over the last few years."

SNT.174636.5860	At 8:50 AM local time (15:50 UTC) a man attempting to enter the United States at the Tijuana – San Diego section of the US – Mexican border, tried to escape U.S. customs officers, after he could not provide official documentation.

SNT.139681.5867	NASA's Cassini orbiter has sent back remarkable images from Saturn, revealing that the planet's famous rings are far more bumpy than expected.
SNT.139681.5868	Astronomers previously thought that the rings were almost completely flat, with changes in height of only a few metres.
SNT.139681.5869	However analysis of the new images show ridges up to 4 kilometres tall, similar in height to the Rocky Mountains or the Alps.
SNT.139681.5870	The images were taken around the planet's equinox on August 11, when the Sun was directly over Saturn's equator and caught the rings edge on.
SNT.139681.5871	But whilst equinoxes occur twice a year on Earth, Saturn takes around 29.7 Earth years to orbit the Sun so the events are much rarer.
SNT.139681.5872	With the light from the Sun reaching Saturn's rings at such a low angle, scientists were able to measure the shadows cast by bumps on the rings and discover their surprising height.
SNT.139681.5873	As Cassini project scientist Bob Pappalardo put it: "It's like putting on 3-D glasses and seeing the third dimension for the first time."
SNT.139681.5874	"This is among the most important events Cassini has shown us."
SNT.139681.5875	Some of the ring features are known to be caused by Saturn's moons, but others are harder to explain.
SNT.139681.5876	"To understand what we are seeing will take more time, but the images and data will help develop a more complete understanding of how old the rings might be and how they are evolving," said Linda Spilker, Cassini deputy project scientist.
SNT.139681.5877	Cassini was launched in 1997, and entered orbit around Saturn in 2004.
SNT.139681.5878	It is part of the Cassini-Huygens joint mission between NASA, the European Space Agency and the Italian Space Agency.
SNT.149987.5879	Ballots are being counted in Sri Lanka, after a presidential election was held there, the first after the Tamil Tiger rebels were defeated during a 25-year-long civil war.
SNT.149987.5880	The incumbent president, Mahinda Rajapaksa, is expected to be in a close race against former army chief, General Sarath Fonseka; both candidates say they expect to win.
SNT.149987.5881	There are twenty other candidates on the ballot, but none of them are expected to win.
SNT.149987.5882	Polls closed at 16.00 local time, or 10.30 GMT on Tuesday.
SNT.149987.5883	There were claims of voter intimidation and sporadic acts of violence, and the BBC reports that there were some small bomb blasts.
SNT.149987.5884	The independent operating organisation Centre for Monitoring Election Violence said it had confirmed close to a hundred violent incidents during the day, adding that it believes the number could rise to 150.
SNT.149987.5885	Polls were reportedly busy, with stations in the capital of Colombo being filled with lines of people half an hour before polls officially opened at 07.00 (01.30 UTC).
SNT.149987.5886	"I have been voting at this booth for over 20 years but never saw a crowd like this," said businessman Mohamed Sallel, who had voted in the Borella district of the capital, as quoted by The Telegraph.
SNT.149987.5887	Another voter, Doctor Nimalka Perera, gave an account of the crowds: "When I first came here, the queue was too long so I went back and came two hours later on my way to the hospital and found the line even longer."
SNT.149987.5888	President Rajapakse, after voting in his home constituency, addressed reporters.
SNT.149987.5889	"We must be ready to face the challenges of reaching new heights after this vote," he said.
SNT.149987.5890	Fonseka, however, wasn't able to cast a ballot, apparently because his name didn't appear on the 2008 electroral register used for the elections.
SNT.149987.5891	"My name is not on the 2008 register and therefore I cannot vote at this election." 
SNT.149987.5892	 "The government is trying to use this to mislead the public at the last minute," Fonseka stated, saying that he had filled out his voter registration forms.
SNT.149987.5893	Foreign minister Rohitha Bogollagama, as well as other politicians from the ruling party, suggested that Fonseka might be disqualified from the elections.
SNT.149987.5894	"We are seeking a court order on the suitability of this candidate because he is not eligible to be declared as a candidate," Bogollagama said, adding that the government wanted a ruling from the courts.
SNT.149987.5895	Independent elections commissioner Dayananda Dissanayake, however, remarked: "Not having one's name on the electoral list is not a disqualification."
SNT.149987.5896	The country's electoral rules state that if neither candidate is able to obtain half of the ballots cast in the first count, then voters' second preferences are to be used to determine the winner.
SNT.149987.5897	Political observers commented that election was too close to call between the two.
SNT.355176.5898	Susan G. Komen for the Cure has stopped funding breast cancer screening and educational programming on breast health run by fellow US-charity Planned Parenthood and its affiliates.
SNT.355176.5899	The Komen institute cites an ongoing investigation, while Planned Parenthood blame political pressures.
SNT.355176.5900	Planned Parenthood received nearly 700,000 from the Komen Foundation last year alone.
SNT.355176.5901	In the last five years, the funding from the foundation has granted 170,000 women breast exams.
SNT.355176.5902	Leslie Aun, a spokesperson for the Komen Foundation, said the organization adopted a new rule that does not allow grants or funding to be awarded to organizations that are under legal investigation.
SNT.355176.5903	Komen's policy disqualified Planned Parenthood due to a pending investigation on how Planned Parenthood spends and reports its money that is being conducted by Representative Cliff Stearns.
SNT.355176.5904	Stearns is investigating whether taxes are used to fund abortions through Planned Parenthood in his role as chairman of the Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee, which is under the umbrella of the House Energy and Commerce Committee.
SNT.355176.5905	"While it is regrettable when changes in priorities and policies affect any of our grantees, such as a longstanding partner like Planned Parenthood, we must continue to evolve to best meet the needs of the women we serve and most fully advance our mission," Aun said.
SNT.355176.5906	Cecile Richards, president of Planned Parenthood, said, "While this is deeply disturbing and disappointing, we want to assure women who rely on Planned Parenthood for breast care that we're still here for them, and we always will be. "
SNT.355176.5907	The new fund we're launching to support these services will ensure that the Komen Foundation's decision doesn't jeopardize women's health."

SNT.87137.5909	Gore spoke today in Oslo after receiving the Nobel Peace Prize.
SNT.87137.5910	He urged the two largest carbon-emitting countries - the United States and China - to make what he called the "boldest moves" to fight global warming.
SNT.87137.5911	The United States has not ratified the Kyoto Protocol, the 1997 international pact that requires reductions in greenhouse gas emissions.
SNT.87137.5912	China was not required to reduce emissions under the deal.
SNT.87137.5913	They also refused today to approve a new treaty designed to cut emissions by 25 percent to 40 percent by 2020.
SNT.87137.5914	Gore said he would go to the U.N. climate meeting in Bali later this week to urge world leaders to meet as often as every three months to enact a global cap on greenhouse gas emissions by 2010.
SNT.87137.5915	Gore shared the 2007 Nobel prize with the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, represented at today's ceremony by Rajendra Pachauri.
SNT.87137.5916	Pachauri stressed the link between the fight against climate change and peace.

SNT.116618.5919	India's first lunar mission, the Chandrayaan-1 (meaning 'moon craft' in Sanskrit), reached its destined lunar orbit on Wednesday.
SNT.116618.5920	It is now in a circular orbit 102 kilometres from the Moon.
SNT.116618.5921	It will stay in this orbit for two years and conduct various experiments to gain a better understanding of the Moon.
SNT.116618.5922	According to Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) officials, the Moon Impact Probe (MIP), with an Indian flag painted on it, will be dropped late tonight.
SNT.116618.5923	The MIP has a mass of 29 kg and it will take 20 minutes to reach the moon's surface.

SNT.9257.5938	The People's Republic of China (PRC) in recent years has begun an effort to reform its judicial system and make trials more fair and accountable, according to its state-run People's Daily.
SNT.9257.5939	Those efforts came to a head today with the official May 1 start of jury duty by more than 27,000 newly qualified jurors.
SNT.9257.5940	According to People's Daily, "It is the first time in Chinese history that the people's juries are appointed in a uniformed way by the people's congresses at all levels."
SNT.9257.5941	Two jurors and a judge will be sitting on each three-person panel, and decide both criminal and civil cases.
SNT.9257.5942	The juries will be available when requested by litigants and also in cases "with considerable social repercussions", which appears to mean major cases.
SNT.9257.5943	The jurors are not chosen for each trial but will serve a five-year term in the jury pool working on different cases from time to time.
SNT.9257.5944	Jurors have been provided for in the Chinese Constitution since 1954, but their role in the system was not well-defined by law until now.
SNT.9257.5945	The changes to the jury system are part of a long-term planned reform of China's judicial system that was announced in 1999 by China's top judge, Xiao Yang.
SNT.9257.5946	In addition to jury reforms, the plan addressed trial procedures and court structure and supervision.
SNT.9257.5947	The goal was to "perfect the socialist judicial system with Chinese characteristics...in accordance with the Constitution and laws, and [without] judicial independence and supremacy, which exist in many Western countries," according to Xiao Yang as reported by the People's Daily in 1999.
SNT.9257.5948	"Court reform represents a major part of China's reform of the judicial system and political restructuring." 
SNT.9257.5949	The essence of judicial reform is judicial fairness, which is crucial to the country's rule of law," Xiao Yang said back then.
SNT.9257.5950	In August 2004, the 10th National People's Congress (NPC) Standing Committee approved a "resolution on improving the people's jury system", which took effect today.
SNT.9257.5951	The system specifies that either by recommendation of local work units or by self-application, potential jurors can take qualifying examinations and be presented to standing committees of the NPC for appointment as jurors.
SNT.9257.5952	The first batch of 1,342 jurors were tested in Beijing under the new law on April 23, 2005.
SNT.9257.5953	Those who were certified to begin service on May 1 are said to "participate in all hearing activities of people's courts according to the law, enjoying the same rights as do the judges except that for a presiding judge after their assumption of the post," according to the People's Daily.
SNT.9257.5954	This is an important move to upgrade and strengthen the system of people's jurors, Xiao Long of Beijing People's Court said to China Daily on April 24.
SNT.9257.5955	The implementation of the NPC's decision will add more transparency and justness to the country's judicial system, he added.
SNT.9257.5956	China has one of the world's largest prison systems with over 1 million prisoners, similar to Russia.
SNT.9257.5957	It has received criticism over the years from the U.S. State Department and others for its arbitrariness and its treatment of political prisoners.
SNT.9257.5958	The United States, however, is the world's largest jailer, with a staggering 2 million prison inmates, out of 9 million total around the entire globe.

SNT.17627.6039	The United States Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is deploying its new Homeland Security Information Network - Secret (HSIN-Secret) in all 50 state Emergency Operations Centers as well as 18 additional state and local law enforcement sites.
SNT.17627.6040	The secret network is a component of the HSIN, which is the primary conduit for DHS to share information on terrorist threats, suspicious activity and incident management with state, local, tribal and private-sector officials.
SNT.17627.6041	Development on this $350 million system by Northrop Grumman Corporation was begun in March of 2004 with basic operation achieved in just 4 months.
SNT.17627.6042	"The Homeland is more secure when each hometown is more secure," said Secretary of Homeland Security Tom Ridge in DHS's February 24, 2004 press release that launched the program.
SNT.17627.6043	Future program expansion will include the county level, communication at the classified SECRET level, and the involvement of the private sector.
SNT.17627.6044	With the "Secret" component in place, classified information can now be disseminated to authorized individuals at all levels of government and business throughout the country almost instantly.
SNT.17627.6045	HSIN lets most government agencies as well as many private companies doing business with the government share information on the whereabouts and suspicious activities of anyone that comes to their attention.
SNT.17627.6046	Internal policies and the judgement of the system's users provide privacy and civil rights protections, while who can access the system is determined by DHS.

SNT.160772.6064	They also recommended that ships maintain a higher speed and report any unusual incidents to the proper authorities.

SNT.160772.6070	With around a third of global oil shipments passing through, it is the main route for travelling from the Middle East to Asia.

SNT.144618.6131	The American Physical Society has awarded its 2010 J. J. Sakurai Prize for Theoretical Particle Physics to six scientists for their contributions to theories on the origin of mass, including the key concepts of the Higgs boson and Higgs mechanism.
SNT.144618.6132-1	The full citation stated the prize was awarded "For elucidation of the properties of spontaneous symmetry breaking in four-dimensional relativistic gauge theory and of the mechanism for the consistent generation of vector boson masses."
SNT.144618.6132-2	The J. J. Sakurai Prize will be presented at the APS 2010 meeting in Washington, DC at a special Ceremonial session in February 2010.
SNT.144618.6133	The Higgs mechanism is a key element of the electroweak theory that forms part of the Standard Model of particle physics, and of many models that go beyond it.
SNT.144618.6134	The papers that introduce this mechanism were published in the journal Physical Review Letters in 1964 and were each recognized as milestone papers by PRL's 50th anniversary celebration.
SNT.144618.6135	The Large Hadron Collider at CERN and the Tevatron in the United States are searching for a particle, the Higgs boson, that will constitute evidence for this theory.
SNT.144618.6136	Because of its importance this particle is often referred to as the "God Particle".
SNT.144618.6137	The LHC, a vast scientific experiment to smash together sub-atomic particles, recently moved a step closer to its goal.
SNT.144618.6138	On Friday physicists announced they had sent protons all the way round the 27 km ring beneath the France–Switzerland border, and on Monday announced the first successful collisions.
SNT.144618.6139	This follows a major setback which shut down the collider for 14 months.

SNT.53813.6148	The New Zealand government has now introduced graphic health warnings on cigarette packs.
SNT.53813.6149	The new warnings, which replace the text warnings, will show images of gangrenous toes, rotting gums and teeth and diseased lungs and will also include the quit smoking Quitline number.
SNT.53813.6150	The new warnings will cover 30% of the front side and 90% of the back.
SNT.53813.6151	The new warnings will come into effect January 2007 but the manufacturers will not have to produce the new warnings until February 27, 2008 and retailers have till August 2008 to clear all their old stock.
SNT.53813.6152	Damien O'Conner, associate minister of health and ex-smoker, said: "Pictures were more effective than written warnings."
SNT.53813.6153	Actually seeing what it does to you is probably more acute than just reading the words on a cigarette packet.
SNT.53813.6154	The approach is designed to shock people into realising smoking kills and causes serious illness.
SNT.53813.6155	"Using powerful imagery to remind people of the real and horrific effects of smoking will act to deter smokers and discourage New Zealand's young from starting the habit in the first place."
SNT.53813.6156	Other countries which also show graphic warnings include Australia and Canada; they say that the warnings are effective.
SNT.53813.6157	Chris Laurenson, Health Ministry team leader national drug policy, said that international evidence was strong.
SNT.53813.6158	"That was confirmed by research in New Zealand which supported the effectiveness of pictorial labelling."
SNT.53813.6159	Altogether there will be fourteen images, of which seven will be released first, with rest following.
SNT.53813.6160	Mr O'Connor said: "The images were horrific; but they are what happen to people who smoke in this country."
SNT.53813.6161	However, according to Mr O'Conner, one company had used removable sticker that were later removed due to consultation.
SNT.53813.6162	The industries will not be reimbursed for any cost that may occur.
SNT.53813.6163	"They understand what it might mean if they don't and I'm confident that they will," Mr O'Connor said.
SNT.53813.6164	"They have already been implemented in other countries and the NZ tobacco industry has the technology to print the new packets within weeks," Becky Freeman, the Action on Smoking and Health director said.
SNT.53813.6165	World Heath Organization rules make New Zealand obliged to increase the warning sizes on packets.
SNT.4088.6166	Scientists studying data from the Chandra X-ray telescope have found strong evidence for the missing half of ordinary matter in the universe.
SNT.4088.6167	Two immense intergalactic clouds confirm the existence of a cosmic web of hot gas, predicted by computer simulations, containing baryons, the material making up visible objects in the Universe.
SNT.4088.6168	"An inventory of all the baryons in stars and gas inside and outside of galaxies accounts for just over half the baryons that existed shortly after the Big Bang," Fabrizio Nicastro of the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics.
SNT.4088.6169	"Now we have found the likely hiding place of the missing baryons."
SNT.4088.6170	Nicastro is lead author of a paper in the February 3, 2005 issue of Nature describing the recent research.
SNT.4088.6171	Various measurements give a good estimate of the mass-density of baryons - the neutrons and protons that make up the nuclei of atoms and ions - in the Universe 10 billion years ago.
SNT.4088.6172	However, sometime during the last 10 billion years a large fraction of the baryons, commonly referred to as "ordinary matter" to distinguish them from dark matter and dark energy, have gone missing.
SNT.4088.6173	Using the computer predictions, Nicastro and colleagues searched specifically for the diffuse system of gas clouds galaxies and galaxy clusters form within.
SNT.4088.6174	Evidence of the clouds had been previously detected around our own galaxy and in the Local Group, but the temperature range (a few hundred thousand to a million degrees Celsius) and low density have prevented detection outside the immediate neighborhood of galaxies and the reliable estimation of baryon density for the entire universe.
SNT.4088.6175	The clouds were detected using Chandra observations when the galaxy Mkn 421 brightened in X-ray emissions.
SNT.4088.6176	The X-ray spectral data showed two hot gas clouds, 150 million and 370 million light years distant, absorbing the X-rays from Mkn 421.
SNT.4088.6177	The data shows the presence of carbon, nitrogen, oxygen, and neon present in the clouds.
SNT.4088.6178	Combined with other data the research team determined the thickness and mass of the clouds.
SNT.4088.6179	Assuming that the size and distribution of the clouds are representative, Nicastro and colleagues made the first reliable estimate of average density of baryons in such clouds throughout the Universe, finding it consistent with the mass density of the missing baryons.
SNT.4088.6180	Mkn 421 was observed three times with Chandra's Low-Energy Transmission Grating (LETG), twice in conjunction with the High Resolution Camera (May 2000 and July 2003) and once with the Advanced CCD Imaging Spectrometer (October 2002).
SNT.4088.6181	The distance to Mkn 421 is 400 million light years.

SNT.140237.6187	The tournament will have four divisions for men and one for woman.

SNT.999.6214	On Wednesday North Korea's official media dropped Kim Jong Il's honourific title "Dear leader", reported Japan's Radiopress.
SNT.999.6215	It was only days after the Russian news agency Itar-Tass reported that portraits of Kim Jong Il have recently been removed from public display in North Korea.
SNT.999.6216	According to Radiopress, a Japanese news agency that monitors North Korea's radio broadcasts, the North's Korean Central Broadcasting Station, as well as the Korean Central News Agency and other North Korean media, have stopped using the term "Dear leader" when referring to Kim Jong Il, the country's supreme leader.
SNT.999.6217	Now the media in North Korea only use the official titles "General Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea", " the Chairman of the DPRK National Defense Commission" and/or "Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army" when referring to Kim.
SNT.999.6218	Earlier Itar-Tass also reported that according to an unnamed foreign diplomat in Pyongyang, Kim Jong Il's portraits have recently been taken down from public display secretly and without explanation.
SNT.999.6219	However, the portraits of Kim's father, Kim Il Sung, still remain, according to the same report.
SNT.999.6220	This report has been confirmed by some expatriates living in the country.
SNT.999.6221	This recent development in North Korea has given rise to speculation among analysts, some of whom suspected that these may be a sign that Kim is losing power, or that a power struggle is going on among the top leaders of the totalitarian state.
SNT.999.6222	But most observers believe that the portraits were taken down by the order of Kim Jong Il himself, who might be trying to downsize his own personality cult.
SNT.999.6223	"We believe the change was made at his will to soften his image as a leader of a personality cult, although it is hard to determine what his real intentions are," said Shinya Kato, the editor of Radiopress.
SNT.999.6224	South Korean officials are not yet speculating on the matter, saying the portrait removals "may be for various reasons."
SNT.999.6225	North Korea is one of the few Stalinist states that still exist today, and the political control in the country remains tight.
SNT.999.6226	In recent years North Korea underwent several minor reforms that did not appear to significantly improve quality of life.
SNT.999.6227	It has also remained largely mysterious and secretive to the outside world, as few foreign correspondents are allowed to visit and stay in the country.

SNT.50732.6259	"For courage as much as anything, I walked with my close friend and business partner, who like me, hails from San Diego, California."
SNT.50732.6260	:"I left my suite at the Royal River Hotel and walked down Soi Charansandwong, the narrow street that leads from the hotel to the busy road that crosses the city and shortly thereafter, the Chao Phraya River, known as the 'River of Kings."
SNT.50732.6261	:"Thailand does, indeed, love their kings, or particularly, their current King."
SNT.50732.6262-1	"Evidence of this is clear:"
SNT.50732.6262-2	"at least a third of the people walking on the streets wear the 'King Shirt,' a bright yellow shirt that bears the crest of the King."
SNT.50732.6263	:"Even newsreaders on the local television news can sometimes be seen wearing the yellow shirt as a showing of support for the King."
SNT.50732.6264	:"Leaving the alleyway, we walked to the busy Thonburi district."
SNT.50732.6265	"Immediately, I could see a group of soldiers, some standing, others sitting, along a sidewalk on the main street."
SNT.50732.6266	"They had set up a check point, but I saw but one vehicle stopped, a beat up truck that appeared to have come in from the countryside, loaded with fruit."
SNT.50732.6267	:"We passed all the various businesses along the street as we walked, all open and apparently unaffected by the Coup."
SNT.50732.6268	:"Walking slowly down to where the soldiers were and smiling at them as we walked, we approached the man who appeared to be the commanding officer."
SNT.50732.6269	"He smiled back and asked us where we were from."
SNT.50732.6270	"He was a bit business like at first, but this was a man who had a job to do, of course."
SNT.50732.6271	"It appears that the military, for the most part, is present as a show of support and to act if any anti-Coup action should take place."
SNT.50732.6272	:"My friend noticed that the soldiers appeared to be uncomfortable in their uniforms, not the most comfortable clothing to wear in the hot and humid world that is Bangkok."
SNT.50732.6273	:"Each soldier, unable to wear a yellow shirt and stay in uniform, instead bore a yellow ribbon of support for the King, usually tied to his rifle."
SNT.50732.6274	:"Walking back to a small stand, we purchased twenty bottles of cold drinks and returned to the soldiers and handed them to the officer in charge."
SNT.50732.6275	"He smiled and accepted the offering and handed them out to his men."
SNT.50732.6276	:"As we continued to walk down the sidewalk, three women came out of their shop, one wearing a yellow king shirt, and they thanked us for the gesture."
SNT.50732.6277	:"The streets of Bangkok, otherwise, appeared completely normal in all respects."
SNT.50732.6278	"Street vendors hawked various items of food, car shops were installing high tech stereo systems and dogs, here and there, sat quietly in whatever shady spot they could find."
SNT.50732.6279	:"We crossed the street and walked down an alleyway to the nearest Temple."
SNT.50732.6280	"Walking on the cool, green grounds of the Temple complex, the Coup felt like it was a million miles distant."
SNT.50732.6281	"Bowing and placing our palms together, we greeted a monk on the grounds who was trimming a hedge."
SNT.50732.6282	"Despite the Coup, Bangkok seemingly remains peaceful in all respects."
SNT.50732.6283	"We could smell the delightful scent of freshly cut grass."
SNT.50732.6284	:"Earlier, I asked the doorman at the Royal River Hotel what he thought about the Coup."
SNT.50732.6285-1	"'We needed it', he smiled,"
SNT.50732.6285-2	 'things were too corrupt.'
SNT.50732.6286	"It should all be over in three days or so."
SNT.50732.6287	"But, certainly, I felt no danger on the street from the army or from anyone I encountered."
SNT.50732.6288	"Returning to Soi Charansandwong, I approached an ATM and withdrew a couple of hundred dollars worth of Baht, the currency of Thailand, with my US bank issued card."
