SNT.108659.9136	The February industrial disaster killed 13 people when the Imperial Sugar refinery at Port Wentworth, United States exploded.
SNT.108659.9137	The initial investigation concluded the disaster to have been a dust explosion that ignited under the silos, but investigators from the U.S. Chemical Safety Board (CSB) and the Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA) have been hampered as OSHA declared them to be unsafe after the accident.
SNT.108659.9138	A 7,000lb wrecking ball has now been brought in and demolished the structures, which were 18 inches thick.
SNT.108659.9139	This will allow access for investigators, and make way for replacement silos and a new sugar packaging building, which are scheduled to be in place by Summer 2009.
SNT.108659.9140	The refinery hopes to restart sugar processing by the end of the year.

SNT.108659.9142	2.8 million pounds of fire-hardened sugar were still present in one silo, and 500,000 pounds in another.
SNT.108659.9143	Imperial brought in a crane with a bucket to retrieve this and intends to recycle it for ethanol production.
SNT.108659.9144	Four workers are still hospitalised after the explosion, three in critical condition.
SNT.108659.9145	The disaster is also blamed for a $15.5 million loss Imperial posted in this year's first quarter.

SNT.784189.9147	The government motion was defeated by opposition from the Labour Party, as well as rebel MPs from both the Conservative and Liberal Democratic parties.
SNT.784189.9148	David Cameron argued the recent events in Syria were a "humanitarian catastrophe, and if there are no consequences for it, there is nothing to stop Assad and other dictators from using these weapons again and again".
SNT.784189.9149	The motion rejected by the Commons said the House "agrees that a strong humanitarian response is required from the international community and that this may, if necessary, require military action", and such action would be "legal, proportionate and focused on saving lives by preventing and deterring further use of Syria's chemical weapons".
SNT.784189.9150	Thirty Conservative MPs and nine Liberal Democrats voted against their party against military intervention.
SNT.784189.9151	Ed Miliband, leader of the opposition Labour Party, said the proposal to go to war was an "ill-thought through action", it lacked international support, and Cameron had acted in a "cavalier and reckless" manner.
SNT.784189.9152	Deputy Prime Minister and Liberal Democratic leader Nick Clegg said the sole intention of the government's motion was to "relieve humanitarian suffering by deterring and disrupting the further use of chemical weapons".
SNT.784189.9153	"President Obama's intentions are highly limited and so are ours."
SNT.784189.9154	The former foreign secretary and Conservative MP Sir Malcolm Rifkind said during the debate: "The Assad regime in Damascus are watching very carefully as to whether they will get away with what they have done."
SNT.784189.9155	Opposition came also from Britain's smaller parties: Caroline Lucas from the Green Party said the actions "cannot be justified", and expressed concern that the United Kingdom would be "flouting international law" by going into Syria.
SNT.784189.9156	Respect MP George Galloway argued there was "no compelling evidence" of Syrian government involvement in the chemical weapons attack.
SNT.784189.9157	Labour proposed an opposing motion that called for the government to present "compelling" evidence before action, which was rejected as well as the government's motion.
SNT.784189.9158	The defeat of the government motion for military intervention has surprised some.
SNT.784189.9159	Shadow Defence Secretary Jim Murphy said "Parliament is entirely unpredictable sometimes and I don't think many people saw this coming."
SNT.784189.9160	Philip Hammond, the Defence Secretary, confirmed that following the vote, the country would not participate in any action in Syria, but he noted he expected the United States to carry on without the UK, anticipating "the US and other countries will continue to look at responses to the chemical attack."
SNT.784189.9161	"They will be disappointed that Britain will not be involved."
SNT.784189.9162	"I don't expect that the lack of British participation will stop any action."
SNT.784189.9163	Hammond noted the rejection of military intervention would strain the "special relationship" between Britain and the United States.
SNT.784189.9164	The former leader of the British Army, General Lord Dannatt, said the vote in the Commons was a "victory for common sense".
SNT.784189.9165	The United States has said they will still seek military action against the Syrian regime.
SNT.784189.9166	US defense secretary Chuck Hagel said the US would seek to build an "international coalition".
SNT.784189.9167	Caitlin Hayden, spokeswoman for the White House, reacted to the British vote by saying: "The US will continue to consult with the UK Government — one of our closest allies and friends."
SNT.784189.9168	Hayden said that President Obama "will be guided by what is in the best interests of the United States", and that Obama "believes that there are core interests at stake for the United States... countries who violate international norms regarding chemical weapons need to be held accountable".
SNT.784189.9169	Representative Eliot Engel, a Democrat on the House Foreign Affairs Committee, said the White House had told them "beyond a doubt [...] chemical weapons were used, and used intentionally by the Assad regime", and that there is evidence from intercepted communications of involvement by "high-level Syrian officials".
SNT.784189.9170	The Parliamentary vote on intervention in Syria is on the front pages of many of the national newspapers in Britain, with The Times claiming Cameron was "humiliated" by the vote.

SNT.115617.9199	"This would only give my country one option, the option of war."
SNT.115617.9200	The Eritrean ambassador to the UN, Araya Desta, claimed to have peaceful intentions and that his nation had no wishes to take new territory.
SNT.115617.9201	He claimed his country desired "the cultivation of good neighbourly relations with Djibouti," and said that "Contrary to the claims made, Eritrea has not taken any land that belongs to Djibouti and it does not have any territorial ambitions."
SNT.115617.9202	Desta accused Ethiopia of worsening the situation by preparing military forces to help Djibouti.
SNT.115617.9203	"Ethiopia has built from the Djiboutian side a network of winding roads up the mount and deployed offensive long-range artillery and heavy equipment directed at Eritrea," he said.
SNT.115617.9204	Olhaye dismissed the idea of Ethiopia's involvement with the claim "Whatever the Eritrean ambassador has said is hogwash."
SNT.115617.9205	The UN security council has urged both nations to show restraint; it was the UN who called on the nations to agree to a ceasefire in June.
SNT.246010.9206	Veteran striker Pat "Bam Bam" Healy put an end to the undefeated streak of Lyle "Fancy Pants" Beerbohm in a close main event fight that went to the judges' decision at the Strikeforce Challengers 14 event at Cedar Park Center in Cedar Park, Texas on Friday night.
SNT.246010.9207	Veteran fighter Carlo "Neo" Prater also prevailed in his Strikeforce debut against Bryan Travers.
SNT.246010.9208	Ryan Couture, son of MMA legend Randy Couture, remained undefeated in his second-ever bout.
SNT.246010.9209	Lyle Beerbohm came into the main event bout with an undefeated 15-0-0 record, in addition to his 8-0-0 amateur record.
SNT.246010.9210	"This is going to be a fun, tough, hard fight that I expect will go everywhere," stated Beerbohm in a pre-fight media workout on Wednesday.
SNT.246010.9211	"My time has come and I am really looking forward to the fight."
SNT.246010.9212	Beerbohm also stated he wanted to eventually fight for a Strikeforce Lightweight title, but recognized that he first needed to move past his veteran opponent, Pat Healey, who came into the fight with a record of 25-17-0, who was making his return to action since his loss to Josh Thompson via submission in 2010.
SNT.246010.9213	The bout was very close, going the distance through all three rounds.
SNT.246010.9214	While Beerbohm pushed a lot of the action, especially with grappling on the ground, Healey was able to land more effective strikes and weathered persistent take-down attempts from Beerbohm.
SNT.246010.9215	The action was back-and-forth, neither fighter never able to clearly dominate the other.
SNT.246010.9216	The last few minutes of the fight proved to be the best for Healey, who wore down Beerbohm's strength and left him gasping for air, allowing Healey to attempt more submissions on the ground.
SNT.246010.9217	The three judges scored the bout 29-28, 29-28, and 29-28 to give Healey the unanimous decision win.
SNT.246010.9218	After the match, Beerbohm was upbeat, but felt he had won the bout.
SNT.246010.9219	"I thought going into the third we'd each won a round, but I definitely thought I won that last round."
SNT.246010.9220	"But that's what happens when you let it go to the hands of the judges."
SNT.246010.9221	Healey complimented his opponent, "Beerbohm fought a good fight but I think I outworked and outhustled him."
SNT.246010.9222	Healey also welcomed the idea of a rematch, stating, "He talked a lot of trash, but if he wants a rematch, I'll give him one anytime."
SNT.246010.9223	Asked who he wanted to face next, Healey stated he wanted to fight the winner of the Billy "Cyborg" Evangelista and Jorge "Gamebred" Masvidal on March 5, noting that both fighters had previously defeated his brother, Pat Healey.
SNT.246010.9224	The co-main event for the show featured Carlo "Neo" Prater, a veteran fighter with a 25-10-1 record making his Strikeforce debut against the 14-3-0 Bryan Travers.
SNT.246010.9225	The bout was over in just 38 seconds as Prater used his superior reach to jab Travers several times before using a trip to take Travers to the ground and submitting him with an Anaconda Choke.
SNT.246010.9226	Prater showed a lot of emotion in his post-fight interview.
SNT.246010.9227	"My record shows I'm not a perfect fighter, but when you're down you get up," Prater said.
SNT.246010.9228	"This was a good win, I'll get better off this fight, but I'll be right back in the gym soon."
SNT.246010.9229	Ryan Couture, the son of MMA legend Randy "the Nature" Couture, pushed his fight record to 2-0-0 with a victory over 2-0-0 opponent Lee Higgins.
SNT.246010.9230	Most of the first round featured very little action until Higgins attempted to take down Couture, and found himself fighting off Guillotine Choke and a D'Arce Choke in the last minute of the round.
SNT.246010.9231	Couture dominated nearly all of the second round with superior stand-up striking and ground control.
SNT.246010.9232	Higgins fared little better in the third, as Couture was able to put Higgins against the cage and stop Higgins' take-down attempts, and then eventually control Higgins on the ground before submitting him with a Rear Naked Choke with 20 seconds left in the bout.
SNT.246010.9233	The main card was broadcast in the United States on premium broadcast network Showtime.
SNT.246010.9234	The Showtime Strikeforce Challengers series highlights mixed martial arts fights between up-and-coming fighters as well as veteran fighters who are looking to move up towards the larger Strikeforce events.
SNT.43904.9235	Mauritanians voted in favour of a new Constitution by an overwhelming majority in a referendum held on June 26, according to results announced by Interior Ministry officials today.
SNT.43904.9236	The new Constitution sets limits on the number of presidential terms a leader can serve, in contrast to several sub-Saharan countries, where several leaders have amended their Constitutions to retain power.
SNT.43904.9237	The Interior Minister, Mohamed Ahmed Ould Mohamed Lemine said that over 96 percent votes cast were in favour of the new Constitution.
SNT.43904.9238	The turnout was over 76 percent of the close to One million registered voters, who constitute about a third of the country's population.
SNT.43904.9239	The referendum will now lead to municipal and legislative elections to be held in November, followed by elections to the parliamentary upper house and the President's post in 2007.
SNT.43904.9240	The new Constitution provides for a presidential form of government, with the President commanding significant powers, including the appointment of the prime minister.
SNT.43904.9241	The Parliament though, can vote for no confidence in the government or censure it.
SNT.43904.9242	The Constitution disallows members of the present junta from running for the President's post and requires future leaders to swear on the Qur'an that they will not amend the Constitution to stay in power.
SNT.43904.9243	International observers from the African Union and the Arab League said that the referendum appeared to have gone smoothly, but have yet to make their final reports.
SNT.43904.9244	President Ely Ould Mohamed Vall, who also voted in the referendum said, "This is a great day and a rebirth for Mauritania ..."
SNT.43904.9245	"I am sure that all Mauritanians feel the same way and that for this reason the Constitution will receive massive support."
SNT.43904.9247	The Constitution has the backing of most civic and political groups, though two small parties called for a boycott of the referendum, saying the proposed Constitution ignores slavery, which is officially banned but still persists according to activists; and issues of "cohabitation between the different national communities" (such as Blacks and Arabs).

SNT.28615.9250	The Australian Department of Foreign Affairs has said that Trinh was receiving consular assistance, but that it was too early to negotiate for clemency as his case is still subject to appeal.
SNT.28615.9251	The government has reiterated its long standing opposition to the death penalty.

SNT.7284.9268	The channels will be available via both wired cable services and by satellite, which is more popular in Asia than it is in the United States.
SNT.7284.9269	"Cable operators throughout Asia are preparing to dramatically expand channel capacity on many of their systems through digital technology," Jonathan Spink, CEO of HBO Asia said in a World Screen News report.
SNT.7284.9270	He said HBO plans to be one of the first programmers to take advantage of increased channel capacity.
SNT.7284.9271	The first new channel HBO plans to launch in Asia is HBO Signature, which is targeted to women.
SNT.7284.9272	It is planned to debut in Singapore, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Macau and Sri Lanka by the end of the year.
SNT.7284.9273	According to reports, HBO already has struck deals for carriage in all of those countries except Macau.
SNT.7284.9274	In addition to programming HBO Signature to women, the company said it plans on two other genre-based channels, but did not disclose what niches they would market toward.
SNT.7284.9275	A clue could be to look to the U.S. where HBO's niche channels include HBO Family for children-friendly programming and the self-explanatory HBO Comedy channel.
SNT.7284.9276	Like the parent HBO Asia channel, along with limited original programming, the new genre channels are expected to offer top Hollywood fare dubbed into local languages.
SNT.7284.9277	This is the largest expansion of HBO Asia, which has been operating in Asia since 1992 and serves 25 countries, since the launch of Cinemax Asia in 1996.
SNT.171476.9278	British Airways (BA) and the Spanish airline Iberia have signed a merger deal, which will create one of the largest air carrier groups in the world.
SNT.171476.9279	The two announced the merger yesterday, and said that the deal, which has been expected for a long time, is to be implemented by the end of 2010.
SNT.171476.9280	The move will make a group with a market value of US$8 billion.
SNT.171476.9281	Under the plan, both companies keep their own brands and operations, but will be owned by International Airlines Group, a new holding company.
SNT.171476.9282	It will be listed in London, but taxed in Spain.
SNT.171476.9283	The airlines believe the merger will save $530 million annually.
SNT.171476.9284	In February, BA reported a loss of $102.4 million for the final three quarters of 2009, whilst Iberia posted an operating loss of $629 million.
SNT.171476.9285	Meanwhile, investors in BA will receive an IAG share for every BA share they own, and stockholders in Iberia 1.0205 shares for each share in the Spanish airline; thus, BA shareholders will take 55% of IAG.
SNT.171476.9286	"The merged company will provide customers with a larger combined network," commented BA chief executive Willie Walsh.
SNT.171476.9287	"It will also have greater potential for further growth by optimising the dual hubs of London and Madrid and providing continued investment in new products and services."
SNT.171476.9288	Meanwhile, Iberia chief executive Antonio Vázquez remarked: "This is an important step in creating one of the world's leading global airlines that will be better equipped to compete with other major airlines and participate in future industry consolidation."
SNT.171476.9289	Independent aviation specialist James Halstead said he believed the merger was necessary for BA to remain competitive amongst other European air carriers.
SNT.171476.9290	"BA's unique position at Heathrow could help it survive for a short while, but in the long run it needs more than just Heathrow."
SNT.171476.9291	"The main point of the Iberia deal is to be able to cut costs and put the combined company in the position that Air France-KLM and Lufthansa are already in," he said, quoted by The Independent.

SNT.497600.9293	China's Feng Zhe won gold in the men's parallel bars, just narrowly beating out the German gymnast Marcel Nguyen by 0.166 points.
SNT.497600.9294	China also claimed a gold with Deng Linlin scoring a 15.600 in the women's beam.
SNT.497600.9295	The balance beam proved treacherous for some: Gabrielle Douglas, considered a favourite for the event, came seventh after a dramatic fall.
SNT.497600.9296	The United States did manage to get a bronze on the beam thanks to Alexandra Raisman who pulled off a routine that received enormous applause.
SNT.497600.9297	She initially got less points than Romania's Catalina Ponor, but took the bronze after an appeal.
SNT.497600.9298	The men's horizontal bar event was a volley of high-scoring, high-difficulty routines.
SNT.497600.9299	Danell Leyva from the United States started with a strong 15.833 point routine.
SNT.497600.9300	China's Zhang Chenglong then grabbed the lead by earning 16.266 points.
SNT.497600.9301	The German gymnast Fabian Hambuchen raised the bar even further with a 16.400 routine.
SNT.497600.9302	The Dutch gymnast Epke Zonderland performed a near-flawless and immensely difficult routine that earned 16.533 points, earning him both a gold medal and a standing ovation from the audience in the North Greenwich Arena.
SNT.497600.9303	Zonderland's performance makes him the first Dutch gymnast to win gold at the Olympics since the win for the Dutch women's team at the Amsterdam Games in 1928.
SNT.497600.9304	Hambuchen got a silver medal and the Chinese gymnast Zou Kai took bronze.
SNT.497600.9305	In the women's floor event, the eighteen-year-old United States gymnast Alexandra Raisman secured a second gold after her success in the women's team event last week.
SNT.497600.9306	As in the beam event, she narrowly beat out Catalina Ponor from Romania with a score of 15.600 to 15.200.
SNT.497600.9307	Aliya Mustafina from Russia took home bronze for her 14.900 point routine.

SNT.145523.9313	The Wiltshire town beat 24 others in a competition to become the first ever to be twinned with the famous resort.
SNT.145523.9314	Rebecca Warren, a local building society worker, created a poem and video praising Swindon which won over the judges.
SNT.145523.9315	Among other features she highlighted the town's well-known Magic Roundabout, a complicated junction composed of five interlinked mini-roundabouts, comparing it to Disney World's teacup rides.
SNT.145523.9316	A sign marking the twinning is planned for the roundabout.

SNT.16889.9346	President Bush is lobbying the U.S. House of Representatives to pass the Central America Free Trade Agreement (CAFTA), which is scheduled for a vote Wednesday night.
SNT.16889.9347	Similar to the existing North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) among the U.S., Canada, and Mexico, CAFTA would create a free trade zone putting an end to most trade barriers between the United States and six additional countries, including Costa Rica, El Salvador, Honduras, Guatemala, Nicaragua, and the Dominican Republic.
SNT.16889.9348	Many Republicans who represent agricultural Corn Belt or industrial Rust Belt and southern textile states in Congress also have stated opposition to the bill.
SNT.16889.9349	But with a Republican majority in the House large enough to ensure passage of CAFTA, party leaders are trying to shore up enough votes to ensure CAFTA's passage.
SNT.16889.9350	This has prompted last minute action by the President to lobby individual members of the House, reminding them that Central American countries have committed troops and other resources to fight the U.S. War on Terror.
SNT.16889.9351	Other Republican leaders have been using the party's traditional pro-business message and linking it to homeland security issues.
SNT.16889.9352	"Trade creates jobs and lifts people out of poverty and there's nothing like a stable society to fight terrorism and strengthen democracy, freedom and rule of law," Dennis Hastert, Speaker of the House, reportedly said at a news conference Tuesday.
SNT.16889.9353	CAFTA is "a bad deal for Central Americans and also for Latinos in this community... (with CAFTA) the exploitation of workers will continue in Central America," Democrat Representative Hilda Solis of Los Angeles said.
SNT.16889.9354	Her views are common among Democrats, who are overwhelmingly against the treaty.
SNT.16889.9355	According to opponents of CAFTA, the current trend of American jobs being sent to foreign countries, particularly in the information technology sector, would greatly expand under the treaty.
SNT.16889.9356	"This will be a vote in the middle of the night."
SNT.16889.9357	"They'll keep the vote open for several hours, in violation of the rules."
SNT.16889.9358	"If it passes, it will be by fewer than five votes," predicted Rep. Sherrod Brown, a Democrat from Ohio, according to a Washington Post report.

SNT.66363.9411	A camera set up in the jungles of Malaysian Borneo in Sabah by the World Wide Fund for Nature or WWF, has captured, for the first time, a Borneo Rhino on videotape.
SNT.66363.9412	"This astonishing footage captures one of the world's most elusive creatures."
SNT.66363.9413	"Tremendous progress has been made in recent years to secure the rhino's habitat but so much more needs to be done considering this species may very well disappear in the next 10 years," said President and CEO of the World Wildlife Fund in a press release, Carter Roberts.
SNT.66363.9414	"In the video, the rhino comes out of the jungle brush and then proceeds to sniff the camera and equipment surrounding it."
SNT.66363.9415	"The video also shows the rhino getting a bite to eat."
SNT.66363.9416	It is estimated that there are only 25 to 50 of the rhinos alive on the planet, and they can only be found in the jungles of Sabah, or better known as the "Heart of Borneo."
SNT.66363.9417	For the past 20 years, the rhino has not been reported anywhere else in Sabah and researchers say that it is likely "extinct" in the rest of Malaysia.
SNT.66363.9418	Researchers say that poaching to use the rhino's horn in medicine and encroachment into their habitats are causing them to decline.
SNT.66363.9419	Researchers also say that because the rhino is so isolated from the rest of Malaysia, that they are rarely able to breed together.
SNT.66363.9420	"The rhino is very sensitive to the presence of human beings."
SNT.66363.9421	"Till now, we can still see the rhino, but if we cannot develop any kind of protection method, I think the rhinos will survive less than 10 years," said a project manager for the WWF for elephants and rhinos in the Borneo region, Raymond Alfred.
SNT.66363.9422	In 2006, the first ever still image was captured of the rhino.

SNT.46870.9436	According to Bierce, a U.S. Special Agent investigating the incident, the brutal attack which saw Abeer Qassim al-Janabi slain and her parents and younger sister murdered was premeditated.

SNT.46870.9451	"If you have the power to make something right, you should do it."

SNT.122075.9506	Oyler, 38, set the Esperanza Fire out of anger his dog had been impounded, according to prosecutors.
SNT.122075.9507	The October 2006 blaze destroyed 34 houses and 20 outbuildings, scorching over 17,400 hectares.
SNT.122075.9508	Prosecutors also alleged Oyler started the fire at night specifically to leave firefighters "on their own" without aerial support.
SNT.122075.9509	He was identified as the arsonist behind the fire after a security camera saw his car several times and samples taken from the scene matched those found in his girlfriend's house.
SNT.122075.9510	Oyler, an unemployed car mechanic, was also identified by the owner of a local petrol station as having stood in a car park and watched the fire's spread.
SNT.122075.9511	The five firefighters that were killed died when their truck was overrun by the flames.
SNT.122075.9512	Oyler was convicted of murdering them on Friday March 6 after a six-week trial in Riverside California.
SNT.122075.9513	The twelve-member jury took nearly a week of deliberation before returning the guilty verdict, and will meet to hear arguments regarding Oyler's sentence on Tuesday.
SNT.122075.9514	His defense had admitted Oyler likely started several fires in the Riverside County area, but denied he had started the one that killed the firefighters.

SNT.23523.9516	The acquisition is expected to be completed within six months.
SNT.23523.9517	"Alias' technology spans several of our most important markets and augments the synergy between our design and media business," said Carl Bass, COO of Autodesk.
SNT.23523.9518	Autodesk is the creator of one of the top computer aided design programs; AutoCAD, which is used by many engineers and architects for design activities including drafting.
SNT.23523.9519	They are the 5th largest PC software company in the world.
SNT.23523.9520	Alias produces 3D graphics software used in the creation of special effects, video games, industrial, and automotive design.
SNT.23523.9521	They were founded in 1983 under the name Alias Research.
SNT.23523.9522	They merged with Wavefront Technologies under SGI in 1995 and changed its name to Alias in July 2003.
SNT.23523.9523	In June, 2004 they were spun off from Silicon Graphics Inc. and acquired by Accel-KKR and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan.
SNT.23523.9524	In the 2005 fiscal year they earned $83 million in revenue.
SNT.23523.9525	Alias customers include DreamWorks SKG, Pixar, Nintendo, Industrial Light & Magic, General Motors, and BMW.
SNT.23523.9526	According to Alias, their software has been used in nearly every film nominated for an Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences award in the Best Visual Effects and Best Animated Feature Films categories.

SNT.55658.9535	In the intervening election, the victorious Conservatives promised that if they were elected parliament would hold a free vote on whether to amend or repeal the Act.
SNT.55658.9536	Several surveys have suggested that MPs in the minority parliament will overwhelmingly reaffirm support for same-sex marriage once a vote has held.
SNT.55658.9537	The pro-same sex marriage group Canadians for Equal Marriage estimates that the motion will be defeated by at least 35 votes.
SNT.55658.9538	This has prompted supporters of same-sex marriage to urge that a vote be held as soon as possible while opponents of gay marriage have been urging the government to delay the vote until the next election, expected early in 2007, in hopes of the election of a Conservative majority that would repeal the act.
SNT.55658.9539	A number of Conservative MPs and strategists have supported an early vote, however, in the belief that the same-sex issue would hurt the Tories in an election campaign by emphasizing a social conservative agenda that is unpopular in urban areas and Quebec.

SNT.15962.9554	The British Parliament approved the first stage of the new Crossrail underground railroad through London as a £15 billion construction project earlier this month.
SNT.15962.9555	Crossrail is the first major new train line to be built in London in decades.
SNT.15962.9556	The rail line being implemented as a hybrid bill in Parliament.
SNT.15962.9557	After a second reading in Parliament, it was voted upon and decided that the government will commit to the project so that the line will be built.
SNT.15962.9558	The next issue before Parliament of to ensure that the implementation of the bill so it is consistent with private interests of neighborhoods to be affected by Crossrail.
SNT.15962.9559	This is when residents can petition Parliament to change the way the line is constructed.
SNT.15962.9560	As a result of construction of the Crossrail line, hundreds of homes will have new tunnels excavated beneath them.
SNT.15962.9561	On contacting Crossrail, they have indicated approximately £50 will be offered to each landowner to buy all the land rights-of-way to build the train tunnel more than 9 meters below the residential buildings.
SNT.15962.9562	The average value for properties in the affected areas is £350,000.
SNT.15962.9563	Under UK compulsory purchase laws to be used in this bill, the residents are entitled to the difference in the value of the whole property with and without a tunnel under it.
SNT.15962.9564	If the offer given by Crossrail is not accepted by any of the residents, the residents can take the case to the Land Tribunal, where the fair value will be established.
SNT.15962.9565	Crossrail does not indicate that it will attempt to assign a fair value in the original offer and instead is only going to offer around £50 per property in the hope that not many people take the matter to the Land Tribunal.

SNT.101585.9578	The International Football Association Board (IFAB), the body that decides on the laws of the game, has decided to discontinue all experiments involving technology, and for the first time has also decided on the exact size of a soccer field.
SNT.101585.9579	Instead of pursuing the idea of using cameras or microchips in the ball to see if it has crossed the goal-line, the International Board wants to see if the introduction of two extra assistant referees can improve the quality of referee's decisions.
SNT.101585.9580	FIFA general secretary Jerome Valcke declared: "We have decided to freeze for the time being the goal-line technology and all technology experiments."
SNT.101585.9581	"We will look on these two additional referees and we avoid considering any goal-line technology during this time."
SNT.101585.9582	FIFA President Sepp Blatter said the move was necessary to maintain the universal spirit of the game: "We have 260 million people directly involved in the game."
SNT.101585.9583	"If we maintain the laws of the game ... it's so easy to understand ..."
SNT.101585.9584	"We have to live with errors, football has to keep its human face."
SNT.101585.9585	"We have to maintain the laws of the game in their simplicity."
SNT.101585.9586	"Do you want technical devices to take decisions? That's why, after three years of tests with no conclusions, I am in favour of putting the whole thing on ice," Blatter explained.
SNT.101585.9587	UEFA president Michel Platini agreed: "Football should stay human, but two more officials can help, especially around the goal."
SNT.101585.9588	Platini made the suggestion to freeze all investigations into technology and to try two additional assistants behind each goal.
SNT.101585.9589	Blatter said the system using the microchip "was very complicated, needing electrified lines on the field of play and other devices including antennae and when we tested it in Tokyo last year there was one mistake during the seven matches we used as an experiment at the Club World Championship."
SNT.101585.9590	With regards to the system using cameras, he pointed to "problems with players obscuring the views of the cameras, or of flares or weather conditions."
SNT.101585.9591	The system of the extra referees will be tested at an upcoming FIFA or UEFA tournament, and a final ruling is expected at next year's meeting, according to FIFA's Jerome Valcke.
SNT.101585.9592	Hawk-Eye, the company that was working on the goal-line technology that is already being used for line calls in tennis, reacted with disappointment: "I'm livid, it is completely out of the blue..."
SNT.101585.9593	"A year ago they met and gave us four criteria to meet and we have met all of them, yet they have kicked it out now..."
SNT.101585.9594	"We have invested an awful lot of money and now we have no return on that investment," director Paul Hawkins said.
SNT.101585.9595	He said he was encouraged to continue research on the project only 10 days ago at a private showing for IFAB members at Reading's Madejski Stadium.
SNT.101585.9596	While the Welsh FA were also against the idea, the English Football Association supported the use of technology and was hoping to start using it by next season.
SNT.101585.9597	The FA clubs and referees supported the use of Hawk-Eye technology, said Mike Foster, general secretary of the English Premier League.
SNT.101585.9598	A spokesperson of the Premier League said that "A lot of time, money and effort has gone into developing a system that meets all the criteria laid down last year."
SNT.101585.9599	The Scottish and Northern Irish FA also voted in favour of the goal-line technology.
SNT.101585.9600	FA chief executive Brian Barwick expressed his disappointment at the annual meeting of the IFAB in Gleneagles, Scotland: "We were in favour of goal-line technology but there will be no more experiments and it will not be back on the agenda next year, or in the foreseeable future."
SNT.101585.9601	FIFA President Blatter denied ulterior motives for the decision: "There has been no change of heart."

SNT.722550.9630	Researchers at the Massachusetts General Hospital have created laboratory-grown rat kidneys that function when transplanted into rats according to a study published online yesterday in the medical journal Nature Medicine.
SNT.722550.9631	The kidneys were capable of urine production and excretion without blood clots in both the laboratory and inside living rats.
SNT.722550.9632	The researchers were able to create the functional kidneys by using a donor kidney and using a detergent to remove the rats' kidney cells, then used new cells to cause the kidney to grow around the remaining "scaffolding," the natural protein-based structure of the kidney that remained after washing the kidney.
SNT.722550.9633	These kidneys would also be of the patient's tissue avoiding issues of organ rejection and would increase the pool of kidneys available for human transplant.
SNT.722550.9634	The researchers incubated the kidneys in a specialized oven for 12 days to mimic the insides of a rat.
SNT.722550.9635	The researchers reported that these kidneys produced urine at 23% of the normal levels of properly working kidneys.
SNT.722550.9636	The lead researcher of the study published in Nature Medicine, Dr. Harald C. Ott, says this partial functionality is enough, saying, "If you're on haemodialysis then kidney function of 10% to 15% would already make you independent of hemodialysis."
SNT.722550.9637	"It's not that we have to go all the way."
SNT.722550.9638	The techniques developed by Ott and the team of researchers still have to be further researched before it can be applied for use in humans.
SNT.722550.9639	When it comes time for use in humans, Ott says that pigs' kidneys would be used as the templates for making human-usable kidneys.
SNT.722550.9640	Ott said, "You'd take a kidney matrix off the shelf."
SNT.722550.9641	"Then in an ideal world, you'd take cells from that patient and create a kidney on demand."
SNT.722550.9642	Roughly 100,000 patients in the United States need an immediate kidney transplant, with 500,000 more on dialysis.
SNT.36626.9643	In one of the most contentious Democratic primary races of the season, Iraqi war veteran Tammy Duckworth garnered 44% of the vote in the 6th Illinois congressional district, beating out Christine Cegalis (40%) and Lindy Scott (16%).
SNT.36626.9644	Duckworth's victory earns her a spot in the race against Republican state Senator Peter Roskam, who won the Republican nomination to replace retiring Congressman Henry Hyde.
SNT.36626.9645	Cegalis ran for the seat in 2004, garnering 44% of the vote, the best achieved by a Democrat against Hyde.
SNT.36626.9646	Working off of momentum gathered in that race, she continued to increase her grassroots organization and her Internet campaigning to gain support from Democrats across the nation.
SNT.36626.9647	Cegalis, a software engineer, was running unopposed for the nomination until Duckworth joined the race in December.
SNT.36626.9648	Supported by the Democratic establishment, Duckworth quickly out-fundraised her opponents, receiving support from prominent Democrats such as John Kerry, Hillary Clinton, Rahm Emmanual, and Barack Obama.
SNT.36626.9649	The race became strongly contested between self-proclaimed progressive activists supporting Cegalis and Democrats who preferred to work with the party candidate.
SNT.36626.9650	Duckworth, who lost her legs in Iraq in 2004, received a strong showing of support from outside the district, including large fundraisers in New York and Chicago.
SNT.36626.9651	Scott, a former pastor of an evangelical church in Des Plains, attempted to paint the race in religious terms.

SNT.87701.9653	Wikinews reporter David Shankbone is currently, courtesy of the Israeli government and friends, visiting Israel.
SNT.87701.9654	This is a first-hand account of his experiences and may — as a result — not fully comply with Wikinews' neutrality policy.
SNT.87701.9655	Please note this is a journalism experiment for Wikinews and put constructive criticism on the collaboration page.
SNT.87701.9656	Dr. Yossi Vardi is known as Israel's 'Father of the Entrepreneur', and he has many children in the form of technology companies he has helped to incubate in Tel Aviv's booming Internet sector.
SNT.87701.9657	At the offices of Superna, one such company, he introduced a whirlwind of presentations from his baby incubators to a group of journalists.
SNT.87701.9658	What stuck most in my head was when Vardi said, "What is important is not the technology, but the talent."
SNT.87701.9659	Perhaps because he repeated this after each young Internet entrepreneur showed us his or her latest creation under Vardi's tutelage.
SNT.87701.9660	I had a sense of déjà vu from this mantra.
SNT.87701.9661	A casual reader of the newspapers during the Dot.com boom will remember a glut of stories that could be called "The Rise of the Failure"; people whose technology companies had collapsed were suddenly hot commodities to start up new companies.
SNT.87701.9662	This seemingly paradoxical thinking was talked about as new back then; but even Thomas Edison—the Father of Invention—is oft-quoted for saying, "I have not failed."
SNT.87701.9663	"I have just found ten thousand ways that won't work."
SNT.87701.9664	Vardi's focus on encouraging his brood of talent regardless of the practicalities stuck out to me because of a recent pair of "dueling studies" The New York Times has printed.
SNT.87701.9665	These are the sort of studies that confuse parents on how to raise their kids.
SNT.87701.9666	The first, by Carol Dweck at Stanford University, came to the conclusion that children who are not praised for their efforts, regardless of the outcome's success, rarely attempt more challenging and complex pursuits.
SNT.87701.9667	According to Dweck's study, when a child knows that they will receive praise for being right instead of for tackling difficult problems, even if they fail, they will simply elect to take on easy tasks in which they are assured of finding the solution.
SNT.87701.9668-1	Only one month earlier the Times produced another story for parents to agonize over, this time based on a study from the Brookings Institution, entitled "Are Kids Getting Too Much Praise?"
SNT.87701.9668-2	Unlike Dweck's clinical study, Brookings drew conclusions from statistical data that could be influenced by a variety of factors (since there was no clinical control).
SNT.87701.9669	The study found American kids are far more confident that they have done well than their Korean counterparts, even when the inverse is true.
SNT.87701.9670	The Times adds in the words of a Harvard faculty psychologist who intoned, "Self-esteem is based on real accomplishments."
SNT.87701.9671-1	"It's all about letting kids shine in a realistic way." 
SNT.87701.9671-2	But this is not the first time the self-esteem generation's proponents have been criticized.
SNT.87701.9672	Vardi clearly would find himself encouraged by Dweck's study, though, based upon how often he seemed to ask us to keep our eyes on the people more than the products.
SNT.87701.9673	That's not to say he has not found his latest ICQ, though only time—and consumers—will tell.
SNT.87701.9674	For a Web 2.User like myself, I was most fascinated by Fixya, a site that, like Wikipedia, exists on the free work of people with knowledge.
SNT.87701.9675	Fixya is a tech support site where people who are having problems with equipment ask a question and it is answered by registered "experts."
SNT.87701.9676	These experts are the equivalent of Wikipedia's editors: they are self-ordained purveyors of solutions.
SNT.87701.9677	But instead of solving a mystery of knowledge a reader has in their head, these experts solve a problem related to something you have bought and do not understand.
SNT.87701.9678	From baby cribs to cellular phones, over 500,000 products are "supported" on Fixya's website.
SNT.87701.9679	The Fixya business model relies upon the good will of its experts to want to help other people through the ever-expanding world of consumer appliances.
SNT.87701.9680	But it is different from Wikipedia in two important ways.
SNT.87701.9681	The altruistic exchange of information is somewhat dampened by the knowledge that somebody, somewhere, is profiting from whatever you give.
SNT.87701.9682	Second, with Wikipedia it is very easy for a person to type in a few sentences about a subject on an article about the Toshiba Satellite laptop, but to answer technical problems a person is experiencing seems like a different realm.
SNT.87701.9683	"People really want to help other people," said the presenter, who marveled at the community that has already developed on Fixya.
SNT.87701.9684-1	"Another difference from Wikipedia is that we have a premium content version of the site."
SNT.87701.9684-2	Their premium site is where they envision making their money.
SNT.87701.9685	Customers with a problem will assign a dollar amount based upon how badly they need an answer to a question, and the expert-editors of Fixya will share in the payment for the resolved issue.
SNT.87701.9686	Whereas Wikipedia editors are judged by how they are perceived in the Wiki community, the amount of barnstars they receive and by the value of their contributions, Fixya's customers rate its experts based upon the usefulness of their advice.
SNT.87701.9687	The site is currently working on offering extended warranties with some manufacturers, although it was not clear how that would work on a site that functioned on the work of any expert.
SNT.87701.9688	Another collaborative effort product presented to us was YouFig, which is software designed to allow a group of people to collaborate on work product.
SNT.87701.9689	This is not a new idea, although may web-based products have generally fallen flat.
SNT.87701.9690	The idea is that people who are working on a multi-media project can combine efforts to create a final product.
SNT.87701.9691	They envision their initial market to be academia, but one could see the product stretching to fields such as law, where large litigation projects with high-level of collaboration on both document creation and media presentation; in business, where software aimed at product development has generally not lived up to its promises; and in the science and engineering fields, where multi-media collaboration is quickly becoming not only the norm, but a necessity.
SNT.87701.9692	For the popular consumer market, Superna, whose offices hosted our meeting, demonstrated their cost-saving vision for the Smart Home (SH).
SNT.87701.9693	Current SH systems require a large, expensive server in order to coordinate all the electronic appliances in today's air-conditioned, lit and entertainment-saturated house.
SNT.87701.9694	Such coordinating servers can cost upwards of US$5,000, whereas Superna's software can turn a US$1,000 hand-held tablet PC into household remote control.
SNT.87701.9695	There were a few start-ups where Vardi's fatherly mentoring seemed more at play than long-term practical business modeling.
SNT.87701.9696	In the hot market of WiFi products, WeFi is software that will allow groups of users, such as friends, share knowledge about the location of free Internet WiFi access, and also provide codes and keys for certain hot spots, with access provided only to the trusted users within a group.
SNT.87701.9697	The mock-up that was shown to us had a Google Maps-esque city block that had green points to the known hot spots that are available either for free (such as those owned by good Samaritans who do not secure their WiFi access) or for pay, with access information provided for that location.
SNT.87701.9698	I saw two long-term problems: first, WiMAX, which is able to provide Internet access to people for miles within its range.
SNT.87701.9699	There is already discussion all over the Internet as to whether this technology will eventually make WiFi obsolete, negating the need to find "hot spots" for a group of friends.
SNT.87701.9700-1	The second problem is if good Samaritans are more easily located, instead of just happened-upon, how many will keep their WiFi access free?
SNT.87701.9700-2	 It has already become more difficult to find people willing to contribute to free Internet.
SNT.87701.9701	Even in Tel Aviv, and elsewhere, I have come across several secure wireless users who named their network "Fuck Off" in an in-your-face message to freeloaders.
SNT.87701.9702	Another child of Vardi's that the Brookings Institution might say was over-praised for self-esteem but lacking real accomplishment is AtlasCT, although reportedly Nokia offered to pay US$8.1 million for the software, which they turned down.
SNT.87701.9703	Although one can see an e-classroom in architecture employing such software to allow students to take a walking tour through Rome, its desirability may be limited.
SNT.87701.9704	Whether Vardi is a smart parent for his encouragement, or in fact propping up laggards, is something only time will tell him as he attempts to bring these products of his children to market.
SNT.87701.9705	The look of awe that came across each company's representative whenever he entered the room provided the answer to the question of Who's your daddy?

SNT.48681.9726	India's nominee for the post of Secretary-General of the United Nations, Shashi Tharoor has revealed a four-point plan to tackle the problems the international body is facing.
SNT.48681.9727	He said that the biggest hurdle faced by the UN is that it has to deal with a large number of issues at the same time.
SNT.48681.9728	The United Nations with its "impressive achievements" and "haunting failures" has changed but needs to change further, he said in an article in Newsweek International.
SNT.48681.9729	Tharoor's proposal is concentrated on four areas- making democracy a priority; bolstering the ranks (of the United Nations); prioritising and streamlining; and healing wounds.
SNT.48681.9730	He talked about the crisis in the Middle East, and the nuclear standoff between the U.N and countries like North Korea and Iran, referring to them as "obvious and trying".
SNT.48681.9731	He also pointed out "problems without passports" such as climate change, narcotics smuggling and human rights violations.
SNT.48681.9732	Tharoor, a leading candidate to succeed Kofi Annan, said that strengthening the capacities of both the UN and its member-states was the best way to deal with these problems.
SNT.48681.9733	Tharoor stated that further efforts were needed to promote democracy and good governance the world over.
SNT.48681.9734	"We now have a Democracy Fund to help us do that, financed not just by the rich West but by countries like India," he said.
SNT.48681.9735	He also pointed out that the UN should try and stand up more for human rights by making sure the Human Rights Council did its job more effectively than the "over-politicised" Human Rights Commission it replaced.
SNT.48681.9736	He said the UN should support the efforts bodies like NATO and the EU were making in their peacekeeping.
SNT.48681.9737	Tharoor also spoke about the conflict in Iraq, saying "And where the task, like enforcing peace in Iraq, is clearly beyond us (the UN), we should let wars be fought by warriors, not peacekeepers,"
SNT.48681.9738-1	In reference to "healing wounds", he pointed out the danger of the Cold War divisions being replaced by a North-South divide at the UN.
SNT.48681.9738-2	"The new secretary-general must urgently combat this."
SNT.48681.9739	"I would focus on building issue-based coalitions to deal with specific practical problems (things like management inefficiencies, procurement policies, information technology, outsourcing) that have little to do with ideological politics," he said.
SNT.48681.9740	Tharoor is currently the UN's Under Secretary-General for Communications and Public Information.
SNT.48681.9741	He and South Korean Foreign Minister Ban Ki Moon are considered frontrunners in the race to succeed Annan, whose term ends at the end of the year.
SNT.48681.9742	Thailand's Deputy Prime Minister Surakiart Sathirathai and former UN disarmament chief Jayantha Dhanapala from Sri Lanka are also official candidates for the top UN job.
SNT.5272.9743	An analysis of melatonin studies has upheld the controversial supplement's effectiveness as a sleep aid.
SNT.5272.9744	The analysis, which included 17 peer-reviewed scientific papers, was aimed at determining whether supplements of the hormone can improve sleep among insomniacs, older adults and others.
SNT.5272.9745	"A meta-analysis essentially tells 'yes' or 'no'—that a treatment does or does not have a significant effect," says Richard Wurtman of MIT, the study's principal investigator.
SNT.5272.9746	"When a meta-analysis says 'yes,' there should no longer be any controversy about whether the treatment works."
SNT.5272.9747	Previous studies by Wurtman and colleagues showed that small doses of melatonin, about 0.3 milligrams, are necessary for restful effects.
SNT.5272.9748	The researchers found, however, that commercially available melatonin pills can contain 10 times the effective amount.
SNT.5272.9749	At that dose, says Wurtman, the hormone's effects end after a few days because melatonin receptors in the brain become unresponsive when exposed to too much of the hormone.
SNT.5272.9750	Such inadvertent overdosing, say the researchers, has contributed to controversy over melatonin's efficacy.
SNT.5272.9751	But the new meta-analysis shows that melatonin does indeed have positive effects on sleep—even though some of the analyzed studies also involved high doses of the hormone.
SNT.5272.9752	The research is reported in the journal Sleep Medicine Reviews.

SNT.34317.9767	Ricin is one of the most deadly poisons in the world and can exist in the form of a pellet, mist, or powder.
SNT.34317.9768	Some symptoms of exposure can include vomiting and dehydration, sweating, nausea, fever, cough and difficulty of breathing.
SNT.34317.9769	An earlier report by the Associated Press had said tests had found the substance might be ricin.
SNT.34317.9770	Such tests are designed to error on the side of caution, thus ensuring that possible poisoning victims receive treatment in time.

SNT.140446.9831	Parties to a lawsuit against Amazon.com agreed September 25 to a proposed settlement resolving claims that Amazon unlawfully deleted content from users' Kindle reading devices.
SNT.140446.9832	Justin Gawronski, a Michigan high school senior, and Antoine Bruguier, a California engineer, had sued on July 30, after Amazon deleted George Orwell's Nineteen Eighty-Four from their Kindles.
SNT.140446.9833	Gawronski also said his digital notes lost value because they were no longer associated with the relevant text.
SNT.140446.9834	The plaintiffs argued that Amazon had breached its terms of service and violated the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act and Washington Consumer Protection Act.
SNT.140446.9835	Amazon had first claimed it was forced to delete the books when it learned it did not have the right to sell them.
SNT.140446.9836	However, it apologized on July 23 and on September 7 offered affected customers either US$30 or a copy of the deleted book.
SNT.140446.9837	The proposed settlement includes a commitment that Amazon will only delete e-books remotely under four circumstances: the user consents, the user fails to pay or gets a refund, the government mandates it, or the deletion is necessary to "protect" the consumer, device, or network.
SNT.140446.9838	Amazon would also pay KamberEdelson, the plaintiffs' firm, US$150,000 in legal fees, with the proviso that it go to charity.
SNT.140446.9839	Michael Aschenbrener, an attorney at KamberEdelson, described the agreement as a "great settlement" that "provides protection for Kindle users and provides confidence to them that the books, newspapers and magazines they purchase will not be subject to remote deletion by Amazon."
SNT.140446.9840	"It sends a message to digital media purveyors of all kinds that sellers really need to respect users' rights to that content."
SNT.783.9841	Hassan Rowhani, head of the Supreme National Security Council for Iran, announced Monday that the country would temporarily suspend conversion of uranium as of November 22.
SNT.783.9842	"Iran is planning to suspend uranium conversion activities from November 22," Rowhani said during a news conference.
SNT.783.9843	Uranium is a chemical element which can be used in nuclear weapons and nuclear power plants.
SNT.783.9844	The process of conversion modifies the uranium oxides into uranium hexafluoride.
SNT.783.9845	The purpose of such a conversion process is usually an intermediate step in the production of nuclear fuel.
SNT.783.9846	Uranium hexafluoride cannot itself be used in a nuclear weapon, but can be enriched into weapons-grade uranium, or it can be converted into plutonium in a nuclear reactor.
SNT.783.9847	Iran has claimed to be using its nuclear program for only peaceful nuclear energy, rather than for nuclear weapons, but there are concerns in the European Union and the USA as to whether they are being truthful.

SNT.44365.9886	Asteroid 2004 XP14, a half-mile wide chunk of hard rock travelling at 40 000 miles an hour, will miss the Earth by a few hundred thousand miles, Monday.
SNT.44365.9887	Dr David Asher from the Armagh Observatory in Northern Ireland said if the rock, discovered in 2004, were to hit the Earth the result would be devastating.
SNT.44365.9888	"It would probably be big enough to wipe out a small country," he said.
SNT.44365.9889	Amateur astronomers with 6-inch telescopes would be able to follow the speeding space debris in Europe and North America at its closest approach to the planet at 0425 UTC.
SNT.44365.9890	At this time it would be at a safe distance of 268,624 miles from Earth - closer to the Earth than the Moon would be at its farthest extent in its orbit.
SNT.44365.9891	2004 XP14 is named as a Potentially Hazardous Asteroid (PHA), along with 782 known others by Astronomers at the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory at Harvard.
SNT.44365.9892	Zipping about in the solar system no PHAs have yet been found on direct collision course with the Earth.
SNT.44365.9893	Still, "For something of this size to come this close is unusual," said Don Yeomans, the head of NASA's Near Earth Object Program.
SNT.44365.9894	An expert at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California said it was the closest approach by such a massive object for over 80 years - since 1925.
SNT.44365.9895	Before 2004 XP14's exact orbital path around the sun was known with more precision, there were concerns it would hit the Earth.
SNT.44365.9896	In the near future Jon Giorgini said such cosmic uncertainty would be much less and the public less alarmed.
SNT.44365.9897	"In the next 20 to 30 years, we'll have a complete catalog of hazardous objects," Giorgini said.
SNT.44365.9898	Edward Lu and Stanley Love, of Johnson Space Centre, Houston, also have allayed fears about a collision.
SNT.44365.9899	In a 2005 article in Nature they theorised a "gravity tractor" could move any known threat within a year.

SNT.11106.9901	According to Robert Burns of the Associated Press, U.S. military officials acknowledged that, "a Muslim holy book was splashed with urine," and "a detainee's Quran was deliberately kicked and another's was stepped on."
SNT.11106.9902	The US government first denied a specific report that the Qu'ran had been flushed down a toilet at the prison facility, but on Friday agreed that similar allegations were indeed true.
SNT.11106.9903	On May 16, Newsweek magazine apologized to the victims of deadly riots that ensued due to a Newsweek article stating that U.S. officials defiled the Qur'an.
SNT.11106.9904	White House Press Secretary Scott McClellan criticized Newsweek's initial response to the incident, saying it was "puzzling."
SNT.11106.9905	Later that day, Newsweek retracted the story, which the White House said was a "good first step".

SNT.11106.9907	Pentagon spokesman Bryan Whitman, acknowledged that allegations were made on "rare occasions" but were uncorroborated.
SNT.11106.9908	Simon Schorno, a Red Cross spokesman, disputed the Pentagon's denial saying, "All information we received were corroborated allegations."
SNT.11106.9909	Scott McClellan explained in a press conference that the White House is not trying to tell Newsweek what to print.
SNT.11106.9910	McClellan said, "Look, this report caused serious damage to the image of the United States abroad."
SNT.11106.9911	"We appreciate the step that they took by retracting the story."
SNT.11106.9912	"Now we would encourage them to move forward and do all that they can to help repair the damage that has been done by this report."
SNT.11106.9913	"But, no, you're absolutely right, it's not my position to get into telling people what they can and cannot report."
SNT.11106.9914	On May 25, Amnesty International called for the shutdown on Guantanamo Bay due to numerous human rights violations, saying "The 'war on terror' appeared more effective in eroding international human rights principles than in countering international 'terrorism'."
SNT.11106.9915	Amnesty International's view was shared by both the International Red Cross (IRC) and the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU).
SNT.11106.9916	The IRC has said it reported to the U.S. government detainee's reports of desecration of the Qur'an.
SNT.11106.9917	In the foreword of the report, written by Amnesty International Secretary General Irene Khan, Guantanamo was compared to a Soviet-era gulag in that it is "entrenching the practice of arbitrary and indefinite detention in violation of international law".
SNT.11106.9918	White House spokesman Scott McClellan responded saying the report's allegations were "ridiculous and unsupported by the facts."
SNT.11106.9919	"The United States is leading the way when it comes to protecting human rights and promoting human dignity."
SNT.11106.9920	"We have liberated 50 million people in Iraq and Afghanistan."
SNT.11106.9921	"We have worked to advance freedom and democracy in the world so that people are governed under a rule of law and that there are... protections in place for minority rights, that women's rights are advanced so that women can fully participate in societies where now they cannot", as well as supporting the fight against AIDS in Africa.
SNT.11106.9922	About the allegations of abuse at Guantanamo, which McClellan has previously called isolated incidents, he said, "We hold people accountable when there is abuse."
SNT.11106.9923	"We take steps to prevent it from happening again, and we do so in a very public way for the world to see that we lead by example, and that we do have values that we hold very dearly and believe in."
SNT.11106.9924	On May 31, U.S. President George W. Bush dismissed the human rights report as "absurd" for its harsh criticism of U.S. treatment of terrorist suspects at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, saying the allegations were made by prisoners "who hate America."
SNT.11106.9925	"The United States is a country that promotes freedom around the world," Bush said of the Amnesty International report.
SNT.11106.9926	William F. Schulz, executive director of Amnesty International USA, defended the report, saying, "What is 'absurd' is President Bush's attempt to deny the deliberate policies of his administration."
SNT.11106.9928	Irene Khan also responded saying, "The administration's response has been that our report is absurd, that our allegations have no basis, and our answer is very simple: if that is so, open up these detention centres, allow us and others to visit them."
SNT.11106.9929	And, on Friday, the U.S. military released the results of their investigation and confirmed that in 5 separate incidents, American guards at the Guantánamo Bay prison "mishandled" the Islamic holy book.
SNT.11106.9930	However, they stress that guards were usually "respectful" of the Qur'an.
SNT.11106.9931	One incident involved splashing a Koran with urine by urinating near an air vent while others involved kicking, stepping on and writing in Qur'ans.

SNT.11106.9933	He said that the inquiry did not find any evidence supporting this particular allegation.
SNT.11106.9934	"The inquiry found no credible evidence that a member of the Joint Task Force at Guantanamo Bay ever flushed a Qur'an down a toilet."

SNT.132079.9986	The high-profile game was nationally televised on the ESPN network.

SNT.7128.10020	According to a page at the Gmail Help Center, while not all accounts currently have the formatting features added, "over the next several weeks, we are introducing rich formatting to all of our users."
SNT.7128.10021	The increase in storage is announced on the main Gmail page with a JavaScript counter that increases the quoted available storage in relation to the current date.
SNT.7128.10022	For example, on April 1 at 5 a.m. UTC the site announced 1025 MB available, 30 hours later — 2050 MB, and a week later it should announce a total of 2075 MB.
SNT.7128.10023	Unless Google adjusts the code behind the counter, the text will read "Over 2075" after April 9.
SNT.7128.10024	Code analysis performed by Wikinews writer Pingswept, and while believed to be correct, is original reporting and has not been verified by any external source.

SNT.197759.10084	A recent scientific review, involving more than 300,000 people across several previous studies, has revealed that inadequate social networking and frequent isolation can have negative effects on a person's health equal to that caused by smoking and alcohol abuse.
SNT.197759.10085	It was found that those who experience sufficient social interactions were 50 per cent more likely to be alive when re-examined eight years later than those who were more socially isolated.
SNT.197759.10086	The scientists on the project ranked having low-quality relationships with friends and family as equivalent to frequent substance abuse (that is to say, 15 cigarettes a day or heavy alcohol consumption) but worse for a person's health than not participating in exercise and being obese.
SNT.197759.10087	Timothy Smith, project leader from Brigham Young University (BYU), in Utah, claims that "the importance of having a network of friends and good family relationships is comparable to quitting smoking and exceeds many risk factors of mortality such as obesity, physical inactivity."
SNT.197759.10088	Related studies have shown that quality relationships stimulate mental and physical health.
SNT.197759.10089	Smith went onto suggest that General Practitioners should also examine a patient's social network to promote good health.
SNT.197759.10090	"Physicians, health professionals, educators and the public media take risk factors such as smoking, diet and exercise seriously."
SNT.197759.10091	"The data presented here make a compelling case for social relationship factors to be added to that list," he continued.

SNT.4162.10108	A United Nations report has shown that sports footwear companies are making progress towards ending the use of sweatshops and are implementing more worker-friendly codes of practice than clothing companies and retailers.
SNT.4162.10109	The study, published by the International Labour Organisation, suggests that consumer pressure is behind the changes.
SNT.4162.10110	As a result of consumer's concerns, footwear companies have been diverting financial and human resources towards developing and implementing better codes of conduct for suppliers.
SNT.4162.10111	Large teams have been established within companies to work toward the goal of better conditions for factory workers.
SNT.4162.10112	The study, based upon interviews with hundreds of managers, activists, government officials, factory workers and worker representatives and visits to companies all over the world, goes on to suggest that workers should be given more powers to oversee conditions in their places of work.
SNT.4162.10113	Clothing companies have been failing to make such good progress due the large number of constantly-changing suppliers they use, with the ILO study describing progress as "spotty."
SNT.4162.10114	A major retailer may have a supply base of over 5,000 different companies, making it more difficult to establish stronger, more effective links with supply companies.
SNT.4162.10115	They have also assigned less manpower to the task of compliance with codes of practice.
SNT.4162.10116	In some areas of the retail industry, there has been almost no compliance with codes of practice.
SNT.253499.10117	India's 2011 census reports that its population has increased by 181 million in the span of one decade, a figure 17.6 percent greater than 2001.
SNT.253499.10118	The census results, publicised today, show the population of India now stands at 1.21 billion.
SNT.253499.10119	C. Chandramauli, the commissioner of the census, said India's population represents "over 17 percent of the world population, [while] India is 2.4 percent of the world’s surface area."
SNT.253499.10120	According to BBC News Online, the current population of the country is in excess of the populations of Pakistan, Indonesia, Bangladesh, Brazil and the United States put together.
SNT.253499.10121	While India's population has increased by more than 17 percent since the 2001 census, this growth rate is the lowest since India achieved independence in 1947.
SNT.253499.10122	Between 1991 and 2011, the population growth rate has steadily decreased.
SNT.253499.10123	Approximately 25 percent of Indians over the age of seven were found to be illiterate in the 2011 census, a decrease of 10 percent from the census held ten years ago.
SNT.253499.10124	The increase in literate females is greater than that of males, the new census reports.
SNT.253499.10125	The findings have suggested a preference of male over female children.
SNT.253499.10126	For every one thousand boys below the age of seven, there were 914 girls, a decrease from the 2001 census, which reported 927 female for every one thousand male children.
SNT.253499.10127	"This is the lowest ever in the demographic history of the country," he said, and noted "[t]he last census in 2001 had warned us about this, the tendency has worsened."
SNT.253499.10128	This pattern continues although the Indian government has prohibited hospitals from disclosing the gender of an unborn child.
SNT.253499.10129	According to The Washington Post, parents in much of India abort female fetuses and young female children for financial reasons.
SNT.253499.10130	Incidents like this occur more frequently in the better educated and the richer Indian states, including Punjab and Gujarat.
SNT.253499.10131	Pillai, the home secretary, has claimed that "[w]hatever policy measures we have been following in the last 40 years will need a complete review now."
SNT.253499.10132	There are now 940 female adults for every one thousand men, in contrast to 2001, when there were 933 women per thousand males.
SNT.253499.10133	However, in the capital, Delhi, only 866 females were counted for every one thousand males.
SNT.253499.10134	Throughout the states of India, the population growth rate varies significantly.
SNT.253499.10135	This results in an inequality in the allocation of funds and is a problem, experts say.
SNT.253499.10136	According to Management Institute of Population and Development consultant Devendra Kothari: "Our federal government sends funds to the states according to their population."
SNT.253499.10137	"This means that the states that have worked harder to reduce their population growth get less money from New Delhi".
SNT.253499.10138	Kothari continued: "The states with lesser population send fewer members to the Indian parliament."
SNT.253499.10139	Over the course of the approaching year, concluding census figures will be publicised, according to officials.

SNT.97851.10152	Launch, from area 200/39 at the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan took place on schedule, and the satellite was successfully placed into an intermediate transfer orbit.
SNT.97851.10153	Operations to place the satellite into its final Geosynchronous orbit, through further burns of the Briz-M upper stage, should have been completed, however no official announcement has yet been made.
SNT.97851.10154	This is the third orbital launch of 2008, and the first to be conducted by Russia.
SNT.97851.10155	The satellite will provide C, L and Ku-band communication services.
SNT.97851.10156	It has a mass of 2600kg, and an expected orbital lifetime of 12 years.
SNT.97851.10157	It was constructed by NPO PM and Thales Alenia Space, and will be operated by the Russian Space Communication Company, and RKA.
SNT.97851.10158	It will be placed in a geosynchronous orbit, about 36,000 kilometres above the Earth, at a longitude of 95.5°E.
SNT.97851.10159	It will replace the AM-11 satellite, which malfunctioned in 2006.

SNT.86992.10221	And Studs and Leather is basically Heaven's on Fire (KISS song) meets Balls To The Wall (Accept song).

SNT.239066.10223	For four years, Marius "Mario" Nejloveanu and father Bogdan trafficked women into and around the UK, forcing their victims into prostitution.
SNT.239066.10224	Nejloveanu, 23, was also convicted of a series of rapes and headed the business with guidance from his 51-year-old father.
SNT.239066.10225	Five women were lured from Romania, the youngest in her teens, the oldest 27, with promises of work and romance with Marius.
SNT.239066.10226	Originally founding a brothel in their hometown of Birmingham, the pair met resistance from local rival pimps and relocated the women to Manchester.
SNT.239066.10227	There, they worked six or seven days each week, sleeping in brothels and having sex with eight-to-ten men each night against their will.
SNT.239066.10228	Typical fees from customers were around £40 but some may have paid as low as £10.
SNT.239066.10229	Around half of each fee went to the Nejloveanus and half to the brothel.
SNT.239066.10230	Police launched raids, rescuing the women after receiving a tip-off.
SNT.239066.10231	Bogdan was accused by Rachel Smyth, prosecuting, of giving advice and assistance to Marius; Smyth opened the trial last year telling Manchester Crown Court "[h]aving heard the evidence you [the jury] may conclude that the son, Marius, learnt this trade from his father and that this was a family business."
SNT.239066.10232	The woman were "threatened, beaten and degraded" and faced "extreme sexual violence and humiliation," the court heard.
SNT.239066.10233	Bogdan was convicted of seven offences - three counts of trafficking within the UK for sexual exploitation, three counts of trafficking into the UK for sexual exploitation and controlling prostitution for gain.
SNT.239066.10234	Marius was found guilty of five counts of trafficking women into the UK for sexual exploitation, one count of conspiracy to traffic a woman into the UK for sexual exploitation, two counts of trafficking women within the UK for sexual exploitation, one count of trafficking a woman out of the UK for sexual exploitation, four counts of rape, five counts of assault, two counts of causing a woman to engage in sexual activity without consent, five counts of controlling prostitution for gain, and one count of witness intimidation to total 27 offences.
SNT.239066.10235	The duo join two others who admitted lesser roles in the scheme.
SNT.239066.10236	Costel Maruntelu, 24, was previously jailed for five years and six months for sex trafficking crimes.
SNT.239066.10237	Juanita "Toni" Huntingdon, 41, helped set up the Birmingham brothel and acted as a receptionist at both sites and entered guilty pleas to five counts of controlling prostitution for gain.

SNT.66765.10262	The deal is reported to be worth CAD2.2 billion in an all-cash transaction.
SNT.66765.10263	It manages 1,110 square kilometres of oil sands leases located in northern Alberta.
SNT.66765.10264	It is estimated that the NOASC oil sands hold approximately 2.2 billion barrels of oil reserves.
SNT.66765.10265	The company is planning to develop an extraction project and an upgrading facility.
SNT.66765.10266	When the project is completed, NAOSC expects it to produce over 200,000 barrels of bitumen per day.
SNT.66765.10267	The upgrading facility would then process the bitumen into synthetic crude oil.
SNT.66765.10268	The NAOSC board of directors has approved the bid from Statoil unanimously, and has recommended that its shareholders accept the offer.
SNT.66765.10269	Paramount announced Friday that it had entered into a lock-up agreement with Statoil, which calls for Paramount to sell its 30.9% interest in NAOSC to Statoil ASA for a cash deal worth approximately $682 million.
SNT.66765.10270	"We are impressed by the performance and competence held by the employees in NAOSC,” said Helge Lund, chief executive of Statoil.
SNT.66765.10271	“Combined with Statoil’s experience and commitment to prudent operations, we are well-positioned to develop the resources in a sustainable manner, creating value for Statoil and its shareholders."
SNT.66765.10272	Statoil suggests that the development plans for the NAOSC oil sands includes an application of Steam Assisted Gravity Drainage (SAGD) technology, which, according to the company, leaves a smaller environmental footprint than strip mining.
SNT.66765.10273	Statoil admits, however, that heavy oil production, such as is required in the oil sands, is "energy intensive and challenging in an environmental perspective."
SNT.66765.10274	The company said it intends to capture the carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions from its oil sands production and store it underground.
SNT.66765.10275	Under new environmental regulations announced Thursday by Canadian Environment Minister John Baird, companies that can't meet new intensity targets for CO2 emission reductions will be able to purchase offset credits or contribute to a technology fund, at an initial cost of $15 per tonne of emissions.
SNT.66765.10276	New plants would have three years before they were obligated to begin reducing their emissions.
SNT.66765.10277	However, Julia Langer, director of the World Wildlife Fund's global threats program, told the Globe and Mail that the initial exemptions for new plants and the technology fund contributions would undermine the government's new environmental plan.
SNT.66765.10278	"This is a regulatory plan that is geared to business as usual for the tar sands sector," said Langer.
SNT.66765.10279	The Statoil-NAOSC transaction is expected to close by the end of the second quarter of 2007.

SNT.41398.10344	According to Clean Up Australia plastic bags can take between 20 and 1000 years to break down.
SNT.41398.10345	Despite their recyclable nature, an estimated 6.67 billion or 36,700 tonnes of plastic bags are disposed of in landfill sites throughout Australia each year.
