SNT.333252.10359	On Friday, the United States Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) expanded its long-standing definition of rape to include men, and the rape of any gender by lack of consent — as opposed to physical coercion.
SNT.333252.10360	The revised definition should ensure all rapes are recorded in crime statistics.
SNT.333252.10361	Valerie Jarrett, a White House adviser, said it was a "very, very important step."
SNT.333252.10362	The new definition defines rape as: "The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim."
SNT.333252.10363	Describing the changes to crime reporting as "long overdue", United States Attorney General Eric Holder said the revised definition of rape will, "help ensure justice for those whose lives have been devastated by sexual violence and reflect the Department of Justice's commitment to standing with rape victims".
SNT.333252.10364	The prior definition of rape — "the carnal knowledge of a female, forcibly and against her will" — was set by the FBI in 1927.
SNT.333252.10365	In contrast, the revised definition drops the requirement that there be physical resistance, thus including crimes where the victim is unable to give consent because they are under the influence of alcohol or drugs, or due to their age.
SNT.333252.10366	The changes are primarily a revision to the Uniform Crime Reports system (UCR), and are not expected to impact prior cases or current prosecutions.
SNT.333252.10367	Introducing no changes to current State or Federal law, the FBI expects the revised definition of rape will see victim numbers "more accurately reflected in national crime statistics".
SNT.333252.10368	Close to the revised rape definition is a 2010 study by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), which included male rape and non-consensual sex; their figures indicate that, at some point in their lives, about 20% of women and 1.5% of men in the United States have been raped.
SNT.333252.10369	Writing for Significance magazine, Stephanie Kovalchik says this report shows the US "is experiencing an epidemic of sexual violence."
SNT.333252.10370	Comparing with other CDC reports, she highlights "that [the] number of American women who have been raped is greater than the number who are current smokers."
SNT.333252.10371	Vice President Joe Biden, with a history of advocating improved rape legislation, described the changes as "a victory for women and men across the country whose suffering has gone unaccounted for over 80 years."
SNT.333252.10372	Whilst still in the Senate, Biden led efforts to implement legislative change — including authoring the Violence Against Women Act.

SNT.197937.10517	It was contained and suppressed by mid-afternoon, but the other two fires ignited while firefighters were battling the first.
SNT.197937.10518	The second fire, the "Briggs Fire", began shortly after 2:00 pm near 8334 Soledad Canyon Road and Briggs Road, south of the freeway.
SNT.197937.10519	It burned 500 acres south of the 14 Freeway, but the Los Angeles County Fire Department (LACFD) now has it contained, and firefighters are hopeful that it will burn itself out as it edges closer to the 160,577-acre burn area of last year's Station Fire.
SNT.197937.10520	The third fire, the "Crown Fire", broke out at around the same time as the Briggs Fire on the northern side of the 14 Freeway near Acton.
SNT.197937.10521	The Crown fire has so far burned 13,000 acres and has been heading north into Leona Valley and Palmdale.
SNT.197937.10522	Over 800 firefighters are now tackling the Crown Fire on the ground, Boeing 747 and McDonnell Douglas DC-10 fixed-wing aircraft have taken to the skies to drop Phos-Chek slurry (a red powdery fire retardant that is a mixture of mostly water and fertilizer, and doesn't evaporate) on the fire, and modified Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk helicopters known as "Firehawks" are making water-drops.
SNT.197937.10523	As well as LACFD, firefighters from Los Angeles City Fire Department, California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection (Cal Fire) are also helping to battle the fire.
SNT.197937.10524	Weather conditions and topography have hindered their efforts, as temperatures rose to 98 degrees Fahrenheit today, with windspeeds of 25mph.
SNT.197937.10525	Tonight, the National Weather Service predicts winds will reach as high as 50mph.
SNT.197937.10526	The fire burned down a Los Angeles County Sheriff Department communications tower, forcing Lancaster and Palmdale-based deputies to set up mobile operations bases and coordinate their efforts using cell phones and computers.
SNT.197937.10527	Last night, the California Aqueduct acted as a barrier to the fire.
SNT.197937.10528	Residents of Leona Valley, Lake Elizabeth, Ritter Ranch, Rancho Vista, Ana Verde and Palmdale received Reverse 911 telephone calls last night alerting them of mandatory evacuations.
SNT.197937.10529	Many of the evacuation orders were lifted this morning as the spread of the fire decreased.
SNT.197937.10530	However, as winds picked up in the afternoon, fire embers were carried across the aqueduct and the fire is now heading towards a highly-populated area of Palmdale.
SNT.197937.10531	Residents who were allowed back into their homes were re-evacuated to Red Cross shelters set up in local schools and parks.

SNT.103003.10564	The United States Army has suspended its contract with a company that delivered old and corroding ammunition from China for use by Afghan army and police forces in a way that violated the contract terms.
SNT.103003.10565	The ammunition was supplied by the Miami-based AEY Inc., a company run by a 22-year old named Efrain Diveroli.
SNT.103003.10566	The nearly US$300 million contract stated that bullets were coming from Hungary, but were actually decades-old, damaged and corroded bullets from China.
SNT.103003.10567	Officials from the Army Legal Services Agency notified Diveroli, via a letter, that his company is suspended from future contracting with any U.S. government agency.
SNT.103003.10568	The letter came as part of an Army investigation since November regarding violation of the contract.
SNT.103003.10569	According to the New York Times, Diveroli signed papers back on November 25, 2007 certifying that 28 pallets of ammunition for Afghanistan had been manufactured by MFS 2000, a Hungarian company, according to a memo written by investigators.
SNT.103003.10570	AEY violated the contract by breaking two clauses, one stating that the ammunition could not be acquired directly or indirectly from the People’s Republic of China, which is a violation of American law.
SNT.103003.10571	The other clause specified that it must be packaged to comply with best commercial practices for international shipment.
SNT.103003.10572	According to the Times, says the ammunition arrived in decomposing cardboard boxes which contained ammunition dating as far back as 1966.
SNT.103003.10573	However, Army officials believe some ammunition even dates back further to 1962.
SNT.103003.10574	The Army had contracted with AEY in January 2007 to supply various types of nonstandard ammunition for use by the Afghan National Army and Afghan National Police, an Army official said on background.
SNT.103003.10575	The company was required to purchase the ammunition and deliver it to Kabul International Airport in Afghanistan.
SNT.103003.10576	AEY was recently awarded a delivery order amount of $48,717,553 on March 17, 2007 as part of the $298,004,398 contract.
SNT.103003.10577	Also according to the Times, when purchasing the ammunition, AEY worked with middlemen and a shell company which has been placed on federal list of entities suspected of illegal arms trafficking.
SNT.103003.10578	Also, the Times reported that, Diveroli was secretly recorded in conversation that suggested corruption on his company's purchase of 100 million aging rounds from Albania.
SNT.103003.10579	Bryan Whitman, The Pentagon's spokesperson told reporters that suspension of the contract was due to the violation of the origin of the ammunition and the packaging of the ammunition, not the safety and performance.
SNT.103003.10580	“Safety and performance has not apparently been a factor, according to our folks in Afghanistan."
SNT.103003.10581	”They have had no safety incidents reported and no reports of any ammunition that has malfunctioned associated with this particular contract,” Whitman told the press.
SNT.103003.10582	He also denied that the issue happened because the Army awarded the contract to the lowest bidder and that he was not aware of AEY's qualifications to fulfill the contract.
SNT.103003.10583	“As the United States government does business, they are obviously always trying to ensure they get the best value,” he said.
SNT.103003.10584	“But that does not mean that, in achieving the best value for the taxpayer, that we will accept something that is below standard for what it is we are purchasing, either.”
SNT.103003.10585	According to an Army official, the suspension of the contract will not have an impact on Afghanistan operations and other contractors are expressing interest into entering into a contract.
SNT.103003.10586	Michael Diveroli, Efrain's father, who originally founded AEY as a small printing business, said of his son's career choice to CBS' Miami affiliate, WFOR, "I would prefer he became a nice Jewish doctor or lawyer rather than an arms dealer."
SNT.103003.10587	"He doesn't always take my advice, I don't influence him."
SNT.103003.10588	"As a father of a boy genius he's hard to control."
SNT.103003.10589	Angelo Diveroli, Efrain's grandfather said the young man frequently accompanied him to gun shows when he was younger and became an expert at weapons.
SNT.103003.10590	A friend of Diveroli said to WFOR, "The government came here and checked him out and gave him the contract."
SNT.103003.10591	"How do you give someone, a 21 year old kid a contract like that?"
SNT.103003.10592	The United States Army Criminal Investigation Command is continuing their investigation, according to officials.

SNT.25080.10625	In the morning of 30 October 2005, Romania with other countries from Europe will switch to Official Winter Time.
SNT.25080.10626	Thus, 04:00 AM will become 03:00 AM and will be valid until 26 March 2006 when the Official Summer Time will be again used.
SNT.25080.10627	Following Romanian Government's Decision nb. 20 from 1997, Romania adopts Winter Time and Summer Time in the same day with the states of European Union and other countries part of this deal.
SNT.25080.10628	Official Winter Time is adopted in the last Sunday of October and the Summer Time in last Sunday of March.
SNT.25080.10629	Usually, the official time of a country is Winter Time.
SNT.25080.10630	Summer Time is a legal time adopted by some countries or territories during a part of a year.
SNT.25080.10631	Summer Time is usually one hour in front of Standard Official Time.
SNT.25080.10632	During summer months, the time is moved forward in order to use as much sunlight for human activities, as well as to save electric energy used for lighting.
SNT.25080.10633	Until 1939 this worked yearly from the first Sunday of April (in 1932: 22 May) 00:00 AM and the first Sunday of October 01:00 AM (local time).
SNT.25080.10634	From 1 April 1940 00:00 AM and 2 November 1942 03:00 AM, Summer Time was permanent in Romania.
SNT.25080.10635	From 1943 the Summer Time was suspended and Romania used just Official Time (Winter Time).

SNT.129290.10637	The fish bit six bathers, two of whom required emergency medical treatment for bite wounds up to 10 centimeters (3.9 in) long.
SNT.129290.10638	Fish warden Fabio Croci said, "It is quite unusual for Zanders to bite humans".
SNT.129290.10639	It is suspected the fish's aggression could have been a result of a hormonal imbalance.
SNT.129290.10640	After attempts to capture the Zander with a net failed, police divers resorted to harpooning it.
SNT.129290.10641	Meat from the fish was later served to tourists around the lake.

SNT.60403.10680	Recent tests have shown that an inexpensive drug may be able to kill cancer cells in humans.
SNT.60403.10681	Dichloroacetate, a drug generally used to treat rare metabolic disorders, has shown the potential to assist in the treatment of brain, lung, and breast cancers, researchers at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Canada say.
SNT.60403.10682	Dr. Evangelos Michelakis of the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Canada found that that DCA causes tumor regressions in animals with human cancers.
SNT.60403.10683	Testing showed that DCA attacked cancer cells but did not attack healthy cells.
SNT.60403.10684	The researchers and the Alberta Cancer Board and Capital Health do not advise the use of DCA to treat cancer yet, as clinical trials for the drugs use to treat cancer have not been performed yet.
SNT.60403.10685	Unlike healthy cells, cancerous cells do not convert food molecules into energy in the mitochondria.
SNT.60403.10686	Instead, they rely on a process known as glycolysis, which takes place in the main body of the cell, while the mitochondria are "shut down", researchers believe possibly due to the lack of oxygen supply to cells in the middle of a tumor.
SNT.60403.10687	This means that another key function of the mitochondria - to activate an abnormal cell's self-destruct mechanism, apoptosis - is also blocked.
SNT.60403.10688	When Dichloroacetate (DCA) enters a cancer cell, it restarts the mitochondria which in turn activate apoptosis, and the cancerous cell destroys itself.
SNT.60403.10689	DCA is known to be relatively safe, although pain, numbness and gait disturbances may occur.
SNT.60403.10690	The drug is also expected to be cheaper to manufacture than other drugs since there is no patent for it.

SNT.89134.10696	The explosion took place in Ja-Ela, a town some 12 miles north of Colombo.

SNT.127534.10698	Its mission is to bring the key donors of aid and relief together with the Israeli and Palestinian governments to address the current state of affairs between the two countries.
SNT.127534.10699	The AHLC keeps track on how donor countries interact with the Palestinian authorities and how the support they provide is handled.
SNT.127534.10700	Early on the first day, Norwegian Foreign Minister Jonas Gahr Støre and Palestinian Prime minister Salam Fayyad both expressed optimism and hope for the Palestinian situation.
SNT.127534.10701	Minister Støre underlined the importance of continuing aid, but stated that he understood that most countries still had problems because of the world economic crisis.
SNT.127534.10702	As for the unstable political situation in Palestine, Prime Minister Fayyad explained that "the political instability is also a reason why we need more aid."
SNT.127534.10703	During the second day, a press conference with Minister Støre clarified the motives of the donations saying, "It’s is important to stress that donors are not doing this as a humanitarian project."
SNT.127534.10704	Our donor aid is a political project aim[ed] at supporting and sustaining the Palestinian Authority, a key institution in what is supposed to become an independent Palestinian state.
SNT.127534.10705	Minister Støre continued, stating, "It’s very important to stress that without a political horizon what we do as donors becomes less meaningful."
SNT.127534.10706	"So the current states of affairs where the political horizon is unclear and where we don’t have political negotiations of the two states as previous commitments indicates and obligate the party’s."
SNT.127534.10707	"Donors start to change their stand and other agendas get the upper hand."
SNT.127534.10708	"So in 2009 at this present stage, donors have only delivered half the amount they had at this time last year."
SNT.127534.10709	"You can leave that up to the financial crisis, but at the big donor conferences in Paris December 2007, and Sharm el-Sheikh February 2009 there were pledges enough to carry this through."
SNT.127534.10710	On the question if the donor countries had offered to give any immediate financial relief, Minister Støre said "This has to be stressed, [this] has not been a pledging conference."
SNT.127534.10711	"This has not been a donor conference where governments have been invited to come and make new pledges, as I said if everybody lived by their Paris pledges in December 2007, which were three year pledges, we are exactly half way in that, we would have been more or less fine."
SNT.127534.10712	"But I think we have seen a forthcoming approach by some delegations, I will not name them or put a figure on it but I think it follows from what the prime minister and I have together have expressed here that there is an urgent need."
SNT.127534.10713	A new meeting has been scheduled for September in New York, New York in conjunction with the United Nations General Assembly.

SNT.119456.10715	They had an estimated value of five million GBP and impersonated the Classic Gold and Raquel brands of cigarette.

SNT.18220.10728	Lt. Peay said the posted speed limit on the road is 60 mph, but the advised speed is 40.
SNT.18220.10729	At least 17 people received minor injuries and the explosion left a 35 foot deep crater in the highway.
SNT.18220.10730	The driver was transported via helicopter to a hospital, where he was listed in fair condition, and was later released.
SNT.18220.10731	The co-driver Troy Lysfjord, 37, of Blackfoot, Idaho, was helped from the wreck by passers by and listed in fair condition at Utah Valley Regional Hospital in Provo.
SNT.18220.10732	The wreck site occurred on a major thoroughfare between Denver and Salt Lake City - about 60 miles south of Salt Lake City - was already under reconstruction by nightfall, as road crews began installing 10 inches of asphalt on the two lane road.
SNT.18220.10733	Utah Department of Transportation spokesman Tom Hudachko said officials hoped to have the road fully repaired by Friday afternoon, adding that, "When you take a look at that hole that was there 24 hours ago, I think it's amazing the progress that was made."
SNT.18220.10734	As of press time, the mouth of the canyon was reopened to traffic, while traffic at the accident site was impassible, and rerouted nearby.
SNT.18220.10735	The explosion consumed all but about 60 pounds of explosives, and loosened some boulders on the north side of the highway, damaged railroad tracks and some fiber optic lines buried along the roadway.

SNT.117064.10790	A study by the Ernst & Young Scottish ITEM Club has predicted that Scotland will enter the worst recession seen in the nation since 1980, but that the rest of the United Kingdom will fare worse.
SNT.117064.10791	Scottish GDP is expected to contract by 0.4% in 2009, compared to 1% for elsewhere in the UK.
SNT.117064.10792	The report expects this to account for 50,000 job losses in Scotland, with the worst level of unemployment since the 1990s - a jump from 74,000 to 124,000 out of work, or 4.4%.
SNT.117064.10793	Dougie Adams, author of the report, warns that if the financial crisis is worst than anticipated there could be a contraction of 1%, making 60,000 jobs lost.
SNT.117064.10794	Private services will fare worst, he says, with 20,000 jobs to go.
SNT.117064.10795	Next will be manufacturing, with 11,000 jobs lost, and 7,000 more will go in construction.
SNT.117064.10796	"The economy must face a future with a changed landscape for its previously buoyant banking sector," said Adams.
SNT.117064.10797	"These include policy actions at a global and UK level, including any fiscal measures announced in the pre-Budget report, and the fall in oil and commodity prices."
SNT.117064.10798	"The sharp decline in inflation that is in the pipeline will buoy disposable incomes and leaves an open door to further interest rate cuts."
SNT.117064.10799	"Finally, the UK will also benefit from the sharp fall in sterling that is unlikely to be frittered away by wage inflation."
SNT.117064.10800	"However, recovery critically depends on both the willingness of the banking system to extend credit and the readiness of businesses and consumers to use it."
SNT.117064.10801	In 2010, he predicts Scottish growth to recover by 1.5%, with the rest of the UK gaining only 1%.

SNT.110678.10863	The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) approved two new IEEE 1394 Firewire standards last week.
SNT.110678.10864	S1600 and S3200 — which enable data transmission rates up to 1.6 Gbps and 3.2 Gbps respectively — would make Firewire (Apple's name for the standard) theoretically four times faster than is currently possible.
SNT.110678.10865	According to IEEE, the new standards are based on IEEE 1394b (FireWire 800) Standard.
SNT.110678.10866	The new standard will allow peer-to-peer transfer without linking computers.
SNT.110678.10867	In addition, the S1600 and S3200 standards will continue supporting the S400 and S800 previous standards through backward compatibility.
SNT.110678.10868	"The new standard includes all of the amendments, enhancements and more than 100 errata which have been added to the base standard over the last 12 years," Les Baxter, chair of the working group which developed the standard, said in a press release cited in several sources.
SNT.110678.10869	"This update provides developers with a single document they can rely upon for all of their application needs."
SNT.110678.10870	Though not as common as the USB standard, Firewire serves a niche market, especially the aviation industry.
SNT.110678.10871	USB 3.0, the next generation of the competing USB standard, is due in 2010 with reported speeds of 4.8 Gbps.
SNT.8961.10872	The United States Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) says it finished interrogating the nearly 105 Iraqi scientists it held in its search for weapons of mass destruction (WMD).
SNT.8961.10873	In many cases their information was helpful, but in other cases the wrong people were detained, and were subjected to questioning by "inexperienced and uninformed" interrogators.
SNT.8961.10874	From an update to the Comprehensive Report of the Special Adviser to the DCI on Iraq's WMD, "As matters now stand, the WMD investigation has gone as far as feasible."
SNT.8961.10875	After more than 18 months, the WMD investigation and debriefing of the WMD-related detainees has been exhausted.
SNT.8961.10876	"As far as the WMD investigation is concerned, there is no further purpose in holding many of these detainees."
SNT.8961.10877	"These individuals have shown no reluctance to engage in further discussions should the need for questioning arise about past WMD programs."
SNT.8961.10878	Elsewhere, "Some may have other issues to account for, including Regime finance questions, but certainly some have been quite helpful toward the compilation of an accurate picture of the Regime's WMD efforts and intentions over the last three decades."
SNT.8961.10879	The comments were addenda and an accompanying note, supplemental to the original report, which was issued last autumn, and seen as the final report of the Iraq Survey Group (ISG).
SNT.8961.10880	They were added by Charles Duelfer, head of the ISG, and Special Adviser to the Director of Central Intelligence in Baghdad.
SNT.8961.10881	Deulfer emphasised that more information is likely to emerge naturally, over time, from people with differing viewpoints and interests.
SNT.8961.10882	And a backlog of documents recovered from the former regime remain to be examined.
SNT.8961.10883	A preference for reinforcement of short-term security on the part of the coalition forces over anti-proliferation efforts, fear of arrest and detention on the part of the Iraqi personnel, and other factors in the continuing conflict of the post-war environment, all impacted on the effort by the ISG.
SNT.8961.10884	The report confirms the expressed opinion of former UN weapons inspector, Scott Ritter, that Iraq had no significant WMDs.
SNT.8961.10885	"[T]here was not a single intelligence service in the world that said Iraq maintained massive stockpiles of weapons of mass destruction," Ritter said at the time.
SNT.8961.10886	Duelfer summary of the intelligence obtained, as understood by the ISG, includes, "[T]he risk of Iraqi WMD expertise of material advancing the WMD potential in other countries is attenuated by many factors and is presently small ..."
SNT.8961.10887	And, "So far, insurgent efforts to attain unconventional weapons have been limited and contained by coalition actions."
SNT.8961.10888	Also, "There continue to be reports of WMD in Iraq."
SNT.8961.10889	"ISG has found that such reports are usually scams or in misidentification of materials or activities."
SNT.8961.10890	"In a very limited number of cases they have related to old chemical munitions produced before 1990."
SNT.8961.10891	The new addenda included information on the Iraqi Military Industrial Commission, the "state-run military-industrial complex" which played a "central role in the evolution of all the Regime's weapons programs".

SNT.10309.10986	Microsoft, Dell, Hewlett Packard, Intel, Apple and Netgear are taking legal action against the CSIRO to have its U.S. patent broken.
SNT.10309.10987	In 1996, the CSIRO developed technology to allow computers to be networked together wirelessly.
SNT.10309.10988	The technology is now built in to most laptop computers and manufacturers currently pay the CSIRO a licence fee to use it.
SNT.10309.10989	According to CSIRO Chief Executive Dr Geoff Garrett, the system enables the speed of Wireless Local Area Network (WLAN) to be increased by a factor of five.
SNT.10309.10990	This isn't the first time that the CSIRO has been involved in legal action surrounding this patent: in February 2005, it commenced legal action in the United States against Buffalo Technology, a Japanese-owned company, which had ended negotiations with CSIRO about obtaining a licence.

SNT.10309.10992	It has come under increasing pressure following the Australian Government's cutting its funding in 2003, which has only been recently restored.

SNT.10309.10994	"We actively encourage the utilisation of the results of research in industry and communities, both nationally and globally, and any royalty income will be reinvested in further research."
SNT.10309.10995	The patent in question is U.S. Patent 5,487,069 Wireless LAN.
SNT.10309.10996	The case also raises issues about the recent signing of a Free Trade Agreement between Australia and the United States.
SNT.10309.10997	Per the agreement, Australia plans to introduce American-style intellectual property law.

SNT.5199.11031	A gene has been discovered that turns stem cells into cancer killers, promising new treatments that boost the body's ability to destroy tumors.
SNT.5199.11032	South Korean scientists from the Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology in Daejeon say that the gene, Vitamin D3 Upregulated Protein 1 (VDUP1), spurs stem cells to become natural killer cells.
SNT.5199.11033	These components of the immune system can eliminate virus-infected and cancerous cells.
SNT.5199.11034	Research leader Inpyo Choi says the team observed that VDUP1 plays a decisive role in causing stem cells to become natural killers.
SNT.5199.11035	The discovery was made by examining mice bred to lack the gene.
SNT.5199.11036	The mice had a dramatic reduction in the number and activity of natural killer cells.
SNT.5199.11037	Besides determining the gene's importance to the immune system, Choi and colleagues have developed technology needed to spur the creation of natural killers from a person's own bone marrow stem cells.
SNT.5199.11038	Choi calls this "the first step toward developing new treatments using our own immune system to fight cancers and other serious diseases."

SNT.1117.11070	MST is a large organization with many bases throughout Brazilian cities.

SNT.208402.11075	A documentary set to be shown on October 10, 2010 in Australia about the life and times of the soon to be canonised Mary MacKillop — who will be the first Australian to be made a saint — suggests that nuns including MacKillop of the Sisterhood of St Joseph of the Sacred Heart in South Australia were condemned and even excommunicated by high-ranking priests for informing the authorities of the apparent paedophilic acts of Father Patrick Keating at a local public school in Kapunda, South Australia.
SNT.208402.11076	The excommunication of MacKillop and other nuns was performed by the Bishop of Adelaide, Laurence Bonaventure Sheil, in 1871, but the documentary is set to suggest that the influence of Father Charles Horan was the driving force behind the act.
SNT.208402.11077	"She submitted to a farcical ceremony where the bishop was, I'm not sure you should use this word, gaga, but he had lost it and he was being manipulated by malicious priests," Father Paul Gardiner, a prominent figure in the canonisation of Mary McKillop, claims.
SNT.208402.11078	According to Ignatius Fennessy in the Journal of the Galway Archaeological and Historical Society:"One Thursday evening, 21 September 1871, Horan told Mary MacKillop that the bishop (who had called while she was out that day) wanted her to go to another convent."
SNT.208402.11080	"She could not go that night and wanted to discuss matters with the sisters and the bishop as well."
SNT.208402.11081	"Horan told her that the bishop would not see her and added, 'I suppose you won't go.'"
SNT.208402.11082	"The next morning the bishop arrived with four priests and, in a ranting mood, amid the hysteria of some of the sisters, and with MacKillop kneeling down on her knees in the chapel, he excommunicated her and sent her back into the world."
SNT.208402.11083	Bishop Shiel renounced the excommunications on his deathbed five months later.
SNT.208402.11084	The alleged paedophile priest, Father Keating, returned to Ireland, where he continued in fatherhood in the Catholic Church.
SNT.208402.11085	Mary MacKillop officially becomes the first sainted Australian on October 17, 2010 in a ceremony at The Vatican.
SNT.52445.11086	The recent E. coli outbreak that killed three people and sickened nearly 200 in the United States and Canada has been linked to cattle.
SNT.52445.11087	Shortly after the outbreak began, the contaminated spinach had been traced to the Salinas Valley region of California.
SNT.52445.11088	Now, health officials say the contamination came from cattle manure.
SNT.52445.11089	The infected cattle manure was found on a ranch in Salinas Valley that is adjacent to the field that produced contaminated spinach.
SNT.52445.11090	How precisely the infection was transported from the ranch to the spinach field is still unknown.
SNT.52445.11091	Dr. Kevin Reilly of the California Department of Health Services said that "we don't know if wild swine are playing a role or not, but we do know that on this particular ranch, there is a very large population of wild boar, and we have witnessed on this site that they have torn through fencing and under fencing and have the ability to access the field".
SNT.52445.11092	The bacteria could have been carried by wild animals from the cattle ranch to the spinach field.
SNT.52445.11093	Joan Rose, a microbiologist and food safety expert at Michigan State University, commented that it is not surprising that cattle manure was the source of the infection.
SNT.52445.11094	"If you start to look at the pathogen levels even in untreated sewage, it's minor compared to animal waste", she said.

SNT.195091.11098	It was the second time that the European champion for that year won the World Cup as well, the first being West Germany's victory in 1974.
SNT.195091.11099	It was also the first time that a European team emerged as the World Cup victors on a continent other than Europe.
SNT.195091.11100	For the Dutch, it was the third time they have lost in the World Cup finals, having done so in 1974 and 1978.

SNT.195091.11104	The Netherlands were forced to play with only ten players near the end of extra time after John Heitinga was kicked out of the game.
SNT.195091.11105	The winning shot of the match came from Spanish midfielder Andres Iniesta in the 116th minute, just four minutes from the end of extra time.
SNT.195091.11106	He managed to kick the ball past Dutch goalkeeper Maarten Stekelenburg from just 8 metres (26.2 feet) away.
SNT.195091.11107	If Iniesta had not made the goal, and game stayed scoreless until the end of extra time, the game would have been decided by a penalty shoot-out.

SNT.195091.11109	Paul's 2010 FIFA World Cup prediction record stayed at 100 per cent as a result.

SNT.264852.11111	The Thrashers, who have been a target for relocation rumors amid the ownership struggles and financial losses, will leave Atlanta after eleven seasons there in the highest-level professional ice hockey league in North America.
SNT.264852.11112	The deal, which was finalized early in the morning Tuesday, has just one step to climb: a vote by the NHL's Board of Governors, which will take up the matter at their June 21 meeting.
SNT.264852.11113	Atlanta Spirit Group, LLC. SNT.264852.11117	The two teams situated in the Western Conference which reside in the Eastern Time Zone, the Detroit Red Wings and Columbus Blue Jackets, as well as the Nashville Predators are considered favorites to be moved into the Eastern Conference when this happens.

SNT.8079.11136	Dr. Cerf is considered to be one of the fathers of the Internet.
SNT.8079.11137	One of the problems with having a video on demand service is video files take quite a bit of bandwidth to distribute.
SNT.8079.11138	Through the use of file sharing, the clients that are requesting a video can share information amongst themselves and can take some of the load off of the original distributor.
SNT.8079.11139	The only draw back to using file sharing is the distribution would not be instant; instead, it would have to be pre-recorded like TiVo.
SNT.8079.11140	Ironically, the movie industry has been suing people for file sharing for years now.

SNT.81578.11175	All miners have been rescued, and none of them were injured.
SNT.81578.11176	The mining company says that a lift electrical cable broke on a basket that was carrying miners, trapping thousands at least 2,200 meters (1.3 miles) below the earth's surface.
SNT.81578.11177	Reports from MSNBC and the Guardian Unlimited say that the shaft may have collapsed when a water or air pipe burst.
SNT.81578.11178	The rescue operation went well with no complications, with the rescue taking just under 24 hours to complete.
SNT.81578.11179	"They were underground when the accident happened and they were not able to surface because an electric feeder cable that is connected to the mine lift was severed," said a spokeswoman for the mining company, Amelia Soares.
SNT.81578.11180	The snap was caused by a "fatigued" air pipe which burst and fell down the shaft damaging the "steelwork and electrical feeder cords," added Soares.
SNT.81578.11181	"There have been no injuries or deaths," said CEO of Harmony mining, Graham Briggs who also said that the miners were previously contacted and were given "food and water."
SNT.81578.11182	Earlier reports had stated that Lesiba Seshoka, a spokesman with the National Union of Mineworkers, said that the miners have not been heard from for hours and that they could have been enduring temperatures as high as 105 degrees Fahrenheit (40 degrees Celsius).
SNT.81578.11183	"The only exit is blocked, probably by a fall of ground," said Seshoka.
SNT.81578.11184	Rescue workers used a mine shaft that is next to the damaged one in an attempt to reach the trapped miners, and lifted them out, 75 at a time.
SNT.81578.11185	There was no emergency exit in the shaft which is reported to have "not been maintained for ages," added Seshoka.
SNT.81578.11186	"An escape route is the most important thing and they have failed miserably."
SNT.81578.11187	"Our main worry is for more than 3,000 people who are underground," said National Union of Mineworkers for S. Africa chairman, Deon Boqwana.
SNT.81578.11188	Current reports say that "negligence" was the initial cause for the pipe burst and that there has been a history of negligence from the mine.
SNT.81578.11189	"Because of continuous operations there is no time to make adequate checks," said the President of the Miners union, Senzeni Zokwana to reporters during a news conference.
SNT.81578.11190	The Elandsrand mine is currently under development and has been since February 2001 when Harmony bought the mine.
SNT.81578.11191	Officials state that the mine will remain closed for a minimum of six weeks, while an investigation is performed, and the mine is deemed safe for miners to continue working in it.
SNT.81578.11192	The mine is located in the Witwatersrand Basin of South Africa, which is said to be the location of the largest area of raw gold on the planet.

SNT.57010.11272	The New Zealand government has announced that the new minimum purchasing age to buy fireworks in New Zealand is 18-years instead of the current age of 14-years.
SNT.57010.11273	Also the amount of time fireworks are available for sale during Guy Fawkes has been restricted to three days before Guy Fawkes night instead of ten days.
SNT.57010.11274	The New Zealand Fire Service has welcomed the new restrictions despite them calling for a complete ban.
SNT.57010.11275	The Environment minister, Honourable David Benson-Pope, said: "This aims to restrict young teenagers from purchasing these potentially harmful explosives, and to make the Guy Fawkes season less taxing for the Fire Service and Police."
SNT.57010.11276	"We want to see fireworks users behaving responsibly, being aware of and avoiding fire risk, guarding the personal safety of themselves and others, and being aware of the effect the noise has on animals."
SNT.57010.11277	Further restrictions have also been announced which will ban the separate sale of sparklers.
SNT.57010.11278	Sparklers will only be available for purchase in packs contained with other fireworks.
SNT.57010.11279	This restriction is to try and prevent the dangerous, home-made "sparkler bombs."
SNT.57010.11280	Mike Hall, chief executive of the New Zealand Fire Service, said that he is pleased with the new restrictions around the sale of fireworks.
SNT.57010.11281	"I met with the minister in November and expressed the Fire Service’s concerns, and it’s good to see that some action has come out of that."
SNT.57010.11282	In response to why the government had not banned the complete sale of fireworks, Hon Benson-Pope said: "I have listened to the various groups that do want a ban, and I am still open to that possibility in the future, but I believe the best approach at this stage is to tighten up the laws around sale."
SNT.57010.11283	The government has asked the Environmental Risk Management Authority to investigate the fireworks available for purchase in regards to the style, design and the construction of the various fireworks.
SNT.57010.11284	"...and next year government will consult with industry about new regulations in this area," Hon Benson-Pope said.
SNT.57010.11285	Mr Hall said: "Obviously we won’t know whether or not the measures Mr Benson-Pope has introduced will go far enough until the Guy Fawkes period in 2007, but we certainly hope they will limit the chaos we have seen in the past couple of years."
SNT.57010.11286	Hon Benson-Pope said: "Guy Fawkes is a fun event for thousands of families, and fireworks-related damage is caused by a small group of mostly young people."
SNT.57010.11287	"I don't feel it's fair on New Zealanders to ban fireworks sales at this stage because of the actions of a minority."
SNT.57010.11288	"I understand the frustration the Police and Fire Service teams feel when faced with problems over Guy Fawkes, and I hope these new restrictions will send a message that deliberate harm or damage is criminal and is being clamped down on," Mr Benson-Pope said.

SNT.42004.11304	A raid involving 50 members of the Swedish National Criminal Police has taken the servers of The Pirate Bay and Piratbyrån (the Pirate Bureau) — a Swedish lobby organisation that originally developed The Pirate Bay — into custody.
SNT.42004.11305	The search warrant was given on grounds of alleged copyright violation and assisting copyright violation.
SNT.42004.11306	This move comes as a bit of a surprise, as the legality of the site has been under public debate for over three years, with the operators frequently issuing public press releases.
SNT.42004.11307	WiredFire, in an interview with Rickard Falkvinge, head of the Swedish Pirate Party, is reporting that police arrested three staff members, ultimately taking only two into custody.
SNT.42004.11308	The Associated Press, however, is reporting that Ulf Goranzon, a police spokesman, is claiming that none were arrested, they were just under suspicion of violating copyright law.
SNT.42004.11309	The site operators speculate that the police wish to test the legality of the operation.
SNT.42004.11310	Purportedly, this move comes due to political pressure exerted by United States media corporations.
SNT.42004.11311	However, The Pirate Bay claimed that as they only host .torrent files and not copyrighted material, they are not in contravention of copyright laws.
SNT.42004.11312	The Pirate Bay also served as a distribution point for freely licensed material such as some Linux distributions and independent music and film.
SNT.42004.11313	The Pirate Bay claims to be the world's largest BitTorrent tracker.
SNT.42004.11314	In the raid, the police also took several private servers unconnected to The Pirate Bay.
SNT.42004.11315	Some have claimed that there is no legal basis for these seizures.
SNT.42004.11316	Initially, there were also rumors that this could be another stunt by The Pirate Bay to promote awareness.
SNT.42004.11317	This possibility, however, has been already dismissed and only had some credibility given the fact that approximately one year ago today they claimed something similar like this, but instead were simply updating their servers.
SNT.42004.11318	At current there are already some publications made available by officials confirming the authenticity of the raid.
SNT.42004.11319	On June the 1st The Pirate Bay site changed its "Site down" note to "Site down - will be up and fully functional within a day or two".
SNT.42004.11320	The day after the raid, Mr. Svartholm is trying to limit the damage for PRQ's other customers that also had their servers confiscated, even if they didn't have any connections to The Pirate Bay.

SNT.53797.11343	A new strain of Avian Flu or Bird Flu has been discovered in China and has also infected some humans.
SNT.53797.11344	The virus also "spreads fast" and has covered a "big geographic region" according to Chinese health officials.
SNT.53797.11345	It is not known how dangerous the new virus is and whether it is stronger or deadlier than the current H5N1 virus.
SNT.53797.11346	Despite being detected in humans, no evidence has turned up to suggest that the virus can be spread easily from human to human.
SNT.53797.11347	"The new variant doesn't indicate any increased risk for people other than the fact it seems to be pretty widespread," said World Health Organization's [WHO] Global Influenza Program, which is located in Zurich, Switzerland, Doctor Michael L. Perdue.
SNT.53797.11348	"This virus seemed to spread very fast over a big geographic region."
SNT.53797.11349	"However, we don't have any evidence to show whether this virus is more dangerous or less dangerous than any other H5N1 viruses," said State Key Laboratory of Emerging Infectious Diseases at the University of Hong Kong in China director, Yi Guan.
SNT.53797.11350	The strain was discovered during April and June of 2006 in China's Fujian Province when Guan's team examined ducks, chickens, geese and other birds at a market in the province.
SNT.53797.11351	At least 95% of the birds Guan and his team looked at were infected with the new strain and vaccines formulated to fight the H5N1 virus have not worked.
SNT.53797.11352	"This novel variant may have become dominant ... because it was not as easily affected as other strains by the avian vaccine used to prevent H5 infection."
SNT.53797.11353	The team is continuing surveillance on the area where the strain was discovered and according to Guan the virus "is not causing widespread infection outside of our surveillance area" but the new strain is reported in Thailand, Laos, Hong Kong and Malaysia.
SNT.53797.11354	Scientists also say that current vaccines used in birds for the H5N1 virus might have caused the new strain to develop.

SNT.763716.11375	The name change is designed in part to reduce the confusion which surrounded the name Air Pacific.

SNT.763716.11378	Pacific Voyager and Tabua Class have been replaced with economy and business class respectively.

SNT.763716.11380	It has said that the completion of this overhaul and the re-branding efforts will be completed by the end of the year.

SNT.763716.11382	The new identity is to "symbolises the airline's new identity and epitomises all that Fiji Airways represents."
SNT.763716.11383	"It is authentic, distinctive, and true to the airline's Fijian roots", the airline said.

SNT.142561.11412	"We've not had an incident like this in the past," he said.

SNT.142561.11414	The assault came a day after a series of bomb blasts in southern Afghanistan killed eight Americans, making October the deadliest month for US troops in the ongoing eight year war.
SNT.8674.11415	On Monday residents of an apartment building just outside of Paris discovered a World War II bomb lodged in their chimney.
SNT.8674.11416	Officials were able to defuse the device, reports All Headline News.
SNT.8674.11417	However, there are other remnants of the World Wars that have been much more difficult for the French to defuse.
SNT.8674.11418	The prevalence of anti-French sentiments reached a frenzied zenith prior to the U.S. invasion of Iraq.
SNT.8674.11419	While it seemed that the storm had calmed recently, this week's release of Richard Chesnoff's latest book, The Arrogance of the French: Why They Can't Stand Us--and Why the Feeling Is Mutual, reminds us that this issue is not going away anytime soon.
SNT.8674.11420	While there have been fewer sightings of "liberty toast" in recent months, from discussions with students in both the U.S. and France, this reporter found that America's perception of the French remains a hot topic of discussion on college campuses.
SNT.8674.11421	Bryan Doeg, a military science student at the University of Central Florida, outlined the two prevailing thoughts that are the basis for many of these anti-French sentiments.
SNT.8674.11422	"Most of my fellow students feel that the French are politically and militarily weak," said Doeg.
SNT.8674.11423	Doeg believes that he and his classmates are not without reason for their perceptions about the French.
SNT.8674.11424	"They are weak because of France's decline in power over the last century and its defeats against the Germans and Algerians," Doeg said.
SNT.8674.11425	"And most of my experiences regarding their arrogance comes from soldiers who visited France and were treated like untouchables by the locals."
SNT.8674.11426	Southwest Missouri State (SMS) finance major, Fabian Florant, got straight to the point when discussing Doeg's first assumption that the French are weak.
SNT.8674.11427	"Americans hate the French with a passion because of World War I and II," Florant said.
SNT.8674.11428	However some students pointed to France's involvement in the American Revolution, questioning how long America's memory really is.
SNT.8674.11429	Jessica Morgan, an SMS English major, said that this and other examples have shown that France is far from being weak.
SNT.8674.11430	"They stood up against Hitler when he was in his prime for months before he occupied their country," Morgan said.
SNT.8674.11431	"The fact that by the time we got there, the Germans were a heck of a lot weaker than they were when the French had to face them doesn't seem to register."
SNT.8674.11432	Morgan emphasized that France's refusal to support U.S. war efforts is a resounding display of strength.
SNT.8674.11433	"It's somewhat ironic that we call them weak," Morgan said.
SNT.8674.11434	"They stood up to the U.S. as well, daring the disapproval of the U.S. ... and all we can do is throw childish insults back at them."
SNT.8674.11435	Lysiane Lavorel, a native of France and college student studying English there, offered a tongue-in-cheek response to France's supposed weakness while making reference to the 1996 film Independence Day.
SNT.8674.11436	"As for the French being weak, it's true that in comparison with the strong and good Americans preventing aliens from invading the Earth, we are more than weak," Lavorel said.
SNT.8674.11437	"It's true that we don't have any real impact on the world, and I find it much more comfortable that way …"
SNT.8674.11438	"I wouldn't want to feel responsible for a war, for example."
SNT.8674.11439	Doeg's second assumption is that the French are arrogant, and Lavorel agrees again.
SNT.8674.11440	"Yes of course, I think we French are very arrogant," Lavorel said.
SNT.8674.11441	Lavorel went on to explain her definition of French arrogance.
SNT.8674.11442	"It's quite hard for us to see how people [Americans] seem to be so easily manipulated by government, big firms or media," Lavorel said.
SNT.8674.11443	"Because for most French, we have learned to become skeptical, doubtful and to make our own opinion on things.
SNT.8674.11444	However, she pointed out that this is especially true of Parisians, from which she says many of American's perceptions about the French are based.
SNT.8674.11445	"Even in France, they [Parisians] are said to be arrogant," Lavorel said.
SNT.8674.11446	"They are said to consider France as only composed of Paris, and provincial people are just hillbillies."
SNT.8674.11447	An American student at a California university, who asked to remain anonymous to prevent the damage of his reputation among colleagues, said that he would describe 90 percent of the Parisians he has met as being arrogant.
SNT.8674.11448	"In an academic setting, this arrogance is particularly frustrating," the source said.
SNT.8674.11449	"Often the Parisians I know belittle other people when they understand a complicated concept better than another person.
SNT.8674.11450	"On one occasion, a Parisian made a fool out of a good friend of mine," the source said.
SNT.8674.11451	"My friend asked him how to model the eigenfunction of a microdisk resonator with finite-differences time-domain."
SNT.8674.11452	"He said 'everyone knows you can derive these fields analytically."
SNT.8674.11453	The source said that he is not perpetuating these stereotypes and that his preconceived notions do not alter how he perceives these interactions.
SNT.8674.11454	"Often I'll hear someone say something like, 'Oh and be careful when you meet him--he's French," the source said.
SNT.8674.11455	"But you know, 99 percent of the time, all of the stereotypes prove to be perfectly true and the warning is useful."
SNT.8674.11456	SMS media student Lydia Mann, who visited France for two weeks recently and has hosted two French foreign exchange students, said that these perceptions are based upon cultural differences.
SNT.8674.11457	"Americans, I think, misunderstand their culture which leads to their actions," Mann said.
SNT.8674.11458	"They make a point to make themselves individualistic, which people find rude."
SNT.8674.11459	SMS English major Christin Green agrees and believes that this entire discussion that attempts to blanket such a large group of people is ridiculous.
SNT.8674.11460	"I want to learn about them with an open mind and a fresh perspective, unpolluted by bias or preconceived ideas," Green said.
SNT.8674.11461	"It is not my place to judge or make assumptions about an entire people."
SNT.8674.11462	"Stereotypes ruin this foundation and build another one that is much more destructive."

SNT.130066.11474	This morning, the sixteen remaining occupiers were told to prepare a list of items for future deliveries.
SNT.130066.11475	But, according to "Mark", an occupier in the Vestas plant, this afternoon Vestas management reversed their decision, terming the August 1 food delivery a one-time "goodwill gesture" and saying food would no longer be allowed in.
SNT.130066.11476	The food delivery followed a formal complaint by the RMT that denying the occupiers food was a violation of their human rights.
SNT.130066.11477	The people inside the factory have been conducting their occupation since July 20, in protest against the closure of the factory, which produces wind turbine blades for the generation of wind power, and the loss of 625 jobs in the Isle of Wight and nearby areas.
SNT.130066.11478	Mark went on to praise the "brave people" who have circumvented the security ring around the plant in order to get food and other items to the occupiers.
SNT.130066.11479	An electric kettle thrown at the end of a rope up to the occupiers is said to be working well.
SNT.130066.11480	Mark also noted that Louise Christian, a prominent British human rights lawyer, is now representing the Vestas occupiers.
SNT.130066.11481	While the number of occupiers at the Vestas plant — originally nearly thirty, now only sixteen — have dwindled, Mark says the ones who remain are "very determined" and furthermore hold no ill will toward their co-workers who have left the occupation.
SNT.130066.11482	In particular, the occupiers offered sympathy for Luke Paxton, who they say left the occupation due to a combination of personal issues and malnutrition brought on by the deprivation of food.
SNT.130066.11483	Paxton, Mark said, has the remaining occupiers' "full support" and continues to campaign for the Vestas workers.
SNT.130066.11484	In contrast to claims that green socialist group Workers' Climate Action were behind the occupation, Mark presented a more nuanced picture: the Vestas workers' initial contacts were with veterans of the occupation of Visteon's auto parts plants, with the AWL, SWP and Socialist Party becoming involved later with "quite a big involvement" from all groups.
SNT.130066.11485	Members of Workers' Climate Action attended Vestas workers' meetings and gave their opinions, but, Mark says, a committee organised by the workers and composed of workers was making all the decisions.
SNT.130066.11486	Mark also strongly rejected the support of Solidarity, a "nationalist trade union" closely associated with the BNP.
SNT.130066.11487	In a July 24 statement, Solidarity backed the Vestas workers, with union executive member David Kerr saying "We are behind the Vestas workers 100 per cent.
SNT.130066.11488	Mark, in reply, told Wikinews: "We do not want their support...they go against a lot of the things people believe in here.
SNT.130066.11489	Most of the Vestas occupiers remain independent of trade unions, with only three of the sixteen people inside being members of any union.

SNT.130066.11491	"Don't back down...do not be pushed around, do not be intimidated".

SNT.108633.11560	On Wednesday, a United States federal appeals court upheld convictions of fraud and obstruction of justice against media mogul Conrad Black, along with three other executives from his former press corporation, Hollinger International.
SNT.108633.11561	Black, born in Canada and bearer of the title Baron Black of Crossharbour in the United Kingdom, was found guilty in July 2007 of three counts of wire and mail fraud for giving himself and others millions of dollars in illegal bonuses taken from Hollinger holdings, and for obstruction of justice based on surveillance footage of his moving 13 boxes of documents out of his Toronto office to his home the day after he was informed that he was being investigated.
SNT.108633.11562	He was sentenced, and from March this year he began a 6 1/2-year prison term.
SNT.108633.11563	Peter Atkinson and John Boultbee were convicted on the same fraud charges, and were sentenced to terms of 24 and 27 months respectively, while Mark Kipnis, who was implicated in the fraud, was given probation with 6 months of home detention.
SNT.108633.11564	The appeals panel from the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit, who heard the defence attorneys' oral arguments, presented its opinion in a 16-page document in which they rejected arguments against the fraud and obstruction charges.
SNT.108633.11565	They noted that while the defence had presented a "no harm-no foul argument", in which it was argued that the accused were owed the money appropriated, "such arguments usually fare badly in criminal cases".
SNT.108633.11566	They also dismissed claims that instructions given to the jury by the judge had been incomplete, or unclear, stating that "the defendants proposed a misleading statement as an alternative", and that in such situations the judge is allowed to stay with the original instruction, and in particular is not required "that a submitted charge be technically perfect to alert the court to the need for a particular charge".
SNT.108633.11567	The appeals judges also discounted arguments from the defence regarding the defendants being unaware of the illegality of the transactions, making reference to an "ostrich argument", based on the urban legend that ostriches sensing danger stick their heads in the sand.
SNT.108633.11568	It was noted that choosing not to investigate the suspicious nature of the payments was equivalent to accepting their illegality.
SNT.108633.11569	An argument from Black's defence regarding the obstruction charge, that in moving the documents he was not in fact escaping scrutiny, was similarly rejected, as "all that needed to be proved is that the document was concealed in order to make it unavailable in an official proceeding," according to the ruling as written by Judge Richard Posner.
SNT.108633.11570	Andrew Frey, the defence attorney for Conrad Black, said that the court's decision was based on "a number of factual misunderstandings", and that the defendants were considering a request for a rehearing of the appeal.
SNT.15302.11571	Research by a team from Canada have published a report in the magazine Science stating that seabirds are the main carriers of pollution in coastal ponds in the Arctic.
SNT.15302.11572	They showed that local sources of pollution are rare, meaning that seabirds played a proportionally greater role in local pollution.
SNT.15302.11573	They do not produce pollution themselves, rather, they carry in other forms of marine pollution.
SNT.15302.11574	The researchers found levels of DDT 60 times higher, 25 times more mercury, and 10 times higher hexachlorobenzene in ponds that seabirds frequented compared to nearby ponds birds did not use.
SNT.15302.11575	All the pollution was originally of human origin - industrial or agricultural.

SNT.52282.11615	Absent an announcement from the Chinese government, it's unclear what the conditions were that caused the site to be accessible from within China.
SNT.52282.11616	A blog by Wikipedia contributor Andrew Lih says that someone in "Beijing emailed me saying he could suddenly start using Wikipedia again.
SNT.52282.11617	He continued that "from a Beijing China Netcom's residential DSL connection, the English language and other foreign language versions are now accessible, but the Chinese version is still blocked", noting that the Chinese-language version is the most important one to most Wikipedians in the country.
SNT.52282.11618	The blog entry goes on to explain the finer points of China's blocking system, which is more complex than most media outlets suggest.
SNT.52282.11619	Wikimedia head Jimmy Wales told Moneycontrol.com yesterday that, "We don't know what they took offense to."
SNT.52282.11620	"We really don't intend to compromise the way Google did."
SNT.52282.11621	"I am trying to set up high-level meetings in China to state our case and explain why we should be unblocked."
SNT.52282.11622	"We have no idea what the result of that would be."
SNT.52282.11623	"Wikipedia is not a haven for dissidents but an encyclopedia."
SNT.52282.11624	"About 99.9 percent of Wikipedia has topics that are not of interest to the Chinese Government."
SNT.52282.11625	He also told the outlet, he stressed how such bans were blocking Chinese perspectives in the global media.
SNT.52282.11626	The third block of Wikipedia, which was implemented 19 October 2005, was issued without explanation or an expected length.
SNT.52282.11627	Wikipedia has been blocked twice before, the first from 2-21 June 2004, due to the 15th anniversary of the Tian'anmen Square Incident.
SNT.52282.11628	A website called baidu.com runs a self-censored wiki-based encyclopedia website, called baidubaike.com, launched in April of this year.
SNT.52282.11629	Wikipedia is a project of the Wikimedia Foundation, a non-profit organisation based out of St. Petersberg, Florida.
SNT.52282.11630	Its 2007 annual convention, Wikimania, is set to take place in Taipei.
SNT.43853.11631	Since Saddam Hussein was toppled in the allied invasion of Iraq in 2003, Iraqi oil production figures have been bleak.

SNT.9065.11636	A UCLA team, headed by Brian Naranjo, has observed the nuclear fusion of deuterium nuclei in a tabletop device.
SNT.9065.11637	The device uses a lithium tantalate (LiTaO3) pyroelectric crystal to ionize deuterium atoms and accelerate the ions towards a stationary erbium deuteride (ErD) target.
SNT.9065.11638	Fusion of two deuterium nuclei results in the emission of helium nuclei (alpha particles), neutrons and gamma rays.
SNT.9065.11639	The team anticipates applications of the device as a tabletop neutron generator, or in "microthrusters" for space propulsion.
SNT.9065.11640	It is possible that there may be applications related to nuclear weapons, although this possibility is not discussed in the research paper.
SNT.9065.11641	This development is not related to earlier claims of tabletop fusion or "cold fusion" having been observed during sonoluminescence.
SNT.9065.11642	In fact, the leader of the team behind this development was one of the main critics of earlier low-temperature fusion claims.
SNT.9065.11643	This device is not the first reliable tabletop fusion device; the Farnsworth-Hirsch fusor, developed in the early 1960s in the laboratory of Philo T. Farnsworth who was instrumental in developing television, is sold commercially as a neutron source.
SNT.9065.11644	Research by Dr. Todd Rider of MIT suggests that the kind of non-equilibrium fusion produced in these sources will never be usable as an energy source (see his PhD thesis).
SNT.123578.11645	Richard Jenkins, an engineer from the United Kingdom, broke a record for the fastest speed attained in a wind-powered land vehicle on Friday.
SNT.123578.11646	Jenkins managed to reach a speed of 126.1 miles per hour (202.9 kilometres per hour) in his Greenbird car along the plains of Nevada's Ivanpah Lake.
SNT.123578.11647	Jenkins said that he had worked for ten years to break the record, and that "things couldn't have been better" on the day he broke the record.
SNT.123578.11648	"It's one of those things that you spend so long trying to do and when it actually happens, it's almost too easy," he said to the BBC.
SNT.123578.11649	"Half the challenge is technical, having to create a more efficient vehicle than the previous record holder, then the rest is luck, being in the right place, at the right time, to get the perfect conditions, with the right people watching."
SNT.123578.11650	"I must have been on record standby at some remote location around the world for at least two months of every year for the past ten years," he said.
SNT.123578.11651	"Then everything came together perfectly and the Greenbird stepped up to the mark and performed amazingly.
SNT.123578.11652	The previous record for the fastest wind-powered land vehicle belonged to Bob Schumacher from the United States, who reached 116 miles per hour in his Iron Duck machine.
SNT.123578.11653	The Greenbird is a fifth generation in an array of vehicles created by Jenkins in his ten-year effort to break the speed record.
SNT.123578.11654	It is composed out of carbon fibre composite, and powered only by wind.
SNT.270770.11655	Jamaican Olympic athlete and coach Pablo McNeil has died at the age of 71.
SNT.270770.11656	The cause of death was a long illness he suffered since a stroke in December 2007.
SNT.270770.11657	A sprinter since childhood, McNeil competed at two Olympic Games.
SNT.270770.11658	In the 1964 Tokyo Games he reached the semi-final of the 100 meters, finishing sixth.
SNT.270770.11659	He also appeared in the 100 meters at the 1968 Games in Mexico City, but failed to make it past the first round.
SNT.270770.11660	He was part of the relay team that won a silver medal at the 1966 Commonwealth Games in Kingston, Jamaica.
SNT.270770.11661	After a career of competing in athletics, McNeil turned his attention to coaching.
SNT.270770.11662	He became the sprint coach at the William Knibb High School where he met Usain Bolt.
SNT.270770.11663	He convinced Bolt to make the switch from cricket to track and trained him up until the age of 16, when Bolt joined the Jamaica Amateur Athletic Association-administered High Performance Training Centre in Kingston.
SNT.270770.11664	Bolt, through his publicist, said that "Coach McNeil was a part of my early track and field life."
SNT.270770.11665	"I appreciate all he sought to pass on to me."
SNT.270770.11666	"I would like to offer my condolences and sympathies to his family and close friends."
SNT.270770.11667	Minister of Youth, Sports and Culture, Olivia Grange paid tribute to McNeil in a statement saying “Pablo McNeil has left a mark on Jamaican and world sports."
SNT.270770.11668	"He was a good competitor for Jamaica and went on to nurture, mentor, inspire and coach some of our fine young athletes at William Knibb High School - including Usain Bolt who has been such a success and inspiration."
SNT.270770.11669	"On behalf of the Government and people of Jamaica, I offer sincerely condolences to Pablo McNeil’s family, friends, and the entire Track and Field fraternity who will be saddened by his passing."

SNT.58836.11849	In Pakistan, the Daily Times reported that construction work on a sewerage project has started in Pindi.
SNT.58836.11850	It said that the construction work for the Rawalpindi Environment Improvement Project (REIP) aims to lay a new underground drainage and sewerage system in the area.
SNT.58836.11851	The project director of REIP, Aslam Sabzwari, said, according to the report, that improvement of sanitation and sewerage system had started in the eastern zone of the city, consisting of 15 union councils (UCs).
SNT.58836.11852	The project includes improvement of the sanitation and sewerage systems, a sewage treatment plant, solid waste management, removal of slaughter-houses and construction of public toilets.
SNT.58836.11853	Sabzwari also said that 22 new tube wells would be installed, while 32 old ones would be repaired under the project, recalling that the existing sewerage systems in Satellite Town and Kahyabane-Sirsyed were laid in the 1950s and 1960s, respectively, and were the main cause of the increasing case of hepatitis in the city.
SNT.58836.11854	Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Punjab government sponsor the REIP.

SNT.145289.11856	The report accuses Israel of implementing an intricate policy including expanding Jewish settlements and demolishing Palestinian homes.
SNT.145289.11857	It says policies "are undermining prospects for a Palestinian capital in east Jerusalem and incrementally render a sustainable two-state solution unfeasible"; this is described as, "an integral part of a broader Israeli strategy."

SNT.145289.11862	4,577 residents of East Jerusalem have had their residence revoked in 2008, this is more than half the total revoked in the past 40 years.
SNT.145289.11863	The Jerusalem municipality places severe restrictions on issuing building permits for Palestinian houses in east Jerusalem, since 2000 over 600 Palestinian-owned structures have been demolished and Palestinians receive fewer than 200 of the 1,500 building permits needed per year.
SNT.145289.11864	The 14-page annual report dated November 23 was drafted by European envoys and consuls in Jerusalem and Ramallah and presented to Brussels EU institutions a few days ago.
SNT.145289.11865	This is the first time the annual report has been made public.

SNT.145289.11867	The report was leaked to Israel's Haaretz daily newspaper and obtained by AFP yesterday.
SNT.145289.11868	The EU report claims the Israeli government and Jerusalem municipality discriminate against Arab residents with regard to building permits, health services, education, sanitation and more.
SNT.145289.11869	Allegations of assisting private right-wing Jewish organisations, such as Ateret Cohanim and Elad, to alter the city's demographics are included.
SNT.145289.11870	The report advises sanctions against people and groups involved in "settlement activity", and taking other measures to protest Israeli policy and to stop the harming of the Arab population, including an "EU presence at Israeli court cases on house demolitions or evictions of Palestinian families when there is a risk of demolition or eviction of Palestinian families", and "information sharing on violent settlers in East Jerusalem to assess whether to grant entry to the EU."
SNT.145289.11871	The report also recommends implementing measures to strengthen the Palestinian National Authority's presence in the city.
SNT.145289.11872	Archaeological excavations in Jerusalem near the Temple Mount are mentioned, suggesting "archaeology in this case has become an ideologically motivated tool of national and religious struggle carried out in a manner that modifies the identity and character of the city and threatens to undermine its stability."

SNT.98618.11874	With few exceptions, the overwhelming theme was "old is new" and that the '70s were even more in fashion than the shows on Sunday suggested.
SNT.98618.11875	Among the designers to unveil their Fall 2008 lines on Monday were Oscar de la Renta, Carolina Herrera, Betsey Johnson, Proenza Schouler and a rejuvenated Halston line, under the direction of designer Marco Zanini.
SNT.98618.11876	Both global warming and the slowing economy have been cited as reasons for the overwhelming use of lighter fabrics over heavier attire.
SNT.98618.11877	Also, retro designs and continuing trends have been used in effort to save money, like the tights that were expected to go out of fashion this year.
SNT.98618.11878	Even in the glamorous world of high-end fashion, money has been tight, and with the world economies in a collective downturn, major designers have been more wary of continuing to churn out the stream of couture designs that past Fashion Weeks have seen.
SNT.98618.11879	The lone daring designer for the day was Carolina Herrera, who discarded the furs she promoted in the Fall 2007 show to focus on a Peter Pan theme, with earth tones and bird feathers.
SNT.98618.11880	To further the "flying Peter Pan" motif, models donned such designs as a chiffon dress with ostrich feathers and a taffeta gown with a feather waistband.
SNT.98618.11881	Oscar de la Renta opted for more traditional blacks, golds and grays, debuting lines for men and women in fabrics he is familiar with.
SNT.98618.11882	Men were outfitted in tweed while women were fitted in dresses that experimented with embroidery and tulle, both shades of past collections.
SNT.98618.11883	Among others, labels Badgley Mischka, Diesel, and Vivienne Tam unveil their newest collections on Tuesday.

SNT.56608.11940	The joint venture replaces the current and long-lasting partnership between Microsoft and Xtra, called XtraMSN.

SNT.56608.11942	Telecom chose to change the partnership because Yahoo! has worked together with BT Group, Verizon and Rogers Communications.
SNT.56608.11943	The new site, along with new online content will go online on around March 1, 2007.
SNT.56608.11944	The partnership will result in Yahoo!7 taking 51% control of the partnership and Xtra taking the remaining 49%.

SNT.56608.11946	"We see there is a fantastic opportunity to grow online advertising and the share of the online market."
SNT.56608.11947	"Online advertising in New Zealand is getting to a tipping point of growth where there is a critical mass of online connections, broadband connections and an increase in the amount of time people are spending online."
SNT.56608.11948	When the new site is launched, it will include a range of news, sport, weather, enhanced e-mail spam and virus protection, photo sharing, and internet radio.
SNT.56608.11949	Theresa Gattung, chief executive of Telecom, said: "The Yahoo Xtra joint venture will provide New Zealanders with access to the world's best online services in a localised way."
SNT.56608.11950	Ian Smith, chief executive of Yahoo!7, said: "The company was achieving market growth of online advertising of between 50 and 60 per cent a year in Australia and believed it could do the same in New Zealand."
SNT.56608.11951	He said that the partnership will give them a great opportunity to showcase its tools, technology and platforms in New Zealand.
SNT.56608.11952	Mr Kenrick said that the reason they had gotten a partnership with Yahoo!7 was that it is very difficult for a small player to develop its services in a New Zealand size market.
SNT.56608.11953	One other online company Xtra had considered for the partnership was Google, among others.
SNT.56608.11954	The reason they chose Yahoo!7 over other companies was because Yahoo!7 has the top position in big fields such as TV and video.
SNT.56608.11955	Mr Kenrick said: "The whole area of content management is one we thought would benefit from others with greater expertise and more scope."

SNT.35155.12005	The judge in the U.S. federal death penalty trial against Zacarias Moussaoui ruled on Friday that prosecutors can seek replacement witnesses for seven Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) employees whose testimony was tainted, and therefore disallowed because of pre-trial coaching by a Transportation Security Administration (TSA) lawyer.
SNT.35155.12006	The 18-member jury (6 alternates) were sent home for a week while the court dealt with the revelation that government aviation security witness had been contacted prior to the trial by TSA lawyer Carla J. Martin, to help prepare their testimony in the case.
SNT.35155.12007	Martin, aged 51, is accused of misconduct by sending prosecution witnesses e-mail that included trial transcripts of another related case along with observations of her own that pertained to the Moussaoui case, including suggestions and talking points.
SNT.35155.12008	She was recently suspended with pay by the TSA and retained Roscoe Howard to act as legal counsel in the face of legal actions that might arise against her.
SNT.35155.12009	Judge Leonie M. Brinkema initially ruled to prevent testimony from any aviation employees, but reversed her decision after the prosecution argued they would have little case left if their testimony remained inadmissible.
SNT.35155.12010	FAA employee testimony is expected to take the form of what measures would have been taken by the agency to prevent against the September 11, 2001 airliner attacks in New York City and Washington D.C. if Moussaoui had warned officials of the plan prior to the strikes.
SNT.35155.12011	The connection to the Carla Martin involvement in the case was discovered in a separate trial involving liability lawsuits against two U.S. airline companies for losses as a result of the attacks.
SNT.35155.12012	Family member lawyers of flight attendants drew attention to contacts by Martin to persons involved in the case.
SNT.35155.12013	A U.S. federal public defender appointed to Moussaoui argued for the jury to spare his life during opening statements on Monday, March 6, in the trial that will determine his fate — either life in prison or death by lethal injection.
SNT.35155.12014	Defense attorney Edward B. MacMahon said that Moussaoui "aspires to martyrdom," and called on jurors to deny the Al-Qaeda operative his wish to die.
SNT.35155.12015	A wish that would result in him becoming "a smiling face on a recruiting poster for Osama bin Laden," MacMahon said.
SNT.35155.12016	Moussaoui is believed by some to be the missing member in the team of 19 other attackers that carried out the suicide airliner strikes in New York City and Washington D.C.
SNT.35155.12017	Arrested in Minnesota on immigration charges three weeks prior to the attacks, Moussaoui could have warned officials of the pending attacks, but failed to do so, argued Assistant U.S. Attorney Rob Spencer for the prosecution in opening statements.
SNT.35155.12018	He said that he was to play a role in another future attack on the White House using an aircraft.
SNT.35155.12019	Four of the conspiracy charges each carry a maximum penalty of death.
SNT.35155.12020	Family members of the nearly 3,000 killed in the attacks were able to watch the Alexandria, Virginia courtroom proceedings by closed-circuit television in six U.S. cities: New York, Boston, Central Islip, N.Y., Newark, N.J., and Philadelphia.
SNT.35155.12021	Moussaoui has a history of disrupting previous trial proceedings with outbursts.
SNT.35155.12022	He has disavowed his lawyers, and mostly ignored his mother who was present during the opening days of the trial because she had spoken to his defense lawyers.
SNT.35155.12023	Upon leaving the Tuesday, March 7 court session for a recess, Moussaoui pumped his right fist in the air and shouted, "Allah Akbar! God curse America! Bless Osama bin Laden!"
SNT.35155.12024	The outbursts have been timed to occur outside the earshot of Judge Brinkema and the jury as those persons filed out of the courtroom for recesses.
SNT.35155.12025	Moussaoui pleaded guilty in April last year to the conspiracy charges.
SNT.35155.12026	Evidence linking him to the plot was discovered when his duffel bags were searched after the attacks.

SNT.2529.12029	This event was important for the Christians because they have been persecuted by the Roman Empire during 300 years and now they would have freedom to profess their religion without been in risk of been arrested or convicted to death by the government.
