SNT.22956.15408	DeLay has publicly countered that the charges are partisan and thus politically motivated.
SNT.22956.15409	The charges originate from the District Attorney of Travis County, Ronnie Earle, a Democrat who has prosecuted Democrat and Republican office holders, including U.S. Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison.
SNT.22956.15410	Mr. DeLay's attorney Steve Brittain said that DeLay was accused of a criminal conspiracy in a campaign finance scheme along with two associates, namely John Colyandro, former executive director of a Texas political action committee formed by DeLay, and Jim Ellis, the head of DeLay's national political committee.
SNT.22956.15411	Attorneys for Colyandro and Ellis have filed to have the proceedings moved out of Travis County in order to obtain a fair trial.
SNT.22956.15412	Travis County, located in central Texas, contains the state capital of Austin and is politically known as a liberal county within a conservative state, as indicated by the most recent presidential elections.
SNT.22956.15413	According to the indictment, "the defendants herein, with the intent that a felony be committed, did enter into an agreement with one or more of each other with a general purpose committee known as Texans for a Republican Majority PAC (political action committee) that one or more of them would engage in conduct that would constitute the offense of knowingly making a political contribution in violation of Subchapter D of Chapter 253 of the Texas Election Code..."
SNT.22956.15414	The indictment does not include specific charges of how DeLay was involved in the conspiracy.
SNT.22956.15415	Mr. DeLay, upon announcement of the indictment, made a solitary public comment: "I have notified the speaker that I will temporarily step aside from my position as majority leader pursuant to rules of the House Republican Conference and the actions of the Travis County district attorney today."
SNT.22956.15416	Bill White, another of DeLay's attorneys, said "it's a skunky indictment if they have one."
SNT.22956.15417	DeLay's spokesman, Kevin Madden, called the indictment "nothing more than prosecutorial retribution by a partisan Democrat," referring to prosecutor Ronnie Earle, a Democrat.
SNT.22956.15418	According to House Republican party rules, DeLay must resign upon indictment.
SNT.22956.15419	Party officials told the Associated Press that Speaker of the House, Dennis Hastert R-Illinois, will likely recommend Republican David Dreier of California as replacement, while some duties may also go to Majority whip Roy Blunt, R-Missouri.
SNT.22956.15420	DeLay has previously been admonished three times by the House Ethics Committee.
SNT.22956.15421	In their October 6, 2004 letter to him, the members wrote in part concluding, "...it is clearly necessary for you to temper your future actions to assure that you are in full compliance at all times with the applicable House Rules and standards of conduct."
SNT.22956.15422	We remind you that the House Code of Official Conduct provides the Committee with authority “to deal with any given act or accumulation of acts which, in the judgment of the committee, are severe enough to reflect discredit on the Congress.”
SNT.22956.15423	House Republicans earlier eliminated the rule requiring his resignation upon indictment, but reinstated it fearing voters' outcry.
SNT.22956.15424	DeLay's Political Action Committee, Texans for a Republican Majority, was earlier indicted on charges it accepted corporate contributions mostly from the credit card industry . for use in state legislative elections.
SNT.22956.15425	Texas law prohibits corporate money from being used in elections, permitting it only for administrative expenses.
SNT.22956.15426	Having gained GOP control of Texas's legislature, DeLay masterminded a redistricting plan in 2004 that allowed the GOP to gain six seats in the U.S. House, formerly won by Democrats, and build a majority in Congress.
SNT.22956.15427	In one case, one lawmaker switched parties, to maintain office.

SNT.26541.15443	He is charged with conspiracy to commit murder, kidnapping, aiding terrorist groups and other acts against US nationals outside the United States.
SNT.26541.15444	These actions come six days ahead of a decision by the US Supreme Court on whether it should review the 4th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeal's ruling that the president is authorised to hold Padilla as an "Enemy Combatant" without charge.
SNT.26541.15445	Jose Padilla, a US citizen born in Brooklyn, has been held without charge in a military brig at a US Navy detention facility in South Carolina for the three-and-a-half years since his arrest in 2002.
SNT.26541.15446	The administration had at the time alleged that Padilla was plotting to detonate a Radioactive "dirty" bomb in the US and later, Deputy Attorney General James Comey alleged that he was involved in plots to blow up Hotels and high-rise buildings .
SNT.26541.15447	The present indictment does not include any charges over these allegations.
SNT.26541.15448	Instead, Padilla is charged with travelling abroad to train in "violent Jihad", providing material support to terrorists by sending money, physical assets, and new recruits to Jihadi groups, and conspiring to murder individuals overseas .
SNT.26541.15449	The change in custody restores to Padilla a number of rights he had been denied when the administration designated him as an "Enemy Combatant", including the right to access federal courts and be defended by an attorney.
SNT.26541.15450	That constitutionality of detaining suspects without charge under this designation has been challenged in court, on behalf of Padilla and in September, a 3-judge panel of the 4th US Circuit Court of Appeals upheld the government's powers to detain Padilla.
SNT.26541.15451	The Supreme Court was set to decide on whether it will review that decision next week.
SNT.26541.15452	Padilla's status, for the purpose of this trial, is that of an ordinary criminal indictee, possessing the legal rights conferred on him by the US Bill of Rights.

SNT.279494.15486	Due to an operational overhaul by Cook, he is credited with the success of the iPad and MacBook Air.

SNT.127320.15499	On Tuesday, 25 more bodies were recovered by other illegal workers.
SNT.127320.15500	"We suspect there was a fire on the 18th of May."

SNT.127320.15502	"It seems more of a case of gas or smoke inhalation."
SNT.127320.15503	"I don't know if there are any more bodies down there, we just have to wait."
SNT.127320.15504	The workers may have died from poisonous gasses, smoke inhalation, suffocation, cave-ins or carbon monoxide poisoning.
SNT.127320.15505	Harmony gold mine will not send anyone in to the mine as the conditions are extremely dangerous and abandoned shafts are without safety equipment.
SNT.127320.15506	Illegal workers may gain access bypassing security at one mine site, and exit via a series of interconnected underground tunnels many miles away.
SNT.127320.15507	Harmony is internationally the fifth largest gold mining company and has bought up old, abandoned mines.

SNT.359245.15558	A neologism coined in advice columnist Dan Savage's column Savage Love in response to comments made by former Pennsylvania Senator Rick Santorum about homosexuality has gained prominence during the ongoing election cycle in the United States.
SNT.359245.15559	After Santorum spoke out against LGBT rights in the United States in 2003, readers of Savage’s column voted to define the word "santorum" as "the frothy mixture of lube and fecal matter that is sometimes the byproduct of anal sex."
SNT.359245.15560	The prominence of this term's association with Santorum, a current candidate for the Republican Party presidential nomination, has had an impact on the former Senator's presidential campaign.
SNT.359245.15561	Dan Savage commented on the continued impact of the santorum neologism, in an interview with the Fort Worth Star-Telegram published Sunday, "It's still out there and it is an insanely dirty joke."
SNT.359245.15562	"It is vile, as are Santorum's comments about gay people."
SNT.359245.15563	At a speaking engagement on Friday, Santorum stated that same-sex partnerships don't "benefit society".
SNT.359245.15564	Whilst speaking as part of his campaign for the U.S. presidency in 2012, Rick Santorum has had to answer questions from supporters of LGBT rights regarding his controversial political positions on issues pertaining to them.
SNT.359245.15565	Critics have showed up to Santorum events and tried to glitter bomb the candidate.
SNT.359245.15566	Democratic strategists poised themselves to take advantage of Santorum's association with the neologism phenomenon.
SNT.359245.15567	Based on sources among Democratic operatives, Jack Cahill of American Thinker reports Democratic tactics in Missouri involve actually galvanizing support for Santorum ahead of that state's Republican caucuses in order to eliminate the possibility of a Mitt Romney win.
SNT.359245.15568	Cahill says they view Santorum as mostly a dirty joke's punchline.
SNT.359245.15569	Wikinews previously reported on the santorum neologism phenomenon in 2006, as part of an article, "Wikinews investigates Wikipedia usage by U.S. Senate staff members".
SNT.359245.15570	The investigation noted that: "An edit to an article about a controversy over Senator Rick Santorum's statements about Constitutional rights to privacy with regards to sexual acts, seemingly coming from Rick Santorum's staff members, removed a reference to an effort to redefine Santorum's last name as a neologism".
SNT.359245.15571	In a 2003 interview with the Associated Press, Rick Santorum compared legalizing same-sex marriage in the United States to supporting bestiality.
SNT.359245.15572	Readers of the Savage Love advice column selected a new definition for the Senator’s last name, and Savage created a website www.spreadingsantorum.com to document the spread of the phenomenon.
SNT.359245.15573	The term became a prominent result in searches online, and gained dominance on Web search engines including Google, Bing, and Yahoo!.
SNT.359245.15574	Google global communications chief Gabriel Stricker commented to National Public Radio in an interview this January, that the company was avoiding editorial judgment, and that the prominence of the santorum neologism phenomenon in web searches is due to increased interest in the subject.
SNT.359245.15575	Stricker stated, "There definitely are people who are finding this to be the best answer to their question, and they are indicating this by either clicking on this result or linking to this result as the best answer to that question."
SNT.359245.15576	In the wake of Santorum's showing in the 2012 Iowa Republican caucuses, additional curious people looked up the former Senator on the Internet and in turn discovered the santorum neologism phenomenon.
SNT.359245.15577	After journalist Laura Sydell of the National Public Radio program All Things Considered received criticism for covering the increased attention to the santorum neologism, she explained why the issue was relevant: "I felt it was an important and legitimate story in the wake of Mr. Santorum's success in Iowa."
SNT.359245.15578	"Although the site had been up for many years, it was only after Mr. Santorum's success in the caucuses that a large number of people were actually searching for more information about him."
SNT.359245.15579	The Canadian Press provided a similar analysis in January — that more coverage of Santorum has led to more coverage of the neologism.
SNT.359245.15580	Rick Santorum himself has acknowledged and discussed the existence and prevalence of the santorum neologism phenomenon, in comments to the press.
SNT.359245.15581	He was quoted in January by The Canadian Press on his assessment of Google's response: "I suspect if something was up there like that about, say, Joe Biden, they would get rid of it."
SNT.359245.15582	"To have a business allow that type of filth to be purveyed through their website or through their system is something that they say they can't handle."
SNT.359245.15583	Santorum tried to alleviate the neologism's results in web searches by reaching out to Google in September, but this act only served to increase reporting and coverage of the phenomenon.
SNT.359245.15584	In a 2011 radio interview with host Steve Malzberg, Santorum characterized the neologism as "filth".
SNT.359245.15585	He criticized the response of the press to the phenomenon, saying, "It's offensive beyond, you know, anything that any public figure or anybody in America should tolerate, and the mainstream media laughs about it."
SNT.114652.15586	In an effort to reduce the effect of the ongoing financial crisis, six central banks worldwide have reduced their interest rates by 0.5% in an unexpected move which took place today.
SNT.114652.15587	The banks involved in the deal are the Bank of Canada, the Bank of England, the European Central Bank, the Federal Reserve, Sveriges Riksbank, and the Swiss National Bank.
SNT.114652.15588	"Throughout the current financial crisis, central banks have engaged in continuous close consultation and have cooperated in unprecedented joint actions such as the provision of liquidity to reduce strains in financial markets," said the banks in a joint statement.
SNT.114652.15589	"Inflationary pressures have started to moderate in a number of countries, partly reflecting a marked decline in energy and other commodity prices."
SNT.114652.15590	"Inflation expectations are diminishing and remain anchored to price stability."
SNT.114652.15591	"The recent intensification of the financial crisis has augmented the downside risks to growth and thus has diminished further the upside risks to price stability."
SNT.114652.15592	"Accordingly, the Bank of Canada, the Bank of England, the European Central Bank, the Federal Reserve, Sveriges Riksbank, and the Swiss National Bank are today announcing reductions in policy interest rates."
SNT.114652.15593	"The Bank of Japan expresses its strong support of these policy actions."
SNT.114652.15594	Japan expressed support for the move, although it did not cut its own interest rate by 0.5% as that would mean bringing its interest rate down to 0% from 0.5%.
SNT.114652.15595	The US interest rate was lowered to 1.5% as part of the move, while the UK rate was lowered to 4.5%.
SNT.114652.15596	The new rate of the Swiss National Bank is 2.5%, while Sveriges Riksbank, the Swedish central bank, lowered its rate to 4.25%.
SNT.20378.15597	On September 29, Minnesota will become the first U.S. state to require diesel fuel sold at filling stations in the state to be blended with 2% biodiesel.
SNT.20378.15598	This follows the statewide mandate requiring ethanol to be mixed into gasoline—also a first by Minnesota—which took effect in 1997.
SNT.20378.15599	The biodiesel mandate was approved by the 2002 state legislature, and was sent to then-Governor Jesse Ventura.
SNT.20378.15600	Ventura allowed the bill to become law without his signature, stating his concern that the increased cost of fuel would affect the trucking industry—potentially spurring inflation—though he felt that this was nearly balanced by the positive impact the mandate would have on agriculture in the state.
SNT.20378.15601	The law had an initial target date of July 1, 2005, but would only go into effect once production capacity exceeded 8 million gallons (30 millon liters) per year.
SNT.20378.15602	At the beginning of 2005, the state was only capable of producing three million gallons each year, but two new facilities in Albert Lea and Brewster increased state capacity twentyfold when they opened this summer.
SNT.20378.15603	Each of the two new plants can produce 30 million gallons (113 ML) annually.
SNT.20378.15604	Agriculture Commissioner Gene Hugoson verified production levels in the August 29 edition of the Minnesota State Register, meaning that the law will become effective following a month-long notification period.
SNT.20378.15605	The prices of diesel and biodiesel have equalized, so the negative economic impact initially feared by Ventura are not expected to come to pass and the effect should be pennies more or less per gallon.
SNT.20378.15606	Despite the dramatic increase in capacity, biodiesel production is not yet a broad solution to shortages or high prices—in 2001, the state used 14.3 million gallons of petroleum every day.

SNT.55610.15621	Atmospheric scientists warn that greenhouse gas emissions are increasing more rapidly, despite global efforts to curb the use of fossil fuels, new research by Australia's Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) shows.
SNT.55610.15622	According to CSIRO research scientist Dr Mike Raupach, 7.9 billion tonnes of carbon were emitted into the atmosphere as carbon dioxide in 2005 - a doubling in the rate of increase since 1990 - and the rate of increase continues to accelerate.
SNT.55610.15623	Data from the Cape Grim air pollution monitoring station in north-west Tasmania shows carbon dioxide emissions have increased by 2.5% each year for the past five years.
SNT.55610.15624	"From 2000 to 2005, the growth rate of carbon dioxide emissions was more than 2.5% per year, whereas in the 1990s it was less than 1% per year," Dr Raupach says.
SNT.55610.15625	Dr Raupach, who co-chairs the international Global Carbon Project also, was surprised by his research results.
SNT.55610.15626	"It shows recent efforts globally to reduce emissions have had little impact on emissions growth," he said.
SNT.55610.15627	The CSIRO found that in global terms, China has the highest current growth rate in CO2 emissions although it's emissions per person are below the global average.
SNT.55610.15628	China's accumulated contribution since the start the 1800s is only five per cent of the global total.
SNT.55610.15629	The USA and Europe have each contributed more than 25% of accumulated global emissions.
SNT.55610.15630	Carbon dioxide concentrations in the atmosphere — a separate measure to carbon emissions — had also increased at an unprecedented rate.
SNT.55610.15631	Dr Paul Fraser, also from CSIRO Marine and Atmospheric Research, said that atmospheric concentrations of carbon dioxide grew by two parts per million in 2005, the fourth year in a row of above-average growth.
SNT.55610.15632	"To have four years in a row of above-average carbon dioxide growth is unprecedented," Dr Fraser said.
SNT.55610.15633	He said the trend over recent years suggests the growth rate is accelerating, "signifying that fossil fuels are having an impact on greenhouse gas concentrations in a way we haven’t seen in the past."

SNT.18522.15636	Israel also will stop issuing permits to close relatives of settlers.

SNT.113114.15656	The International Monetary Fund and the European Union approved aid packages to help Georgia recover from its conflict with Russia, which occurred in early August.
SNT.113114.15657	The IMF approved a US$750 million loan which will allow Georgia to rebuild its currency reserves.
SNT.113114.15658	The European Union also approved an aid package of €500 million in aid by 2010, which is expected to help internally displaced people (IDPs) and economic recovery in the form of new infrastructure.
SNT.113114.15659	Only €100 million of the EU aid will be given to Georgia this year.
SNT.113114.15660	These loans are aimed to restore confidence in Georgia's economy and send a signal to international investors that Georgia's economy is sound.
SNT.113114.15661	According to the IMF, international investors have been "critical to Georgia's economic growth in recent years."
SNT.113114.15662	Takatoshi Kato, Deputy Managing Director and Acting Chairman of the IMF executive committee, said the loan will "make significant resources available to replenish international reserves and bolster investor confidence, with the aim of sustaining private capital inflows that have been critical to Georgia's economic growth in recent years."
SNT.113114.15663	Georgia has requested $2 billion in international aid to help it recover from the conflict.
SNT.113114.15664	So far, the United States has pledged $1 billion in aid.
SNT.113114.15665	Further assistance and loans to Georgia are expected from other organizations.
SNT.113114.15666	Kato noted that "...Georgia is expected to receive financial assistance from multilateral and bilateral donors and creditors in support of the reconstruction effort."
SNT.113114.15667	It is expected that an international donors' conference will take place next month to solicit more aid for the country.
SNT.113114.15668	Georgia's government expects that economic growth will be more than cut in half as a result of the conflict.
SNT.113114.15669	Last year, Georgia's GDP increased 12.4% and it is predicted by the IMF that growth will be less than 4 percent in the coming year.
SNT.3693.15670	Commander Leroy Chiao and Flight Engineer Salizhan Sharipov have just completed their mission's first space walk aboard the International Space Station.
SNT.3693.15671	The mission lasted 5 hours, 28 minutes, ending at 1311 UTC.
SNT.3693.15672	The two astronauts, working in Russian space suits, performed a variety of tasks.
SNT.3693.15673	Chiao and Sharipov installed a work platform, called the Universal Work Platform, along with its base and associated wiring.
SNT.3693.15674	They also installed a commercial robotics experiment and a biological experiment on the exterior of the Zvezda Service Module.
SNT.3693.15675	In addition, they checked vents on systems that help control the Station's atmosphere and relocated a Japanese physical science experiment.
SNT.3693.15676	Residue accumulation around the vents of the Elektron oxygen generator was noted and photographed by Sharipov.
SNT.3693.15677	Technicians on the ground will analyze the information to determine if this residue has been contributing to the problematic operation of the Elektron.
SNT.3693.15678	During this spacewalk, the station again encountered the mysterious forces that have been saturating the Control Moment Gyros during previous spacewalks.
SNT.3693.15679	The walk marks Chiao's fifth for 31 hours, 34 minutes, accumulated time and Shapirov's first.
SNT.3693.15680	This was the 57th space walk conducted at the Station and the 32nd to be based out of the orbital outpost.
SNT.3693.15681	Expedition 10 is scheduled to conduct its second spacewalk in March.

SNT.2041.15710	December 22, 2004 The controversial European Union Directive on the Patentability of Computer Implemented Inventions, also called the "software patent directive" has been put to rest for 2004.
SNT.2041.15711	The directive was expected to easily pass through the European Council's Fisheries Council on Tuesday, December 21, but was removed from the agenda at the request of Poland's Minister of Science and Computerisation, Wlodzimierz Marcinski.
SNT.2041.15712	The directive's opponents, some of whom had conceded defeat on Tuesday before the vote was taken, will continue the debate informally until meetings resume in 2005.
SNT.2041.15713	Software developers, who supported the European Parliament's proposal last year to definitively rule out software patents, welcomed the delay as a chance to reintroduce those provisions into the current draft.
SNT.2041.15714	Florian Mueller, campaign manager of NoSoftwarePatents.com, which is supported by three IT companies (1&1, Red Hat, and MySQL AB), applauded Poland's move.
SNT.2041.15715	"The Polish government deserves greatest admiration for its courage!" said Mueller in a press release.
SNT.2041.15716	"Now Europe has the opportunity to have a constructive debate on the severe shortcomings of the current Council text, under the new Luxembourgish EU presidency next year."
SNT.2041.15717	Germany's representative also backed the delay, saying it would allow everyone to align the current proposal to changes proposed by the European Parliament last year.
SNT.2041.15718	"We were well aware that [the current proposal] has room for improvement with an eye to the objective of arriving at a consensus position between the EU Council and the European Parliament," Germany's Federal Minister of Justice Brigitte Zypries said in a Tuesday statement.
SNT.2041.15719	"We will continue to work constructively toward finding a solution that even better meets the needs of those concerned than the decision taken in May of this year."
SNT.2041.15720	On May 18, 2004 EU Council reached a political agreement on a "Common Position" on the directive which ignored the European Parliament's vote from last year.
SNT.2041.15721	Later, the Dutch parliament failed to convince its EU representatives to reverse their vote.
SNT.2041.15722	According to the new voting weights which took effect on November 1, the majority needed to formally adopt the Common Position (after translations were done) is questionable.
SNT.2041.15723	The 20 countries that supported the Directive on May 18 fall short of the new qualified majority by 16 votes.
SNT.19746.15724	Berlin's Neukoellner Opera House is causing a stir with its new production, The Yellow Princess.
SNT.19746.15725	The story presented in the French opera, by Camille Saint-Saens, is of an artist "whose life is dictated by a love for drugs and Japan."
SNT.19746.15726	As a result, the performers smoke cannabis joints on stage, and the theatre itself is encouraging the audience to join in.
SNT.19746.15727	Artistic director Bernhard Glocksin says that the theatre is claiming the metaphorical "artistic licence", to excuse the actions of the actors and audience, which are against German law.
SNT.19746.15728	Glocksin was quoted by Ananova as saying opera would be "improved with a few joints and some appetising lines", noting the production was partly an experiment, to see what they could "get away with."
SNT.19746.15729	"Artistic licence" is at par to an "artistic liberty", where something is exaggerated or changed for the sake of the art itself.
SNT.19746.15730	For example a visual artist painting a landscape might move a tree to another area of their work, for better balance, or a poet ignoring pentameter when writing a traditional sonnet.

SNT.104805.15819	Authorities say the investigation into how it started may take up to three days to finish.
SNT.104805.15820	So far there have been no injuries and no homes have yet been damaged, but one building storing equipment used by firefighters was burned to the ground.
SNT.104805.15821	For a short time, at least 100 hikers were trapped in the mountains and a boy scout camp was also threatened by the blaze.
SNT.104805.15822	Several people celebrating a wedding have also been trapped by the fire but are not injured and authorities say they are in no danger from the blaze.
SNT.104805.15823	However, there are currently around 1000 people under mandatory evacuations, and the city has been declared in a state of emergency.
SNT.104805.15824	It could take at least five days before the fire can be brought under full control.
SNT.122986.15825	Portions of Wikileaks.org, the "uncensorable Wikipedia for untraceable mass document leaking and analysis", has been blocked in Australia.
SNT.122986.15826	Wikinews has also learned that three URL links to Wikipedia, a free, online encyclopedia anyone can edit, have also been blocked.
SNT.122986.15827	Portions of the video sharing website YouTube have also been blocked.
SNT.122986.15828	The websites are among thousands of others that the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA), a government owned entity, block access to when using their blocking software.
SNT.122986.15829	The alleged three lists, from 2008 and 2009, were leaked to Wikileaks who published the documents.
SNT.122986.15830	Most of the blocked websites are ones hosting hardcore pornography.
SNT.122986.15831	According to their website, the ACMA's role in regards to the internet is to "address community concerns about offensive and illegal material online and, in particular, to protect children from exposure to material that is unsuitable for them."
SNT.122986.15832	Despite the alleged leak, Stephen Conroy, the Minister for Broadband, Communications and the Digital Economy in Australia, much of the listed websites were never an issue with the ACMA, but that some of the websites are.
SNT.122986.15833	He also goes on to say that anyone publishing the content of the ACMA's list will face criminal prosecution.
SNT.122986.15834	"I am aware of reports that a list of URLs has been placed on a website."
SNT.122986.15835	"ACMA is investigating this matter and is considering a range of possible actions it may take including referral to the Australian Federal Police."
SNT.122986.15836	"Any Australian involved in making this content publicly available would be at serious risk of criminal prosecution," said Conroy in a statement to the press.
SNT.122986.15837	Wikileaks insists the list is real and that publishing the three of them reflects what ones were added in the past, then removed or vice versa.
SNT.122986.15838	"Between the 11th and yesterday, the company did an enormous cleanup of the list."
SNT.122986.15839	"No doubt as a result of the list appearing on Wikileaks."
SNT.122986.15840	"Where the list previously contained over 2000 URLs, and Conroy and the ACMA claimed 'See! Our 'current list' never contained that many URLs', this new list is about the size the ACMA claimed it to be," said Wikileaks in a statement posted on their website.
SNT.122986.15841	Wikileaks recently leaked documents that revealed the ACMA's alleged list of 2,395 blocked websites, portions of Wikileaks being among them.
SNT.122986.15842	Of the three lists, the final one shows that the ACMA "cleaned up" their list, according to Wikileaks.
SNT.122986.15843	One of the blacklisted URLs to Wikileaks includes a leaked list of blocked websites in Denmark.
SNT.122986.15844	Not included on the list is the leaked list of blocked websites in Thailand.
SNT.122986.15845	"This week saw Australia joining China and the United Arab Emirates as the only countries censoring Wikileaks."
SNT.122986.15846	"Australian democracy must not be permitted to sleep with this loaded gun."
SNT.122986.15847	"If Australia's 'Senator for Censorship', Steven Conroy, has his way, Australia will be the first Western country to have a mandatory Internet censorship regime," said Wikileaks in another statement on their website.
SNT.122986.15848	"The first rule of censorship is that you cannot talk about censorship".
SNT.122986.15849	Portions of Wikipedia blocked include a photo taken by Wikinews contributor David Shankbone titled The making of an adult film by David Shankbone.
SNT.122986.15850	The URL was added to the ACMA's list on July 28, 2008.
SNT.122986.15851	However, Wikinews has learned that the file was deleted from Wikimedia Commons on January 21, by Wikipedia co-founder Jimmy Wales by "user request: Courtesy delete per request of uploader".
SNT.122986.15852	It was deleted more than one year after the ACMA added the URL to its list.
SNT.122986.15853	Other portions of Wikipedia that are blocked are pages belonging to users Cyde and Ewlyahoocom.
SNT.122986.15854	Wikinews contacted the ACMA for a statement, but as of this report, there was no response.
SNT.122986.15855	Wikinews also contacted Mr. Wales who confirmed the file was deleted because he was asked to do so.
SNT.122986.15856	"This had nothing to do with Australia," said Wales to Wikinews.
SNT.122986.15857	Wales did not say whether he was aware of the specific file linked to Wikipedia was being blocked.
SNT.122986.15858	The Wikipedia URLs appear on all three lists leaked by Wikileaks.
SNT.122986.15859	Another image, in the same photo set was also deleted by Mr. Wales on the same day, but that URL does not appear on the alleged ACMA list.
SNT.122986.15860	It underwent a request for deletion in 2008, which was later deleted despite it being discussed as 'keep'.
SNT.122986.15861	An anonymous source told Wikinews that the images were sexually explicit and featured three men, pornography star Michael Lucas, Rodrigo diCarli and Kurt Wild, having anal intercourse.
SNT.122986.15862	Shankbone told Wikinews that he has "no comment for this story."
SNT.122986.15863	Websites caught linking to or promoting websites on the ACMA's block list could face a fine of AU$11,000 per day if they don't remove the content in question within 24 hours of receiving a notice from the ACMA.
SNT.122986.15864	The same standard can be enforced on an international level.
SNT.122986.15865	Fines can be imposed on websites outside Australia that link to material on its list.
SNT.189902.15866	The MTR Corporation, the only railway company in Hong Kong since the rail merge in 2007, has loosened their rules.
SNT.189902.15867	The corporation proposed the new modifications, then transferred the proposal to the Legislative Council, and will be effective from September 2010.
SNT.189902.15868	The new set of rules allow 'non-disruptive' use of profanity in private conversations, and the punishment for inflammatory use of expletives is lowered from a fine of HK$5000 to HK$2000.

SNT.112839.15881	The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) that started preliminary experiments on September 10, 2008 in CERN,Geneva, and the planned International Linear Collider (ILC) will carry out a series of experiments in the future to validate the standard model of particle physics.
SNT.112839.15882	The model predicts that Higgs boson particles gives mass to all fundamental particles and explains the existence of dark matter, or invisible matter in between galaxies.
SNT.112839.15883	The LHC is a 27 kilometer long circular high energy particle accelerator which took more than 20 years and USD $9 billion to build.
SNT.112839.15884	In the next few weeks the machine will collide opposing beams of protons charged with approximately 7 TeV of energy resulting in cataclysmic conditions that will mimic the beginning of time, a re-creation of the Big Bang.
SNT.112839.15885	An upgraded version of the LHC was announced, nicknamed the "super LHC".
SNT.112839.15886	The new accelerator will perform ten times the number of collisions as the current LHC over the same time.
SNT.112839.15887	The upgrade will feature a new injection system and enhanced detectors to cope with the increase in data packets from collisions.
SNT.112839.15888	The bigger International Linear Collider, nicknamed "Einstein's telescope", is planned by the International Technology Recommendation Panel (ITRP).
SNT.112839.15889	The ILC will have a collision energy of 500 GeV and will collide electrons with particles of antimatter, called positrons, along a 30-40 km completely straight tunnel.
SNT.112839.15890	The ILC's two giant "guns" pointing at each other would be able to accelerate electrons and positrons to near-light speeds before smashing them together.
SNT.112839.15891	"The LHC smashes protons together to discover new particles but also generates lots of debris that obscures the fine detail."
SNT.112839.15892	"The ILC would be a much cleaner machine and tell us far more about their real nature."says Brian Foster, professor of experimental physics at Oxford University and European director of the project.
SNT.112839.15894	The host country for the ILC has not yet been chosen but it is planned to have the machine constructed by late 2010.
SNT.112839.15895	The new machine will cost an estimated USD $7 billion to build.
SNT.112839.15896	Physicists hope that ILC might be able to resolve some of the questions raised by Einstein's theories of relativity.

SNT.9531.15935	In the case of a Marine who fired upon an unarmed and wounded Iraqi in a mosque in November 2004, the U.S. Naval Criminal Investigative Service, headed by Major General Richard Natonski, ruled that the soldier acted in self-defense, and within the law of armed conflict.
SNT.9531.15936	In a statement released by the Marine Corps: "He has determined that the actions of the Marine in question were consistent with the established rules of engagement, the law of armed conflict and the Marine's inherent right of self-defense."
SNT.9531.15937	In a videotape of the event, the Camp Pendleton U.S. marine raises his weapon and fires into the body of a Iraqi lying up against a wall in a mosque.
SNT.9531.15938	When the Marine approached the wounded man, the marine is heard on the videotape saying, "He's f****** faking he's dead; he's faking he's f****** dead."
SNT.9531.15939	Then he fired his rifle point-blank at the man's head, at which point a companion said, "Well, he's dead now."
SNT.9531.15940	The shootings occurred inside a mosque during a U.S. offensive that led to house-to-house fighting in southern Falluja last November.
SNT.9531.15941	A television journalist embedded with the Marines recorded the killing on videotape.
SNT.9531.15942	The man killed was one of several Iraqi insurgents who had been wounded in fighting and then disarmed by marines, who then moved on leaving the wounded men in the mosque.
SNT.9531.15943	The next day a second line of marines moved through the area, who fought with more insurgents.
SNT.9531.15944	Due to the time that had passed since the first wave of marines, the second line assumed that any buildings could have been re-occupied by insurgents.
SNT.9531.15945	The corporal found wounded men in the mosque when they searched it.
SNT.9531.15946	At that moment marines from the first line of attack were approaching the mosque, among them the journalist, who had also been there the first time.
SNT.9531.15947	When they entered the journalist taped what he saw, the same people who were left there, disarmed.
SNT.9531.15948	Some were still alive and one marine thought a man lying on the ground was a threat because one of his arms was not clearly visible, so he could be hiding a weapon.
SNT.9531.15949	However, instead of keeping him covered so another could search him he shot him, while the journalist was taping it.
SNT.9531.15950	When the marine saw this and heard that these men had already been disarmed before he shouted that he didn't know that.
SNT.9531.15951	In sworn testimony, the corporal said he thought the people in the mosque were a threat.
SNT.9531.15952	A known tactic of anti-Iraqi forces (AIF) is to feign injury or death, and the marine could reasonably claim they were still a threat.
SNT.9531.15953	"The evidence supports the conclusion that the shooting of all three AIF by the corporal during the assault on the mosque was consistent with the ROE (rules of engagement)."
SNT.9531.15954	"The evidence indicates that based on the actions of those AIF, the corporal reasonably believed that they posed a hostile threat to him and his fellow Marines and justifiably fired in self-defense."
SNT.9531.15955	"The enhanced videotape of the shooting supports the corporal's claim that the wounded AIF was concealing his left arm behind his head."
SNT.9531.15956	"While it is not clear whether the AIF in the videotape made any overtly threatening gestures, it is clear that the Marines of 3/1, to include the corporal, were aware that feigning death was a common enemy TTP (tactics, techniques & procedures)."
SNT.9531.15957	"Accordingly, it was reasonable to believe that the corporal fired on the AIF after reasonably believing that the individual was committing a hostile act by exhibiting a known enemy TTP (feigning death and subsequently moving his concealed arm)."
SNT.9531.15958	"Based on all the evidence in the case, and the rules of engagement that were in effect at the time, it is clear that the corporal could have reasonably believed that the AIF shown in the videotape posed a hostile threat justifying his use of deadly force."
SNT.9531.15959	Kevin Sites, the NBC TV journalist who taped the event as "pool" footage, was embedded with the 3rd Battalion, 1st Marine Regiment when it neutralized Fallujah.
SNT.9531.15960	The incident in the mosque raised considerable controversy over whether embedded journalists should maintain a neutral point of view.
SNT.9531.15961	The unedited footage was aired extensively by Al Jazeera over the months following the incident.
SNT.9531.15962	Sharif Hikmat Nashashibi of the Arab Media Watch said the footage would support the idea in the Middle East that the prime concern of US forces is not the welfare of Iraqis.
SNT.9531.15963	In the USA, however, the shooting itself was not shown because NBC considered it too shocking.
SNT.9531.15964	Now that Sites is no longer embedded he wants to bring the whole story out in the open.
SNT.9531.15965	Despite the fact that Sites introduced the footage with a long explanation of how the soldiers were under a lot of stress, which could easily cloud their judgement, he received thousands of hate-mails per day and even death-threats
SNT.9531.15966	Sites later responded to the criticism in an open letter to the regiment in his weblog.

SNT.38369.15975	Mr Downer admitted that he did not have the time to read diplomatic cables and the only time he did so was when he is "stuck on a plane" and has nothing else to read.
SNT.38369.15976	The claims are in stark contrast to a statement made to parliament in February where Mr Downer said "Of course I would have read them".
SNT.38369.15977	When asked why the department of foreign affairs and trade did nothing about the allegations first received in 2000, he told the inquiry that his department couldn't investigate AWB and responsibility for the oil for food program laid with the UN.
SNT.38369.15978	"The department does not have the legal authority to go into AWB and access their files" he said.
SNT.38369.15979	"They (the UN) also had people on the ground in Iraq because insofar as there could be infringements of the sanctions regime, those infringements could take place within Iraq and Australia had no access to Iraq during that period."
SNT.38369.15980	Mr Downer admitted that the department of foreign affairs and trade had dealt with each cable, despite he not reading them and that were satisfied with assurances from AWB that there was no substance to the allegations.

SNT.38369.15982	The document alleged that Alia may have been paying kickbacks to the Iraqi regime.

SNT.38369.15983-1	"There is so much intelligence."
SNT.38369.15984	"It's a very major challenge, to deal with intelligence" he said.
SNT.38369.15985	When asked by Terry Forrest, counsel for AWB executives what the point of sending intelligence to his department when it was never read, Mr Downer conceded that it was "physically impossible" to read it all.
SNT.38369.15986	Mr Downer was also questioned about a cable delivered in June 2003 from US army captain Puckett which claimed that every contract under the UN's oil for food program contained a kickback.
SNT.38369.15987	Mr Downer told the inquiry he didn't see the cable as being important because the information was provided by "a junior officer in the US army".

SNT.38369.15989	According to Mr Downer it is common practice in his department to have two advisors at such meetings, where one of them takes notes so there is a record of what is said.
SNT.38369.15990	According to Mr Downer, no notes were taken during the meeting despite it being "the usual practice".

SNT.38369.15992	He also told the inquiry that he couldn't recall if he noticed that nobody was taking notes as he would have been "focused a little more on the meeting than on somebody taking notes".

SNT.147889.16076	On January 14, 2010, in a speech to parliament, Elbegdorj announced that he would pardon all persons sentenced to death, stating that most countries in the world had abolished the death penalty, and Mongolia should follow suit.
SNT.147889.16077	He also suggested that the death penalty be replaced with a 30 year prison sentence.
SNT.147889.16078	The decision was controversial: when Elbegdorj finished his speech, representatives of the Mongolian People's Revolutionary Party refused to join in the applause, which is customary after a presidential address to parliament.
SNT.147889.16079	Human rights groups welcomed the move, with Amnesty International expressing hope that Mongolia will vote in favour of an upcoming United Nations resolution calling for an end to Capital punishment.
SNT.147889.16080	It also urged other nations in the region to abolish the death penalty.
SNT.147889.16081	Many members of Mongolia's opposition-led parliament favour harsh punishments for criminals, and Elbegdorj must gain approval from parliament before the death penalty can be abolished.
SNT.147889.16082	If Elbegdorj fails to be re-elected, the new president could end the moratorium, and executions could resume.

SNT.144079.16084	Official results were released on Wednesday confirming that President Armando Guebuza had won another term in office.
SNT.144079.16085	The secretary-general of the opposition Renamo Party, Ussufo Momade, announced his party's rejection of the election results, saying there had been widespread fraud.
SNT.144079.16086	"We demand the cancellation of the results that were just announced and we insist on a new vote."
SNT.144079.16087	The National Electoral Commission said Wednesday that Guebuza had received more than 75% of the valid votes cast two weeks ago.
SNT.144079.16088	"The National Electoral Commission declares that Armando Emilio Guebuza has been elected president of the Republic of Mozambique for five years," the commission stated.
SNT.144079.16089	The president's Frelimo Party also won 191 of the 250 seats in parliament.
SNT.144079.16090	Before the elections, Frelimo had 160 seats and Renamo 90.
SNT.144079.16091	Frelimo has been in power since 1975, when Mozambique declared independence from Portugal.
SNT.144079.16092	Renamo's candidate, Afonso Dhlakama, received 16% of the vote, while the leader of a new party, Daviz Simango of the Mozambique Democratic Movement (MDM), received 8%.
SNT.144079.16093	Sixteen other parties were also in contention for parliament seats, but none of them received more than one percent of the vote.
SNT.144079.16094	Frelimo, which has a two-thirds majority in the parliament, has a sufficient number of seats to alter the constitution without support from other parties.
SNT.144079.16095	There has been some speculation that Frelimo may use this to allow Guebuza to run for a third term - currently, the constitution allows a president to serve only two terms in office.
SNT.144079.16096	Senior Frelimo party members, however, promised that Guebuza had no intention of seeking another term.
SNT.144079.16097	"The majority in parliament will give us more freedom to choose what is best for Mozambican people."
SNT.144079.16098	"And that is what we will continue to do in the next mandate," said Frelimo election officer Veronica Macamo.
SNT.144079.16099	Soon after the election results were announced, Renamo alleged that there had been widespread ballot-stuffing in some districts, and that its observers had been expelled from others.
SNT.144079.16100	The MDM also protested, saying ballots had been tampered with at some stations, and produced a cell phone video showing election officials apparently tampering with ballots.
SNT.144079.16101	The party also made a list of alleged voting irregularities, which was given to media and election observers.
SNT.144079.16102	He also rejected the electoral body's verdict that the poll was credible.
SNT.144079.16103	"What the CNE is saying is what Frelimo tells them to say."
SNT.144079.16104	"But what the international community didn't know is that those polling station agents were actually recruited to stuff the ballot boxes."
SNT.144079.16105	"If that was not the case, why did they arrest most of our polling station watchers?"
SNT.144079.16105-1	"That is exactly to create the opportunity for them to do the stuffing," he said.
SNT.144079.16106	An observation consortium of religious and civic groups conducted a parallel tabulation of the vote in eight percent of the stations nationwide.
SNT.144079.16107	The group said there were indications of irregularities in six percent of the voting stations.
SNT.144079.16108	Voter turnout nationwide was 45%, but some stations reported a turnout of 95% or more, raising suspicions that there was ballot stuffing involved.
SNT.144079.16109	Other voting stations reported a turnout of 15% or less.
SNT.144079.16110	Many ballots were disqualified because they had a check-mark beside the face of one candidate, but a fingerprint beside the face of another.
SNT.144079.16111	Some observers concluded that such fraud might have affected the outcome in one of the contests for parliament, and several of those for the provincial assemblies.
SNT.144079.16112	Most international observers, however, had deemed the elections fair and free, although there had been some criticism that the electoral commission had disqualified MDM candidates for all but four provincial assemblies on technical grounds.
SNT.144079.16113	"The pre-election phase was characterized by peaceful, tolerant and yet enthusiastic political atmosphere."
SNT.144079.16114	"There was clear evidence of vigor and enthusiasm among political parties as they conducted their campaigns," said the South African Development Community (SADC), which sent 98 observers to oversee the elections.
SNT.144079.16115	The national elections commission stated that no official complaints of voting irregularity were submitted to them.
SNT.144079.16116	"Political parties have two days after the voting day to present complaints or proof of irregularities."
SNT.144079.16117	"We did not receive any complaints during this period," said the chairman of Mozambique's National Elections Commission, Leopoldo da Costa.

SNT.266402.16195	Online organisations around the world are today testing (IPv6) — a new system of Internet addresses hoped to resolve the issue of the present system being at capacity.
SNT.266402.16196	The current standard was set up in the 1980s; it gives everything on the Internet a twelve-digit address and allows for 4.3 billion combinations.
SNT.266402.16197	With these exhausted, IPv6 is designed to increase the limit 340 undecillion — that's 340 trillion trillion trillion.
SNT.266402.16198	Major websites including services run by Google, Facebook, and Yahoo! are taking part in the test, switching their content to use the new system.
SNT.266402.16199	Facebook predicts 99.97% of users to be unaffected and Google anticipates 99.5% will not encounter problems.
SNT.266402.16200	Fiji and Australia are among the first countries to have business-hours web traffic during the test.
SNT.266402.16201	Internet Society of Australia President Tony Hill claims more than 100 global companies are involved.

SNT.309449.16224	Before gifting the castle to the local people in 1923, Lord Leverhulme invested in electric lighting, central heating, an internal telephone system, and the extension of the ballroom for social gatherings.
SNT.309449.16225	In World War II, the castle was the base for a Naval hospital and squadron of amphibious biplanes.
SNT.309449.16226	Post-war, it spent 30 years as a technical college and school.
SNT.309449.16227	If the final tranche of funding is secured, in 2014 the castle will become the first-ever archive facility in the Western Isles.
SNT.309449.16228	The collections of Museum nan Eilean (MnE) could move from their current home into the castle; items held by the National Archives of Scotland could return to their native isles.
SNT.309449.16229	And, modern facilities would permit collections from the National Museum of Scotland and the British Museum – such as the Lewis Chessmen – to be exhibited there.

SNT.106785.16275	Google, the owners of YouTube, claimed in a court briefing today that the one billion dollar lawsuit against the company "threatens the way hundreds of millions of people legitimately exchange information."
SNT.106785.16276	Viacom Inc. is suing Google over 150,000 videos, for which Viacom owns the copyright, that were allegedly being shown on YouTube.
SNT.106785.16277	Google has responded by saying that they followed the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, which prevents companies from being prosecuted if they bring down copyrighted content as soon as they are made aware of it.
SNT.106785.16278	"Viacom’s lawsuit challenges the protections of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act that Congress enacted a decade ago to encourage the development of services like YouTube," said Google.
SNT.106785.16279	"Congress recognized that such services could not and would not exist if they faced liability for copyright infringement based on materials users uploaded to their services.
SNT.106785.16280	It chose to immunize these services from copyright liability provided they are properly responsive to notices of alleged infringement from content owners."
SNT.106785.16281	"Looking at the online world today, there is no question that Congress made the correct policy choice," Google continued.
SNT.106785.16282	"Legitimate services like YouTube provide the world with free and authorized access to extraordinary libraries of information that would not be available without the DMCA -- information created by users who have every right to share it."
SNT.106785.16283	Google then claimed that "YouTube also fulfills its end of the DMCA bargain, and indeed goes far beyond its legal obligations in assisting content owners to protect their works."

SNT.196063.16327	After an investigation, Wikinews has learned that oil spewing from a rupture in the seafloor of the Gulf of Mexico on June 13 was 50 to 60 feet from the Deepwater Horizon leak.
SNT.196063.16328	A nearly four and a half minute video posted on YouTube on June 13 was from the Viking Poseidon ROV (Remote Operated Vehicle) 1.
SNT.196063.16329	It shows oil and methane leaking from the seafloor at around 2:48 a.m. on June 13.
SNT.196063.16330	The ROV monitors the leak for a minute and even gets covered in a plume of oil and sand before it moved on to the next spot.
SNT.196063.16331	Smaller eruptions were seen as the ROV traveled, making the leak locations vary from 50 to 60 feet from the damaged well.
SNT.196063.16332	Until now, there was no way to determine the location of the ROVs in relation to the previously leaking Deepwater Horizon well.
SNT.196063.16333	Alexander Higgins, an independent computer programmer, developed the 'Gulf Oil Spill ROV UTM Distance Calculator.'
SNT.196063.16334	Higgins told Wikinews how he created the calculator, and says it is "very accurate," but that the tool would "not give you accurate measurements over a large distance, e.g. from the well head to New Orleans."
SNT.196063.16335	BP, who owned and operated the Deepwater Horizon, has denied that any oil or methane gas is leaking from the sea floor.
SNT.196063.16336	Seismic tests were conducted on July 16; Admiral Thad Allen of the United States Coast Guard said that "no anomalies" were found, but also that the tests were "not comprehensive."
SNT.196063.16337	On Sunday, Wikinews contacted BP, who authenticated the video, and asked if any ROVs were sent back to the crack and leak location on June 13 for further investigation.
SNT.196063.16338	According to their office in London, England, they "sent ROVs to investigate and monitor that and no further signs of oil or gas were found."
SNT.196063.16339	They also stated that they "have continued to monitor" and "have also carried out seismic surveys.
SNT.196063.16340	Wikinews also asked if they could confirm the location of the leak and crack, but no response was given.
SNT.196063.16341	However, on July 18, the Associated Press reported that there was "seepage" coming from the area at the bottom of the Deepwater well head.
SNT.196063.16342	For the past two days, ROV cameras showed bubbles coming from the base of well.
SNT.196063.16343	BP said it would test the bubbles to determine what they are and as of Sunday, COO of BP Doug Suttles says the bubbles are not methane, but further tests are being conducted.
SNT.196063.16344	"If you can imagine, it is not an easy operation to collect those bubbles so that they can be tested to see what their make-up is."
SNT.196063.16345	Since the June 13 video surfaced, other videos have been posted to YouTube allegedly showing some of the ROVs being tossed around by large amounts of oil seeping through the seafloor.
SNT.196063.16346	One video showed an alleged eruption spraying oil and debris around the BOA DEEP C 2 ROV before it was tossed from side to side.
SNT.196063.16347	Some of the cracks on ocean floors, where oil has leaked from, have occurred naturally.
SNT.196063.16348	One such oil spill in California in 2005 was the result of a naturally occurring crack in the floor of the Pacific Ocean.
SNT.196063.16349	Some of those cracks can cause oil to leak through at a rate as high as 5,000 gallons a day, with most of the oil not even reaching the water's surface.
SNT.196063.16350	In the Gulf of Mexico, oil leaks through natural cracks at a rate several times less than leaked from the Deepwater well.
SNT.196063.16351	"The Deepwater Horizon site releases 3 to 12 times the oil per day compared to that released by natural seeps across the entire Gulf of Mexico.
SNT.196063.16352	By May 30, the Deepwater Horizon site had released between 468,000 and 741,000 barrels of oil, compared to 60,000 to 150,000 barrels from natural seeps across the entire Gulf of Mexico over the same 39 day period," said Cutler Cleveland, a Boston University professor at the university's Department of Geography and Environment.
SNT.196063.16353	The Deepwater Horizon oil spill started on April 20 after an explosion on the rig.
SNT.196063.16354	Efforts to put out the fire failed and the rig subsequently sank to the bottom of the Gulf.
SNT.196063.16355	On April 22, an oil slick appeared on the surface of the Gulf.
SNT.196063.16356	BP capped the leaking well on July 13 which effectively stopped oil from leaking into the Gulf.
SNT.196063.16357	The company has been running a pressure integrity test on the 150,000 pound cap for 48 hours.
SNT.196063.16358	Earlier on July 17, they announced the test would continue for another day.
SNT.196063.16359	BP hopes for the well's pressure to rise to or above 7,500 PSI.
SNT.196063.16360	As of Saturday morning the well's pressure was just above 6,700 PSI.
SNT.196063.16361	BP fears anything lower than the expected PSI could mean a leak in the cap or elsewhere, such as oil or methane seeping up from the seafloor.
SNT.196063.16362	We will keep monitoring and make the decisions as we go forward.
SNT.196063.16363	The longer the test goes the more confidence we have in it," said Allen.

SNT.58381.16365	The sole production will occur after Canon Inc. buys the stake of Toshiba Corp. in their joint venture, SED Inc.
SNT.58381.16366	The companies are expected to make an official statement concerning their joint venture.

SNT.6759.16375-2	Probably not, but the results of the poll offer a worrisome picture about our problems getting a good night’s sleep.
SNT.6759.16376	The National Sleep Foundation, the poll sponsor, reports three-quarters of adults say they frequently have a sleep problem, such as waking during the night or snoring.
SNT.6759.16377	The average adult gets less than the recommended seven to nine hours of uninterrupted sleep each night.
SNT.6759.16378	This leads to poorer health, lower productivity on the job, more danger on the roads and a less vibrant sex life.
SNT.6759.16379	One-fourth admit their sleep problems do have an impact on their daily lives.

SNT.6759.16381	But Guillermo Sardina, 55, of Hamilton, N.J., said "I sleep through the night.
SNT.6759.16382	Darwin McCallian, 51, of Burke, Va., rises at 4 a.m. to get a jump on traffic for his commute to Washington, DC.
SNT.6759.16383	"When I sleep in a little bit longer, it makes me a safer driver," McCallian noted.
SNT.6759.16384	They recommend avoiding alcohol and caffeine close to bedtime, and that adults pay attention to how much sleep they get as well as the quality of that sleep, and seek help if needed.

SNT.500861.16395	Ryan, 42, has represented Wisconsin's 1st congressional district since 1999 and serves as chairman of the House Budget Committee.
SNT.500861.16396	Last year, he authored the budget proposal, The Path to Prosperity, which promotes reductions in federal spending of $6.2 trillion from the Obama plan through a repeal of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, a reformation of Medicare, and capping of federal discretionary spending.

SNT.500861.16398	He added that the campaign "won't duck the tough issues—we will lead" and went after the record of President Barack Obama, arguing that his policies "didn't make things better."
SNT.500861.16399	On the announcement, senior Obama staffers explained that Ryan's selection "makes clear that Romney would be a rubber stamp for the congressional GOP" and that the choice provides the Obama campaign with "clear advantages".
SNT.500861.16400	According to Reuters, Romney made the decision on August 1 after returning from his international trip.
SNT.500861.16401	Four days later, Ryan was secretly flown to Brookline, Massachusetts to meet Romney at the home of Beth Myers, who was running the vice presidential search.

SNT.500861.16403	Thereafter, the campaign decided to make the announcement in Virginia, and so Ryan was once again secretly flown, this time to Elizabeth City, North Carolina near Norfolk, where he met with Romney and prepared his acceptance speech.
SNT.500861.16404	NBC News first announced the decision, and the Romney campaign announced the news to supporters through a phone application at seven a.m., a couple of hours before the official announcement.
SNT.35960.16405	NASA has announced that the Cassini spacecraft has found what seem to be geysers spewing water on the moon Enceladus.
SNT.35960.16406	The find raises the possibility of life on other planets, as liquid water is believed to be a requirement for life.
SNT.35960.16407	"This marks the first time that scientists have seen evidence of water in liquid form so close to the surface on another body beyond Earth," said Cassini scientist Torrence Johnson.
SNT.35960.16408	Although life may be found on the moon, most scientists concede that if Enceladus does harbor life, it probably consists of microbes or other robust organisms capable of living in extreme conditions.
SNT.35960.16409	This latest discovery shows that life in other parts of the universe may be more probable than previously thought.
SNT.35960.16410	"We realize that this is a radical conclusion — that we may have evidence for liquid water within a body so small and so cold," said Dr. Carolyn Porco, Cassini imaging team leader at the Space Science Institute, Boulder, Colorado.
SNT.35960.16411	"However, if we are right, we have significantly broadened the diversity of solar system environments where we might possibly have conditions suitable for living organisms."
SNT.783340.16412	Irish budget airline Ryanair have dismissed pilot John Goss, who has worked with the airline for 25 years, over remarks he made in a documentary about safety at the airline.
SNT.783340.16413	Ryanair issued a statement confirming legal proceedings have been begun against Goss.
SNT.783340.16414	The airline is already suing the UK's Channel 4 over Monday night's broadcast of Secrets of the Cockpit, part of the Dispatches series, in which Goss appeared.
SNT.783340.16415	The programme discussed the airline's safety with a focus on fuel policy, investigating allegations Ryanair uses a bare minimum of fuel and intimidates pilots who raise concerns.
SNT.783340.16416	Goss, who had been due to retire in October, is a key figure of Ryanair Pilots Group (RPG), which conducted a survey of more than 1,000 flight crew.
SNT.783340.16417	According to the RPG survey almost 90% of respondents said the safety culture was nontransparent.
SNT.783340.16418	Ryanair had told pilots anybody signing a "so-called safety petition" might be dismissed.
SNT.783340.16419	Pilots interviewed for the programme said they felt pressured to save fuel, the cost of which has hit Ryanair's profits.
SNT.783340.16420	Following an incident in Spain in which three Ryanair flights declared fuel emergencies after being diverted to Valencia the Spanish Air Authority described Ryanair flights usually landing with a bare minimum of fuel, in a report the airline dismissed as "manifestly inaccurate and factually untrue".
SNT.783340.16421	One anonymous pilot interviewed by Channel 4 accused the airline of "threats and bullying".
SNT.783340.16422	Over 90% of those surveyed wanted a regulatory inquiry, with RPG saying the survey results were passed to the airline and the Irish Aviation Authority.
SNT.783340.16423	RPG is not recognised by the airline which calls the group "[lacking] any independence, objectivity or reliability" and a union front.
SNT.783340.16424	The other pilots interviewed by Channel 4 chose to remain anonymous, with only Goss identifying himself.
SNT.783340.16425	The airline says RPG only conducted their survey to unionise Ryanair pilots and issued a statement describing the documentary as "based on nothing more than anonymous hearsay claims made by individuals whose identity was concealed, and/or by representatives of pilot unions of Ryanair's competitor airlines masquerading as a non-Ryanair Pilot Group".

SNT.100309.16440	"Dissent is the mother of ascent, and in that context I have decided to run for president," said Nader.

SNT.145758.16460	Indonesia's High Court in Yogyakarta has overturned the April conviction of a Garuda Indonesia pilot who was behind the controls in an air disaster.
SNT.145758.16461	Captain Marwoto Komar was cleared of negligently causing the deaths of 21 when his Boeing 737 overshot the runway at Adisucipto Airport.
SNT.145758.16462	The March 2007 crash occurred after the flight from Jakarta landed at excessive speed and a steep angle.
SNT.145758.16463	The jet bounced down the runway before overshooting and coming to rest in a rice field, where it was destroyed by fire.
SNT.145758.16464	Of the 140 on board, sixteen Indonesians and five Australians were killed.
SNT.145758.16465	The court in Komar's trial had ruled that while it could not be shown for sure that the aircraft was mechanically sound with the Captain solely responsible for the dangerous landing, Komar had two minutes in which to inform air traffic control and his co-pilot Gagam Salman R. that they were experiencing an emergency.
SNT.145758.16466	The court found that had he done so Aircraft Rescue and Firefighting equipment could have been mobilised ready for the incoming jet.
SNT.145758.16467	The investigation by the National Transportation Safety Committee (KNKT) found no mechanical defect and stated that fifteen activations of the Ground proximity warning system had been ignored, but international law made this inadmissible as evidence.
SNT.145758.16468	The ruling was overturned in September, but has only just been published.
SNT.145758.16469	The High Court ruled that the prosecution had failed to "legally and convincingly" demonstrate guilt and therefore "the defendant's rights, position and status should be restored."
SNT.145758.16470	Komar received half of the four year sentence sought by prosecutors but avoided jail as he was freed on bail while the appeal was pending.
SNT.145758.16471	Komar's lawyer Mochtar Zuhdi said the High Court decision was final and cannot be appealed.
SNT.145758.16472	The decision to charge Captain Komar was highly controversial; the first time Indonesia prosecuted a pilot over a crash.
SNT.145758.16473	Indonesia Air Traffic Controllers Association chief Adrie Gunawan said that 26 controllers left the country fearing possible prosecutions if anything went wrong on their shift; they also threatened to strike.
SNT.145758.16474	Indonesian Pilots' Association chief Manotar Napitupulu said "This shows that the justice system has finally understood that Marwoto’s case did not belong in court."
SNT.145758.16475	Last year Wikinews interviewed Paul McCarthy, an aviation lawyer and pilot who serves as the International Federation of Air Line Pilots' Associations' representative to the International Civil Aviation Organisation.
SNT.145758.16476	McCarthy said that prosecuting the man could have a chilling effect on people speaking to accident investigators, hence affecting safety.
SNT.145758.16477	Victims' families in Australia are upset and angry at the decision.
SNT.145758.16478	The Sydney Morning Herald used a headline that stated "Ruling denies justice for Australian crash victims".
SNT.145758.16479	"The fact he has had his conviction quashed and pilot status reinstated, it's like nothing's happened," said Caroline Mellish, whose brother Morgan was killed.
SNT.145758.16480	Simone Kerr, who lost her sister in the disaster, said "My greatest fear is that he will be flying again."

SNT.131943.16499	Two CH-47 Chinook helicopters were called in on Wednesday, September 2nd, to help contain the wildfires on the Hawaiian Island of Molokai.
SNT.131943.16500	Smaller helicopters that were fighting the fire since it started around noon on August 29th were redeployed as well.
SNT.131943.16501	According to Gen Iinuma, Maui County Civil Defense administrator, the CH-47s carry 2000-gallon buckets of water, whereas the smaller helicopters only have 100-gallon buckets.
SNT.131943.16502	The Chinooks can dump more water in fewer trips than the smaller helicopters.
SNT.131943.16503	On the other hand, the tremendous downdraft from the bigger aircraft may make the fire worse.
SNT.131943.16504	"If they don't do it right, they'll fan the fire," Iinuma said.
SNT.131943.16505	According to Iinuma, ground crews are continuing to maintain the fire's perimeter, which remained unchanged from Tuesday.
SNT.131943.16506	The helicopters are being used to fight the fires where ground crews can't reach, such as steep mountain passes and valleys.
SNT.131943.16507	Iinuma also expressed concern about a red flag advisory the National Weather service put out for all leeward areas of the Hawaiian Islands, meaning conditions are ripe for fires.
SNT.131943.16508	Lieutenant Governor James "Duke" Aiona, who took an aerial survey of Molokai's brush fire area, said it was "no immediate threat".
SNT.131943.16509	He also noted that the fire seemed to come right up to the perimeter of some properties, but almost always stopped there.
SNT.131943.16510	Aiona's observations are mirrored by a local business owners' story.
SNT.131943.16511	The wildfires destroyed the beehives of Molokai Meli, a family-owned honey business in Kapaakea, but residents admit that the beehives were not their main concern.
SNT.131943.16512	"We were just beating the edges with wet towels and sheets to try and keep it from getting to the houses that are just right over that ridge," said co-owner Brenda Kaneshiro.
SNT.131943.16513	"All that metal right there, that's where they all were, there were 33 of them," said Elijah Kaneshiro, the owner's son.

SNT.80810.16579	He flew a distance of 1,300 kilometres in a wheel well of a Boeing 737 and lived.
SNT.80810.16580	The fifteen year old Andrey Scherbakov spent two hours in the wheel well of the airplane at extreme temperature of −50° centigrade.
SNT.80810.16581	The rear wheels do not go all the way into the plane; the wheel merely retracts into an opening and remains exposed.
SNT.80810.16582	The boy managed to bypass security at the Perm city airport to hide in the plane as it took off.

SNT.80810.16587	However, according to the medical staff at the hospital, it is nothing short of a miracle that the boy survived the ordeal.
SNT.80810.16588	The Boeing 737 has a cruising speed of 900 kilometres per hour and was flying constantly at an altitude of 10,000 metres for two hours.
SNT.80810.16589	As a result, the boy suffered severe frostbite in both of his hands.
SNT.80810.16590	Doctors in Ural city would have to remove his fingertips, which contracted gangrene after they had frozen, but they were committed to do everything within their power to stop it from spreading.

SNT.80810.16592	He said that he was wandering around the territory of the airport and noticed a hole in the fence.

SNT.80810.16594	It is curious how the inspection staff and the technicians found nothing on their inspection of the aircraft just before the flight.
SNT.80810.16595	The boy claims that he fainted soon after and came around only when the plane had landed in Moscow after traveling hundreds of kilometres from Perm.
SNT.80810.16596	However, Moscow's air and water transport control department said that the claim was true.
SNT.80810.16597	A department spokesperson said that the incident happened on Friday, and the boy's parents were immediately informed and flew into the capital on the same day.

SNT.31936.16608	In a move aimed to prevent fines stemming from its antitrust lawsuit filed by the European Commission (EC), Microsoft announced that it will be releasing portions of the source code to its Windows operating system.
SNT.31936.16609	The EC ruled in March 2004 that Microsoft had abused its position in the low-end server and media player market, and required that Microsoft "disclose complete and accurate interface documentation which would allow non-Microsoft work group servers to achieve full interoperability with Windows PCs and servers".
SNT.31936.16610	Microsoft reacted by making available 12,000 pages of technical documentation and up to 500 hours of technical support, but the EC came to the conclusion that it was not enough.
SNT.31936.16611	Announcing that "we are putting our most valuable intellectual property on the table so we can put technical compliance issues to rest", Microsoft General Counsel Brad Smith asserted that Microsoft would be superseding the EC's requirements as a sign of good faith.
SNT.31936.16612	"While we are confident that we are presently in full compliance with the Decision, we wish to dispel any notion that Microsoft’s technical documents are insufficient", said Smith.
SNT.31936.16613	The EC responded in a memo that it will study Microsoft's reply to the Statement of Objections once it receives the full details.
SNT.31936.16614	However, EC Competition Commissioner spokesman Jonathan Todd commented that "it would be premature to conclude access to the source code would resolve the problem of the lack of compliance with our decision."
SNT.31936.16615	A similar offer was made by Microsoft in August 2002 during its antitrust lawsuit filed by the United States Department of Justice and several states' Attorneys General.
SNT.31936.16616	The resulting "Microsoft Communications Protocols Program" had suffered continuous criticism regarding excessive cost, paperwork, and non-disclosure agreements.
SNT.31936.16617	It is unclear at this time if Microsoft's planned "Work Group Server Protocol Program" will suffer from the same issues if accepted by the EC.
SNT.31936.16618	Microsoft is expected to return to the EC courts in April.
