SNT.96436.16620	The promotional video appeared on video-sharing sites including YouTube, Gawker.com and radar online.com, and clips from the video were also shown on Wednesday morning talk shows in the United States.
SNT.96436.16621	In the 9-minute video produced by the Church of Scientology, Cruise is seen discussing his beliefs while the theme from his Mission: Impossible films plays as background music.
SNT.96436.16622	Cruise appears wearing a black turtleneck sweater, speaking about his dedication to changing people's lives.
SNT.96436.16623	The format of the video appears to be an interview with Cruise, and it is edited with questions cut out.
SNT.96436.16624	Throughout the video, Cruise uses Scientology jargon terms such as "KSW": "For me, it’s all about KSW."
SNT.96436.16625	The term stands for Keeping Scientology Working, which refers to a 10-point letter written by Scientology founder L. Ron Hubbard in 1965 to ensure the organization's survival.
SNT.96436.16626	Cruise also discusses "SPs", or Suppressive Persons, "PTSPs", a "potential trouble source" influenced by a Suppressive Person, and the need to "confront and shatter suppression".
SNT.96436.16627	Cruise makes assertions about programs which use Hubbard's teachings such as Criminon and Narconon "We're the authorities on getting people off drugs."
SNT.96436.16628	Of the manner in which he wishes to spread Scientology's message, he says "You're in the playing field or out of the arena."
SNT.96436.16629	The video concludes with Cruise laughing, and then a voiceover says: "Scientology can be defined by a single question: would you want others to develop the knowledge you have?"
SNT.96436.16629-1	" In answering that question, Tom Cruise has introduced LRH [L. Ron Hubbard] technology to more than 1 billion people on earth."
SNT.96436.16630	"And that is only the first wave he has unleashed."
SNT.96436.16631	"That is why the story of Tom Cruise, Scientologist, has only just begun."
SNT.96436.16632	According to Reuters, the Church of Scientology stated that the video was shown at a 2004 meeting of the International Association of Scientologists.
SNT.96436.16633	In a statement, the Church of Scientology said that the video was Cruise's acceptance speech after he had been given the organization's "Freedom Medal", and was shown "before an audience of 5,000 church parishioners and their guests."
SNT.96436.16634	The statement also called the video that appeared on the Internet a "pirated and edited version."
SNT.96436.16635	A representative for Cruise confirmed the Church of Scientology statement: "The video is of Mr. Cruise making an acceptance speech to fellow parishioners at a private church event in 2004."
SNT.96436.16636	David Miscavige, head of the Church of Scientology, had presented Cruise with the "Freedom Medal of Valor" at the 2004 ceremony.
SNT.96436.16637	Eighty Scientologists have received the "Freedom Medal" since the award's establishment in 1985, but Cruise is the only recipient of the Freedom Medal of Valor.
SNT.96436.16638	Andrew Morton's Tom Cruise: An Unauthorized Biography characterizes Cruise as the second most powerful individual within the organization.
SNT.96436.16639	The video first appeared on the Internet on Sunday, and disappeared after the footage was linked to from Gawker.com and The Huffington Post.
SNT.96436.16640	Gawker.com posted a copy of the video Tuesday morning, and said that the video had "been passed around privately by reporters and writers investigating Cruise's ties to Scientology."
SNT.96436.16641	Gawker.com noted that a smaller video clip which had previously been available on YouTube "is no longer available, most likely after the Church of Scientology sent in a copyright infringement notice."
SNT.96436.16642	Gawker.com has stated that the video will stay up on its site, and has reprinted correspondence with Ava Paquette, an attorney with Moxon & Kobrin, a law firm representing the Church of Scientology.
SNT.96436.16643	Nick Denton of Gawker.com commented on the posting of the video "It's newsworthy, and we will not be removing it."
SNT.96436.16644	Investigative journalist Mark Ebner is helping to post more than two hours of additional footage related to the Cruise video, and called it "the most unintentionally hilarious footage you've ever seen," and characterized it as "better than" when Cruise jumped on Oprah's couch during a May 23, 2005 appearance on The Oprah Winfrey Show, and the South Park parody of Cruise in the controversial episode "Trapped in the Closet".
SNT.96436.16645	Ebner appeared on The Today Show on Wednesday, and discussed the video's appearance on the Internet.
SNT.96436.16646	In response, the Church of Scientology called Ebner a "fraud".
SNT.96436.16647	Ebner told the New York Daily News that "These tapes were made for purposes of recruitment."
SNT.96436.16648	Attempts by the Church of Scientology to stop distribution of the video via the Internet "seem to have backfired spectacularly," according to The Press Association, and by Thursday the video was viewable on websites other than Gawker.com, including the New York Post, Independent Television News and the BBC.
SNT.96436.16649	For websites based in Britain usage of the video is protected under copyright laws, specifically for reporting news and current affairs.
SNT.96436.16650	Still other reports on the video linked to locations where it could be watched, including a report in The Times.
SNT.96436.16651	Copies of the video were not available on Google Video on Thursday, but were still available on YouTube.
SNT.96436.16652	Attorney Mark Stephens of London-based firm Finers Stephens Innocent commented on the Church of Scientology's attempts to remove the video from the Internet: "The Scientologists, by taking action to enforce their copyrights, have made it a news story."
SNT.96436.16653	"The mistake was not to foresee that a news story has special protection in copyright law in reporting news and current events."

SNT.65379.16693	Rooney then had a chance for a brace, but his hard shot was palmed away by Lee.

SNT.102842.16699	A final report released today by the Indonesian National Transport Safety Committee found that Adam Air Flight 574 crashed because the pilots were distracted by an instrument failure.
SNT.102842.16700	The loss of the budget carrier's Boeing 737 into the sea near Sulawesi on New Year's Day 2007 left all 102 on board missing and presumed dead.
SNT.102842.16701	The report found that the 737, registered PK-KKW, suffered a Inertial Reference System (IRS) failure.
SNT.102842.16702	While pilots were troubleshooting for this navigational system they first unintentionally disconnected the autopilot, then failed to monitor other instruments informing them they were approaching the sea, crashing into it and destroying the aircraft.
SNT.102842.16703	The flight had been a scheduled domestic passenger service between Djuanda Airport at Surabaya and Sam Ratulangi Airport at Manado, and disappeared from radar screens at 35,000 feet.
SNT.102842.16704	National Transportation Safety Committee head Tatang Kurniadi told a press conference "This accident resulted from a combination of factors including the failure of the pilots to adequately monitor the flight instruments, especially in the last two minutes of the flight."
SNT.102842.16705	Preoccupation with a malfunction of the Inertial Reference System diverted both pilot's attention from the flight instruments and allowed the increasing descent and bank angle to unnoticed...
SNT.102842.16706	"The Cockpit Voice recorder revealed that both pilots were concerned about navigation problems and subsequently become engrossed with trouble shooting Inertial Reference System (IRS) anomalies for at least the last 13 minutes of the flight, with minimal regard to other flight requirements."
SNT.102842.16707	He also supplied a number of statistics concerning the final moments of the flight.
SNT.102842.16708	Whilst in a right bank with sustained elevator input pushing up the nose the aircraft reached Mach 0.926 and 3.5g.
SNT.102842.16709	The airspeed had reached 490 KCAS by the end of the recording.
SNT.102842.16710	Investigator Santoso Sayogo said that the high speed impact caused the plane to disintegrate.
SNT.102842.16711	In 2006 another B737 suffered a navigational problem and flew into a radar blackspot, leaving it lost for several hours before performing an emergency landing hundreds of miles from the intended destination.
SNT.102842.16712	Sayogo said today that in the three months preceding the accident the airline had registered 154 defects in PK-KKW's navigational equipment.
SNT.102842.16713	The crash, coupled with Adam Air Flight 172, which snapped in half during a hard landing, and Garuda Indonesia Flight 200, which overshot the runway in Yogyakarta, killing 21, prompted the European Union to add all Indonesia's airlines to the list of air carriers banned in the EU.
SNT.102842.16714	Earlier this month another Adam Air flight departed the end of a runway during landing, injuring five and damaging the plane.
SNT.102842.16715	This prompted the authorities to ground Adam Air for three months after a regular evaluation, after which they may be permanently shut down.

SNT.120389.16732	Authorities in Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden have warned that starting from February 9, the government will impose hefty fines of 200 Swiss Francs (£122, €135) on naturists found walking or hiking in the nude without clothes in the picturesque mountains because of a recent influx of visiting German nudists.
SNT.120389.16733	The new ordinance is expected to be passed this spring.
SNT.120389.16734	If it is approved by the local parliament on February 9 it should be effective on April 26.
SNT.120389.16735	The Swiss canton aims to stop spread of 'indecent practice' by minimally-clad German climbers.
SNT.120389.16736	The problem started with a group of "boot-only hikers" who were stopped by the police in the Alpine region last autumn.
SNT.120389.16737	They had wandered there regularly, proudly marching through nature with bare bums, and had also advertised what they thought was a naked paradise on the internet.
SNT.120389.16738	A nude rambler dressed in nothing more than a rucksack and walking boots in the eastern Appenzell region was arrested and detained in the canton, but authorities were unable to file lawsuit because the act was not punished by law or ordinance at the time.
SNT.120389.16739	"We were forced to introduce the legislation against this indecent practice before the warm weather starts," Melchior Looser, the canton’s justice and police minister, said.
SNT.120389.16740	“Ultimately, in the summer lots of kids stay in our mountains,” he added.
SNT.120389.16741	In the guidelines imposed, arrested offenders who cannot pay the fine, will face legal action.
SNT.120389.16742	The new enabling ordinance has, however, been met with protests by nude hikers.
SNT.120389.16743	"It's the most harmless pursuit possible," said Dietmar, age 58, a German lawyer.
SNT.120389.16744	German tabloid Bild Zeitung has editorially attacked Swiss intolerance and even suggested nudist alternatives worldwide, after hinting a Swiss tourism boycott.
SNT.120389.16745	Local authorities of Harz mountain range in central Germany have also announced the openness to any visitor of an “official naked walking route” in nature's outdoors.
SNT.120389.16746	The naked ramblers have hoped it doesn't lead to another naturist-clothed 'war', like the one at a beach between German and Polish holidaymakers in 2008.
SNT.120389.16747	Naturism has roots traced from the start of the 20th century.
SNT.120389.16748	"Abandoning unpractical clothes enables a direct contact with the wind, sun and temperature", naked hiker website nacktwandern.de stated.
SNT.120389.16749	"The local people are upset and we in the government share their concern."
SNT.120389.16750	"How would one feel if one was to go walking in nature and suddenly came across a group of naked people? "
SNT.120389.16750-1	"They are definitely not people from the area, and I think many of them come from Germany,” he noted.
SNT.120389.16751	"I can understand that we all have to live in this world together," said Barbara Foley, International Naturist Foundation member of the central committee.
SNT.120389.16752	"But I would certainly enjoy doing the hike in the nude and I wouldn't want to be deprived of it."
SNT.120389.16753	"Maybe they should designate a couple of trails and people would know they might come across naturists there," she added.

SNT.120389.16755	The population of the canton was 15,471 as of 2007, of which 1,510 (or 9.76%) were foreigners.
SNT.120389.16756	The canton in the north east of Switzerland has an area is 173 km².
SNT.120389.16757	It was divided in 1597 for religious reasons from the former canton Appenzell, with Appenzell Ausserrhoden being the other half.
SNT.120389.16758	Most of the canton is pastoral, this despite being mountainous.
SNT.120389.16759	Cattle breeding and dairy farming are the main agricultural activities: Appenzeller cheese is widely available throughout Switzerland.
SNT.120389.16760	Due to the split of Appenzell along religious lines, the population (as of 2000) is nearly all Roman Catholic (81%), with a small Protestant minority (10%).
SNT.120389.16761	The town, however is far from liberalism: the canton granted women the right of suffrage only in 1990 under pressure from the Federal Supreme Court of Switzerland and international human rights groups.

SNT.57924.16764	The disabled girl was operated upon at the request of her parents, to prevent her from growing, menstruating and developing breasts.
SNT.57924.16765	The parents, who wish to remain anonymous, explain their situation on a blog entitled The "Ashley Treatment".
SNT.57924.16766	There have been over 1000 reactions on the blog so far.
SNT.57924.16767	Ashley suffers a condition termed static encephalopathy with marked global developmental deficits of unknown etiology, which means brain damage of unknown cause leading to a kind of static condition.
SNT.57924.16768	She can make sounds, move her arms and kick her legs, but she cannot change her position, eat, walk, talk etc.
SNT.57924.16769	Many of these children are in poor health and die young, but Ashley is in good health.
SNT.57924.16770	For all of these functions she depends on her caregivers.
SNT.57924.16771	Most of the day she passes watching her surrounding, lying on a pillow.
SNT.57924.16772	Her parents call her their "Pillow Angel", "since she is so sweet and stays right where we place her—usually on a pillow."
SNT.57924.16773	Ashley's parents want to keep her at home and care for her themselves, and they want to guarantee their daughter's quality of life.
SNT.57924.16774	To this end, they say, Ashley underwent several surgical procedures and medical treatments during a period of three years.
SNT.57924.16775	To attenuate her growth, Ashley was given high doses of the hormone estrogen.
SNT.57924.16776	Ashley now measures 4ft 5 (1m 35cm) and weighs around 75 lbs (34 kg), which is below her expected length and weight.
SNT.57924.16777	Her low body weight and size would improve her comfort, and at the same time facilitate the work of her caregivers.
SNT.57924.16778	Surgery to remove her uterus (a procedure called a hysterectomy) and breast buds were performed, so Ashley does not menstruate and will not develop breasts, both of which parents think only would cause her discomfort.
SNT.57924.16779	Since high estrogen levels can cause menstrual bleeding and breast development, the surgery was also meant to limit these effects.
SNT.57924.16780	She also underwent surgery to remove her appendix, because it would be difficult to diagnose appendicitis given Ashley's low communication possibilities.

SNT.61026.16828	Mr Dunne says that he is still backing New Zealand Day in some form despite the rejection, as he is now considering many options, including changing the Queen's Official Birthday holiday to New Zealand Day, and starting Dominion Day back up.
SNT.61026.16829	He says that he is now considering writing up a new bill to submit it to the New Zealand Parliament.

SNT.11212.16875	The government of Canada is fighting to keep Washington from having access to passenger lists for Canada's domestic flights.
SNT.11212.16876	The Canadian transport minister Jean Lapierre said two-thirds of Canada's domestic flights at some point cross through American air space.
SNT.11212.16877	The Minister said he may have to re-route them (around U.S. airspace) rather than breach the privacy rights of domestic Canadian passengers.
SNT.11212.16878	In plans which are not yet finalized, Washington recently warned Canada (and other countries) the U.S. intends to require that its no-fly list procedures apply to all foreign airlines which pass through U.S. airspace.
SNT.11212.16879	After 9/11, a watch list of suspected terrorists was created by the U.S. that bars those on the list from air travel within its borders.
SNT.11212.16880	On Wednesday, Lapierre said it's a “very hot issue,” and that he’s working to protect the privacy of Canadians.
SNT.11212.16881	"We don’t think it’s a good idea that Canadians travelling from one (Canadian) city to another would have to be checked under the American no-fly list.” Lapierre said.
SNT.11212.16882	He estimates that nearly two-thirds of the 278,000 yearly flights between Canadian cities cross over the U.S. border.
SNT.11212.16883	Most major flight zones from urban centers in Canada are in its southern portion, close to the U.S. where even winds might push a plane across the border.
SNT.11212.16884	If the matter can not be resolved, Lapierre said, “We would have to take a northern route, which would be much more expensive.” 
SNT.11212.16884-1	Yahoo! News Canada reports that Lapierre intends to lobby U.S. Transportation Secretary Norman Mineta against the changes.
SNT.11212.16885	Last year, the Canadian province of British Columbia put controls on firms that handle an individual's personal data that prevents them from sharing private information on Canadians with U.S. authorities.
SNT.11212.16886	The issue goes to Canada's sovereignty of its citizens and the U.S. sovereignty of its airspace.
SNT.11212.16887	The historically close relations between Canada and the U.S. was evident during the recent Virgin Atlantic incident, where a flight was intercepted by 2 Canadian CF-18 jet fighters.
SNT.11212.16888	They were scrambled from Quebec to escort the inter-continental flight originating from London to the Halifax International Airport after a hijacking signal, an apparent accident, was sent from the plane.
SNT.11212.16889	The plane was detained in Halifax on Friday for approximately four hours.
SNT.11212.16890	Ultimately it was cleared, and landed safely at its original destination in John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York City.
SNT.11212.16891	Both the ACLU and the Electronic Privacy Information Center are involved in lawsuits against the U.S. government relating to no-fly lists.
SNT.11212.16892	EPIC has received documents under the U.S. Freedom of Information Act which it says "establish that the TSA administers two lists: a "no-fly" list and a "selectee" list, which requires the passenger to go through additional security measures."
SNT.11212.16893	"The names are provided to air carriers through Security Directives or Emergency Amendments and are stored in their computer systems so that an individual with a name that matches the list can be flagged when getting a boarding pass."
SNT.11212.16894	"A "no-fly" match requires the agent to call a law enforcement officer to detain and question the passenger."
SNT.11212.16895	"In the case of a Selectee, an "S" or special mark is printed on their boarding pass and the person receives additional screening at security."

SNT.208088.16927	A researcher at the University of Oxford has found a saucy poem attributed to John Milton, the 17th-century poet who wrote Paradise Lost and other religious verse.
SNT.208088.16928	"An Extempore Upon a Faggot", discovered in an 18th-century anthology of poetry, is not thought by modern scholars to be by Milton, however, and may in fact have been written by one of his rivals in an attempt to disgrace him.
SNT.208088.16929	The poem was found by Dr Jennifer Batt, who said that it "is so out of tune with the rest of his work, that if the attribution is correct, it would prompt a major revision of our ideas about Milton."
SNT.208088.16930	She discovered the rude verse in the Harding Collection of poetry anthologies held by the Bodleian Library, the main university library at Oxford.
SNT.208088.16931	"To see the name of John Milton, the great religious and political polemicist, attached to such a bawdy epigram, is extremely surprising to say the least", she added.
SNT.208088.16932	The book in question, the Oxford and Cambridge Miscellany from 1708 (over 30 years after Milton's death), was described by another Oxford academic, Dr Abigail Williams, as "a set of poems written by witty young men about town for witty young men about town".
SNT.208088.16933	Milton wrote in blank verse rather than using rhyme and used differing poetic rhythms, whereas the handwritten poem uses a simple pattern of rhyming couplets as it contrasts the sexual behaviour of young women and more experienced women by comparing them to green wood and dry wood upon a fire.
SNT.208088.16934	Have you not in a Chimney seen 
SNT.208088.16934-1	A Faggot which is moist and green
SNT.208088.16934-2	 How coyly it receives the Heat
SNT.208088.16934-3	 And at both ends do's weep and sweat? 
SNT.208088.16934-4	 So fares it with a tender Maid
SNT.208088.16934-5	 When first upon her Back she's laid 
SNT.208088.16934-6	But like dry Wood th' experienced Dame
SNT.208088.16934-7	 Cracks and rejoices in the Flame
SNT.208088.16935	Milton (1608–1674) wrote many influential religious poems, including Paradise Lost, which is described by the Oxford Dictionary of National Biography as "widely and rightly regarded as the supreme poetic achievement in the English language, fit to sit alongside the poems of Homer, Virgil, and Dante."
SNT.208088.16936	It tells the story of the fall from grace of Adam and Eve in an epic theological poem.
SNT.208088.16937	He followed it with Paradise Regained, depicting the temptations of Jesus in the wilderness.
SNT.208088.16938	Bawdy poetry is not thought by modern academics to be in keeping with Milton's style, with Batt suggesting that it is likely that his name was added to the poem "to bring scandal upon [him], perhaps by a jealous contemporary."
SNT.208088.16939	She suggests that the culprit might have been Sir John Suckling, a poet who was a supporter of the monarchy, in contrast to the Republican Milton.
SNT.208088.16940	The University of Oxford is currently digitising the songbooks and anthologies of the Harding Collection, said to be the world's largest such collection, as part of a project to allow online access.
SNT.208088.16941	It is named after Walter Harding, a British musician who collected music and poetry in Chicago.
SNT.208088.16942	The poem had been read before, but without anyone noticing Milton's name at the bottom.
SNT.208088.16943	Dr Williams, the project's leader, expressed her doubts as to the authenticity of the attribution, commenting that "[y]ou could become very rich and famous – well, famous, anyway – if you could prove the rhyme was really by Milton."

SNT.144950.16945	Natapei was in Trinidad and Tobago at the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting and his staff failed to file the paperwork that notified the parliamentary speaker of his absence.
SNT.144950.16946	Under Vanuatu law, since he missed three consecutive sittings of parliament without notifying the speaker in writing, he must forfeit his seat.
SNT.144950.16947	In order to comply with the law, Natapei would have needed to submit a signed explanation for his absence to the speaker.
SNT.144950.16948	The last time a similar event occurred was in the 1980s when a Member of Parliament lost his job for failure to notify the speaker of his absence.

SNT.91780.16985	Snow has fallen in Baghdad, Iraq for the first time in approximately 100 years.
SNT.91780.16986	Although Baghdad sometimes sees hail and sleet, snow has never been seen in living memory.
SNT.91780.16987	Snow was also recorded in the western and central parts of the country, where it is also very unusual, and in the Kurdish north, which is mountainous and commonly sees snowfall.
SNT.91780.16988	A statement by the meteorology department read "Snow has fallen in Baghdad for the first time in about a century as a result of two air flows meeting."
SNT.91780.16989	"The first one was cold and dry and the second one was warm and humid."
SNT.91780.16990	Dawood Shakir, director of the meteorology department, told AFP his take on the causation of the snow: "It's very rare."
SNT.91780.16991	"These snowfalls are linked to the climate change that is happening everywhere."
SNT.91780.16992	"We are finding some places in the world which are warm and are supposed to be cold."
SNT.91780.16993	Temperatures in some parts of the country fell below freezing, compared to winters that are normally mild in a climate that sees summer temperatures of 120 degrees Fahrenheit.
SNT.91780.16994	Snow fell in the capital city from prior to dawn until just after 9 a.m. local time.
SNT.91780.16995	The flakes failed to provide a covering of snow, instead melting quickly.
SNT.91780.16996	However, many local people still had positive things to say about the once in a lifetime event.
SNT.91780.16997	Mohammed Abdul-Hussein, a 63-year-old in retirement, commented "For the first time in my life I saw a snow-rain like this falling in Baghdad."
SNT.91780.16998	"When I was young, I heard from my father that such rain had fallen in the early '40s on the outskirts of northern Baghdad but snow falling in Baghdad in such a magnificent scene was beyond my imagination."
SNT.91780.16999	Fawzi Karim, who runs a small restaurant in Hawr Rajab, six miles from Baghdad said "I asked my mother, who is 80, whether she'd ever seen snow in Iraq before, and her answer was no…"
SNT.91780.17000	"This is so unusual, and I don't know whether or not it's a lesson from God," while college student Talib Haider said "a friend of mine called me at 8 a.m. to wake me up and tell me that the sky is raining snow."
SNT.91780.17001	"I rushed quickly to the balcony to see a very beautiful scene."
SNT.91780.17002	"I tried to film it with my cell phone camera."
SNT.91780.17003	"I called my other friends and the morning turned out to be a very happy one in my life."
SNT.91780.17004	Resident Aysar Khaled told Reuters "I woke up and I saw snow falling, so I woke up all the family and told them to come and see the snowfall."
SNT.91780.17005	"Everyone in Baghdad is delighted because this is a new thing, this is the first time that it snows in Baghdad…"
SNT.91780.17006	Some viewed it as a sign of impending peace, or at least of an improving situation in the war-torn country.
SNT.91780.17007	Hassan Zahar, a 60-year-old resident, said "It is the first time we've seen snow in Baghdad."
SNT.91780.17008	"I looked at the faces of all the people, they were astonished…"
SNT.91780.17009	"I invite all the people to enjoy peace, because the snow means peace."
SNT.91780.17010	The snow was "a new sign of the new Iraq," according to traffic policeman Murtadha Fadhil, who spoke to Reuters whilst sheltering under a balcony.
SNT.91780.17011	"We hope Iraqis will purify their hearts and politicians will work for the prosperity of all Iraqis."
SNT.91780.17012	There are no reports of any bloodshed during the time the snow was falling.

SNT.5794.17043	Wikibooks, an Internet project which seeks to create free content textbooks using wiki technology, has published its February 2005 statistics.
SNT.5794.17044	The Cookbook project leads the statistics, both by number of contributors (94) and by total edits (668).
SNT.5794.17045	Newcomer of the month is "Wikibooks Pokédex", with 337 edits by mainly one user, followed by "Programming:Ada" (320 edits).
SNT.5794.17046	Seventy contributors edited on "Wikiversity", followed by sixty-eight users on the "Jokebook".
SNT.5794.17047	Wikiversity is a project of its own which aims to build a collaborative learning environment online.
SNT.5794.17048	Wikibooks was originally meant as a place for textbooks and manuals but has increasingly become a community creating books on all kinds of subjects, with the cookbook being the most prominent example.
SNT.5794.17049	Intended as a collection of recipes from around the world, it hosts recipes from Hamburger to Sushi, ethnic cuisines from the Caribbean to the Mediterranean, and gives background information on ingredients, nutrition, and many cooking techniques.
SNT.5794.17050	Wikis are openly editable websites that are often used to create knowledge bases.
SNT.5794.17051	Wikibooks is a project operated by the Wikimedia Foundation, a non-profit organization based in the United States which runs several free content wikis, including Wikipedia, a free encyclopedia, and Wikinews, a free news source.
SNT.5794.17052	The statistics for Wikibooks are extracted using an SQL query on the latest Wikibooks database dump.

SNT.14879.17099	The UK Secretary of State for Defence John Reid has admitted the withdrawal of 5,500 of the 8,500 British troops in Iraq by spring 2006 is a possibility.
SNT.14879.17100	It comes after a report was leaked to the Mail on Sunday in the aftermath of the 7 July London bombings.
SNT.14879.17101	The document (Options for Future UK Force Posture in Iraq) was marked "Secret - UK eyes only" and also contained information on possible U.S. troop reductions, bringing the number of Coalition forces in Iraq down to 66,000.
SNT.14879.17102	About 176,000 Coalition troops are presently in Iraq, 130,000 of which are from the United States Armed Forces.
SNT.14879.17103	However, the document also reveals there is division between the Pentagon, which apparently favours a "relatively bold reduction", and U.S. commanders in Iraq who are more cautious.
SNT.14879.17104	The British Army is the lead component of the Multi-National Division (South-East).
SNT.14879.17105	It has maintained forces in the 8,000+ region since the end of the 2003 Iraq War.
SNT.14879.17106	In the document, Mr Reid admitted that a large reduction of British and U.S. forces would make it difficult for other countries to keep their force in Iraq.
SNT.14879.17107	Mr Reid, who took up the position of Secretary of State for Defence on 6 May 2005, admitted that the document was made by him for Prime Minister Tony Blair.
SNT.14879.17108	In the document, Mr Reid stated that a decision would need to be made later this year on British forces levels in Iraq.
SNT.14879.17109	The possible transfer of control of Al Muthanna and Maysan provinces, followed by Al Basrah and Dhi Qar provinces in 2006, were also included in the document.
SNT.14879.17110	It estimated the reduction of British forces could save about £1 billion pounds (about $1.7 billion U.S. dollars).
SNT.14879.17111	In a statement on 10 July made in response to the leaking of the document, Mr Reid denied that the document signalled any change in policy, stating that, "No decisions on the future force posture of UK forces have been taken."
SNT.14879.17112	"But we have always said that it is our intention to hand over the lead in fighting terrorists to Iraqi security forces as their capability increases."
SNT.14879.17113	"We therefore continually produce papers outlining possible options and contingencies."
SNT.14879.17114	On 4 July, during a debate in the House of Commons, Mr Reid had hinted at possible reductions in forces, saying that, "By and large, about 12 [of 18] of the provinces are relatively free of terrorist attacks."
SNT.14879.17115	"As the Iraqi forces become trained to take the lead, it is possible, over a period of time, to hand the lead role to Iraqi forces in certain areas of the country and gradually, we hope, over the whole country."
SNT.14879.17116	A spokesperson of the MND (SE) was questioned by a Wikireporter.
SNT.14879.17117	When asked whether speculation of reductions would affect British forces morale in Iraq, it was insisted that, "The British forces will continue to operate in the professional manner to which they always have done."
SNT.14879.17118	The spokesperson added, "No decision on the future posture of UK forces in Iraq has been taken."
SNT.14879.17119	"Assisting the Iraqis to improve the security environment remains our top priority."

SNT.124294.17136	Lightning was observed within an ash cloud that formed over the volcano.
SNT.124294.17137	As a result the AVO raised the alert level to 'warning' and level 'red' for aviation.
SNT.124294.17138	According to the Observatory, seismic activity caused a major lahar, similar to a mudslide or landslide, to occur in the Drift River Valley.
SNT.124294.17139	Inhabitants of the Valley were advised to seek high ground and take immediate precautions against flooding.
SNT.124294.17140	So far there are no reports of injuries or evacuations.
SNT.124294.17141	Wikinews has e-mailed the AVO for a statement regarding the event, but has yet to receive a reply.
SNT.124294.17142	"Strong, but diminishing seismic activity is continuing as of 07:35 AKDT," said the AVO on its website.
SNT.124294.17143	At 9:18 a.m., the AVO reported that the event had ended.
SNT.124294.17144	"Continuing seismic activity and web camera images indicate that low level emissions of steam, gas, and some volcanic ash are continuing to be emitted at the volcano at altitudes of [20,000 feet]."
SNT.124294.17145	The AVO is sending a team to investigate the latest eruption which will include a fly-over to take readings on the gases being emitted.
SNT.124294.17146	The explosion sent volcanic ash which spread to "Homer, Anchor Point, and Seldovia" to an altitude of over 50,000 feet.

SNT.124294.17148	The advisory is scheduled to end at 10:00 a.m. (AKDT).
SNT.124294.17149	As a result of recent eruptions at Redoubt, half of the 6 million gallons of crude oil stored in the Drift Valley will be removed to a safer location.
SNT.124294.17150	There is no word on when the move will take place.
SNT.124294.17151	The storage facility is located just 22 miles from Redoubt.
SNT.99740.17152	Two recent polls have shown that the residents of the town of Berwick-upon-Tweed, England would prefer to live in Scotland.
SNT.99740.17153	Located 57 miles from Edinburgh, Scotland and over 300 miles from London, Berwick was a frequent bone of contention in the border wars between the independent kingdoms of England and Scotland, changing hands at least 13 times between 1147 and 1482.
SNT.99740.17154	Under the Treaty of Perpetual Peace agreed in 1502 by the English King Henry VII and the Scottish King James IV, Berwick was declared to be "of the Kingdom of England but not in it".
SNT.99740.17155	This resulted in Berwick having to be named individually in legislation until the British Parliament passed the Wales and Berwick Act in 1746 which stated that unless specially specified otherwise, the term "England" in laws included Berwick and Wales; in 1853 the declaration of war on Russia specifically mentioned Berwick, but the 1856 Treaty of Paris did not, leading to the urban legend that the town was still at war with Russia until the Mayor signed a peace treaty with a Soviet diplomat in 1966.
SNT.99740.17156	Since the creation of the Scottish Parliament in 1999, Berwickers have noted that Scottish residents receive about £1500 more government expenditure each year than English residents, including free care for elderly people and free university tuition, both of which have to be paid for in England.
SNT.99740.17157	The town already has a strong Scottish influence - famously both its football team and rugby team play in the Scottish leagues, a minority of the town's banks are Scottish, and the Church of Scotland has a large congregation in the town.
SNT.99740.17158	A poll conducted for the ITV television programme, Tonight, to be broadcast on February 18 has shown that 60% (1,182 for, 775 against) of those polled would prefer the town to be in Scotland, while a poll for The Berwick Advertiser newspaper showed 78% in favour.
SNT.99740.17159	This has resulted in a motion being proposed by Scottish National Party MSP Christine Grahame, calling on the Scottish Government to negotiate for Berwick's "restoration" to Scotland.
SNT.99740.17160	A spokesman for Scottish First Minister Alex Salmond said "The Scottish Government has no territorial demands on our friends in England.
SNT.99740.17161	But it's clear most people in Berwick would rather be part of SNP-governed Scotland than Labour-run England."

SNT.1005448.17245	The probe discovered evidence of hundreds of thousands of pounds going towards shares in weapons firms like BAE Systems and alcohol company Diageo.
SNT.1005448.17246	It is also alleged to have pledged upwards of £3 million into tobacco firms.
SNT.1005448.17247	Ethical fund manager Helen Wildsmith told Panorama: "If people who've been giving them money, after watching the television, next year think twice and don't give that money, because they're concerned about their investment policy, then that could be argued to be a breach of fiduciary duty.
SNT.1005448.17248	They're risking their reputation, and a charity's reputation is very precious."
SNT.1005448.17249	Comic Relief was founded in 1985, and since then has taken in nearly £1 billion in donations.
SNT.1005448.17250	It funds charitable organisations in the United Kingdom as well as overseas.
SNT.1005448.17251	It uses a range of managed funds, which invests the money in the charity's name - including on the stock market - in order to maximise return.
SNT.1005448.17252	A spokesperson for the charity told the British newspaper The Daily Telegraph: "We put the money into large managed funds, as many other leading charities and pension funds do.
SNT.1005448.17253	On balance, we believe this is the approach that will deliver the greatest benefits to the most vulnerable people."
SNT.1005448.17254	The controversial investments were made between 2007 and 2009, Panorama explains.
SNT.1005448.17255	Peter Bennett-Jones, former chair of the company, defended the investments in a post on The Guardians website.
SNT.1005448.17256	He said: "The Charity Commission guidance is quite clear that trustees must invest for the best possible financial return, while taking a level of risk appropriate for money in their care.
SNT.1005448.17257	They should only adopt an ethical investment approach with specific justification and not on the grounds of individual moral views.

SNT.79146.17306	Mr Scipione credited the huge numbers of police and poor weather for the successful outcome of the rally.
SNT.79146.17307	"It certainly caused numbers to dwindle, in fact it surely caused numbers not to turn up," he said.

SNT.79146.17309	"We always indicated that we would be there, in sufficient numbers to be able to act swiftly against those that broke the law.

SNT.7557.17410	April 7, 2005 The Federal Bureau of Investigation is investigating allegations of wrongdoing in the building of a new $1.5 billion "skyway" portion of the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge, according to a report published in the Oakland Tribune.
SNT.7557.17411	The bridge spans the San Francisco Bay between Oakland and Yerba Buena Island.
SNT.7557.17412	The paper reported that welders for KFM, the company under contract to build the bridge, told authorities they were pressured – and even paid monthly bonuses of between $200 and $600 – for performing substandard welds on the support piers for the bridge if it meant the project proceeded faster.
SNT.7557.17413	But Caltrans, the state agency in charge of building the bridge said their inspectors checked the welds and determined the work, although rushed, met safety standards.
SNT.7557.17414	"We've got good welds, good procedures and everything is in place to have a quality product.
SNT.7557.17415	If a defect got in, we can't find it," Pete Siegenthaler, Caltrans project manager told the Tribune in an interview.
SNT.7557.17416	A KFM spokesman told the Tribune that the welds are in "compliance with stringent Caltrans specifications."
SNT.7557.17417	According to a report by Oakland television station, KTVU, the Office of the Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Labor and the U.S. Department of Transportation are joining the FBI in the investigation of the matter.
SNT.7557.17418	The federal government is getting involved in the investigation because more than $1 million in U.S. taxpayer money was spent during its construction.
SNT.7557.17419	If questionable welds are found in the support piers, according to reports, much of the new construction may have to be torn down to be rebuilt.
SNT.7557.17420	The current 68-year-old span was damaged in the 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake.
SNT.7557.17421	At $6.2 billion total, the new bridge qualifies as the largest public works project in California's history.

SNT.53726.17437	The New Zealand Medical Association (NZMA) has warned the public against taking party pills, even though they are legal in New Zealand.
SNT.53726.17438	This warning comes because Benzylpiperazine, or BZP, can trigger hypothermia, seizures, paranoia, insomnia, anxiety, nausea, vomiting, palpitations and spasms of the muscle.
SNT.53726.17439	Some of those side effects will occur if the person has taken 4.5 tablets.
SNT.53726.17440	Those who do take party pills should not mix them with medication, drugs or alcohol.
SNT.53726.17441	Also those with mental illnesses are advised to steer clear of the pills.
SNT.53726.17442	Ross Boswell, chairman of the medical association, said: "There were growing concerns about the safety of BZP-based party pills," and the legality of the pills is coming under fire.
SNT.53726.17443	"If people insist on taking the pills, they should make sure they stick to the manufacturer's recommended dose, of one or two pills, and not combine them with other stimulants."
SNT.53726.17444	A study done at the Christchurch Hospital has shown that 61 patients had been to the emergency department a total of 80 times.
SNT.53726.17445	Of those 80 times, 15 of them were toxic seizures and two patients presented life threatening conditions.
SNT.53726.17446	The pills are often sold as "herbal highs" but according to Boswell, there is nothing "herbal" about them as they were first made to treat cattle that had worms.
SNT.53726.17447	Boswell said: "Further research on the effects of BZP is soon to be released by the Health Minister," as the New Zealand government is debating whether or not they should be banned or have their sale restricted.

SNT.42680.17481	In May exports were said to be 1.5 million bpd.
SNT.42680.17482	The line on a graph that plotted oil price had done a steady incline over recent years, though many factors are involved in the price of a barrel of oil so it is almost impossible to say how much the troubles in Iraq contributed to this rise.

SNT.252664.17500	On Thursday, London's Mayor Boris Johnson announced the shortlist of bidders to supply up to ten further trams to Transport for London (TfL) for use on the city's Tramlink network in Croydon.
SNT.252664.17501	TfL, who purchased the Tramlink network from Tramtrack Croydon Ltd. in 2008, announced the plans late January, after submitting the tender to the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU) on January 29.
SNT.252664.17502	According to the notice, the additional trams will operate approximately 75,000km per year, will be needed for "at least 10, but not more than 20 years" and can be either new build or existing vehicles that can be modified — at a reasonable cost — to run on the Tramlink infrastructure.
SNT.252664.17503	The tram fleet is currently made up of 24 Bombardier CR4000 trams, which were constructed for the opening of the 28km network between 1998 and 2000.
SNT.252664.17504	22 of these trams are currently needed to operate the three tram routes each day, and the new service is expected to require at least an additional five trams daily, bringing about the need for a boost to the fleet levels.
SNT.252664.17505	The shortlist to supply the trams consists of City of Edinburgh/CAF, Stadler (Stadler Pankow GmBH) and Pesa (Pojazdy Szynowe PESA Bydgoszcz S.A.Holding, and the the three consortia will now be invited to submit proposals to supply the additional trams.
SNT.252664.17506	It is not currently known whether the bids made by Stadler and Pesa will be for new-build or second-hand vehicles, however the bid from Edinburgh/CAF is to use a number of the currently-dormant trams that were constructed for that city's own tram network.
SNT.252664.17507	The system has had several set backs since construction began, with the network now set to open in stages with a number of tram lines (but not the trams to operate them) being cancelled, leading to a large surplus of vehicles that could be hired out in the short term.
SNT.252664.17508	The trams are amongst some of the longest and heaviest in Europe, though, and will require a large amount of modification to enable them to be able to operate on Croydon's network if the bid is successful.
SNT.252664.17509	Shortly after the announcement, whilst inspecting one of the network's current trams at East Croydon tram stop, Boris Johnson said: "I have no greater responsibility as Mayor than to ensure people can move around this city with ease, comfort and reliability.
SNT.252664.17510	"Trams in Croydon have proved a major success and this is reflected in journey numbers which have soared by 45 per cent since the network opened in 2000.
SNT.252664.17511	"I look forward to the extra vehicles developing this vital, much-appreciated, and indeed attractive, form of transport further."
SNT.252664.17512	Funding for the new trams is expected to largely come from TfL, however the London Borough of Croydon has also confirmed a £3m contribution to the project.
SNT.252664.17513	This will also include the refurbishment of tram stop surrounds.
SNT.252664.17514	Croydon Council Leader Mike Fisher said: "This is looking like a great deal for Croydon and shows the benefits of an ambitious local authority and committed Mayor working together, pooling resources and expertise.
SNT.252664.17515	"There is real support to get additional trams for Croydon to keep pace with growing demand for Tramlink services and also to secure major improvements for pedestrians and transport users around and between East and West Croydon stations."
SNT.252664.17516	TfL anticipates that, providing a successful bid is made, the new trams would be delivered to the network's depot at Therapia Lane in late 2011, with an entry into service from early 2012.

SNT.33445.17602	The two were charged with attempting to smuggle 8.3 kg of heroin from Bali to Australia.
SNT.33445.17603	The Australian Federal Police have been criticised for allowing the Bali Nine to travel to Indonesia, where it was known they could face the death penalty.
SNT.33445.17604	Yesterday two other drug mules, Renae Lawrence and Scott Rush, were sentenced to life imprisonment.
SNT.33445.17605	Chan was alleged to be the mastermind of the operation, and Myuran was alleged to be an enforcer.
SNT.33445.17606	Chan, who claimed to have rediscovered his Christian faith, prayed for divine intervention prior to the sentence being handed down.
SNT.33445.17607	Chan fell over after jostling with a media scrum, and Sukumaran threw a bottle of water at the media.
SNT.33445.17608	Donald Rothwell, a Professor of International Law at the University of Sydney, has said that, unlike countries such as Singapore, it may not be long before the two are executed.
SNT.33445.17609	"The Indonesian judicial system is one in which death sentences are often carried out very quickly," he said.
SNT.33445.17610	"So unlike the situation of Van Nguyen in Singapore, where an appeal process and a clemency process played out over quite some time, this may not be the situation in Bali."
SNT.33445.17611	Foreign Affairs Minister Alexander Downer told parliament today that he had made a direct request to the Indonesian government that the death penalty not be imposed.
SNT.33445.17612	"On the 18th of December last year, I wrote to the Indonesian Attorney-General reminding him that the Australian Government was opposed to the death sentence and we didn't want to see, in the context of the Bali nine, any of the Australians sentenced to death," he said.

SNT.252189.17723	Figures released by the U.S. 2010 census on Wednesday show that the city of Detroit has lost approximately 238,270 people, one-fourth of its total, since 2000.
SNT.252189.17724	Detroit, once one of the top five U.S. cities in population, has its lowest number of residents since 1910.
SNT.252189.17725	Population numbers affect the the amount of federal and state funding a city receives.
SNT.252189.17726	In the last few decades, dozens of Michigan state laws have been passed allowing Detroit, because its population was at least 750,000, special measures to raise revenue and allocating it a larger share of Michigan's state revenue than its population warranted.
SNT.252189.17727	Now that Detroit's population has fallen to 713,777, it is no longer eligible for these financial advantages.
SNT.252189.17728	The mayor of Detroit, Dave Bing plans to appeal the census results.
SNT.252189.17729	"Every person that’s counted in the census brings approximately $10,000 to Detroit over the next decade for schools, roads, hospitals, and social service programs," Bing explained.
SNT.252189.17730	"Additionally, we could lose millions in statutory revenue sharing from the state.
SNT.252189.17731	We are in a fiscal crisis and we have to fight for every dollar.
SNT.252189.17732	The decline of the auto industry hastened the population loss already diminished by the 1967 riots that precipitated white flight to the suburbs.
SNT.252189.17733	Approximately 23 percent of the city’s living quarters are now empty.
SNT.252189.17734	To reduce the city's size there is a program in progress to demolish 10,000 abandoned or vacant buildings and turn the land into farms or countryside by 2014.
SNT.252189.17735	U.S. federal laws forbid drawing congressional district boundaries that dilute minority voting strength.
SNT.252189.17736	The 2000 redistricting rules for the 2012 elections mandated that Detroit's two congressional districts must be 60 percent black voters, since four out of five of Detroit's residents are black.
SNT.252189.17737	To comply, the two remaining congressional districts will have to expand into Detroit's mostly white suburbs to attain enough minority voters to meet the 60 percent target, reducing the clout of black Detroit.
SNT.252189.17738	Andrew Beveridge, Queens College sociology professor, attributed Detroit's population decline to the loss of its industrial base.
SNT.252189.17739	He said: "Except for New Orleans after Katrina, it's basically the largest drop for a U.S. city in history.
SNT.252189.17740	They have to find an economic base or the decline will continue."

SNT.50622.17745	A population study, released by Statistics New Zealand titled A History of Survival in New Zealand, highlights that the life expectancy of New Zealand males born in the mid 1890's would have been five years higher without the impact of the two world wars, as 10% of males died in war.
SNT.50622.17746	Also males born in the late 1910's would have had a three year higher life expectancy, without the impact of the two world wars as well.
SNT.50622.17747	The new study is an international study of survival and mortality.
SNT.50622.17748	The study also reveals that a male born in the late 1870's would have had an average life span of 51-years-old and in the 1930's the average life span was 69-years-old.
SNT.50622.17749	And in females the life expectancy is 75-years-old, previously 55-years-old.
SNT.50622.17750	Kim Dunstan, Statistics NZ demographer, said: "The dramatic lifespan changes were attributed to many factors, including improved hygiene, sanitation, medicines and infectious disease control.
SNT.50622.17751	People born in the late 1870's had a 23% chance of not making it to see their 15th birthday, people born in the 1900's had a 15% chance, people born in the 1930's had a seven percent chance, people born in the 1960's had a three percent chance and those born around the 1990's had a one percent chance.
SNT.50622.17752	Mr Dunstan said: "The study provided the most complete picture of how long New Zealanders lived and showed for the first time the impact of war deaths on the population.
SNT.50622.17753	Death comes to us all and it does affect us at a lot of levels.
SNT.50622.17754	A lot of people have had family members who died in the war and can relate to their own experiences."
SNT.50622.17755	A History of Survival in New Zealand also shows that New Zealand is one of the few countries in the world that has an almost complete and detailed history of births, deaths and migration information dating back to the late 1800's.
SNT.50622.17756	This study is a historic book full of births, deaths and external migration for the population of New Zealand.
SNT.50622.17757	It will also be used in the future relating to health, population and mortality areas.
SNT.50622.17758	It is also unique because it follows the population from birth right through to death.
SNT.50622.17759	"We see the study very much as the basis for further work ... across other organisations in New Zealand and, indeed, internationally," Mr. Dunstan said.

SNT.86644.17771	On Tuesday, the United States Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs's Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations held a hearing titled "Credit Card Practices: Unfair Interest Rate Increases."
SNT.86644.17772	The hearing examined the circumstances under which credit card issuers may increase the interest rates of cardholders who are in compliance with the terms of their credit cards.
SNT.86644.17773	Subcommittee Chairman Carl Levin said in his opening statement: "Today's focus is on credit card issuers who hike the interest rates of cardholders who play by the rules — meaning those folks who pay on time, pay at least the minimum amount due, and wake up one day to find their interest rate has gone through the roof — again, not because they paid late or exceeded the credit limit, but because their credit card issuer decided they should be 'repriced'."
SNT.86644.17774	Present to testify on behalf of credit card issuers were Roger C. Hochschild of Discover Financial Services, Bruce L. Hammonds of Bank of America Corporation, and Ryan Schneider of Capital One Financial Corporation.
SNT.86644.17775	Much of the 90 minute hearing focused on specific cases where interest rates were raised, allegedly because credit scores of the debtor dropped, and not because they were delinquent or otherwise behind on payments.
SNT.86644.17776	According to Levin, this practice made it so that almost all payments went towards finance charges with almost none toward repaying the principal.
SNT.86644.17777	This, he felt, is an unfair practice, as the credit card companies were negligent in informing their customers of the rate hikes and the reason for such hikes.
SNT.86644.17778	The collective credit card debt of Americans totals an estimated US$900 billion.
SNT.86644.17779	Issuers have come under pressure to disclose their policies in regards to setting fees and interest rates.
SNT.86644.17780	The US Truth in Lending Act requires that terms of a loan be set forth up front.
SNT.86644.17781	Fluctuating interest rates on credit cards would, on the surface, appear to violate this act.
SNT.86644.17782	Roger C. Hochschild disagreed, arguing that "every card transaction is a new extension of credit ...
SNT.86644.17783	This makes it difficult — and risky — to underwrite, and price, the loan based solely on the borrower's credit-worthiness at the time of application [for the card]."
SNT.86644.17784	Ryan Schneider, agreed: "The ability to modify the terms of a credit card agreement to accommodate changes over time to the economy or the credit-worthiness of consumers must be preserved."
SNT.86644.17785	"Attempts to interfere with the market here ... will inevitably result in less credit being offered," warned Bruce Hammonds.
SNT.86644.17786	All three credit card executives also mentioned an ongoing Federal Reserve System review of credit card rules that already proposes a 45-day notification ahead of any rate changes.
SNT.86644.17787	Included in the criticism was the practice of mailing checks to card-holders, failing to notify applicants that obtaining additional cards could lower their credit score and raise their rates, and "ambushing" card-holders with raised rates.
SNT.86644.17788	Ranking minority member of the subcommittee, Norm Coleman said, "families find themselves ensnared in a seemingly inescapable web of credit card debt.
SNT.86644.17789	They particularly report being saddled with interest rates that skyrocketed on them seemingly out of the blue."
SNT.85130.17790	A fierce storm on Sunday resulted in massive 18-foot waves, which split a Russian oil tanker in two and sank two Russian freighters nearby.
SNT.85130.17791	The tanker spilled at least 560,000 gallons of fuel into a strait which leads to the Black Sea, and officials say it may take years to clean up.
SNT.85130.17792	The tankers sank in the Strait of Kerch, which links the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov in the northeast.
SNT.85130.17793	The two ships were carrying a total of around 7,150 tons of sulfur, according to Sergei Petrov, Russia's Ministry of Emergency Situations regional spokesperson.
SNT.85130.17794	The tanker was carrying nearly 1.3 million gallons of fuel oil, and was stranded several miles from shore.
SNT.85130.17795	Emergency workers were prevented from collecting the spilled oil immediately due to stormy weather; the head of the state environmental safety watchdog Rosprorodnadzor, Oleg Mitvol, said "there is serious concern that the spill will continue".
SNT.85130.17796	Workers eventually managed to begin work on cleaning up the spill, an effort which may be long-term.
SNT.85130.17797	Tar-like sands laden with oil and seaweed were piled on the shore, while oil-covered birds in slick-covered water tried to flap their wings.
SNT.85130.17798	Regional coast guard officer Anatoly Yanhuck said once weather improves they will begin pumping oil from the tanker, then tow the ship to port.
SNT.85130.17799	Two fuel-loaded barges and Turkish freighter Ziya Kos also ran aground in the area, but there was no further environmental damage, said Petrov.
SNT.85130.17800	Ten ships altogether were sunk or run aground in the area of the Black Sea near the Straight of Kerch and the Straight itself; a Russian freighter carrying metal was also reported as having sunk near the port of Sevastopol on Ukraine's Crimean Peninsula.
SNT.85130.17801	One of the sulfur-carrying freighters reported three crew members as drowned, and five more as missing, while two members of the sunk freighter carrying metal were reported as drowned and another remains missing.
SNT.85130.17802	The oil tanker's 13 crew members were all rescued safely, and all members of the second freighter were also reported as safe.
SNT.85130.17803	Captains had been warned Saturday morning of the stormy conditions, regional prosecutor Maxim Stepanenko told Russia's Vesti 24.
SNT.85130.17804	The oil tanker was not built to withstand fierce storms, having been designed to transport oil on rivers during Soviet times, he said.
SNT.85130.17805	Chemist with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Ocean Service office of response and restoration, Jim Farr said the sulfur spill from the two freighters wouldn't create a "hazardous situation", a statement backed up by Alexei Zhukovin, expert with the Emergency Situations Ministry's branch in Southern Russia.
SNT.85130.17806	Although on land sulfur is used as a fungicide, in a marine setting it wouldn't act as one, said Farr; instead a sulfur spill can be compared to dumping sand on a reef and smothering it, or placing a blanket on a bed of grass.
SNT.85130.17807	Long-term effects are more difficult to speculate on, however, without better knowledge of the area and its currents.
SNT.85130.17808	Oleg Mitvol said that although the sulfur spill doesn't present an environmental danger, the two freighters might also leak fuel oil from their tanks, adding to the pollution.
SNT.85130.17809	Russia, Turkey, Bulgaria, Romania, Georgia, and Ukraine all border on the Black Sea.

SNT.120377.17837	A trial date has been set in a fraud case against the Church of Scientology in France.
SNT.120377.17838	The date for the first hearing has been set for May 25, 2009.
SNT.120377.17839	If the Church is found guilty, then Scientology would be ruled illegal and would be banned from operating in France.
SNT.120377.17840	Prosecutors claim that the Church is engaged in illicit practices in attempts to sell their alleged self-help material.
SNT.120377.17841	The Church also faces charges of illegally operating as a pharmacy by illegally treating individuals with prescription medications.
SNT.120377.17842	The charges come from an unnamed woman, who in 1998 purchased nearly 140,000₣ (US$30,000) worth of Scientology self-help material which allegedly included prescription drugs.
SNT.120377.17843	After a few months passed, the woman said she felt like she was being scammed.
SNT.120377.17844	Following several complaints from other unnamed individuals and an investigation, judge Jean-Christophe Hullin ordered the Church's 'Celebrity Center', and the seven managers to be put on trial for fraud and "illegally practicing as pharmacists."
SNT.120377.17845	On September 8, 2008 the Church released a statement following the order to stand trial saying that they felt "stigmatized" by the French judicial system.
SNT.120377.17846	"The special treatment reserved for the Church of Scientology Celebrity Center raises questions about the equality of the justice system and the presumption of innocence," the Church said in a statement to the press.
SNT.120377.17847	This is not the first time the Church has been accused of fraud in France.
SNT.120377.17848	They have also been convicted of it several times, including the Church's founder, L. Ron Hubbard who was convicted of fraud in 1978.
SNT.120377.17849	In 1997 the Church was convicted of fraud in Lyon and 1999 in Marseille.
SNT.120377.17850	The 1978 convictions included Hubbard and his wife at the time, Mary Sue, both now deceased, and two other Scientologists.
SNT.120377.17851	The 1978 convictions included Hubbard and four Scientologists after a seven year investigation into the Church by the French authorities.
SNT.120377.17852	The court ruled that Hubbard and the others were using Scientology by making fraudulent claims that it was curing people from diseases to "increase the financial revenue" of the Church, and the ruling ordered Hubbard and the Scientologists to serve four years in prison.
SNT.120377.17853	However, Hubbard, along with the four Scientologists fled France, never to return, and never served a prison term.

SNT.57755.17855-2	Usually elderly or very ill hospital patients get the disease.

SNT.57755.17858	The bacteria can cause boils, pimples, or in extreme cases, flesh-eating disease, and more.

SNT.41074.17872	Cholera, an acute intestinal disease caused by ingestion of food or water contaminated with the bacterium Vibrio cholerae, causes copious, painless, watery diarrhoea that can quickly lead to severe dehydration and death if treatment, including rehydration, is not given promptly.

SNT.1237.18006	The People's Republic of China has signed an agreement with ASEAN to establish the world's largest free trade area.
SNT.1237.18007	Japan, South Korea, New Zealand, India and Australia are considering joining.
SNT.1237.18008	ASEAN members include Myanmar, Laos, Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, Philippines, Malaysia, Brunei Darussalam, Singapore and Indonesia.
SNT.1237.18009	In the last four years China has become a major importer of oil and commodities, and a major exporter of finished goods.
SNT.1237.18010	China has also strengthened relationships with oil suppliers in the Middle East and Africa.
SNT.1237.18011	This pact lifts trade restrictions and removes tariffs from many imports and exports.
SNT.1237.18012	It also allows China to continue manipulating the value of its currency in its own interests.
SNT.1237.18013	The yuan is currently undervalued, making Chinese-made goods artificially cheap for foreign importers.
SNT.1237.18014	Stated in the agreement is ASEAN's intention to create a unified economy--and by implication polity--similar to the EU.
SNT.1237.18015	This agreement will cement China's role as the center of the South Asian regional economy, and at the same time strengthening bonds between China and other countries in the region and ease their suspicions over a growing superpower.
SNT.1237.18016	Japanese Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi and South Korean President Roh Moo-Hyun separately adopted accords with the 10-nation Association of Southeast Asian Nations, agreeing to launch the talks early next year.
SNT.1237.18017	Australia and New Zealand are expected to sign similar agreements with ASEAN before discussions close later Tuesday, although ASEAN remains wary of Australian Prime Minister John Howard's refusal to sign its nonaggression treaty.
SNT.1237.18018	Howard played down these concerns but said on record that he reserves the right to preemptively act against terrorists on foreign soil if they threaten Australia.

SNT.5004.18196	The Global Polio Eradication Initiative has announced its goal to eradicate Polio from Asia in 2005.
SNT.5004.18197	The 16 year old private-public project aims to add Poliomyelitis to the list of childhood diseases which have been eliminated.
SNT.5004.18198	The World Health Organization, Rotary International, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and UNICEF are leading the Initiative and coordinating a series of overlapping immunization campaigns in the region.
SNT.5004.18199	In 2004 Afghanistan, India, and Pakistan cut their number of Polio cases by 45%.
SNT.5004.18200	In 2005 the goal is to cut the number of cases by 100%.
SNT.5004.18201	The three countries are the last in Asia to have endemic polio, and the disease is confined to a small number of regions within the country.
SNT.5004.18202	Only 186 cases were reported in 2004, down from 336 the previous year.
SNT.121075.18203	The United States military Strategic Command (STRATCOM) has said that the 'fireballs' spotted over areas of Texas in the United States on Sunday February 15, are not related to the collision of a U.S. and Russian satellite in space.
SNT.121075.18204	According to spaceweather.com, NASA says the object was a meteor.
SNT.121075.18205	"There is no correlation between the debris from that collision and those reports of re-entry," said STRATCOM military spokeswoman Major Maj. Regina.
SNT.121075.18206	"It's a natural meteor, definitely," said Bill Cooke, an astronomer at NASA's Meteoroid Environment Office.
SNT.121075.18207	On Tuesday, February 10, the American civilian communications satellite Iridium 33, launched in 1997, and the defunct Russian military communications satellite Kosmos-2251, launched in 1993, collided over Siberia.
SNT.121075.18208	On Friday February 13, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) issued an alert for falling debris from the satellites, following reports of "explosions and earthquakes" along with "flashes in the sky" in Jackson and Louisville, Kentucky.
SNT.121075.18209	Then again on Sunday, calls to 9-1-1 began to come in to Williamson County, Texas sheriff's office around 12:30 p.m. (Central time) that burning debris and fireballs were seen falling from the sky onto parts of Austin, Houston, Waco and San Antonio.
SNT.121075.18210	"The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) reported to local law enforcement on Friday that these events are being caused by falling satellite debris."
SNT.121075.18211	"These pieces of debris have been causing sonic booms, resulting in vibrations felt by some residents, as well as flashes of light across the sky," said the NOAA on Friday in an public information alert posted on their website.
SNT.121075.18212	The FAA says the burning material over Texas is not related to this alert.
SNT.121075.18213	Residents in Texas reported their homes and windows shaking and large explosions on Sunday morning.
SNT.121075.18214	After a search of several areas, the Williamson county sheriff's office reported that no debris or impact sites were found.
SNT.121075.18215	Earlier unconfirmed reports had said the debris could have been the result of a small plane exploding.
SNT.121075.18216	There was previous speculation was that the object in Texas could have been a meteor.
SNT.121075.18217	Doctor Marco Ciocca, a professor at Eastern Kentucky University told WKYT on Sunday that it's too early for the debris from the satellites to be reentering the planet's atmosphere.
SNT.121075.18218	"[It could] be months" before any of the satellite wreckage enters the earth's atmosphere.
SNT.121075.18219	"It will either vaporize or stay in orbit for some time before falling into earth's atmosphere."
SNT.121075.18220	However, the Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS) said on February 12 that the debris could have taken 10 days or less to reenter over portions of the planet.
SNT.121075.18221	"Within 24 hours of the collision, the U.S. space tracking system had identified 600 pieces of debris."
SNT.121075.18222	"This large number suggests that the collision must have been relatively head-on."
SNT.121075.18223	"If the two satellites hit head-on, rather than a glancing blow, the energy of the collision would completely disintegrate both satellites into clouds of debris," said the UCS in a statement on their website who also added that the collision took place in "the same region of space where China destroyed a defunct Chinese weather satellite with an anti-satellite (ASAT) weapon" in 2007.
SNT.121075.18224	"That January 2007 test created a massive amount of debris."
SNT.121075.18225	There have been at least eight major satellite collisions since 1991.
SNT.121075.18226	The satellites, both of which had a mass in excess of 450 kilograms, and were traveling at approximately 17,500 miles per hour (28,150 km/hour), collided 491 miles (790 km) above the earth.
SNT.121075.18227	Scientists say the explosion caused by the collision was massive.
SNT.121075.18228	They are still trying to determine just how large the crash was and how the earth will be affected.
SNT.121075.18229	The results of a plotting analysis will be posted to a public website.
SNT.208936.18230	New research published in the journal Nature Medicine has shown a link between a faulty gene and migraines.
SNT.208936.18231	Scientists hope that this discovery will lead to improved pain management treatments for sufferers, with possible benefits for pain treatment generally.
SNT.208936.18232	The breakthrough involves a gene known as TRESK, thought to control the brain's reaction to pain: if it is defective, then many normal activities and actions will be painful.
SNT.208936.18233	Migraine sufferers (thought in the United Kingdom to number about eight per cent of men and eighteen per cent of women) often complain that light, noise and touch cause pain.
SNT.208936.18234	TRESK can potentially be affected by drugs that would change the point at which it reports pain, which would alleviate the suffering of those with migraines.
SNT.208936.18235	The study involved scientists from the Medical Research Council Functional Genomics Unit at the University of Oxford and from Canada.
SNT.208936.18236	They looked at the DNA of 110 people with migraine and members of their family, and found that TRESK was a major component in migraines.
SNT.208936.18237	One of the Oxford researchers, consultant neurologist Zameel Cader, described it as a "once in a generation find" and said that it could "potentially lead to a treatment for pain in general."
SNT.208936.18238	Before this study, no genes had been directly linked to migraines, although parts of the DNA that raised the general risk had been found.
SNT.208936.18239	Migraines are described by the World Health Organisation as a major worldwide cause of disability.
SNT.208936.18240	In Britain, it is estimated that migraines affect 20 per cent of the population, with about 190,000 migraines occurring daily and over 25 million lost days from work every year.
SNT.208936.18241	Lee Tomkin, director of a sufferers' charity, Migraine Action, described the news as "fantastic" and "genuinely a really great step forward."
SNT.208936.18242	Professor Peter Goadsby from the Migraine Trust termed it "a novel direction to consider new therapies in this very disabling condition."
SNT.5916.18243	With studies suggesting the existence of life on Mars, the new system may soon see implementation.

SNT.43531.18245	Paraguay edged the game from start to finish and got a goal in each half.
SNT.43531.18246	Trinidad and Tobago could manage just two shots to trouble Aldo Bobadilla in the Paraguay net.
SNT.43531.18247	Kelvin Jack, who started his first Fifa World Cup game, made seven saves.
SNT.43531.18248	After 25 minutes Jack was a bystander when Roberto Acuna's freekick was driven hard into the box.
SNT.43531.18249	Jack's central defender Brent Sancho inadvertently directed the ball goalbound with his head.
SNT.43531.18250	The goal that sealed the game for the South Amercians was scored six minutes from time by Nelson Cuevas after he had exchanged passes with Roque Santa Cruz.

SNT.34871.18253	The Common Council requested on Tuesday that a picture be found on what many thought was the site of a previous hotel.
SNT.34871.18254	The Proposed Elmwood Village Hotel would be placed on the intersection of Elmwood and Forest.
SNT.34871.18255	It was suspected by residents and business owners in the area that hotel once stood in the same spot.
SNT.34871.18256	The Elmwood Village hotel is a proposed development by Savarino Construction Services Corp.
SNT.34871.18257	After some research, a freelance journalist writing for Wikinews was able to determine that there was never a hotel on the proposed Elmwood Village Hotel site.
SNT.34871.18258	However; there was a temporary hotel located on the northeast corner of Elmwood and Forest.
SNT.34871.18259	Buffalo was the host of the Pan-American Exposition from May 1 until November 2, 1901.
SNT.34871.18260	It was a fair designed to feature the latest in technology, including electricity.
SNT.34871.18261	There was a midway, athletic events, and had African, Eskimo, and Mexican villages.
SNT.34871.18262	However; what is likely the most famous event that took place at the exposition was the assassination of then President William McKinley on September 6, 1901.
SNT.34871.18263	He was shot by Leon Czolgosz just outside the Temple of Music and died eight days later while in the home of John Milburn on Delaware Avenue in Buffalo.
SNT.34871.18264	Just a short time later, Theodore Roosevelt was inaugurated on September 14, 1901 at the Wilcox House on Delaware Avenue in Buffalo.
SNT.34871.18265	During that time several hotels and rooming houses were built around the exposition including The Elmwood at 717 Elmwood, the Hotel Elmhurst at Forest and Lincoln Parkway, Hotel Gibbs 1005-1021 Elmwood, the R. Palmerton Merritt at 441 Forest and The Norman at 422 Forest.
SNT.34871.18266	Probably the most famous hotel that was built during the exposition was the Statler's Pan-American Hotel built by Ellsworth Milton Statler.
SNT.34871.18266-1	A freelance journalist writing for Wikinews has obtained the only known reproduction photo of the hotel [pictured at the top].
SNT.34871.18267	The hotel stood on the northeast corner of Elmwood and Forest Avenues in Buffalo, had 2,100 sleeping rooms and accommodations for 5,000.
SNT.34871.18268	At the time, the Statler was the largest hotel [based on the number of rooms] ever constructed.
SNT.34871.18269	It was three stories high, plastered on the inside, made mostly of wood and was covered with ornamental staff on the outside, which made it semi-fireproof.
SNT.34871.18270	Every room was an outside room and was well lighted and ventilated.
SNT.34871.18271	It was located within one block of the exposition's main entrance.
SNT.34871.18272	The Statler was built for only one thing, the exposition.
SNT.34871.18273	Work began in 1900 and finished just before the beginning of the exposition.
SNT.34871.18274	When the exposition ended in November, the hotel was taken down.
SNT.34871.18275	Maps from 1894 show that there was no hotel, let alone any buildings or houses on the intersection.
SNT.34871.18276	However; research did show that the homes 1119-1121 Elmwood, the buildings that would be demolished to build the Elmwood Village Hotel, were built sometime before 1915 but were not on the intersection prior to 1902.
SNT.34871.18277	Based on research conducted at the Buffalo Historical Society, it was concluded that between the years of 1890 and 1902, no other major hotel existed in the area.
SNT.34871.18278	In fact, research had shown that almost every hotel built in the area, existed only during the time of the exposition.
SNT.34871.18279	Research also indicated a hotel or a rooming house at 1089 Elmwood around 1901-1903.
SNT.34871.18280	The only known name of the hotel was the John C. Hill Hotel.
SNT.34871.18281	The hotel was in the house now called the Atwater House.
SNT.34871.18282	The house was the first house to be built on the east side of the block.
SNT.34871.18283	The Atwater House is currently vacant and owner Pano Georgiadis wants to demolish it to expand his restaurant.
SNT.34871.18284	The house was built by 1894 and the original owner and builder of the house is currently unknown.
SNT.34871.18285	Its earliest known occupant was Edward Atwater who in 1862 founded the oil refinery company of Atwater & Hawes in Buffalo.
SNT.34871.18286	The site of this company was recently uncovered in the Canal District during an archeological dig.
SNT.34871.18287	At the moment, current research does not show any connection between the two men.
